Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie8888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very contemporary. It's recently been renovated. Very clean, comfortable. The lobby area is a bit small and plays techno 'runway' style music. We arrived early, before check-in and they stored our luggage. I was traveling with my daughter and we wanted 2 double/queen beds, but only Kings were available. They gave us a complimentary roll away bed. The rooms were clean and comfortable but very small. There was only a small chair, no desk & a tiny closet. The bathroom was small as well. There wasn't even an ice bucket in the room and I never saw ice machines. (Dean & Deluca by the lobby gave us a free cup of ice.) There were 4 elevators so there was very little waiting. Our room was near the elevator so we heard a lot of noise from that. We had to set the room temp so the heat would not come on at night because the heater made a loud clanging noise that woke us up one night. The best part was the location. Very close to Times Square, but not right in the middle of the chaos. Very convenient to all the little deli's right around the corner, too. Easy to pick up a snack or a continental-style breakfast to bring back to the hotel. I would stay there again, but make sure there are only 2 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but Spartan”
Reviews.Author: GERARD B
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights in this oddly decorated, spartanly equipped, but strategically located Times Square hotel. The Paramount provided adequate accommodations without any luxury amenities. You get a clean, quiet room with a comfortable king sized bed, plenty of hot water for showering, and a wide screen TV. Situated on 46th Street about two-thirds of a block east of Times Square, the hotel was positioned directly across the street from the Richard Rodgers Theatre that was playing Porgy and Bess, which we saw one night while there. The Paramount should suit the tourist who embraces the less-is-more philosophy and requires nothing more than a clean place to sleep after touring the city. The spare furniture, furnishings, and overall design of the Paramount have a dimly lit, spare quality that could be viewed as downright depressing. The two night tables in our room, just large enough to accommodate a digital telephone, are the smallest I’ve seen during my years of traveling. A wall mounted flat screen TV and a leather-bound easy chair were of decent size, but the room lacked a writing desk, chest of drawers, and mini-refrigerator. The bathroom’s stainless steel fixtures were modern and functional; the tapered, conical shape of the metallic pedestal sink in the bathroom reminded me of the paper cones used for snow cones or French fries. The shower head in the tub provided plenty of hot water, and the staff responded quickly to our service requests. The Paramount’s lobby appears to be the victim of an inadequate design budget. Modestly lighted by a huge, crystal chandelier shaped like a flying doughnut, the lobby reminded me of a shadowy nightclub featuring an unattended white piano, ever-present up-tempo music, and antique sofas and chairs occupied by travelers checking electronic devices. Why the walls were decorated with large murals depicting Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck, and other Warner Brothers cartoon characters was a puzzle I never solved. Likewise the presence of the weird “sculpture” made from what appeared to be aluminum foil and housed in a Plexiglas case in the lobby left me scratching my head. The best feature of the lobby was its easy access to the Dean and Deluca store next door. The store’s ample supply of hot and cold beverages, flaky pastries, refreshing yogurt parfaits, and other edibles supplied tasty breakfasts for each day of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, cool & clean”
Reviews.Author: honoluluK
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if going to NYC to see broadway shows. Located in the heart of the theater district on a safe street. Small rooms, which are standard for the city. Does not feel like a mega-big hotel. Lobby is decorated funky with red, black & white; feels more like a boutique hotel, not a big chain hotel. Everything was clean. Staff was friendly & knowledgeable. I wanted to return here with my children, but there are NO adjoining rooms, so we did not stay here. I will stay there again, just wish they had some adjoining rooms for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location. Shame about the WiFi”
Reviews.Author: AdzDoug
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at the paramount. The location was perfect as was our room. The hotel was immaculately clean and very welcoming. I have to say that the bed in our room was so comfortable that I've looked for a similar one since being home. The take-out pizza place next door is amazing. You need to try it. One thing did really bother me whilst staying at the paramount though. The wifi! If I can use wifi at a coffee shop for the price of a latte, why am I paying the earth for it at a hotel I've already paid thousands to stay at??? The signal was so bad that on the 9th floor, I kept losing connection. It was extremely frustrating. I was there during hurricane Irene so wifi would've been a help whilst stuck in my room. I would definitely stay at the paramount again but come on guys, these hotels are ripping us off with these wifi charges. Do not pay for the wifi, buy a slice of pizza from the place next door instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms, average service”
Reviews.Author: theavidtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days pre-Easter. Room rate via Expedia for a refurbed twin was about 200 pounds / 320 dollars a night so not that cheap The good: Location right off Times Square, by the theatre showing ghost. About 5 mins walk from subway (depending on the crowds) Free wifi in lobby (but not free in room) 24 hour gym On site dean and deluca coffee shop The bad: Rooms were very small and noisy. Stayed in a room by the lift and I could easily hear the conversations outside While refurbished, the room was obviously once in a pretty bad state. Livable but I'd expect more for a new room Paying 2 dollars per piece to store luggage on check out day. Never heard of this before The lobby is active but often can get too crowded due to the wifi access points. Overall: Good location, would explore other options in the same price range if staying in new York again. Tip: There's a water fountain and free apples in the gym

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: corymcintyre
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, stayed many times, The hotel staff are wonderful, and thats what it takes to make a great hotel It's close to time square and subway is near by. I can never find anything wrong with the hotel. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: sheepfellover
Reviews.Content: I love a cuppa first thing in the morning so disappointed that there was no kettle or facilities for this. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean but the tiled walls could have done with a rub down in places. The breakfast selection was excellent but the 'all you can eat' at $34 at the price was ridiculous! The decor of the rooms and reception is amazing and different.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: I was here for 4 nights at the end of March 2012 and had a good stay. I found the staff to be extremely helpful with my handful of requests for this and that and they were intent on making sure I was satisfied. My room was small but comfortable with a flat screen TV, iPod dock and bathrobe. I enjoyed the views of the city in the evening and found the room to be very quiet all night long. This is the type of hotel to stay at if you are in the city for a show or entertainment and you would like a hotel that is close to the action. It is not fancy or romantic but it is more artistic and has a "world beat" feel. If you need to connect to the internet for a short time, the WiFi is free in the Lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Dissatisfied with service”
Reviews.Author: mahebalas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for the price i paid. Arround $150 per night. The rooms are terribly small. There is no silverware, cofee maker, microwave or a table. I am from the west coast and this is my first visit to NY. I am not sure if this is how all manhattan hotels are. The main entrance to the hotel is horrendous as well. Would not recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: amaze79
Reviews.Content: Floor: 11 - Room: 1126.Nice size room, a bedroom + a livingroom with sofabed. Good views. Perfect location. Good service. Soundproofed rooms. A decent gym. A bit too noisy in the lobby, they play a bit loud music - Even for us in the late twenties. The wi-fi in the room should have breen Free.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: jgjoseph
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in March 2012. First the negatives, gym is poor, only two out of 5 running machines have been working, bathroom was in need of some tlc, and it is expensive. Positives, great location, 46th and 7th is very central, barmen were superb (very hospitable and the knew how to mix drinks), and the breakfast is very good. Be careful when charging stuff to your room, at breakfast I was over-charged twice in 5 days. This is a good hotel, with a little attention to detail this could be excellent. It needs to correct the niggles to charge what it does. One tip, out hotel turn right then right again, across the road a great pharmacy that sells everything you may need. Cafe on ground floor does great coffee and muffins.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirlromi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and can honestly say for the price this is a great place to stay. It is in an incredible location just steps from Times Square. I have always stayed in a room with two double beds which is great, but the bathrooms are a bit small. The lobby is really cool and Dean and Deluca is right there for a quick coffee and muffin in the morning or else you can eat at the hotel restaurant for an amazing breakfast buffet. I found the rooms to be clean and the bedding nice (no polyester)! I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very nice but extremely small”
Reviews.Author: Destiny11
Reviews.Content: I rented a king size room and got a double bed room. It is the size of a closet. The hotel itself and the lobby and room are all nicely maintained but I stayed in the hotel with my husband and son and it was ridiculous. Not to mention the $30 we spent for over night parking. The location of the hotel is great. We walked to the Rockerfeller center and thru time square itself but definitely would have rather pay a bit more money for some more room. For one person a night or two the room is good but not for more than 1 person. The advertise their rooms incorrectly. When I was in the lobby checking in, the service was pretty bad. Their were three lines waiting to check in. And then one line closed, at a horrible time. It took a good 20 minutes to check in and get our key. While in line the ladies in front of us were upset because the hotel had loss their tickets to a show. (Something within that nature) Not a good look!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Megs7154
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat this location. We were less then half a block from Time Square. The staff was friendly and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Amber R
Reviews.Content: Excellent location!! Just 1/2 block from Time Square. We were able to upgrade to a "suite" with 2 queen beds (one was a pull out) with 2 bathrooms which was perfect for 4 girls. The rooms are small but the upgrade only cost a minimal fee per night. Subway entrance just short 2 block walk with quick access north or south and excellent access to Broadway shows. One shower wouldn't work first day (plunger wouldn't stay up) but when mentioned to housekeeping was fixed by next day.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, accommodation poor!”
Reviews.Author: FergusonW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paramount for 4 nights (19-23 March 2012) and had read the reviews about the small rooms before arriving so phoned to see how much it would cost to upgrade. I was initially quoted 30 dollars a night for a queen size room, when I contacted the hotel to make the booking the cost was quoted at 60 dollars for the stay and 80 dollars for a superior king. We opted for the superior king. I expected a decent size room but it was still tiny. The facilities in the room were basic. A bed, two side tables, a chair and a very small built-in wardrobe. This is the least well equipped room I have ever stayed. The location is great but it doesn't compensate for the poorly designed and equipped room. I wouldn't recommend this hotel, but NY was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Huge waste of money---strongly advise you stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Hambos83
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over another NYC favorite (Hilton Garden Inn Times Square) because it had a special deal and was a higher star-rated hotel. We were aware that it would be small from other reviews but assumed it couldn't be too bad- and we wouldn't be in the room much anyway. As soon as we stepped into our "4 star" room we were astounded at the ridiculous size. There was next to no room for us to put our two bags and we could hardly walk around. The bed was tiny and shoved against a wall which made it impossible for the person on the wall side to sleep. The bathroom is like a prison bathroom. The only shelving is above the toilet which is treacherous. The air conditioning is too loud to use and when the toilet flushes it sounds like a rocket. There is no fridge or coffee making facilities in the room, which is just ridiculous for a "nice" hotel. The free lobby wifi is very slow and always drops out. This is partly because the whole hotel seems to sit in the weirdly fragrant lobby to use the wifi. We tried to cancel our booking but it was non-refundable. We were so miserable in the tiny room that it was ruining the holiday, and we went and booked the Hilton Garden Inn anyway and just paid for two hotels. For people booking the Paramount's most expensive rooms these issues may not be a problem. But for anyone thinking about booking the more basic rooms who is convinced by the star rating and value, please don't do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..but a couple of issues”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: First, the other reviewers are quite correct. Great location and very, very reasonably priced. I paid $209 for a queen...Also, good Ethno throbbing music and great art in the common areas. Check in was flawless and they found a room away from the street which was quiet. Having said that, be aware that the rooms are incredibly small, toilets are installed at an angle from the radiator in the bathroom, the concerige wasn't particularly helpful (I asked for a fish or light fare and the response was "there are a number of good restaurants on 46th Street between 8th and 9th Avenue,' etc. I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Shoebox size rooms”
Reviews.Author: ilir11
Reviews.Content: Maybe one of the few places in the world where you would pay 200 dollars to sleep in a closet, with an airplane-like lavatory. The location is great as it is steps away from Times Square and the whole freakshow central... However, next time, I would rather stay somewhere further south and to the west, for a bit less money. I forgot how small Manhattan really is, and really you don't need to be that close to Times Square. Oh, and don't you dare to make a call with the room phone. I think they charge 17 dollars a minute for local calls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, trendy atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Ellen R
Reviews.Content: I travel for business often, and have stayed in many places in NYC. Paramount has become my favorite. Funky, open lobby with Euro-tech music, friendly staff greeting at the door, clean and modern rooms. If you go, you've got to visit the Library bar on the second floor. The very knowledgeable bartender makes a _perfect_ Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, average accommodation”
Reviews.Author: groberts51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in one room and my in-laws and sister-in-law shared another. For me, this was my sixth visit to New York (wife's 2nd) but it was the in-laws first time to this great city and, because my mother-in-law is not great on her feet, we chose a hotel for its location - and this is where the Paramount is excellent. With it only being 50 yards from Times Square it is in an ideal location for you to walk to most of the midtown attractions. However, the hotel itself was a bit of a let down. The staff were very helpful, even when there were issues with the rooms - and there were a few. In our room the a/c was not working - so much so that when we tried to get the overnight temperature down from 22 to 18, we woke in the middle of the night to find the setting at 29 degrees C!! The storage in our room (and we were in a so called deluxe room) was minimal and that is being polite. The issues in the other room ranged from too small beds (2 doubles promised) and a dreadful smell from the drains (resulting in a change of room and a free breakfast for the five of us - which we would not have considered otherwise because we felt it was very expensive for the buffet style it was). The issue of storage was more of an issue for them because they had less storage for 4 people than my wife and I had in a room for two. A plus for the hotel would be the free wifi offered in the lobby and the good access to the internet offered via 3 ipads and 2 computers. All in all - if you are choosing a hotel and location is the number one priority then this could be the hotel for you. However, as I said at the start, this was my 6th time to New York and I would have to rank this 5th out of the 6 hotels I have stayed at in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and the price was right”
Reviews.Author: Hofman24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a Friday night after booking a last minute rate. Location was great, within 100 yards of Times Square. Walking distance to the theaters. Only draw back was the double bed, wish they were all queens at least. Deli on the first floor for coffee, etc in the morning. Would stay here again for another quick trip to the theater.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Whitebaps
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The paramount from 8th March 2012. We were upgraded to a Queen room - it had a disabled adapted bathroom but no worries as there was lots of space. We did however miss having a dressing table or extra table as could not plug in GHD's and use of a mirror other than the bathroom was a bit of a nuisance when you are both getting ready. Apart from this staff anf hotel were great. Very Clean, lobby smelt amazing and our room was cleaned well every day. We were just off Times Square and there's a great Deli called Danny's Deli directly behind the hotel in the next street and not too expensive either. Definitely recommend the Grayline hop on/off bus tickets and also Juniors Restaurant just off Times Square. enjoy your stay - we did! x

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: amie f
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the paramount for 6 nights from March 5 -11, this was my boyfriends first time in New York and we were really looking forward to the trip we arrived at the paramount and from the minute we walked through the doors, the staff could not have been more helpful, taking our bags, speedy check in and also upgraded our room to Queen size, which was perfect as we had a lot of luggage and needed the space. The room was fabulous, nice view, extremely clean, and had A docking station which I thought was a nice touch! Our favourite part of the room, was the bed! It was huge and sooo comfy! The location of the hotel was perfect, you couldn't get more central and was a great base for seeing the sights! The lobby of the hotel is fabulous and sit down and enjoy a coffee, the hotel had iPads in the lobby which were free to use, very helpful for looking up sights and locations of restaurants etc. joined to the hotel is a Dean and Deluca coffee shop, which was handy for a quick breakfast. Overall, I cannot fault this hotel, I recommend it to anyone travelling to new York and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: angelaMerseyside
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the paramount hotel in June 2011 with a group of friends. The hotel was in a great location just a stones throw away from times square. This was ideal for us as we wanted to be close to all the main attractions. Although it was close to times square it wasnt as noisy as I was expecting in fact you couldnt really hear any traffic noise at all. The only reservation I had with this hotel was the size of the rooms they were extremely small. We had a family room as there was three of us in the one room but there was hardly any space to put our belongings. compact would be the best way to describe it. But apart from that it was ideal for what we wanted out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; service and amenities barely midline”
Reviews.Author: EscapesfromTexas
Reviews.Content: I succumbed to the dreaded NYE in Times Square temptation and booked a couple of rooms here for my family. Even at such a busy time of year, the missteps were too much for the cost involved (several hundred per night per room). First, when reserving, the person on the phone stated that there was a rooftop bar from which to watch the ball drop. No such thing exists. The bar is on the lobby floor and looks onto the theatre across the street. I knew this though by looking at the hotel online, but found this unethical. Second, the rooms were not ready at check -in and the front desk staff did not call as promised when they were readied. This left us out in Times Square with no room key to be able to get back past the barricade when the police put that up around 5PM. Third, we booked for a stay beyond NYE. The front desk personnel put us on a floor that was closing after the NYE influx, and told us (after we were already in our room) that we would have to be relocated. If I had wanted to move rooms, I could have stayed somewhere else. (Note: they required pre-payment of the room because of the holiday, which made leaving more hassle than it was worth.) Finally, the hotel itself is pretty spartan. The room are unusually small, even for NYC. You could not open the bath door and walk inside without climbing on the bed to do so. The lobby was HEAVILY perfumed. I don't usually notice air fresheners much, but this was so powerful, my eyes were watering. The smell was heavy and persistent throughout the stay. I've stayed other places in NYC and had much better experiences. I could not really recommend a stay here. They have location, so they will fare well, but I would suggest looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Paramount!”
Reviews.Author: 565David
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paramount on 7th March 2012 as a treat for our anniversay. The staff upgraded us to a queen bed room as the standard rooms are a little on the small side, but in New York hotels the rooms are pretty small as standard. Very clean and very quiet room. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Excellent location for theatres and shopping. Could not recommend this hotel enough! We will definately be returning to the Paramount.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PhilEtFred
Reviews.Content: Excellent location: One block from Time Square Very nice hotel and, most important for us, really helpful staff : Sean, Romel, ... Could be one of the best service we've seen! Nice, clean room and good bed. We're recommending this Hotel to our friends. Near to this hotel a simple and great pizza restaurant: Patzeria twitter @philippevayssac

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: neilgt4
Reviews.Content: I would definately recommend the Paramount Hotel in New York City to any tourist that wants to spend their time seeing the city. Location is incredible, right in the heart of Manhattan half a block away from Times Square. Impressive lobby, with a magnificent stairway full of candles. The rooms are small but provide the essentials. HDTV, ipod dock/alarm clock, ironing board/iron, hot-air hair dryer, and a safe for valuables are the high points of the room we stayed in. Though I didn't utilize the following services, they also offer a fitness center, business center, bar/nightclub, etc. I find it difficult to complain about the size of the room, because we didn't spend much time inside. We were there to see NYC. The breakfast service at the mezzanine restaurant was excellent. Very nice, polite and helpful staff! especially when it came to buy tickets for events, they were extremely friendly. While our stay was short, the location of the Paramount Hotel and the service provided by it's staff made for a very wonderful first impression of New york City. See you again.

Reviews.Title: “I so wish it had been better 2.5 starts”
Reviews.Author: ericamcarr
Reviews.Content: I have to preface this review by saying that Andrea Yeager & Shakaysha did an amazing job at trying to right the wrongs of our stay. All in all I think this hotel needs work on many things. First day of arrival for my WEDDING WEEKEND, we found a pair of DIRTY UNDERWEAR, yes that's right, under the edge of a couch cushion. This grossed me out so much that we almost left. But since we had 12 members of our family patronizing the hotel, it would have been hard to find another place last minute. When I called to report the, a'hem, dirty panties, it took them over 45 min to come collect them. I was speaking to operator Carol whom told me to 'act irate when the manager calls" so that they would know how unacceptable it was. Thanks Carol for being on my side, but the 7 calls you made after that were a bit much. She kept calling to see what the managers would do for me. Carol the operator offered me a free dinner and a fee bottle of wine, both of which I declined. That would not make up for a soiled pair of underwear on the beginning of our wedding weekend. Finally the dirty panties were removed and then I was given a call by the assistant manager, Shakaysha (not sure how to spell it). She apologized over and over, & even came up to make sure we were ok. Nice touch. That night, the heat was cranking from the registers even though the thermostat was on OFF. It was so hot, we could not sleep, not fun after a 5 hour plane right and 3 hour time change. They said an engineer would come fix it, but did not as it happened again the next 2 nights. Also, there was a light in the hall of the room that would not turn off - also not cool when you can't sleep because of it. Next morning we both tried to take showers, only to find the water ICE COLD - WTF? Another phone call to the front desk, another promise to fix - didn't happen The next evening when we returned home from dinner, we found chocolate covered strawberries and an apology note. Nice touch and appreciated. Again another night of super hot air, we ended up opening the windows to compensate. Next morning another shower try - this time it was tepid/cold, not a warm or hot shower that I preferred. After we came home from dinner the next night there was a bottle of Champagne waiting for us with another apology note. They also offered to move us to another room. If this had not been our wedding weekend, I would have gladly packed up everything and done it. But with all the dresses, luggage and tons of other pre wedding things already in place (plus on no sleep and no proper shower), I didn't want to do it honestly. Next morning, the shower was cold again and when I called down to complain, the phone was dead. ARE YOU FING KIDDING ME RIGHT NOW???????????????? So I called one of the managers, Andrea Yeager on her cell (I had it from an email she sent before our arrival) to let her know my dissapointment. She encouraged me to move and she had another suite for us right now. I met her on another floor and I was shown their biggest suite, The Entertainment suite. PERFECT for our party to get ready, 3 bathrooms huge tv's etc. I was thrilled and went back to pack. We were so happy! We both took showers & it was super hot - perfect! I was so excited about this. Then came the night before the wedding. We invited the girls over for a little food/slumber party. When we tried to use the iPod doc, it was broken. When we tried to order a movie on the huge flat screen, it didn't work. AGAIN - WHAT THE F???????????????????? We called and had TWO engineers try to come fix the iPod doc with no luck. He had to rig it up with tape and a book. The guy trying to fix the TV said he would have to come back (it was 11 at night & I was getting married the next day - no thanks). So we gave up and didn't have the night we wanted. Day of the wedding I was startled by a housekeeper letting herself in at 8am with a master key. I couldn't believe it- what the hell? I had the do not disturb on and at 8am? AHHH! The wedding day couldn't have been any better, thank God! For the next day, the housekeeping staff came in and changed out the towels but cleaned nothing AND LEFT OUR DOOR WIDE OPEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. I wrote a final letter to Andrea Yeager, but received nothing back. I'm sure they were all sick of me complaining about things, but hey wouldn't you prefer to know from someone who is reasonable rather than a nut job? They did comp ONE NIGHT for us - that was fine. All in all, I would not stay here again. There were just too many things going wrong. And I do agree with the other reviews here and on yelp, the breakfasts were WAY over priced for what you got. Ok - done.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at the Paramount NYC”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a trip to NYC where we stayed at the Paramount Hotel just off Time Square. The Lcoation could not have been better with immediate access to the Subway, Time Square and the Theatre district. The hotel lobby was really cool and vibrant and they offer complimentary wifi here. there are also some IPAD's and Mac's available for your use with a free print facility. the staff were really friendly and we recieved an upgrade to a larger room which was cool. It was my girlfriends birthday the day we arrived and when we got to the room we found a small chocolate cake on a dessert plate which was really tasty saying Happy Birthday on the plate in chocolate along with two complimentary cocktail vouchers for the Hotel Bar which again I cannot fault. Really trendy bar! The Room was not the biggest and a little bit of street noise but you are litterally a stone throw from times square so this was not an issue. Rooms were cleaned daily and they were immaculate. I cannot fault this hotel in anyway and would recommend taking the short walk to W50th street from the Hotel to a Mexican Bistro called "Toalache" for an evening meal. they serve refined mexican cuisine and it was amazing. Their guacamole is a must have. Book in advance though as they are so busy with theatre goers you may not get a seat :) thanks to Crystal and all the staff at the paramount for a memorable stay

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: TBK1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from NY and stayed at the Paramount for 4 nights what a great location,1 minute to times square and theatres.The hotel itself is very easy,great lifts(elevators) small rooms,we had a king,but very clean and comfortable.We didn't use any facilities apart from the concierge and Internet.We had no complaints whatsoever and loved New York.will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniela603
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very nice and helpful staff (Great Guglielmo). Nice room, very good bed. Thanks a lot, I am recommending the Hotel to friends. Daniela and Andrea, Italy

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: AnnieCBanbridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with 3 friends from 2-7 March. We booked two rooms. Both rooms were very small and the hotel upgraded us to bigger rooms for a small fee. Not a lot of room to hang clothes in wardrobe, the drop only 3' max. But anything longer you could just drape on a coat hook with one of the hangers. The bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean (again tho no shelf in bathroom for your products) The location of hotel is excellent. Just a 5 minute walk to Times Square and a ten minute walk to the Port Authority bus centre where you get the bus to the airports and the Outlet at Woodbury Common. There is an excellent coffee shop which isnt over expensive which serves delicious danish pastries and croissants! No tea or coffee facilities in the rooms. Overall the faults that we found were small. Any of these were soon made up by the excellent staff who were always helpful and courteous. Rooms were clean, plenty of towels and hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: LaneOne
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat the location. One block from Time Square and walking distance to Broadway theatres. Rooms are small, even by NYC standards, but are clean, relatively quiet, and comfortable. We had a suite, and even that was small. Beds are small -- very small -- and soft. Our suite had views on three sides, including Time Square and 46th Street. Breakfast buffet (served in the Library bar) was surprisingly good. Excellent selection and high quality food. Suggest you book a room that includes breakfast as it is quite expensive if purchased separately ($34 per person) -- though even with breakfast vouchers, the hotel charges 18% gratuity to your room, or about $6.12 per person, so not really a free breakfast (in all my travels, this was a first). Building is quite old, but updated to a more trendy look. Front desk staff quite friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “such an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annieb1987
Reviews.Content: Me and my 2 sisters went to NYC in December 2011 for my younger sisters 21st and in all honestly could not have picked a better hotel.... The staff are all very helpful, we booked all our trips threw the hotel and was 100% happy the hotel it's self is very classy we loved it!!! I'm planning to go back in November with a friend (another girlie shopping trip) and of course I will be staying in the Paramount hotel again.. Also it's in the best location 30 seconds and ur in the middle of Times Square!!

Reviews.Title: “A week of wonderment”
Reviews.Author: lizbeth40
Reviews.Content: My daughter son n granddaughters sent my husband and I here for a week 25th feb -3 march. Big thanks to anneka Joseph and everyone who made our stay a wonderful experience. Highly recommended great hospitality everyone friendly. Anneka Corfu kassioppi village see you there. And if your ever in Liverpool uk look us up wud love to see u again xx thank you all once again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/ great Location”
Reviews.Author: karenastafford
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Paramount .Was a bit concerned by some previous reviews. Hotel was good. Room size average. Comfy beds and clean sheets and towels every day My one critisism of hotel...no mirrors in bedroom only in bathroom a pain trying to put on makeup etc when your other half is in shower and mirror all steamed up!! Don't have breakfast in hotel too expensive. Come out of hotel turn right and right again at end of block straight ahead to end of next block(about 200 yards) Carve deli is a cracking cheap little american deli which serves delicious bagels, breakfast rolls,coffee , fresh orange juice and lots more.Another tip we got from a guide always look for the blue A in eating places windows this means the place has passed a very strict hygene inspection annually. Doesn't mean it is the best for food but it usually follows if place is clean you will get something decent to eat.(have to say don't i don't class NY as a gourmet city).Directly next door on the left of the hotel doorway is a brilliant pizza takeaway(doesn't look much ) but cracking pizzas. Back to the hotel top marks for location about 100 yards from Times Square. Another tip (especially if you are not going at peak times) don't buy theatre tickets till you get there. We bought Sister Act tickets pre travelling (£180 for 2) but managed to get Priscilla and Rock of ages tickets at half price on the day of the show if you are willing to queue for a very short time at TKTS booth just around corner from hotel in Times Square). Queues look very long but they go down really quicky when booth opens at 3pm. I loved my visit to NY it was even more than I was hoping for and if I return I would have definately stay at the Paramount

Reviews.Title: “Great location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pearlypaula
Reviews.Content: There were four of us we had two rooms both had two double beds and it was big enough for two of us, it was clean bright and modern. We requested a high floor prior to our visit which we got. Perfect location staff friendly and helpful would stay here again. Did find drinking in the bar expensive 3 wines and a Vodka and Coke $60

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a shoebox”
Reviews.Author: WorldtrotterCH
Reviews.Content: First for the good stuff : an excellent location, just only a few steps from Times Square and Theatre area. The staff was friendly, helpful and had a professional attitude. The reception area had this Modern Art design touch that makes you feel you're in a different kind of hotel miles away from the standard lookalike international hotels you would find anywhere in the world. We reserved several single rooms with my business colleagues. All were comparable : despite the Philippe Starck designer signature, the single rooms were really tiny and "well lived" (I'm avoiding to say "used and old") Our rooms were noisy - you could hear people in the corridor as well as the next room TV - and so small, they weren't big enough to lay an open suitcase. Thermal insulation (window) was pretty poor and I slept the two nights with a draught on my back. Double rooms are probably bigger and better but we didn't bother to check (and change) since we were only there for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel,great experience..although slight hiccup on checking out”
Reviews.Author: neillaura3011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel feb/march 2012 and are so glad that we did. the location of this hotel is literally only a 30 second walk into the heart of times square, couldnt be more perfectly placed if it tried. The lobby is very classy and always smelt fresh and the staff were very helpfull,always wishing us good morning,evening and welcoming us back when we retured. We upgraded prior to arrival to a queen size room after reading comments about the room sizes and from recomendations of freinds who have stayed there. The queen size was adequate and the bathroom was tiny, the shower pressure when hot was not very good (but then again we were on the very top floor) so that was to be expected to a sense. But then came the hiccup on checking out...... When we checked in,we were told our upgrade to a queen size room was free of charge which we were delighted about, so we spent the money that we had saved for the upgrade on souveniers and gifts. Then upon checking out,we were told we had to pay for the upgrade and that the upgrade was not free. I questioned this and in the end, the charge was dropped. After asking why a member of staff would say its free for it then not be free, the answer i got was "the upgrade was not free as she did not get you to sign for it". This just left me more confused but i left not paying for it and happy it was sorted out. overall i would stay again and was generally pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lottyxm
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and friendly staff are as far as the 'wows' go at this place. After checking in we went to our room to discover just how tiny it was (not big enough to lay a suitcase on the floor and open it) we decided to pay the additional money to upgrade to a 'queen'-basically a better sized room with a normal double bed. Cleanliness was not of a particularly high standard due to the large build up of dust on the picture rail and dirt unhoovered by the bed. the room was very tatty there was a cupboard door missing scuffed paint etc...The rooms are extremely loud ( can hear everything outside the room and above) windows are very poor, despite the blinds being shut to prevent the obvious draught the room was still very cold. The tv was another issue, after having to pay for the upgrade to a room that was of a habitable size and wifi access we then turned on the tv to find that anything you want to watch you have to pay for! After travelling for several hours and being out in the city after an early start. We wanted to relax on our first night in the hotel But apparantly it even costs to do nothing! I was very dubious about reading all of the previous bad reviews on the hotel, assuming they were 'complainers' or had just been unlucky. Sadly they are highly accurate. Hugely disappointed. Would also like to point out we are still at the hotel after 2 nights but are considering looking for somewhere else to stay for the duration of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Paramount Hotel - a great bargain!!”
Reviews.Author: Ardaga43
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Very pleased with the location.Rooms are very small, but adequate. Also, all was very clean. Good beds. Pillows needed some help. Staff friendly. Very nice Library Bar. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Hobby design by Stark”
Reviews.Author: RiadDarNajat
Reviews.Content: Very convenient area in the heart of NY with all around! Trendy with a FAB lobby entrance and place to have a chilly dinner; Nice bar in front ,lots of theaters and attractions for sure as you are in Broadway and you will feel very safe there also with a very attentive staff. Only complain..if you like sausages and eggs the morning, the breakfast cost and you must” brake the bank “ when you just wake up.. and..the accommodations are not really "huge" even if convenient and cheap for what you get! all in all. highly recommended and (very) last ,they have a great marketing with always sending some card & co to the passed guests! Sincerely ,Oliver Behar from Marrakech

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: MHerzfeld
Reviews.Content: So i'm spoilt with hotels in other areas on the globe, but was a bit upset that there was only paid tv when i had time to kill and not in the mood for going out! The rest was ok. The location made up for the rest

Reviews.Title: “Fab location!”
Reviews.Author: Louise A
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights at the beginning of February. I was a bit wary especially after reading the not so complimentary reviews on here but it was absolutely fine! The best thing about this hotel is the location, you are literally a minutes walk from Times Square and within easy reach of most Broadway shows (especially Ghost, Evita and Porgy & Bess which were in the same road!). Its about a 15/20 minute walk to the Empire State Building and similar to the Rockefeller Centre, about 30 minutes to Madison Square Gardens & Central Park - everything really is within walking distance. The only time we got a cab was back from Bloomingdales as we were so tired and couldn't walk anymore! (Beware of some cabs tho, if you're not going in the direction they are they refuse to take you which we thought was a bit rude) As for the hotel itself we found it great on the whole. We had a Broadway Classic room on the 3rd floor which was one of the cheapest and yes it was small but not small enough to bother us. We could stand both suitcases up or lay them down on the floor without having to step over them. The bed was very comfy and we had plenty of room in there with both of us. We had no view from our room, we were just looking onto another building. It wasn't noisy outside (or inside for that matter) either apart from the night NY giants won the superbowl and we heard them all night though that was to be expected and again didnt bother us. Now onto the bathroom and heating which together caused the only problems/bugbears we had on our journey. Overall the bathroom was ok, it was adequate for the 2 of us, we had a bath which we liked and didnt expect, towels were replaced and it was thoroughly cleaned every day. However it was impossible to sit on the toilet without hitting yourself on the bathroom heater, we always had to sit at an angle which was a bit odd. As for the heating, it was already on when we got there and we thought it was at an ok level so left it. Big mistake - we were woken during the 1st night by a horrible clanking noise coming from the heater in the bathroom. As it was the middle of the night we left it, shut the bathroom door and then we couldn't hear it anymore. The next morning it was so hot and stuffy in the bathroom we couldn't go in there. I had to go and ask how to turn the bathroom heating off (there were no instructions for it only the main room). I mentioned it to the front desk and someone was up within 10 minutes to look and he managed to turn it off. This didn't seem to stop the clanking, although it wasn't as loud anymore (may have been coming from another room?) so we just left it as it didnt bother us anymore. The room heating was also quite strange, it was controlled by a box on the wall and was quite hard to regulate. Luckily it wasn't too hot or too cold so we didn't need to mess with it much. Onto the reception area, that was quite art deco with its huge chandelier in the centre and wall paintings. There was a gorgeous smell as well as you walk in the building! The wifi was available there - a bit sad we couldn't have it in our rooms though without paying! I had to check us in for our flight on the last day so used 1 of the 3 ipads they have there. That was all done fine, you can print anything off for free and they give it to you at the front desk. The cafe joined to the hotel is good too, their pastries and hot chocolate are gorgeous!! The staff we encountered were pleasant especially the concierge who helped us find our bearings on the first day with the free maps and advice. Overall we really enjoyed ourselves, had the best holiday ever,we would recommend it to anyone and definitely stay here again if we were to ever come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal Great Location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: trowland57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I often stay in the Times Square area. Our return trip to The Paramount Hotel was terrific. We got a great deal and a wonderful king size corner room. We checked in very early and they were very accomadating. The staff is very friendly and helpful.. Nathalie,Nerma,Hector, and the front desk manager Luis Otero are the best. Hope to get another deal in March.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for New York”
Reviews.Author: IanA1964
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice before. Yes the basic rooms can be a bit small. Going back to New York Paramount Hotel on 28th of March this year and have booked a suite this time. Will let you know what it was like. But at the end of the day, the hotel is in a perfect position for broadway and all the shopping that you want. A perfect place to make your base in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Set your expectation's right and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PaulR99_12
Reviews.Content: This isn’t the Waldorf, this isn’t the Plaza, but if you want convenience of location (200 yards from Time Square), really friendly staff, affordable accommodation, a beautiful coffee shop with heavenly treats, and most of all .... a bed that is so comfortable (tried robbing the mattress and pillows they were that amazing) that when you’re exhausted from shopping, sightseeing, and general merrymaking you’ll float off to slumberland as if you’ve fallen into a cloud of marshmellows! If I’m to be honest, I thought the lobby was a little dark, the wifi wasn’t great, and the hotel brekkie prices are too high to keep you from skipping around the corner to a deli. But, take it for what it is, a place to retire to, keep you safe, allow you to recharge your batteries and prevent you to traipsing too far with shopping bags. As I said, set your expectations and this place will hit the mark !!!

Reviews.Title: “kinda like that Ikea dresser you bought 10 years ago”
Reviews.Author: ekdc
Reviews.Content: You know how when you buy furniture at Ikea, it looks kind of cheap but functional. Then, ten years later, after years of wear and tear, it never looks good? This hotel is like Ikea furniture. When I first stayed here about 5 years ago, it was fine. But now, it's showing wear and is fairly uncomfortable. I checked in after booking on Hotel Tonight. I was supposed to get a room suitable for two people. What I got was a room with one twin bed, and the room was only slightly larger than the twin bed. So not even enough room for a second person to sleep on the floor. Very small, even for New York standards. The hotel was rude and demanded more money to upgrade to a two person room. Hotel Tonight, which has GREAT customer service, cancelled my reservation and I stayed that night at another hotel down the street. I would avoid this place. The staff are rude, and the rooms are run down. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for business travelers...”
Reviews.Author: Maggie6868
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Paramount for a week for business travel purposes. Overall, the hotel is "ok" but I would not recommend it for business travelers. I have written to the hotel about a few concerns and they did not bother to reply back to me. The room I was in was horribly hot and adjusting the thermostat on the wall was useless because the unit was not working properly. Being on a high floor, I had to open the window to get the room cooled down and therefore, I had to sleep with a bunch of NYC street noise. I had a weeks worth of clothing to put away upon arrival. I opened the closet door to put my clothing away and there are two drawers which are rendered useless because you cannot open them due to the hinges on the closet door being in the way. That was rather frustrating. Another issue is in the bathroom. The electrical outlet is across the way from the sink and mirror located next to the shower. There was a space between the electrical outlet and the wall tile so if any water gets in there while using a razor or hairdryer, that is completely unsafe!!! Love the lounge area but the rooms need some improvement!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Tohono
Reviews.Content: Although I had asked for a room on the higher floors, the hotel was fully booked so I spent the first night in an extremely noisy room on the 3rd floor. The next day, I moved to a slightly smaller room on the 17th floor, which was much quieter. The Paramount Bar is fun but be careful: a 18% tip is automatically added to the bill. I didn't pay attention so I left another 20% tip! When I got my hotel bill at the end of my stay, I noticed the huge tip amount and mentioned it at the front desk. The manager immediately refunded the 20%.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Kitty053
Reviews.Content: I recently spend 4 days in NYC with my fiance staying at this hotel. On arrival We were impressed by the building, lobby etc. check in wasn't very friendly. On first impression of room, it wasn't as small as I thought as I read reviews on here. There was a hole in the ceiling above the window where plaster had fallen off and the light above the sink did not work. However this was resolved when we were out on the first day and I informed the girl at reception of the ceiling but I advised changing rooms was not necessary. Another negative is that on our second day we were very ill with a vomiting bug not able to get out of bed, we ordered 2 slices of plain toast room service explaining we were sick and this came to $18 for two slices of dry toast. Despite the sickness during the trip the hotel was fine, in a central location. Would recommend it to others, but if I were coming back to NYC is stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great deal”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborMichigan
Reviews.Content: To save money, I booked a "Broadway Petite" that had a single bed. It was tiny with no desk, and the window faced another wall, but the decor was modern without being austere and the linens were crisp. As the front desk said, this size room is for the traveler that just wants a place to drop their suitcase. The location is extremely convenient, just half a block from Times Square, but far enough to avoid the ever present jostling crowds. I had a lot of trouble with the WiFi in my room even though I was willing to pay, but accessed it quickly without charge on the second floor. (Free WiFi is also available in the attractive lobby.) After an unpleasant, rude, and unprofessional encounter at check-in, Scott, the manager on duty, rectified the problem to my satisfaction. The elevators were so fast and efficient that other NYC hotels should be envious. With the one exception at the front desk, the staff were friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was thorough. I would definitely stay here again. If you stay there, be sure to head to 8th Street for the many restaurants. Even though they are only a block away from 7th, they seem like neighborhood eateries and are not part of a national chain.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, and great location”
Reviews.Author: Julie200111
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in one of the smaller rooms tho we found it to be big enough ,very basic,with what the hotel claimed to be a double bed ( seemed smaller), however very comfortable! Rooms cleaned daily with fresh linen left in bathroom. Safe was a safe box in small cupboard that was also used as a wardrobe, it wasn't secured to wall so anyone could walk out with it under their arms ! No tea, coffee facilities in room. Bar expensive, $60 for 2 beers and 2 cocktails! Walls thin! People in room next to us had been smoking ,smell,smoke filtered into our room from gap under joining doors . Complained to front desk who promtly dealt with this , we were offered another room . Looks like hotel has been refurbished to give it a contempory feel however its been done on the cheap. Hotel is in a great location , only a stones throw from time square . Would i stay here again, possibly but would not pay full price, only if rooms were on offer .

Reviews.Title: “It is just okay”
Reviews.Author: teacher557
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Family Day/ President's Day weekend. It was rated 4 star so we thought it should be okay. The location was amazing but the hotel itself was lacking. The room was smaller than small. It was ridiculous. There was no storage space in the washroom for makeup, hairbrush, toothbrush ect.. Although the beds were comfy the room was not. The room was too small for 2 people. Even housekeeping must of thought so too as they kept leaving one washcloth. 1 face towel, and one shampoo. Overall I would not stay here again. The price was right though. The doorman ripped us off so be careful if he offers to get you a cab. Get an orange one and not any other one. He got us a $25 plus tip ride to Union Square and on the way back it only cost $10 with tip. Hmmmm. Someone must of be getting a kickback!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “super clean!”
Reviews.Author: L W
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 12th floor, lifts give perfect access. The hotel was immaculately clean, always someone hovering, spraying or wiping something clean. Rooms cleaned daily with fresh towels, refreshed soap bars, mini shampoo, conditioner, body wash and moisturizer. Bedding was freshly maid and daily changed, it was clear the cleaners had had a tidy round stacking magazines etc. Room has a TV with free cable access, this worked perfect - cartoons for the children, and various family TV. Optional movies on demand service. Rooms have thin walls, the first 3 nights we were awoken by our neighbor having friends back, opening and closing his room door (possibly to exit his room to smoke outside), however, this is overlooked by a hotel mid city center, for the price you pay. Most evenings there was EMT siren noise, however this slowly mingles into your dreams and you don't notice it. Rooms small with a bed, shower/bath, toilet and sink, but we expected this as we looked at you tube videos (pre-trip). There was plenty of room for two suitcases to stand up and hand luggage in the wardrobe. A mini table twisted out for dining. Nice touches such as paper and pencil in your room to plan your day. The shower was not so powerful if you are used to a power-shower, however water was always hot. Windows open wide for 'fresh city air' and room temp' climate control to suit your desire. A safe is in the room, accessed by use of swiping your credit card, not something we chose to do. A credit card down-payment on checking into the hotel is needed in-case of room damage, £75 deducted on arriving, if the room is ok when leaving, your credit card is fully refunded. (I wait to see if charges/VAT have occurred) The hotel is decorated beautifully with chandeliers, piano, and tasteful Disney art work. Wifi available in the lobby, with lots of comfortable seating areas to rest. Internet available in your room with an extra charge, sitting in the lobby was fine for us. The hotel Lobby contained electronic machines with tourist ideas you might like to explore and get a little pre-knowledge. Hotel is right in Times square, food and entertainment all in walking distance. Food and drink available in the hotel but we did not access this. A beautiful pizza/pasta shop next door....... amazing - the best we found!!!! We often took food back to the room, with no complaint from the hotel. Staff are very friendly, a $ tip is required if your cases are carried up to the room or put into a taxi. We both used the hotel car to the airport (fully recommend total for $65 + tip), and the airport travel express shuttle bus. I would defiantly pay the hotel car price. Shuttle bus ($15 each person, each way) is comfortable, warm and friendly, however the journey to and from the airport is a very long ride. A separate bus will collect you mid journey to take you to your hotel as the shuttle bus doesn't go the full way. Hence, hotel car is a winner with your own personal driver!! Usual American charm, doorman service. The hotel will store your luggage $2 per bag for the day (when leaving). A excellent service, we just extended suitcases to contain hand-luggage for the storage to keep the $2 charge minimal. I was more than happy with this hotel and would defiantly book again. Although the room was small with background noise, it was what we needed it for, to sleep, shower, and sit.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnighter for quick getaway!”
Reviews.Author: brothernot
Reviews.Content: I live close to the city. I'm not that familiar with hotels in the big apple. This one night trip was planned with 6 other couples. We had tickets to see a guitarist named Ronnie Earl at BB Kings. Each couple traveled from various suburbs. My wife and I took an Express Bus in,so we didn't have to deal with parking. One of the best nights out in a long time. The hotel is so conveniently located to Times Square. The room was a bit small,but who cares we only slept there one night. If you live close to the city and plan on going to a show in the area,this is a great place and I think the price was right. Staying in the city overnight was a great idea. We could of went home after the show but after a few cocktails and enjoying a great show with some old friends this was the way to go and have a worry free night. No stress! I would absolutely do this again. Dinner at the Celtic Pub was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “small spaces can suffice”
Reviews.Author: Jubal9654
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in The Big Apple. Stayed at the Paramount which is a half block off Times Square. Very convenient to theatres and museums. Walked to most events with relatively short taxi rides to others. Hotel recently refurbished. Clean and vibrant place with reasonable rates for NY. Total cost for 3 nights $750. Room small, as in very, but nicely decorated with a few signs of it's old age on the door jams. Don't bring a large suitcase as the standard room won't accomodate two of you and two large suitcases very well! Handy breakfast spot off the lobby at Dean & Deluccas- again reasonable, for The City.

Reviews.Title: “In love with NYC”
Reviews.Author: GiCano
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in NYC, the second for my husband but after 14 years. I dreamed about it all my life, and after some planning finally got to NY. I searched carefully for the Hotel, in fact I consulted tripadvisor several times, and I ended picking up Paramount because of the proximit to Times Square and the overall nice reviews. It was the best trip I could have and it have a lot to do with this Hotel. From the begining we´re vey welcome and even having a little problem with the reservations, we´re soon in our upgraded bedroom, which they gave us to compensate this issue. With Times Square just around a corner and subway stations around the other one, we´re able to go everywhere and see so much of the city in 7 days. I just got back but can´t stop thinking about it yet, it was really a dream. The staff was gentle, from reception, to the door guys and the maids, everyone was warm and polite. Our upgraded king room, was a dream, spacious and with a nice view of 8th ave, was just awesome. I fell in love with the city and plann to come back soon and, if possible, stay at The Paramount again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with a very good service”
Reviews.Author: loryBarbados
Reviews.Content: We were there in August 2011 and it was a really good experience.The room was not big but confortable,the location is amazing just closed to the action...the hotel staff was very kind giving us an attent assistance...we will go back

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: cookie57uk
Reviews.Content: very frienly staff, check in a bit slow, room was small but clean, comfy bed, free safe, location is fantastic. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel we went to Daniels on 8th street, you come out the hotel turn right then left good price and very nice food. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome place...can't wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Michele I
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night with my husband but our experience was nothing shy of perfect. The customer service was pleasant and friendly asking us question like getting to know us. The main lobby was breath taking. It was dim and somber and comfy with the big velvet seats and the music. The hotel was clean and the decor was modern with a classic look very pretty. The location is perfect it was across the way from the theatre (litterally cross the street and cross a parking lot and we were there) and it's right down the street from time square. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are amazing...I wish I could have put the bed in my bag and took it home lol. Yes like everyone else said the bathrooms are a little small but there isn't much to do in a bathroom that i needed a ton of room. the view is awesome. I didn't have a view of time square but I did have a view of 8th street which is just as nice. all in all no complaints here and would def recommend this hotel to friends and fam.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place we've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Kay C
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is not at all as advertised. Each time we went to ask the concierge a question, it was someone different and none of them ever had any answers. The beds are on the floor, so so seniors beware. The bathroom was tiny and had no place to sit any toiletries where they didn't fall off onto the floor. There were times of the day when there was no ice available because the bar was closed. You had to go get the ice yourself as there was no room-service either. All the other travellers we spoke with were very disgruntled, as were we. The only good thing about it was its proximity to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a weekend trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: Mexx_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the second time in 2 years and not much has changed. The customer service at check in and check out is very professional and efficient. The lobby bar as well as the library bar are worth visiting. I have to agree with the dimly lit lobby as well as the hallways and elevator areas. This time I didn't enjoy our room, as it was even smaller and at the end of the hallway, which was loud from heating and wind noise. I have to say the bed was very comfortable and the linen in good shape. Really this hotel is all about location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Stafff”
Reviews.Author: Rick s
Reviews.Content: Paramount Hotel has been great to me in all of my visits. I would especially like to mention Nerma, who works at the front desk, who always remembers me, welcomes me with a warm smile and could not possibly be nicer or more accomodating. I would highly recommend this hotel and especially saying hi to Nerma upon your visit. Everyone has been great!!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, beautiful setting but not good value”
Reviews.Author: aistiby
Reviews.Content: This hotel I found a little pretentious, but then again what to expect in such a touristic area of New York? The hotel rooms were clean and so were the shower rooms, but were very small and I really feel this was not expressed on the website. The bed they claimed to be a double bed was pretty small, and when we complained they just reeled off measurements of the bed to prove it was so. Although, after we complained we did get a small room upgrade the following day free of charge so I cannot complain too much. The staff were a mixed bag, some friendly and others like they really could not be bothered to talk to you and were a bit snooty. The area around this hotel is nice if you like to fight your way through people all the time. I would probably not stay in the same location when I return to New York, but this is not the hotels fault. I would stay here again but not as a priority. Also, the breakfast was fantastic but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Comfortable room. Basic bathroom. Average customer service.”
Reviews.Author: GMT80
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its proximity to Times Square, the theatre district and the fact that it is fairly central in Manhattan. But importantly it is a comfortable and clean hotel. The lobby area has no natural light and is so dimly lit it feels like you’re walking into a nightclub. The customer service was average at best. Our travel agent had made an error with our booking with the number of guests and length of stay at this hotel. No fault of the hotel, but despite us producing paperwork showing the correct booking, they seemed reluctant to sort it out and give us a room for two until the manager came in the following morning (we were trying to check in at about 11pm - not sure where they expected us to go). Eventually we had no option but to take the room for one person – a room which could only be described as a shoe-box even for one person (A queen bed and a bathroom), and with a shower-head you have to duck under – and I’m only 5’9”. They said they would send up a fold-away bed but that never came even after a follow up call. After frantic international calls to our travel agent back home, who in-turn called the hotel to sort out the mess, they gave us a room more akin to what we had booked, but we still had to spend two nights in the shoe-box until that room became available. Upon checking in for that room we were told that room was a “very nice” room. We laughed when we saw it because the room was pretty much status-quo for a hotel room. Comfortable and clean, but nothing luxurious - old rooms which have been refurbished basically. The bathroom was dim, basic and without much bench space to put toiletries which was a bit annoying, and the shower took a long time to heat up. But we were still able to relax and get a good night’s sleep which is probably the most important thing. In between our change of rooms we had to leave our luggage with reception. When we came back to collect them, they had moved the bags for some reason and they couldn’t locate one of our bags. The guy seemed almost lazy to help us find it. Just as concern was setting in we found it around a corner – and then we tipped him for I don’t know what. During our stay there was an inflatable rat out the front warning of the Paramount’s supposed bed-bug infestation among other things, but we found no evidence of such a problem in either of the rooms we stayed in. Breakfast on the mezzanine floor was expensive for not a lot of food which wasn’t that great. There weren’t any tables available so we were forced to have our meal on the sofa and coffee table! But this is New York City and there is no shortage of places to have a good breakfast! So I wouldn’t bother with breakfast in the hotel. Overall, it was still a good place to stay and well worth considering given its location, and probably one of the cheaper options in that area. The rooms are good apart from a few minor negatives. However for people working in a major area of the hospitality industry, their customer service needs improvement. If you only need to deal with them when checking in & out then you’ll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Paramount Exceeds My Expectations Again!”
Reviews.Author: KatzenMuseumStore
Reviews.Content: As a returning visitor, the Paramount helped me procure a room rate that beat all others. My room needs at booking couldn't be guaranteed, but at check-in were granted. The front desk staff were exceptional, from check-in to check-out! The rooms were clean and comfortable. I have stayed here 3 years in a row and will continue to return for business, for years to come. Thank you Paramount! Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room in hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: murphyScotland
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in, double rooms are elaborate cupboards, lobby is tacky and uninviting, concierge is not available in the evenings, bars are not open until late afternoon,only good thing is location, ok you do not expect to stay in your room in New York, but a bit of comfort wouldn't go amiss, and the Paramount offers none of it!

Reviews.Title: “Theatre Going Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Glenn E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paramount during my last visit when i saw 12 shows in 12 days. It is the perfect location for all there is to see on Broadway, literally a cross the street. Yes the rooms are small but who visits New York to stay in their room? The lobby hums with an international crowd and positive energy. The staff is very friendly and I loved the Dean and Deluca in the morning. The small gym has all you need for a quick workout. The rooms are very functional and the housekeeping team did a great job every morning. I will surely stay there on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “modern and great location”
Reviews.Author: Adite
Reviews.Content: Location near times square and close to several metro stops was excellent. Rooms were small, but i think every room is in NYC, especially for a reasonable price. Our bed (broadway classis) was also small, but didn't bother us since we're small ourselves. Many pillows, flatscreen, modern en and certainly sufficiënt. Of course there is noise at night, but it's NYC, there has to be noise ;) Our bathroom was very spacious (but i think there are different sizes of bathrooms). Staff was very friendly, cleaning happened everyday and was sufficiënt. Loved the lobby, computer able for use at lobby, don't know about the internet prices for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & lobby”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth155
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paramount with my daughter for 2 nights after XMas .The price was cheap--about $195 w/ taxes--considering its great location right near Rockefeller Center & Times Square. The lobby was also very chic.The major downside was that our double room was one of the tiniest I've ever seen & slightly shabby.

Reviews.Title: “This a Great funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonie158
Reviews.Content: Well like everyone else we read the reviews and was a bit sceptical when going but had an open mind, however, the other reviews did help. We caught a cab from the airport which cost approx $60 including tip. We arrived at the hotel and got checked in quite swiftly, we got offered an upgrade to a slightly bigger room and we took it after asking what floor we would be on and where in the hotel it would be, (a previous review stated ninth floor and at the back with less noise- this is exactly where we were put, no views but lots of peace and quiet) - think about it - you are a 2 minute walk from Times Square a very busy all night location - bit like being in London. We found a great breakfast place called Cafeurope (need to google this - it was the better one, possibly the 49th or 50th street from Broadway)- great you can pick what you want, all fresh, and it isn't expensive, for 2 of us it cost around $20 total. The first few days we booked onto the grayline tours, fantastic, this helps you to find your bearings and see the sights with a great tour guide, 3 day pass and a choice of 3 visits (for example, Rockafellas(worth a visit but real early in the morning on a clear day)/Statue of Liberty/Guggenheim museum/etc you do have a choice) - $104 each - However, at the present moment Statue of Liberty is closed for approx 12 months, hence you can only walk around it but the ferry ride is lovely - go on a clear day and as early as possible to avoid the mass queues. We did find some lovely places to have a drink (alcoholic of course) and meal, which are as follows: Fanelli's Bar, corner of princes street / mercer st - great atmosphere, fantastic service and lovely food, reasonable too. On Tap Pub - it is in a shopping precint - Columbus Square, Time Warner Centre, but great to visit - lovely atmosphere and beer & food are good. Bierhaus - very much of a german bar but great beer and food was ok but not too great. Shopping places - Century 21 for a few bargains, and if you visit Macy's don't forget to visit the customer service desk to obtain your card for 10% of certain products from their store. The last comment for this - if you go in the winter, forget the dressing up clothes and leave enough room in the suitcase for extra's to take back. Hope this has helped as much as everyone else's reviews helped us - enjoy your holiday ..

Reviews.Title: “We expected more...”
Reviews.Author: AshtonMorgan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Paramount Hotel in NYC on business the first weekend of February. We booked through Hotwire, getting a great price on a 3 star hotel. Based on the description of the hotel's amenities after booking, we did expect a little more, but also found the hotel to have many positives. The hotel lobby is that of a swank boutique hotel, complete with aroma therapy and great music. They offer a concierge service, a lobby bar, and a restaurant with a bar on the 2nd floor that overlooks the lobby. The room, however, left a little to be desired. We had a room with one queen bed...and that room was SMALL (think college dorm room). There was nothing really special about it--no fridge, no microwave, no extras. It was just a room with a bed, a closet, and bathroom, and a flat screen TV. However, the maid service was excellent and the room was kept clean. The heater in our room went out overnight during our first night there. When we called maintenance in the morning, they arrived promptly in less than 20 minutes to service the failed heating unit. They also fixed the super drafty window. Once functioning properly, the heater was never able to regulate the temperature in the room. Either it was too hot, or too cold at all times. Also, it was constantly clinking and ticking loudly, even at night which made for a restless sleep. The Business Center DOES NOT EXIST and what they call the Business Center is completely in adequate--3 iPads with horribly slow connection speeds (if they connect at all) connected to a printer behind the reception desk where the staff is too busy with checking guests in/out to tend to a malfunctioning printer. Printing boarding passes turned into an hour fiasco--totally unacceptable. The hotel, did however have wonderful customer service--we were credited for our first night because of the lack of heat, given two complimentary breakfast buffet coupons, and given a coupon for free wifi in our room. The breakfast buffet was tasty and plentiful. We did have drinks in the lobby bar--just be cautious of the prices. Drinks there are in the ballpark of $11-14 and they automatically add an 18% gratuity regardless of the size of your party. The hotel is less than a block from Times Square and a little over a block from Restaurant Row which features many different kinds of cuisine. The location and the Lobby were the best aspects of this hotel. Would I stay here again? I would, but I would go expecting less. It's rated as a 3 star, I'd give it a 2.5 just to be fair.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: CLong60
Reviews.Content: The hotel atmosphere and service were nice. The bedding was very comfortable. Request extra luggage racks to keep your things off the floor. No tables for food and drinks - very inconvenient for room service. The air/heat extremely noisy. All things considered, the location is the best aspect of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia L
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Paramount. The room was clean and the king-sized bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in a marvelous location and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The drink specials were excellent and we took full advantage of those. There are many good restaurants nearby and the subway is not far either. We will definitely be back here to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good but small rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: An1989
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good but small rooms, good service Gym is small but adequate Warning that air condition can be a bit loud Avoid eating there as it is expensive as hell, better off going to the local excellent breakfast diners around the local blocks All the negatives were compensated by the fact that it's location is dead on Time Square and close to everything you could want from a New York experience. Choose this if you are a first-timer on a decent budget. If it's you second trip try some place else.

Reviews.Title: “expect a bad room on the first night”
Reviews.Author: reza b
