Reviews.Content: We had booked 3 rooms (group of friends) - 2 double and a single room. My girlfriend and my room was 2 meters by 3 meters. The double bed was 120cm wide (They insisted this was a double bed - despite us buying a tape measure and measuring it!!!!! unbelievable!!!!). There was no place to put our bags, there were no chairs and you could not open the bathroom door as there not enough room. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen. This was by far the smallest room I have ever seen or heard about. Our friends room was almost as small as ours (the bed was the same size but the room was about 20cm wider). They did change our rooms on the second night which was definitely better (still small but the bed was 140cm wide and you had room to walk around the bed and open your suitcases). This seemed to be routine - everybody we spoke to had an awful room on the first night and this was changed to a bigger room on the second night. When we went down to complain there was a queue of at least 5-6 people with exactly the same problem - It seemed they used these ridiculously small rooms for the first night of everybody's stay. This surely should not be allowed as it is literally putting people into a cupboard and people not having a choice to stay for at least one night. I can imagine that during the high season this will be even worse (people might actually be forced to stay in these in-human conditions for longer). I do understand that in NY the hotel rooms are small and I have been there 4 times before but this place was very different. Good points - The staff were actually very friendly and the location was great and it also had a nice bar (although it was a little too expensive)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Splintaay
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be more conveniently located, it is a stones throw away from Times Square! We stayed here for 4 nights during the heatwave last summer and although we were initially placed in a small room the staff were more than happy to move us into a queen sized room the very next day. I stayed here with my wife on our honeymoon and we were very impressed with the facilities from iMac computers in the lobby area to the free boarding pass prints upstairs for the journey home. Very contemporary, modern feel to the place and very clean. The rooms were spotless and plenty of channels to watch when you retire to put your feet up. Bedding etc changed every day and there was minimal noise from outside. I wild highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NY and I would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: maggim
Reviews.Content: We went to New York just after New Year and had a splendid time. New York is always a treat but what has made it even better the last three times we have stayed there was staying at the Paramount. It is an upscale hotel with all the fixins and never makes you feel like you're staying 'on the cheap'. The service is great, someone on the desk and at the door, everytime we needed them. A cosy bar downstairs, a great (if somewhat overpriced) coffee shop accessible from the lobby, not their own coffee shop, but appreciated none the less. The beds are comfy, the rooms very clean and modern, some people might find the rooms compact but they are just the size they need to be. We don't go to New York to hang around in our room. My 88 year old mother, my sister and her 10 year old daughter as well as my husband and I stayed this time and everyone had a great time. The location is out of this world. Not from a view point of view, although I love looking out on to the theatres across the street in case I catch sight of Alan Rickman arriving early or leaving late. If I had to find a negative it was with the price of the buffet breakfast, compared to the reasonable room rate we found it way over priced. This time we didn't bother with it at all but found a very good restaurant serving breakfast a few blocks west. It's a shame because it makes the closeness to Times Square sometimes not seem so close, at least first thing in the morning, but last thing at night it is a true haven.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round”
Reviews.Author: twilightrobe
Reviews.Content: The Paramount was everything we needed for our eight day stay in NYC.. quiet, clean, and comfortable, and its location in Midtown is pretty much as convenient as it gets. The hotel itself has a nice vibe, kind of drawing the best of the city inside and into the lobby and bar areas. Great stay, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “TOP HOTEL OF CHOICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: thierry a
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location, furthermore, I am always pleased by the personal care that the staff provides to me as well as my employees that stay there. From the Upper Management, to their Housekeeping. When our ventures call for NYC, there is only one hotel of choice.......PARAMOUNT!!

Reviews.Title: “Love New York in January”
Reviews.Author: MJNielsen
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to stay, check into the Paramount. They are close to everything being just a block off Time Square. The room was soooo quiet and we got a super good rate because of it being the slow time. We arrived the 3rd of January just as all the holiday traffics was leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, right in the middle of Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: NvillePublicist
Reviews.Content: Hadn't stayed at the Paramount in years, but when planning a recent business trip, I noticed that they had some very good rates, so I booked it. I was very, very happy with my stay: the staff was very friendly, the room was clean and efficiently arranged, and the location is IDEAL if you want to be in the thick of Times Square. Sure, the room is small - but ALL hotel rooms are small in Manhattan, so no big deal there. And the bed is great - got a great night's sleep! I'll happily book my next NYC room at the Paramount.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from several nights at the Paramount, and am most disappointed. We have been staying at this location for almost two decades; most recently, about six months ago. I booked online, and choose the mid-range room, given that rooms tend to be small. Instead, we were assigned their smallest room; further insult was a room just next to the housekeeper’s closet and near the elevators and stairwell, it was unbearably noisy. But it did have a view of an airshaft. I discussed this with the front desk manager, and his only solution was to ask us if we were willing to pay for an upgrade. I can only assume that the hotel is ‘long in the tooth’ – the sheets and b’room towels were threadbare. It is also a pity because the Paramount – which is well situated in the theatre and mid-town restaurant district - seems to have lost sight of its raison d'être; to break from the mold of traditional NY hotels with a fresh design, helpful and HONEST staff, along with value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lovely helpful doormen”
Reviews.Author: IheartNYC8
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are very small, and No not all NYC hotel rooms are as small... this is the 8th hotel I've stayed in in Manhattan, NYC and though not the best, it was a great little room with perfect location and very helpful doormen. Room -I booked this hotel for 6 nights having read some good reviews of it on Expedia, then before I went read some some bad reviews and almost cancelled my booking, I'm glad I didnt because on arrival I asked for a room with bath as opposed to just a shower which I think then meant the room was also bigger. Having paid for a mid priced room this seemed fair, however I was disappointed to see the size of the room initailly. After a day or two I adjusted and it was fine, the bed itself was very comfortable though not king size, and the room itself was clean and well kept. The decor is meant to be modern contemporary but i found it a bit dated, rather 80s. There was no table or desk, but their was a chair, and no bedside tables either but a very small wall attached ledge for the phone. The wardrobe was also small not enough room for two in spite of it being a double room, there was a luggage stand thankfully. The bathroom had a great bath and shower combo, shelving and mirror, lots of hot water and towels and comp toiietries. The long and short of it is, I wouldnt use this hotel again but had no complaints as I had a great holiday. The Distrikt Hotel also in midtown or the Radisson on Lexington are far better in my opinion for room size, facilities and decor at roughly the same price range. Facilities - The hotel itself has good facilities inc bar restaurant and inhouse Dean and Deluca which was fab for grabbing a coffee, pastry or sandwich and stays open till after 7pm, opening at 7.30-8am. The door staff were lovely, very helpful and obliging as were the housekeeping staff when I ran out of conditioner. There are two PC's off the lobby to use which was also very handy,and two doors along there is a great little pizza shop, possibly too handy! Delicious pizza!. There is alos a 24hour Starbucks just a few hundred yards away on Times Square which was perfect too. Tips - do explore the different areas of Manhattan and go off the beaten track to dine and drink where the locals do to get a real feel for NY, love Greenwich village and Soho, fantastic shopping in mid Jan when the sales are still on and there is further discounts. Brooklyn is also gorgeous and well worth a trip, its nor far. Bring flat/comfy shoes and walk everywhere that way you happen upon hidden gems and see lots of the city, the subway is clean and fast and at the end of a long day a taxi is very cheap. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel that I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Skyline-16
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at this hotel for 3 nights in a superior queen room, on arriving in our room we first noticed how noisy it was and then that it was vibrating. As we had been on a ship for 2 weeks we really couldnt face having any more movement whilst sleeping, so we phoned down to reception and asked for another room, we were told the new room was still a superior queen, but without a view. This new room and Bathroom were tiny and made our stateroom on the ship seem huge!! This room was also noisy and the air con is terrible either you have it on full blast cold or the heater is on full blast, no inbetween. Do not give this hotel your credit card as when we orignally checked in for 3 nights using a cashpassport from Travelex, they removed nearly $600 from our account and as we only stayed 1 night expected them to reinburse this instantly which they didnt this took a further 3 days ! We went back into the hotel twice and asked the hotel staff why they had taken out more than we were orignally quoted, they could not explain why and we also asked why it was taking so long for our money to be refunded and they couldnt explain that either . If this had been our only source of money this really could of ruined our break in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Paramount Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PAUL B
Reviews.Content: Superb location,to everything in New York. Theatres, Bars and restauraunts. The Paramount is lovely, staff are mega friendly. If you book a Broadway Classic Double, the double bed is not suitable for two people, it is more like a 3/4 bed. We booked one and within five minutes we returned to reception and they changed us to a Queen bed at no extra charge. Rooms are small but they have everything you need, think they are for one nighters really. We were there for a week and it was fine. Best place to get a coffee was a little Pizza place next door. 2 dollars for a large one. Loved the place and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price - eclectic but interesting decor!”
Reviews.Author: pasowine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the price and location for business. Quite interesting decor - large and bustling lobby where everyone congregates. Loved the library bar in the evening and for breakfast in the morning. The place felt very comfortable and cozy and full of life! The room was quite small - but that is to be expected in Manhattan. I had a nice view looking north towards 8th Avenue. It was minimal, but clean - and the bed was fine for a good night's sleep. Easy walking to Times Square, Theatres, and restaurants in Hell's Kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Liane A
Reviews.Content: Very chic hotel with impressive lobby and bar area. Rooms are clean, but very small, can hardly walk around the bed. Only shower en-suite. Pleasant but you are certainly paying for the location as opposed to the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for location”
Reviews.Author: Lindyloo65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights before going to Philadelphia and found it fine for the time we were staying in New York. The hotel is quite hip and funky with great music always playing in the reception. Check in was easy and the staff were relaxed and friendly. The room was a standard double, good size bed, nice and clean and I'm fussy but very small room and the bathroom was tiny. We had a problem with the heating as the room was really cold and it was freezing outside. I spoke to the receptionist and she offered for me to look at another room which was lovely and warm and a bonus we had a larger bathroom. They provide a hairdryer and iron and ironing board in the room. New York is known for small rooms, by the time both cases were on the floor and opened out there was no space to move but it was fine for 3 days, we slept well and it was quiet considering the area.The wifi is free in the reception/lounge area and there is a small coffee shop attached to the hotel handy for a drink or snacks. The hotel as you enter has a lovely smell I heard a few people mention this. This is a great little hotel, just off Times Square with lots of places to eat near by. Don't expect anything too fancy or large rooms of you'll be disappointed but great staff and location and I'm hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel, I am 30, he is 34. This hotel was great, it baffles me why there are some negative reviews on this site. One thing I have learned about trip adviser is that people have majorly high expectations of what there their accommodation should be like for having paid not a lot. The hotel is grea! It has a great location just a minutes walk from times square and about 2 minutes to the nearest tube. There is a cafe just beside the hotel which is great for grabbing morning coffee etc. The hotel is very funky, really modern, some people have commented on the smell in the hotel lobby, I really liked the smell, it was like a nice perfume...although it might not be to everyone's taste. The lobby is always busy as this is where you get free wifi. If you don't have a pc, there are three iPads to use and two macs in the lobby area which are free to use. The only fault is that you can't get wifi in your room, you need to pay for it...but it's not a big deal as you hardly go on holiday to surf the net do you! The room was fine, we were fortunate to have a room with two double beds, flat screen tv, small chair, lots of nice minature toiletries in the bathroom, roasting shower, bathroom was small, but big enough for one person! Room had a mini safe which was good. Overall this hotel was great, can't fault it! I am going back in December 2012, I'd highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nanadod_11
Reviews.Content: We were concerned about staying in this hotel after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor. However we were well looked after and really enjoyed our stay. All the staff were extremely pleasant and professional, our room 737 was more than generous with a comfy bed. The linen and towels were changed everyday and the room well cleaned. The Hotel location is very good being just off Time Square and ideal for the half price Ticket Booth, Tour buses, Hard Rock Cafe the Empire State Building,Macys and Rockerfeller Centre are all within easy walking distance. We would like to say a big thank you to Crystal for all her help in making our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good points and bad points!”
Reviews.Author: leemurphy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Paramount for 7 days in early January. On the whole it was a good experience - the hotel is in an excellent location, there's loads to do nearby and it is also easy for getting around to explore the rest of the city. However, the rooms are incredibly small - we wwere in a double room, but the bed was tiny so we enquired about a larger room, only to be told that the beds were that size because it was a boutique hotel! I have stayed in many boutique hotels over the years, and all of them have had a full size double bed, no matter the size of the room! Anyway, the room upgrade was going to cost us an extra $60 per night so we decided to sleep on it and see how it went. It was actually not too bad so we saved our money for the delights on NYC instead. There was another problem with the room - the shower stopper did not work, so we reported this first thing in the morning and were told that they would send someone up right away. However, on returning to the room later that night, the problem had still not been fixed so we had to go back to the front desk again - they did send the handyman up straight away this time and he fixed the problem in five minutes, which was great! The final downside of our stay was when it came to checking out time - the bill was slid under our door, and they had charged us for upgrading the room for five nights - an extra $300! So we had to go to the front desk and wait for ten minutes while the reception staff were sorting out travel money for another hotel guest in order to get this issue rectified. The reception staff were very apologetic and removed the charge straight away. Check your bill carefully! Other points - the Library Bar is lovely but very expensive - $14 for a glass of wine! Didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that but the menu did look good. Generally a decent enough hotel though, and despite the negative points I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: kazab76
Reviews.Content: This property is lovely, stayed here in November 2011. Right smack bang in the middle of Times Square so couldnt complain about that but the rooms are very very small. Clean and well decorated but not much room to move. But at the same time it was perfect for all the time you actually be in your room it didnt matter, it was only for sleeping in.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly average all round...”
Reviews.Author: MrsSparra
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe king room... it was very a reasonable size for a NY hotel, which was good considering that we had 4 suitcases and were able to spread out a bit. The bed was comfy but pillows were terrible. The bathroom was fairly small but certainly not the smallest we've seen! Overall the room was clean and the hotel staff were very attentive with making it up and providing us with whatever we needed. Also, patience is needed with the lift when going down to the lobby as continually skipped our floor and were often left waiting for 10-15 minutes to get downstairs! We arrived in NYC the day before Thanksgiving and were in a PRIME location to watch the parade, plus we were able to walk to heaps of restaurants, shops, the subway and even Central Park - given this, I would stay at the Paramount again if need be. Disappointments included having some spare change taken from our room (not a BIG deal but still, glad it was only a few dollars), having a truck stop-point RIGHT outside our window which added to the NYC noise factor and made a good nights sleep virtually impossible... and booking a shared accomodation van to the airport through the concierge desk, which never turned up and the hotel just passed the buck and wouldn't do anything about it - FYI, in NYC cabs to JFK airport are FIXED, so don't bother with the shared vans, the hotels only recommend them because they get a kick-back from it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location by far!”
Reviews.Author: Carly368
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was incredible and the staff was curteous (however the concierge gave us wrong directions twice). Everyone said the rooms were going to be tiny so I was expecting the worst but was nicely suprised. Yes they are small but deffinatley manageable and cleaned every day. The only thing I noticed was the last night we were there we noticed blood stains on the sheets and it wasn't either of ours. Overall good experience and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura D
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the Hotel, we found the Hotel lobby very dark and the loud music very intimadating. The Hotel seemed very stylish and you could see they spent quite a bit of money on it. The Receptionist was helpful on arrival and got offered an upgrade to a Twin Room for $80 for the 4 nights, which we took advantage of as my Mum and I didn't fancy sleeping in a Double together for 4 nights. Once we got up to the 12th floor to our room, the hallway was very dark, it made me feel quite dizzy. The corridor didn't feel clean and the carpet wasn't hoovered. Once we got into our room we were very dissappointed. The floor was vibrating, there was mould on the walls above the beds, there was dust all over the over head lamps, paint flaking off the walls and the toilet in the bathroom obvisously hadn't been cleaned from the previous guests. We went down to complain and got a different Receptionist would seemed to feel our complaint was an inconvienience to her day. She told us the Head Housekeeper would go to look so we sat and waited for an answer but nothing was said so we went back to ask and got told to ring the Housekeepers ourselves to ask. The Housekeeper was helpful and offered us a room move, which we took without hesitation. We were offered help with our bags to our new room, which we declined but wished we accepted as the new door key didn't work in the door. My mum went to get this fixed, which worked but the door was still very stiff and heavy. Our new room was so much better. The paint was still slightly flaking away but everything else was so much cleaner. One tip for the room TV, when you turn it on it will automaticly go to the pay for films but press + twice on the channels and this will go to the normal TV channels. Times Square is literally 2 minutes down the road (Out the front door and turn left) with the amazing atmosphere and Central Park about 20 mins away on foot. The mezzanene bar was lovely and modern but extremly over priced $32 dollars for a glass of Red Wine and a Malibu and coke, however we figured out this included the tip. If you do go into the Bar look out for the Barman, Rodney, he was the most helpful member of staff we encountered at the Hotel and happy to answer your questions. Do be aware, considering we were staying in the "city that never sleeps" we couldn't get a cup of coffee between 8.00pm - 6.30am or an alcoholic beverage until the Bar opened at 5pm. Overall the Hotel was nice and comfy in a lovely location, just not up to the standard we really expected. New York was amazing however and didn't want to leave :(

Reviews.Title: “great location - rooms are OK”
Reviews.Author: Isabel39_10
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect - you cant ask for better location but the rooms are very ordinary. and the bathrooms very very small with a very small sinc. if the rooms are not imortant for you, you will enjoy the lobby and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy room but shiny and clean...! What more...?”
Reviews.Author: LeonardoV
Reviews.Content: Hi slept here last time I was in Manhattan. No complains, the location is just great (litterally a minute from Times Square) and the room was quite nice. I mean, very small....but I have seen much worse in NYC...and anyway...we were coming back to the room just for resting...so no real need of any more space. The room was very clean, and the staff very kind. I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sarah b
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in December 2011. When we first arrvied the place looked great and the people were very polite. We got seen to straight away. However when we checked in and went to our room it turned out to be a single bed (which for a couple wasnt the best) but we just went straight back down to reception told them the problem and got given another room straight away. The room we booked was Broadway classic, out room wasnt very big but it was very clean and modern so couldnt complain at all. The bar was very funky. We had dinner at the hotel once and that was very nice and resonably priced, and we had breakfast once. I had the pancakes with maple syrup (which was the best breakfast i had out there) and that was $14 and my boyfriend had 2eggs and toast which was also $14. Mine was great but i think what my boyfriend had wasnt really worth £8-9 (at the time) It was still very nice though. The hotel itself its right next to times square (W46th between 8th & Broadway) so was a great location. I would definately stay there again no problem, lovely hotel, Great location :)

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic!”
Reviews.Author: NYCdomer
Reviews.Content: I've been in small hotel rooms before, including in NYC and Europe, but this is by far the smallest. There's about 3 ft of space on either side of the bed, 2 ft at the foot of the bed, and that's it. The whole bathroom is the size of a normal shower. The location right in Times Square is nice, but I've stayed in several other hotels in this area that were comparably priced and not this tiny. Also, the woman at check-in had a major 'too cool for school' attitude that was the opposite of welcoming. On the plus sides, the bed/pillows are comfortable and the room is clean. So if you have no qualms about claustrophobic spaces, then you might not mind it here. Oh, also forgot to mention that the thermostat appears fake. You can't change the temp on it, and while it looks like you can turn off the heater, it didn't work so we had to open the window all night to cool down the room which I hate doing for environmental reasons, and if we hadn't been able to open it we would've had to leave it was so hot.

Reviews.Title: “Cared for very well”
Reviews.Author: Meeranda_Black
Reviews.Content: I stay at the paramount every time I'm in NYC...at least 3 times a year. They try and give me the same room every time which is nice because it starts to feel more homey. The bathroom is lovely, the beds are divine. Take ear plugs with you because NYC is noisy but that will be the same, or worse, at every hotel in the city. ESP Times Square. Ive stayed in much more expensive hotels that have had smaller rooms than this. Rooms in NYC are just small. It's extremely convenient for both business (Javits is close) and touristy things. You can walk to Penn Station in 15 mins. The bath tub is nice and deep. Oh, and they returned my employees iPhone charger when she left it in her room. I have never experienced that kind of service before.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BUSHMCLOVIN
Reviews.Content: I've been to new York 5 times and stayed in this hotel 4 times. I love the location you are right in times square so its a great central point for starting off your day. some of the rooms can be small but It never bothers me as i don't spend that much time in the room. The rooms are decorated really well, the beds are comfortable and the decor is modern. There is a nice bar there to either chill for the night or start your night off in. they have lovely cocktails. There's free use of internet in the lobby area which comes in really handy for booking trips or checking in for your flight. There is also free printing. The concierge are always very helpful with booking excursions or show tickets. Never once had any problems with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Paramount New York”
Reviews.Author: trotskite
Reviews.Content: Have just completed a month's trip visiting Fiji, Australia, and finishing in New York, staying at the Paramount Hotel. We stayed for 3 nights in January 2012, and got a good deal on a double room paying about £80 per night for a room with two queen beds in. The rooms themselves are basic and quite small with minimum facilities (no tea making), but was adequate for our needs as we mainly wanted to sight see. The room was clean and fit for purpose at the price i considered it value for money. Breakfast wasn't included but there are many Deli's around that serve a mean egg and bacon roll, yoghurts, fruit juice, etc and you can sit in if you want to eat. The public areas of the hotel were newly refurbished and quite funky and fun. A brilliant location only 3 minutes from Times Square and within easy reach of many main attractions. Cocktail bar fun, and a very good atmosphere overall. Staff generally helpful and friendly too. For the price i thought very acceptable. Do check out if you want a double bed because often it advertises twin rooms and sometimes you can get a free upgrade - although don't get too excited as the room is still small. This seems to be the case with most of the reasonably priced hotels in that area. Do check out The Empire State building when it's dark, and don't get fooled by touts trying to sell you overpriced tickest telling you there's massive queues!! Pay in the building it's about 22 dollars to go up to the viewing level and well worth every penny. Ground zero you have to go get tickets and book a time slot but tickets are free and usually only an hour or two wait for your slot. Bikes round central park a good idea too!!!! Enjoy!!! Would use Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Dont bother!!”
Reviews.Author: jennylouise411
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing like it is described in the brochure!! The corridors are dark and depressing with the walls and doors painted in awful metallic grey, felt like we were in prison. We were told when we arrived that our room had been upgraded....well i would hate to see a standard room!! There were holes in our bed sheets, plaster falling off the ceiling above my pillow, wires hanging down from the radiator, the fixtures were hanging off the wall in the bathroom and the plug didnt fit in the sink so you couldnt run a bowl of water!!! The staff were snooty and not at all helpful, hence we stayed there only 1 night as all other hotels were fully booked so close to Christmas, then managed to find a much more decent hotel for our next 2 nights, to move to! This is not the standard i would expect from a 4* hotel and we have made an official complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds, good location, nice service”
Reviews.Author: Maggie P
Reviews.Content: It is located 1 minute away from Times Square. I had nice customer service. Comfy bed and bedding. Breakfast have good amount of choices. Small rooms but it is in NYC. I will definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are on a budget! Never again!”
Reviews.Author: PauBCN
Reviews.Content: Great location, only 1 minute walking to Times Square. The first thing that will call your attention is the loud music and strong smell of the lobby, that looks like a dance club. This old hotel has very small rooms (perhaps you will have a bigger one paying a lot more, which is really not worth it in this hotel). The room had a confortable bed, but almost no room to leave our luggage and walk arround it! The closet was very, VERY small.The bathroom is very, VERY small. If you are sensible to the noise when you sleep, make sure you turn off the air conditioning system. It is loud as hell!!!! It does not look old, but it is OLD! Free Wi-Fi in the lobby, expensive inside the room. We had to wait for our room (it was not ready when we arrived). There was a problem with the water pressure in the shower, too low and not regular . Just for the record, I paid 756.48 dollars to sleep on New Year's Eve, which is a clear abuse for the quality offered by this hotel. I really didn't expect it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HalKOregon
Reviews.Content: While the price was advertised as $149/night, at check-out we noticed that there was a total of 20% taxes added on as well. Not having stayed in NYC before, didn't realize the city would really be that expensive to stay in with the taxes. Also to sign up for internet service was an additional $14. Room was small, but very clean and quiet. Charges in the restaurant and bar were expensive, too. And, then if you need to have your luggage looked after when the room isn't ready when you first check in, there is a charge for that, too. Maybe being new and inexperienced to the city, the other hotels do the same thing. Basically too much money. But we had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “room small”
Reviews.Author: bill n
Reviews.Content: Summertime you might have problems if your room gives to street, since it might be noisy due to cars passing by. In other comments it is mentioned that the Hotel is a bit far from the oldtown. Well, if 10 minutes walk is a big distance....We could get everywhere in the City from the hotel by walk very easily.

Reviews.Title: “All round a great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at the Paramount hotel for a week i can only compliment it. The hotel is set in a great location with only a 2 minute walk to Times Square. The hotel has a great ´vibe´ to it with a chique decor and bar area (however the drinks are very expensive!!!). Although the rooms are small, they are comfortable, and have everything you need. The cleaners did a fantastic job and always made sure towels, soaps, lotions etc were replenished. Overall a great experience, the only thing that ruined it was an awful experience in ´Sofias´ restaurant next to the hotel, stay away! Thanks Paramount

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Pretty tiny - Really modern”
Reviews.Author: paula3230
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NYC with my boyfriend on March 2011. The hotel was really busy when I arrived but got the room before time. The room was pretty small, but really modern and comfortable. The location is excellent, just a few steps away from Times Square, but no loud noises or anything disturbing. A bad thing I could say is that no breakfast was included in the price...It was not cheap and it would have been nice to have something included in the rate. It´s really a great hotel for a young couple looking for a good location and clean place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations with "hip" lounge/lobby - great location.”
Reviews.Author: kipwingerjr
Reviews.Content: Overall impression: very good forthe location. We stayed the Friday night before new years eve and found a reasonable rate that included parking. The lobby was clean and "hip" or "moody". The rooms showed their age (if you are familiar with NY this is considered charming when you get a pre-war apartment), beds comfy, tv fine. Bathroom spacious enough, but again older with iron tubs and interesting sinks. Plenty of amenities like towels, soaps, etc. Service: check in took a while, but thy seemed to be working quickly. Surprised to find out that if you arrive early/leave town late, they CHARGE to hold bags! This is a first for me. $2 a bag. I was pretty shocked. Not as shocked as when I heard there was a 125 NONREFUNDABLE fee for a pet. Not acceptable nor fair. I would gladly put a large deposit and/or small fee, but this was insane. Valet arriving was quick and efficient, getting it was not as quick and required that I walk across the street and ask for my car, even though the hotel called ahead. Not the hotel's fault. I would stay here again, but only at a very discounted rate. The pet issue might also hold me up. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: mississaugamom
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a five night stay at the Paramount Hotel. The location is great very close to Time Square and the theatre. We booked the hotel through a travel website and the price was good. The room was small, but this is New York City and this was expected. The bathroom could use an upgrade especially around the bathtub area. The room was constantly hot and we were unable to adjust the temperature, the heating system was noisy and became a nuisance at night. The front desk staff was pleasant but the concierge was quite rude and served people ahead of us when we asked him to make a call for us to a restaurant. When checking out we asked them to hold our bags as we had a late flight, we were charged $2.00 per bag including a small carry-on. I have never been charged a fee to store luggage at any other hotels. My next trip to New York I will be looking for different hotel. My advice pay a little more for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel for exploring NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: Ascot_eater
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went NYC in January 2010 (not Feb 2011) for 3nights. We wanted a nice, clean, safe hotel in times square but on a budget. We found this hotel on travelrepublic (the best website for low prices on hotels you can trust we've found) and liked the look of it so went ahead and booked. The price was amazing for times square, the only thing more amazing was a the hotel itself!!! Very modern look, faultless lobby, clean, yes the rooms are slightly small but adequate!! After all we wanted to see the city not the hotel room walls, which were actually very well decorated with stylish pictures. No exaggeration when you step outside the hotel if you look left you can see the famous lights of times square no more than 50metres away!! The only reason I can think the price is so low is because it's just off times square, a hidden gem!! Would definitely return to this hotel and wouldnt think twice about recommending to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Paramount.”
Reviews.Author: RobCassLondon
Reviews.Content: Over the years I've stayed at a lot of hotels in New York City and to be honest the Paramount is definitely my favourite. It's got a relaxed, professional, cool sence of itself which really puts you in step with the rhythm of the city. Placed right in the heart of the greatest metropolis in the world you can't go wrong. The staff's attitude is nothing is ever a problem and they make you feel valued and Important. This hotel understands you have look after guests and they do it admirably. As the terminator said "I'll be back".

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms , very bad service, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Laila T
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great , 1 min walk from Times Square. However, the standard room is very very small, so after booking a standard double room we shifted to a queen room , it's size is good but the air-conditioning did not work and we couldn't change the room on the spot we had to wait a whole night in the extremely hot weather ( July). The hotel staffs were not friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing localization!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LauraDedino
Reviews.Content: It is localized in the heart of times square!!! The petit room was small, however enough. Big bathroom for Ny's standard. The check in was very fast, nice songs in the lobby!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location/price, but not good sleep & shower”
Reviews.Author: annyong1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when it first opened so I knew the rooms would be small (plus price & location must equal small rooms). I booked thru hotwire after out train was seriously delayed so definitley cant complain about price & location. I do agree with other reviewes about location and style. However - a few warnings, the double bed was smaller than a normal double bed which made sleeping very tough (we were two) especially coupled with a LOUD A/C that would not cool down to lower than 73 degrees. Walking in to the room, we immediatley noticed that the door clasp was missing so no extra "chain" lock. The ipod dock was also broken. After a very long day (& warm for NYC in Jan.) we really needed showers - the water pressure was terrible and there was only one washcloth. We were on the 18th floor and it's an old building so I guess I cant expect much - this is just a warning to others not to expect the two things needed from a hotel - good sleep and a good shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great as a base camp”
Reviews.Author: KayDenmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a 1-day trip through NYC. Check-in was slow, but the bellmen were great - we were two people with six suitcases! - and the room was clean and quiet. This hotel was very trendy during the 1990s, but it has been well-maintained and updated. The only clue to its age is the lack of outlets in the room for recharging today's iPhones, iPads, etc. - the only one we could find was in the bathroom! Also, wireless in the room costs $14 bucks a day, which is silly. It's free in the lobby. The Paramount is a great choice for young, hip tourists who want to use it as a base camp while exploring NYC. The rooms are small, but they work fine if all you want to do is sleep, shower, and get dressed for the next nightclub tour.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic fantastic fantastic 15th dec to 19th dec”
Reviews.Author: hoddy_9
Reviews.Content: great location and very stylish. Stayed 15th dec to 19th december. We had upgraded rooms as we were on our honey moon and we follow the hotel on twitter, which is advised. people complain about the small rooms and we did see the small rooms. my advice, the more you pay the more you get, pay for the cheapest and you get the smallest. 30 seconds from time square and we will use this hotel again, Choose your flights so you arrive late afternoon and you leave before dinner. if not everybody stays in the lobby but the bar up stairs is always empty in the day and has a free pool table.

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay at the Paramount!”
Reviews.Author: GracieJ1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 5th November for 5 nights and loved every minute. The location could not be better, service is excellent, the hotel itself is lovely and has a great atmosphere! Rooms are very clean although compact but everything you need in there! Anyway, who goes to New York to sit in their room!?!? I would go back to this hotel again but stay longer! Thanks for a fab week!

Reviews.Title: “This place is nasty!”
Reviews.Author: LeonardHJ
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I checked in for New Years Eve. This was our first time to visit NYC. We checked in early, they did hold our bags until 3. The front desk lady was extremely RUDE. Sometimes a smile and your welcome goes along way. The lobby was crowded, which was understandable, but no reason for her to be hateful. Afterall....that's her job, to wait on the guests. I was in line, when it came time for me to proceed to the desk, someone walked up and she told me I would have to wait my turn. Next, the rooms was disgusting! The bed pillows, bed, comforter.....smelled. The bathroom sink leaked water from the faucet and base. The shower was nasty, with black mildew. The toilet was cheap plastic, and the lid had to be put down each time you flushed. After that you had a nice view of black RUST around the pipes. THEN AFTER WE GOT IN BED, THE COMFORTER HAD BLOOD ON IT AND BLOOD DRIPPINGS ON THE FLOOR.!!!!!!! This was the worst place I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet rooms in busy area”
Reviews.Author: jjandhb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during week between xmas and New Years. Hotel was full during our stay. Lobby/bar service was good. Had a double-bed room facing 46th. No street or hallway noise bothered us with heating fan running. Room lacks some space for storing or hanging clothes. Hot water was lacking during busy mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Classy & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Toneslider12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on 46th between 7th & 8th which puts it in walking distance from most of the sights near Times Square and only a couple blocks from the Subway. Our room was on the 46th Street side and pretty quite considering how much traffic is nearby. I reserved the smallest room and was warned at check in how small they are. My girlfriend and I had four suitcases and the hotel rep said we would likely be uncomfortable in the room if we didn't upgrade. We took the next step up and were glad we did. The bed was one of the best I've ever slept on in a hotel. The bathroom was a bit small but had been redone quite nicely. The hotel lobby is very classy but loud in the evenings with music from the attached bar. Free Wifi would be nice, it seemed a bit priecy but pretty much every convenience in NYC will cost you.

Reviews.Title: “By far, did not stack up to 4 star rating.”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: While our visit to NY was loads of fun, our stay in the Paramount hotel was a big disappointment. For what is considered a 4 star hotel, it was not we expected. I am an interior decorator and home stager from Massachusetts and I was expecting a much higher upscale feel. Lobby was almost gloomy with furniture that looked like it was leftover from the Adams Family House. We arrived just at 3 o’clock, quite tired after walking around with all our bags killing time until the 3 oclock check in. When we finally were able to check in, we were told our room would not be ready until at least 4 and we were instructed to check back then. When I expressed my disapproval, they noted check-in was considered anytime AFTER 3. This completely disrupted our plans and made it impossible to get ready in time to meet the others for dinner whom we had planned to meet. After a 4 and a half hour drive, this was VERY disappointing and was a huge inconvenience and upset to us and the others involved. The room though ample, was also disappointing for a 4 star hotel. Very sparse. There wasn’t even a luggage rack to set luggage off the floor. TV mounted on the wall and a small while leather looking chair stuffed in a corner. Our room and bathroom had been cleaned but it was anything but spotless. Decorative pillows on both double beds were dirty and stained and smelled. There were no wash clothes in our bathroom, and we had to call twice before someone finally managed to bring us some. The actually room did not smell fresh or that great either. The hallways were so dark and dingy with not nearly enough lighting. Nothing on the walls and painted a depressing color. Felt more like a mental hospital than a 4 star hotel. I've stayed in many hotels and I do not feel this hotel even comes close to it's 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “The people posting good reviews must be getting paid”
Reviews.Author: MaddZo
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the Paramount this afternoon. The hotel is certainly located in a prime location in Times Square, but that is the extent of what you are paying for. The parking situation was incredible inconvenient. The valet and doorman are not dressed in any way that distinguishes them as a hotel employee, which does not make you feel very secure leaving your car keys in the middle of screeching taxis and disgruntled pedestrians with a man who just wiped Cheetos crumbs on his black pants and who nods with a complete lack of zeal when you ask "Do you work here?." You pull up to the hotel in prime city traffic for check in time- there is a small spot in front of the hotel monitored by police officers who discourage you to pull over, despite the instructions of the front desk employees who tell you to do so. The valet and doorman are difficult to track down, and in my experience, were incredibly rude (see Cheetos reference, above) despite my friendly demeanor. It was a very chaotic start to our stay. Once inside, the hotel lobby is exactly as pictured on the website, paying homage to Broadway and theater in a classic way with a modern twist. The rooms are extremely small (like really, very, very small) but clean. In my particular room, the door was unable to open fully without hitting the bed, which sat in the middle of a small square room with about 2 feet of walking space on each side. The front desk attendants were very friendly but seemingly under a lot of stress. Many guests were complaining about room accommodations. They handled all of the situations in a very polite and respectful manner that did seem to make the guests feel cared for. We left the hotel to go to dinner and a show and when we returned late at night, we came up to the room and changed into evening attire to go downstairs and enjoy the well-esteemed Paramount bar. We arrived at 12am. The bar is advertised to be open until 1am. At the door the bartenders and waitress told us that they were closed and we could not enter. We asked if they were typically open until 1am, and they replied that they had already melted the ice and were breaking everything down for the evening. Upon speaking with the evening manager we were told that unfortunately this wasn't the first time the bar staff had behaved this way and he apologized. The one positive moment of our stay was morning breakfast in the Library bar. The staff were attentive and friendly and the food was very enjoyable in a beautiful ambiance. After completely ruling out the idea that this hotel could provide any form of hospitality, it was honestly confusing moment, but very refreshing. As someone who studied Hotel, Restaurant Management and who has several years of experience in the industry, I believe the hotel has most of the physical infrastructure that should equate with success (prime location, beautiful lobby, modern bars/lounges, historical significance). It seems, however, that there is a clear lack of genuine care and concern on the part of management- which is kind of sad. If you are looking for comfort, care and true hospitality, this is NOT the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: bird73BuryStEdmunds
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from our stay at the Paramount Hotel. I have to admit to being anxious about staying here after reading all the previous reviews but was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Check in was quick and easy, the Receptionist was very helpful and polite. There is free internet in the hotel which makes checking in for flights etc really easy. The room was clean and very comfortable and was cleaned on a daily basis. The staff were polite and friendly. The hotel is beautiful and is in a amazing location, less than 5 minutes from Times Square. I really didn't have any problems at the Paramount and would be very happy to recommend to family and friends. I will be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great room”
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: Amazing location in the heart of Times Square...walk 1 block east and you have access to plenty of "touristy" locales; walk 1 block west and you have access to the "real" NYC. Room was amazing....clean, big and the decor was cool/hip. Breakfast buffet was spectactular and the staff was unbelievably helpful and friendly. I highly recommend The Paramount for your next NYC trip!

Reviews.Title: “Please try to find a different hotel before booking at this property.”
Reviews.Author: Abevilaque1
Reviews.Content: I travel often and have NEVER written a negative review but this was my worst hotel stay ever. A "non-smoking" hotel and the rooms smell like smoke! Don't make any special requests when booking (pillows, roll-away, etc.) because they won't accommodate you. Most of the guests standing on line at check-in are complaining about the condition of their rooms. Stay somewhere else unless your desperate. Thanks for ruining our annual Christmas trip Paramount staff and owners!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: Superb location a stones throw from Times Square itself. Hotel very clean & quiet with all amenities you would expect with very helpfull & informative staff. As with all N.Y. hotels space is at a premium, so great sized beds, good size room but a small closet to keep clothes in so pack light! Good tips are the free Staten Island ferry runs every 1/2hr & is one of the best way's to view the Statue of Liberty. Don't be put off by appearances as there's great food to be had for breakfast & lunch from the most unlikely looking shops/cafes. do the Hop on Hop off bus tour but don't buy tikts from the official street vendors that wait at the stops for attractions such as Empire State & Top of the Rock. They will try to sell you, at an extra $12 a fast pass tikt. Go direct to the building itself as it's not needed. Little Italy a must for great food, nice surroundings & atmosphere at cheap prices. A shame it's in the middle of China Town which is very scruffy. My family & I would go back to N.Y. & this hotel tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: fionadavid91
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from 12/12/11 to 16/12/11 and on arrival were initially surprised as it was quite dark and dingy in reception but over a few days that opinion changed to quirky. The room on the 3rd floor was also very small and we were initially disappointed as the bathroom had old fittings and a stainless steel sink and looked tired but again the room turned out to be very comfortable and clean but very small and sparsely furnished, dingy corridors though.Very central location made up for the defects!! Reception staff were very helpful and wi-fi in reception was great with access to IPads. Beware though if booking a car to Newark - don't try to pay by credit card as I got a CC rate from the hotel but arrived at Newark and had to run around like a headless chicken looking for a cash machine. Also if you buy an international dialling card for 10 dollars it will cost you 1.25 dollars per call to use it, a 52 dollar charge which reception cut to 26 dollars(1st hotel in NY we have been charged in). Also 2 dollars per bag to store our bags is a new way of charging customers and also a 1st. Carve around the corner was a real find bacon and egg bap with a deliciouscoffee for 3dollars 75(same as a coffee in the coffee shop attached to the hotel). Great trip all round, don't miss Jersey boys and Sister act and visit Woodbury Common to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Scots-Traveller11
Reviews.Content: Being the first time in NYC my wife & I thought this would be a good hotel. Unfortunately they had given us a single room which is what they call a double room where the bed would defintely not have suited a middle age couple like us. When I went down to question this was given a choice to upgrade to a queen size room which was great. The receptionist couldn't have been more helpful and would like to thank them for this. Rooms are a bit small but location is excellent, rooms are clean, fresh towels every day and staff very friendly. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: jnelson8487
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location to fit our needs! We definitely wanted to experience Times Square, but also wanted to experience the outskirts by walking. We were steps from Times Square & within very short walking distance of Broadway, Fifth Avenue (Garment District), Central Park, and Hell's Kitchen Restaurant Row. All we had to do to reach other areas (SOHO & Lower Manhattan) was to take a short bus or cab right. Now the location as I said was wonderful & the hotel is very classy & nice, but the rooms were SMALL! Imagine the smallest room you can & then half that! Even after reading other reviews we were very shocked at just how small it was. That being said, we spent very little time in our room & it ended up being functional for us. I guess to pay for a bigger room & miss out on other experiences would not have been worth it to us! Most of the service staff was very helpful & courteous including the front desk & doormen (who made the hotel feel very secure). I was quite disappointed in the concierge however. The first full day we were there I told him we were headed to Central Park & I asked him if there was anything in particular we should see or do there. He looked very puzzled & said "No, but I can give you a map." Turns out the most helpful people in that area were our hired drivers to & from the hotel. I would recommend that over a taxi. Overall, it was a great experience & I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “10/10 hotel for comfort & location - ideal for exploring Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Thomas_UK
Reviews.Content: Following the reviews on TA, this was my wife’s and I first stay at The Paramount Hotel but not to NYC. It is located about half a block from the top of Times Square and as such has to be the best located hotel for the Midtown sites. The Rockefeller centre is a few block walk North; Times Square is on the door step; Macy’s around 15 minutes walk and Central Park may be 30 minutes walk. The nearest subway is available at Times Square/42nd Street. As our visit to NYC was to celebrate my 40th birthday, I booked directly with the hotel through their website for a Queen Superior room seven to eight months previously. The photo on the website by the way is representative of the Queen Superior room. On a whim two days before departing I checked the price again on the hotel’s website and was amazed to see that overall it was $255.00 cheaper than when I originally had made the booking, effectively equivalent to one nights stay! A quick phone call from home before the obligatory 24 hours cancellation notice period came into force and they kindly honoured this reduced rate – either that or I would have cancelled and rebooked again. I will do the same now for any future hotel bookings to make sure that I am getting the best price for my stay. On entering the hotel through the two sets of heavy glass doors you open a large open reception area with check-in to your immediate right. Check in was quick and simple and very friendly after a long day of travelling from the UK. We were given two complimentary drinks vouchers which was a nice change. The reception area has many comfy chairs to offer with funky art on the walls and a superb chandelier above you. There are three iPads available to use at a station next to reception by guests for checking email or checking in online. Boarding passes can be printed as well and are available from the reception desk next to the iPads. Alternatively the hotel had wi-fi is available starting from $13.95 for a day’s use. In the evening the reception lights are very low and candles are placed on the stairs opposite the entrance. Very pretty when you enter from a long day’s travel/sight seeing but their coconut fragrance personally was way too overpowering and quite sickly. Please change to ordinary un-scented candles! We were allocated room 430 which was sufficiently spacious for us with a large wet room style bathroom (was slightly smelling of stale urine when we entered but after leaving the door open for the day, this smell disappeared), comfortable bed, HD TV, alarm clock with docking statiom, room safe, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. Bed was very comfortable with the room serviced every day and had no problems at all. Our room was located at the front of the hotel and so we did have a lot of “city noise” during all hours (bin men at 0100hrs and drilling at 0600hrs) which is why we always pack ear plugs now on a travels. Not a critique of the hotel as obviously out of their control but just a FYI travellers! There was also a constant background fan noise which we thought was our a/c but wasn’t. Could not put our finger on it as it have been more hotel wide than just our room. Not annoying, just as a background noise. Liked how there was a large mirror opposite the lifts that tells you what the weather was for the day, either cloudy, sunny, warm, cold etc. Nice quirky touch. Can thoroughly recommend The Paramount for comfort, service and ideally placed for exploring the Midtown area of Manhatten. Concierge service was very helpful to book show tickets, answer general questions about your stay and also in arranging airport transfers. Although not related to the hotel, they did kindle arrange the airport transfer for the pair of us to JFK @ $44.00, however I would highly recommend not using this service. Let me explain why. We were collected at 0415am for a 0830am flight. Took an hour and a quarter to collect from three other hotels before then sitting outside Grand Central Station for another 15 minutes before then actually leaving Manhatten for the airport - 1.5 hours later and we were still on the island!! For the duration of the trip both within Manhattan and on the Interstate out to La Guardia and JFK, the speed and manner of driving was bluntly dangerous. In town the driver of this 10 passenger van was aggressively driving from block to block - full on acceleration then slam on the brakes. On the interstate he was literally the fastest vehicle on the road driving recklessly and excessively fast, jumping from lane to lane, tailgating, honking cars in front to get out of the way and swearing at them when he eventually bullied them out of the way. This is the first time I have frankly been concerned for my life when travelling in a motor vehicle. Not an exaggeration. So people, for the sake of $20 more I would highly recommend your own town car for the transfer, not only giving you the 1.5 hrs extra in bed but it will be a much safer transfer door to door transfer. I can recommend using Dial 7 cars (dial7.com) before and had second to none service and will always be using them in my future trips to NYC. Lastly there is a fantastic pizza place next door, ideal for late night munchies and are delicious. Thank you Paramount and we look forward to staying with you again next year when we return.

Reviews.Title: “It worked”
Reviews.Author: supergirl605
Reviews.Content: Great location. Quaint small rooms. Nothing fancy. Clean linen, no bed bugs. Great little pizza joint right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: RB_Leeds
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have just returned from the Paramount Hotel and we had a fantastic stay there. We arrived at approx 6pm on the 11th and first impressions were great, the decor in the hotel is beautiful. The guy that checked us in automatically upgraded us to a queen sized room as he said we are there for a while (6 nights) and one was available. Once we went to the room, it was on the small size but very modern decor and a nice sized tv on the wall and decent channels, we thought the bed was very comfy and i thought the pillows were lovely. We have a king sized bed at home and the bed was about the same. He did say we would be on the roadside so we would have a view but it was in fact looking at another window, he may have got mixed up but given we were in NYC to sight see and we didn't intend on spending too much time in the room i thought it was excellent. The only downside to the room was you had to sit on the toilet side ways practically as it was very close to the wall. The room was cleaned everyday and the linen changed. This hotel is in a fantastic location, turn left at the main door and walk to the end of the road and you are in the middle of Times Square. A little about our stay in NYC... We bought a Metro Card for $30 each which gives you unlimited use of the subway and buses, we used to the subway to get around which was so easy. i would recommend this as a way of getting about. The concierge in the Hotel helped us book our tour buses, this was the grayline and you pay $44 each for 48 hours hop on hop off and you can go on all the tours. We went on the downtown and also the brooklyn tour, this is a good way to find out information about NYC and see places, we also did the harlem and uptown tour. We gave the congerie a tip for helping us. We booked the Empire State Building and Statue of Liberty before we went both of these i would recommend. We booked tickets to visit the world trade center site, which are free but you give a donation. This was very emotional and think it is a nice way to donate and pay your respects to the families and friends of those it affected. For anyone going to NYC for their first time tips are a big thing, everyone wants a tip. I was told by an american on the plane going you don't usually tip less than 15%. When eating out once you receive the bill at the end it will usually have gratuity at the bottom what it would be for 15%, 20% and 25%, we usually gave 15 or 20 and they were happy with that. Some actually circled the amount they thought they deserved! The shops are just brilliant, if you like shopping like me and my partner its paradise, there is honestly every shop you could ever imagine! i would recommend buying things like basketball vests and other sports stuff from sports shops like footlocker etc as we bought a vest from adidas and it was $90 we then went to footlocker and it was $60, The actual brand stores may be RRP. i bought UGG's from David Z which were $20 cheaper than the actual UGG Store itself. Every store we went in a shop assistant usually stays with you and they help you with whatever you want which is quite nice it feels more personal. All in all we loved NYC and the people are lovely. Americans are the politest people we have ever met. i would recommend the paramount hotel on its cleanliness, value for money and location.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in the heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: delfuaney
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Paramount between 11-16th Dec faultless. The room was always spotless on our return after our days out in NYC. I have read a number of reviews on trip advisor pulling this hotel down for any reason they can find. Well lets get things into perspective, when you go to New York most of your time is spent out of the hotel so if you haven't got a view from your room I wouldn't even worry about it. We were lucky enough to receive a free room upgrade with a nice view but as I said we were out all day so by time you get back to the hotel, your not interested in looking out of the window. Ipads and free wifi in the lobby. We visited the Library bar one evening and 2 cocktails with tip came to $34 but this is a 4* hotel so that's expected. Walk out of the hotel, turn left and walk down the road and your right in the middle of Times Square, the location alone is quite simply worth the cost of your trip. Concierge were very helpful, we wanted to book a trip one day so I went and spoke to them, concierge made a quick phone call and it was booked. Check in and check out was smooth, a debit or credit card is required so a deposit of $75 can be taken for any breakages (returned to your card at then end of your stay), if you do not have a card it was around $200-250, again returned to you at the end of your stay. I have read a review from hell on trip advisor (with pics too) for a place I have previously stayed at and when we arrived we got the same room as the review from hell and while everything was not perfect in the place the reviewer did manage to leave out all the plus points like the fact we had the largest balcony with the best view, maid service was excellent so all I can say to anyone going to the Paramount who reads this is that the hotel is ideally located in the centre of Manhattan and literally yards from Times Square, I will certainly go back to the Paramount hotel again

Reviews.Title: “I dont know what all the negative fuss is about...”
Reviews.Author: Nick R
Reviews.Content: People are over sensitive! I actually only have positive things to say about the Paramount Hotel. Sure, the rooms are tiny, but this is NYC, get out and see this amazing city! Considering the only thing I did was shower and sleep when I was in the room, the size didn't concern me at all. As far as the staff, I had no issue. They were efficient and courteous to me. I needed someone to come and change the battery in the heating control on the wall in the middle of the night and they were up within 2 minutes. Checking in and out was a breeze and I was always greeted with a friendly smile and a hello from the staff as I came and went. I would stay with Paramount again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “micro sized rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: i was heading out from the hotel and had to stops some friends to come up and see the size of the room. Barely enough space for the king bed and the bathroom had no place to put your toiletries. the location is great but the rooms....well.. and staff majority have an attitude, why i dont know theyre not curing cancer theyre working in a hotel like thousands and thousands of fine people

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Spfld539
Reviews.Content: We were told that check in was at 3pm, we arrived at 4pm after walking NYC all day. They said although the room was prepaid, it was still not ready unitl after 5pm. I should have realized it when arriving in the lobby and seeing way too many people at 4pm to be waiting for rooms. The room itself was disappointing. It was a hotels.com booking and we quickly realized you get what you pay for. It's worth it to pay and extra $50 or so to stay at another hotel in Time Square. I would not stay here again. "Renovated room" was just that- a room with TV as soon as you walk in with a chair in the way. Very old and not updated. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect,price excellent given location!”
Reviews.Author: MHIre
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at this hotel. This is my third trip to NYC and decided to splash out this time and stay in Times Sq. Great value given the location,rooms clean,tidy,staff helpful. Food and drink a little pricey but lots of alternatives to be found elsewhere. Billy Elliott musical just across the road so put it on your list of things to do! Thank you to all at the Paramount for my best NYC experience to date!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Janet C
Reviews.Content: Room was very small. My Secretary booked the room as a "suite" at a four star hotel. Far from it, this was a joke. The small room had two beds in it and one small bathroom. When I returned home I was dismayed to find I had been bitten by bed bugs! Disgusted, this hotel should be closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - old, tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MeggieMiller
Reviews.Content: We visited in April 2011 to see Charlie Sheen (can you tell we were just looking for an excuse to take a trip?!). The rooms, as you'll read about in a million other reviews, are indeed tiny. My boyfriend and I are madly in love and we still got annoyed having so little room to move around each other when getting ready to go out. Our room had a view straight into a brick wall. Not a big deal to us - we did our sightseeing outside the hotel. Front desk staff was rude, but maybe that's just New York. The tiny pizza place next door is INCREDIBLE. I highly recommend the lasagna pizza with fresh ricotta. I swear to you: this tiny little place with $5 slices of pizza nearly made the entire trip. It is my single best memory from the occasion. Anyway, if experiencing a location is more important to you than having a nice hotel room, this is a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Dominic T
Reviews.Content: Not only did we get an overpriced small room but it was close to the elevator and very noisy. The staff tried to change our room but they somehow "forgot" us and didnt tell us so we had to move to an even worst room on the second night. One of the worst experience and a staff which could be bored with us. little did they know that we are in NYC twice a month for business and this was the last time we booked there.

Reviews.Title: “Despite makeover, looks tired”
Reviews.Author: hargar
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms supposedly have had a makeover. If that is the case I would have hated to see them before. Rooms are very small, even by NY standards. I stayed at the hotel because it has always had a good reputation. The bathrooms are very small and the bath had chips out of it all over. The rooms facing the street were extremely noisy all night and the thermostat for heating in the room did not work, despite calling the engineer twice. No mini bar, no desk and the room only has one chair, probably because you definately could not fit another one in the space. Really cramped!! Reception staff can be rude, but with only two of them on the desk at a time I dont blame them. Dont even bother with the concierge desk, they dont seem to be interested al all! The hotel has a graet location but even that is not enough to persuade me ever to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hayley H
Reviews.Content: Trendy, clean comfortable hotel. Extremely central. Rooms are small but lovely and clean and beds are soon comfortable. Bar to left ofrhodes lobby is very nice until around 8 when for some unknown reason they think it cool to blast music out so that you have to scream to be heard in conversation. Tis is the only down side but there are so many bars in NYC that this dosent affect the hotel stay at all. Really is lovely and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Never get the petite room”
Reviews.Author: Maxbellan
Reviews.Content: Never buy the petite room for two persons...the bed is actually for ONE person and you are obliged to get the supplement id. You want à NORMAL bed!

Reviews.Title: “Why oh why did they have to make rooms so tiny?”
Reviews.Author: Smartybass
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before taking a cruise out of New York, they have done a great job on the refurb but such a shame ghe rooms & beds are not small they are tiny. As two not very big people my wife & I can't see how 2 larger people could even get in the room never mind share the bed, 2 pillows could not lie side by side without 1 falling on the floor, rest off hotel & location very good although we allowed doorman 2 use hotel taxi to docks & he got lost & charged about $30 more than a yellow so just stick 2 yellow

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Ian_M_T
Reviews.Content: Not a great stay. Small rooms, no desk at all, a mouse trap in plain view in the room, a rusty heater under the window, peeling paint, a closet that didn't fit my suit to hang it up and so on. Staff were pleasant and although they couldn't move me because the hotel was full they did their best. Probably ok place to stay as a tourist visiting NY: not a good place of you're in town for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Allison W
Reviews.Content: This was a first trip to NYC for my 13-year old son and I and we chose the Paramount based on location, price and reviews on Trip Advisor. We got to the hotel early and knew the room probably wouldn't be ready yet. The front desk clerk got us all checked in and showed us where to go to stow our luggage onsite. When we returned, we were quickly able to pick up keycards and even got an upgraded room from the very friendly staff. We knew to expect a small room but we certainly didn't feel squished. The room was updated, pleasant and very functional. The lobby was appealing too (read an earlier comment that it needed to be updated and don't agree). I would definitely recommend and would stay there again (looks like they have some good Jan/Feb rates)! The room was quiet with no hallway or neighbor noise and we slept like babies. Room temp was comfortable; bed and bedding were as well.

Reviews.Title: “Paramount”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa B
Reviews.Content: I just got back home yesterday from NYC, we stayed at the Paramount. We had a smooth check in and was able to check in early. Actually they had the room ready for us at 1:00 instead of 3 which was great, having to roam NYC with luggage is never fun. The furniture is pretty tacky and doesn't really match, the rooms are VERY, VERY small but you're in Time Square what do you really expect? Besides you probably aren't going to spend time in the hotel. It's got great location, right in Time Square it's perfect. We went for a SP concert, and we had a great time, the shopping, the concert, the food all worth it. Only thing that really annoyed me about this hotel were the plug outlets, they were all sideways which made it impossible for me to charge my IPOD. I had to go into the library lobby which was uncomfortable and sit there to charge it. It was inconvenient, also for such a tiny room and only a one night stay, def not worth 300 dollars. However, if I was coming back for a SP concert I would stay here again. Everything worked out well...And it's next to a great pizza place, I suggest checking it out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: pete1607
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple at the beginning of our trip and, to be honest, 2 nights was enough. It is a nice little hotel, with friendly staff who checked us in very quickly, but I wasn't prepared for just how small the room was going to be. The "double" bed (which was more like a slightly larger single) was pushed up against one wall, with barely enough space to edge around it or even open the room door fully. And with 2 suitcases on the floor the room became very uncomfortable. It was clean though, and we just used it as a place to sleep rather than spend any length of time in there. On the plus side, it's ridiculously close to Times Square. Walk 30 seconds east and you're in the middle of "The Crossroads of the World". I'd never seen it before and was completely blown away, and it made me extremely pleased to be staying at the Paramount. In summary, the price was reasonable and you're extremely well located with countless restaurants and attractions literally a stone's throw away. Just be warned about the tiny rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, close to everything, very poor lighting”
Reviews.Author: conben
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, the room was clean and comfortable. the hotel was quiet considering how close to Times Square it was. The lobby needs major updating. The lighting on the floors is very poor. It looks like you are in a dungeon when you get off the elevators. It needs major lighting upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawnywawny
Reviews.Content: On arrival there is a strong smell like cologne, although this is smelt throughout the hotel it's quite pleasant. The decor is fab and really classy. We had booked a double room but the room was extremely small. Having voiced my concerns especially as the bed was a single. Being on my honeymoon I wasn't happy. But they upgraded our room and we we're delighted to have a bottle of champers and strawberries when we returned t our room the next day. Door staff are very pleasant and the location really is top class. Would definitely return again xxx

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: huzzy_bear
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights and absolutely loved the Paramount. We were originally booked in a double room but were upgraded to a Queen size room upon arrival at no extra charge. The staff were friendly and the concierge very helpful.
