The location is perfect, so close to the theatres and Times Square. The rooms are a little on the small size but were kept very clean and our bed linen was changed everyday. I would definitely reccommend staying at the Paramount, so much so that we will are staying here again when we visit in January.

Reviews.Title: “Zen monastery meets Prison aesthetic”
Reviews.Author: WhereAreMyGlasses
Reviews.Content: The good news: This was the most reasonably priced hotel we could find on a holiday weekend and the location for going to the theater could not be better -- just a block or so from Times Square. The rooms were clean and the beds were sufficiently comfortable. The bad news: First of all, what IS that smell in the lobby? Has someone been burning hay and incense sticks? And what is it with the lighting? They seem to be using 25 watt bulbs everywhere. The lighting in the elevators is so dim you have to put your nose next to the numbers to see which button to push. The lighting in the lobby on the room floors is like wearing sunglasses in a dark basement. The rooms themselves are a model of form over function. There are no bureaus -- just cubbies in the closet. The lighting is entirely florescent, under-lit and inadequate. The effect is compounded by the absence of furnishings other than the bed, one chair and two small side tables, and grey walls. The effect is depressing. The bathroom fixtures are old except for the sink which is stainless steel and looks surgical prep sink mounted on an inverted funnel. Really. This hotel is fine for a night or maybe two -- if the price is right -- but this isn't a hotel where anyone would want to linger or any place you'd want to stay if the room price is equal elsewhere. They were trying for a clean austerity but it ended up looking and feeling like a prison cell. Mabye I am just not cool enough to "get it."

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: visitornyc_11
Reviews.Content: Staff is rude!!! Concierge and restaurant staff seem to think it is not part of their job to be of assistance to their guests. When asking for a glass of water at the bar we were yelled at because it was 30 minutes before "opening" and then they just turned up the music to an exceedingly loud level and ignored us. This was not one person but 3 staff members. We ate thanksgiving dinner here - BIG MISTAKE. Not only was the food overpriced and not good, it was cold. We waited an hour and a half to even get the food - no wonder it was cold. The staff was uninterested in us which is actually understandable given that the TIP is AUTOMATICALLY included in your bill - therefore service seems to be an afterthought. I'm pretty sure the waiter was drunk as he spilled the bottled mineral water we paid for all over the table, didn't bother to wipe it up, and then charged us for it. As I was staying with my international in-laws I was embarrassed by the service we received at this hotel. I was upset by the ATTITUDE of the staff - even if this is NYC - and not having manners may be the stereotype of a New Yorker - they definitely lived up to it. The rooms are terribly small. The only plus to this hotel is the location in Times Square if that's were you want to be. Spend your money somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear”
Reviews.Author: Kate S
Reviews.Content: First the ok bits. The communal parts of the hotel are fine although probably better suited to younger people with constant music playing in the lobby seating area and the first floor seating spaces. The bedding was clean and the bed reasonably comfortable. The breakfast was very good and there is free internet in the communal areas but you have to pay in your bedroom..... which brings me to the bad bit. This was probably the worst hotel room we have stayed in in a long long time. The bedroom was called a ;superior' queen, never has an adjective been so inappropriate. The room was very badly designed with simple things lacking or just wrong. There was only one bedside cabinet which means one person has to put all their 'bits' on the floor. The wardrobe was tiny and short, there was nowhere to hang dresses or coats. In the absence of an alternative I hung a dress from the picture rail only to get dust all over the back. The window of the bedroom looked directly into the window of another bedroom as a result of which it wasn't a great idea to raise the blind. The bathroom was tiny and sooooo badly planned. There was an old bath that had been re-coated, this was peeling off in places. The shower was a dribble of water and crammed into the tiny space was a ridiculous conical metal sink that took up far more room than was necessary or indeed desirable. As a result the toilet had been pushed into the corner and was positioned at an angle towards the wall so that you could not sit on it properly and had to take a side saddle approach! And in case you were wondering I am a size 8. I waited for the feedback form to arrive on the final day.. it didn't; neither were we asked if we had enjoyed the stay when we left, maybe they know what the response will be.

Reviews.Title: “To be in amongst the action, this is where to stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: JulieLee75
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel that was conveniently located, not too expensive and not a cookie cutter chain hotel. I certainly found that with the Paramount! Having read that one of the refurbs of this hotel had been done by Philip Stark I expected something funky and it was, especially in the foyer. The rooms were fairly plain, and there was no fridge or coffee and tea making facilities in the room, but it was big enough and nicely decorated. The bathroom was also a good size and well maintained. I am not sure if all Times Square hotels have the same problem but for me the biggest issue was the noise. We were on the 12thfloor, but I felt as though I was on street level as far as traffic noise went. So make sure you pack ear plugs if you're a light sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Vinicius C
Reviews.Content: Good location; great atmosphere in the lobby (wi-fi free in the lobby); small rooms (not a problem since in NY you dont stay in the hotel room anyway); small double beds (ask for queen size minimum!!); tiny bathroom (big guys take care!!!!). Concierge indicated good restaurants around. I will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: blackandwhitefatfred
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on here before I booked so the size of the room was not a surprise to me. I booked a King Delux and this room was fine for us. It was well decorated and the bed was extremely comfortable, the maid service was impeccable as the room was always spotless when we got back in the evening. I found the pillows too soft but that's just my preference, not a fault of the hotel. Check-in and concierge services were very good although we were not asked did we need any help bringing our luggage upstairs. We visited the Library bar on our first evening and having been charged $52.00 for two bottles of Blue Moon beer, one cocktail and a large bottle of mineral water, we didn't return. The breakfast was priced at $35 per person so we found a fantastic Diner about 200 metres away, turn right as you come out of the hotel, turn right at the corner and walk about 150 metres until you come to a fire station, the Olympic Diner is across the road down about another 30 metres. Pancakes, eggs, bacon omlettes etc at less than $20 for two. Overall my impression of the Paramount was very positive and I would stay there if I return to NY.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate hotel in a great location to explore Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Bully1981
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Paramount on the first leg of our honeymoon in NYC. The room was fairly standard fair but certainly very clean, modern decor, and flat screen tv. The bathroom was a very good size and overall the room was of a good size for hotels in Manhattan. The bed was a double but big enough. I noticed a few reviews commenting on the noise. I can't deny that you can hear the traffic so if you are a light sleeper then it may not be for you, but IMO this really shouldn't be complained about as a negative given the superb location, 2 minutes walk from Time Square, middle of theatre district and all the buzz. If you don't want that then go look in Greenwich Village which is a lot quieter.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel At Best”
Reviews.Author: Lala V
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night (I had to transfer from another hotel just for my last night due to availability). I found a great rate online, and for the one night, staying by myself, this hotel was very convenient. The rooms are VERY small, but for one person, I didn't mind. The cleanliness of the room was lacking big time, but for my last night, I really didn't care - plus I've stayed in far worse conditions, so not much fazes me. For a hotel which calls itself "upscale", I would expect the rooms to be maintained in a better condition. There is nothing worse than walking into a beautiful lobby only to find horrible rooms hiding behind such a gorgeous façade. And that is what I found here. My room had large patches of paint peeling off the back of the door, grungy, dirty, light switches which looked like someone had tried to clean up by caking white paint over them (if you've seen this sort of thing before, you know what I'm saying), and same with the window trimming. There was hair all over the bathtub tiles and fingernail trails all down the headboard - which conjures some delightful ideas of what previous guests were doing in the bed I am about to sleep in. It's normal, but I don't need physical evidence of it where I am about to rest my head! And finally, someone busted into my room at 9:00 am. I had the bar-lock on, but it scared me. I immediately called the Front Desk, and they told me it was likely Housekeeping (at 9:00 am on the day I am checking out???). They said they would tell them not to come to my room. At 11:00 am, Housekeeping was back. They knocked and allowed about half a second before opening the door – just in time for me to walk out of the bathroom with a towel wrapped around me. Thank goodness for that bar-lock!

Reviews.Title: “Best Part of this hotel is the location!”
Reviews.Author: Jnetjung
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this hotel because of the location and cost. This hotel is literally 1 block from time square. The noise didn’t affect us at all, possibly because we were staying out till 3 and 4 in the am. The rooms are very small but clean with nice simple decoration, walls are thin, and the bathroom is nothing to brag about! But we expected that from an old hotel like this one. They seem to advertise the unique sinks in the bathroom but I would have much preferred a regular sink with more counter space. We arrived when they were doing a photo shoot in the lobby (apparently the hotel is in the middle of an owner change) so not only was it chaotic, but very busy as well. The check in staff were just mediocre. Our room was not ready (after 3pm) so we left our bags, and ventured out. $5 to hold our bags tho?? The hotel price was excellent, but you can definitely rack up the cost with ALL the extras! They did offer free wifi in the lobby but we were never told about this and only found out when we asked another guest why there were SO MANY PEOPLE hanging out in the lobby! With all that said, the hotel ambiance/design was great, the location and price certainly added to the enjoyment, I’m not exactly sure why its a 4 star--exercise gym? Either way it was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated chic not for old people....”
Reviews.Author: MELVIN_M34678
Reviews.Content: Sure, young folks will enjoy the amenities, but the room was very small, no desk (no desks in any rooms according to the management). Tiny closet. Two tiny drawers. Old bathroom with dirty bathtub (permanent stains). No water pressure. Rust water at sink on hot. Poor TV reception. Queen bed. I was there alone but I cannot imagine two grown folks in that room. Loud air conditioner. This is not a hotel for older Americans…and 4-star? More like a 2-star hostel. Note to older travelers: If you see mirrors on the floor leaning against the wall in the common areas, run! Renovated chic is not cool for old folks. Web sites should warn its older clients. Meanwhile, this client is now more savvy and will be more cautious when using the discount page. 4-star in Times Square may very much be in the eye of the beholder.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: Psychobaby44
Reviews.Content: Paramount hotel forever Next time we will check again in paramount.small rooms but its okay to only sleep.gym is very clean and youtube got everything what youtube need Very good place, everything is in the near. One minute to go to time square, so beautiful trip. Nyc never sleeps:-) www.kunstnagel-nagelkunst.de Greetings from germany alex, halis

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda G
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long journey from Switzerland and had a hotel room booked for 6 nights. We arrived around 3:30 and the room first of all was not ready- we are easy no problem we went out and when we got half hour back the room was ready. At check in then the lady gave us the room key in the hand and just advised us about smoking fee. That was it????? Is that service called in a 4 star hotel? I just feel sorry that you dont aim to be better in a team. I must say the Housekeeping team understands more of customer service than the front as they were so friendly. Yes it seemed to be busy but this is no excuse to provide bad customer service. But if someone is staying 6 nights we dont kniw this hotel have never been no information was giving. Ok forgiven, then we gave it a last chance on check out nothing. just got taen the room key by the same lady like a robot. Really usually we are easy but i have never stayed in a hotel that has no sense of customer service. When already the rooms are tiny at least try to be good on the customers side so they come back, but they dont aim to that. On depature u need also to pay for keeping the luggage? That is not normal after having to wait on check in. On the website is written check in time is 3 pm-- so try to keep to this standard otehrwise offer the ustmers a waiting drink or something. If you want to be a 4 star hotel. My opinion is this hotel deserves a 1 star only for its unfriendly staff and no sense of keeping up on time with the rooms. Sorry but will never be back :) but i think they dont care anyway :D

Reviews.Title: “raises the bar for ripping you off - avoid no matter what price you get”
Reviews.Author: IpanemaGuys
Reviews.Content: Good things - the location is in the middle of Times Square and the lobby's huge and well designed. Unfortunately that's about it. We requested an early check in and were told if it was possible they's accommodate us. When we arrived we were told that no one had ever said that to us - not that the room was unavaiable. When we arrived back at 2:30 we were told the room had been available since 9:00 a.m. The room was tiny, even by NYC standards. Paying $14 a day for inernet is annoying but not a big surprise. I've stayed in a lot of hotels but never had one try to charge me $15 for an ice bucket and two wine glasses. The management is terribly confused - slapping that kind of charge on an amenity makes me thing they're all about milking you for money yet there is no minibar/refrigerator in the room, a no brainer profit center. There are a lot of hotely in this town and the Paramunt certainly is not aiming for repeat customers.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not Four Star”
Reviews.Author: natzack1804
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Paramount from Manchester at about 4.00 pm. After a long journey it's not great to be told that your room isn't ready. The receptionist asked us to wait in the lobby for about half an hour. At this point i would have expected to be offered a complimentary drink at the very least but there was nothing. I had to then go to reception again after considerable time to check on the room. At last it was ready. There was no one to help us with our bags to the room and we had to hump them up there ourselves. We had booked a 2 double bedded room which was adequate. The bathroom was small but functional and could do with a re-fit as the bath was all chipped and there was no fan. The beds were the saving grace for the Paramount. The comfiest hotel beds we have slept in. The lobby was quite funky but the perfume they fill it with becomes quite sickening. The concierge and door people were extremely helpful and the location if you are looking to stay at Times Square is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “"Paramount"”
Reviews.Author: MManuVR
Reviews.Content: It´s an excellent hotel. The rooms are perfect. The hotel has a excellent decoration. It´s just about 1 block from the Times Square. The only problem it´s that at night you hear the shouts of Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Carelessness with luggage”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo R
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 21/29 September 2011. In the checkout, baggage handlers broke my friend's new iPad. The hotel security industry noted the data, promised to solve the problem and still no answer. Rooms too small.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, New York City was AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: holidays4me_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Paramount Hotel in March 2011 for my 30th Birthday celebrations. Visiting New York was not only special as it was my birthday but when I arrived in New York I had a Boyfriend when I left I had a Fiance ;0). The hotel was in a great location the rooms were generally small but as it was New York we didnt stay in the room that much. The Hotel was very clean and the Restaurant/Bar was very funky I would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor service from executive office”
Reviews.Author: D V
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Paramount Hotel from October 13 - 16, 2011. I picked this hotel strictly off it's 4 star rating and it was a good price. The lobby is beautiful and the front desk staff was very helpful. However I was extremely disappointed in the room. There was paint chipped everywhere throughout our room (I stayed in Room 922) and the water pressure of the shower was extremely weak. Two things I would certainly not expect from a hotel that claims to be 4 stars. It was my service and treatment afterwards however that horrifies me most about this place. I left an electronic cosmetic device that cost $120 in my room. I realized my error and called the hotel the next day to see if housekeeping could mail it to me. I spoke with someone in housekeeping and she informed me they threw away all cosmetic items, and since nothing had been found in my room, it would be safe to assume they threw it away. I then spoke to Natalie and Marcio in the executive office about this incident, asking if the hotel could reimburse or replace my item. They said I would need to fill out insurance paperwork and make a claim to get my item replaced and they would email me the forms right away. It now has been over a month, and I have called/left messages with either Natalie or Marcio at least six times and they a) have not emailed me the insurance paperwork b) have not returned any of my phone calls regarding this incident. This is definitely not the kind of service I expect from a hotel that lists itself as 4-star, and I will be sure to never stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: nycityfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights beginning 31.10.11. Although the photos of the reception area don't quite match reality, I found the hotel excellent. 3 of us shared a double room with 2 very comfy queen size beds, and a clean bathroom. We were on the 3rd floor just overlooking 46th Street and it was quite noisy at night - but hey we were in New York and less than a minute from Times Square so on day 2 I purchased ear plugs, and had no further problems. Staff were friendly and helpful. I hope to visit New York again and would definitely stay here again as the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bev86England
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. Our room on the 19th floor was tiny, the smallest hotel room we have ever stayed in anywhere in the world. It was supposed to be a double room. The bed for pushed up to the wall, so we had to climb over the other person to get in and out, or crawl out from the top of the bed to the bottom. The air conditioning didn't work. We reported this and they said they would send the maintenance guy up to fix it. When we returned to our room later that evening, we opened the door and he had left the heating on at 80 degrees! (This was when we had complained that the room was too hot, and the air conditioning didn't work)! We rang down to reception and the duty manager came to see the room, she was very nice and moved us immediately, to a much nicer room on the 10th floor, bigger in size, and much bigger bed. The other thing we were not impressed with was the wardrobe space, there wasn't enough hanging space for longer clothes. Location of hotel was very good for Times Square though.

Reviews.Title: “The Paramount Hotel is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Wes1andJane
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Paramount Hotel, New York with my boyfriend for the 2nd time. I loved the place last year when we visited for my birthday & thought the service was great. This year there were a couple of minor incidents that happened which I reported to a staff member on the way out, mainly regarding the bar staff upstairs & when trying to order some food. The barman said they couldn't get waiters to take orders & serve around the side tables overlooking the square ground lobby, (near the elevators). Why?? Yet, I saw a waiter clearing tables on the next table to where we were sitting?? We ended up just having a drink & leaving to go & eat elsewhere. The Paramount lost customers there! As we have paid a lot of money last year & this year at this hotel, I feel put off ordering any meals there again. We will always think twice about eating at the Paramount. Other than that, the rooms were ok, the boutique style lobby was nice, (it was different to last year), & I would always go back to the Paramount as it's in a great location. Great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, the best location”
Reviews.Author: Tinytoes2009
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 7 nights in november, check in was late as they had organised a free room upgrade for my partners birthday which was nice :) They also left choc covered strawberries and cookies in our room which was a nice touch. we had a queen room which was perfectly sized for 2 plus 2 suitcases. Bed was comfy, pillows not so much, bathroom was small but not too much, u do have to sit on an angle pn toilet but thats not really a biggie. Shower was amazing so powerful. Room was cleaned every day with clean towels, considering the state we left the room in the cleaners did an awesome job!! Free safe was good as a lot of places charge for that service. Only doenside was expensive wifi (it was sold to us in the travel agents as having free wifi but thats only in lobby and it can b slow, $43 for the week) You cant beat the location, for that alone i wud recommend this hotel and wud stay again.

Reviews.Title: “welcome to NYC not to the Paramount”
Reviews.Author: worldy10
Reviews.Content: Just checked in and had the surprise of my life. Not enough space for my shirts AND jackets. Where do I put the suitcase? The bathtub is old and disgusting. Staff at reception just shrugged and told me that's what you get for a superior room and just go ahead and complain, it won't change a thing. Do what you have to. Welcome to NYC. Will I come again? I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: BorisBex
Reviews.Content: What can i say, this place is right where you want to be! Next to the church of scientology and minutes walk to Times Square. Its expensive though, and the rooms are very small - but comfortable and you have everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and nickeling and diming!”
Reviews.Author: To-kro
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. Very expensive considering the very small rooms but the location is of course great. Trying to get an extra dollar out of whatever you ask for, and this really reduced our impression!

Reviews.Title: “FAB LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Jayne H
Reviews.Content: Really is a brilliant location, right on Times Square. Room quiet at night though so both slept well which surpised us. Room was adequate for what we needed. Not as tiny as some have complained. Not massive but reasonable for a city centre hotel. Good value for money. Beautiful decor and lovely comfy bed. Very clean and good use of space. Reception area was beautiful - photos don't do it justice. Very trendy. Didn't eat breakfast in the hotel - so can't comment on that. Cheeck in and out was efficient and quick. Staff professional but not over friendly. Excellent base for sight seeing and shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterGuernsey
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel only to be told we had been booked into three double rooms, we had booked three twin rooms through our booking agent as we were a party of females. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful, they quickly took action and moved two of us into queen size rooms for that night - unfortunately two of our party still had to stay in the room which had been booked, which I have to say is incredibly tiny and we could not imagine having had to stay in this room for the length of our stay. The next day we were advised we had been moved into three rooms next to each other with two beds in each room. Thank you so much to the wonderful staff at the hotel who made our stay so much more comfortable, as it was a special birthday celebration they put some fizz and chocolate covered strawberries in our room and also gave us vouchers for a complimentary cocktail - very generous of them. I am currently in an argument with the online agent we booked through who don't seem too bothered that we ended up with rooms we did not book and pay for. The hotel location is brillant, just by Times Square and close by lots of great delis and restuarants. Yes the rooms are a little tired in places but they are very clean and the beds are wonderfully comfortable which is just what you need after a hard days shopping and sightseeing. I would recommend this hotel for the great location and for the helpful and friendly staff who work there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jessica F
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the hotel staff at the Paramount Hotel for such a great weekend. The hotel staff, especially Natalie Vachon who was a pleasure to work with and suggested a variety of places to visit and Cheryl who assisted in providing amenities to our rooms. The hotel management staff was also very pleasant to work with...the snow mixture had put a slight damper on our plans to explore NYC for the day and the hotel suggested a few shows and even checked us into our room within a timely fashion so we could enjoy the room/view without freezing in time square! Overall, the experience at the beautiful Paramount Hotel was excellent and I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC as the staff was a pleasure to work with and made the experience one to remember. Thank you Natalie Vachon & Cheryl again for all your assistance with this trip.

Reviews.Title: “great location for times square”
Reviews.Author: ann b
Reviews.Content: Should have gone to New York but was cancelled due to hurricane Irene so when rebooking this was the only available hotel for the dates we had. Staff very helpful and polite,room was very small tiny cupboard so had to leave most of clothes in suitcase bit annoying no where to put suitcases so they took up some room.Rooms cleaned daily had a problem with telly only wanted to see news re the snow that N.York had this was sorted out within half hour of reporting. Could leave suitcases in hotel on departure day (charge of 2 dollars a case )if late flight home. Still did not go to N York to stay in hotel so as a location it could not have been better 2 mins from times square. Helpful when leaving for airport arranged taxi. I probably will not go back to N.York but would encourage anyone to give this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: suitcase0810
Reviews.Content: Just come home after a 4 night stay in New York. There were 2 of us -female friends and although we had e mailed the hotel twice to confirm that we wanted a double room with 2 beds we were allocated a double bed.A fter some arguments and a horrible start to our holiday we were 'upgraded'(ha! Ha!!!) by a very nice and polite receptionist(male)The room was a joke .I am 5 ft and my friend is 5 ft 2ins and one of us always had to stand on the bed for the other to move.The bed was a large double and a roll in bed(which we had to insist on)The wardrobe was tiny and because of the safe at the bottom of the wardrobe we could not hang skirts etc.There were 2 small drawers at side of bed which was difficult to get into because of the roll in bed and 2 small drawers in the wardrobe. There was a full size ironing board and iron in the ward robe as well!There was a plastic chair as well which we had to climb over to get to the other side.The decor was misreable. Bathroom needed a spruce up but was well cleaned and looked after daily by the poor maids- how they did it I have no idea.The hall outside resembled a prison. Noisy air conditioner but I did not mind that.Staff were fine, helpful and pleasant. Went for a drink at the first floor bar - great staff, dirty glass tables.I am not an old foggy and I can see how the reception area is modern etc but it would be nice to be able to see where the door was. Night manager lovely, friendly and polite.Location fabulous, could not be better. I have stayed in hptels all over the world including family Chinese run hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Poor rooms reminiscent of student halls of residence but with 4 star price!”
Reviews.Author: horabed61
Reviews.Content: We got allocated a double room on 19th floor which was a jole we are not big people but we had to push the bed near the wall so as not to fall out. It was a very noisy room and even worse when the a/c came on. We changed the next night but had to pay $100 extra for a room we thought we had in the first place. The decor is very cold and it smells fusty just like student halls! The location is great but not worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: reviewxx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in times square a great location. A lot of reviews on here said the rooms were small but me and my family were pleasntly surprised. Our room was quite decent in space, not anything special. The lobby was dark and did not have much lighting. The corridors was dark and did not feel like a hotel. Overall the hotel was ok, had a great location.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location!”
Reviews.Author: TiaMaria82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paramount Hotel at the end of September. Having never been to New York before we wanted a hotel that was in a good location and this hotel more than delivered. The only thing between this hotel and Times Square is a theatre, you couldn't be any closer! We found the reception and concierge staff to be very helpful and friendly. Our room was modern and always clean but very small! We were expecting a small room having read some of the reviews before we travelled but we didn't realise how small. Firstly the bathroom........considering the size of the room the bathroom was actually a decent size containing a bath with shower, basin and toilet. We did however have a problem with the toilet. It was impossible to sit straight on the toilet for 2 reasons; 1) there was a radiator directly in front of the toilet and 2) the toilet was angled in towards the wall and radiator. Secondly the bedroom.........The room contained a double bed, tray table and chair. The room had a wardrobe but unfortunately a foot below the hanging rail was the safe, preventing you from being able to hang anything longer than a childs t-shirt in the wardrobe! Because of this we had to live out of our suitcases. Normally this wouldn't have been a problem for a 3 night stay but having the suitacases on the floor took up half of the available space in the room. The air conditioning in the room was poor. If the air con was on it was very loud and freezing but if it was off the room was baking. Despite my comments above I would stay at this hotel again mainly because of the excellant location and considering the minimal amount of time we spent in our room.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paramount Hotel in August 2010 - it was over a year ago but I feel that it is important that I let everyone know how great it is! As it was our first time overseas, we were a little anxious in regards to booking accommodation. We selected the Paramount Hotel as we had read the reviews on Tripadvisor and it seemed modern looking from the photos and reasonably priced. The foyer to this hotel is AMAZING! Staff were very friendly on the front desk and restaurant and you wouldn't even know that there were cleaning staff (except for the fact that our room was made immaculate each day by them). I have stayed at a number of places in Australia where cleaning staff have walked into the room whilst I am still there so it was a lovely change to not have interruptions. The room and bathroom were very tidy and modern - they were on the small side (especially as we didn't have a view) however this didn't bother us as we were expecting the room to be small and really, we were hardly in the room! When we were, we found it comfortable and it was actually sad to leave as it felt like a second home:( I thought the mirror with the temperature reading near the lifts was great, especially as we weren't sure what it was like outside as we didn't have a view. We had a wonderful time in New York and we were absolutely thrilled with the Paramount Hotel - we would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Grasshopper”
Reviews.Author: Grasshopper75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paramount Hotel october this year, the hotel is in a great location, rooms are small but your not really in them long enough, only to rest those tired feet. The rooms are refreshing and fresh towel every day, having been to NY before, being in Times Square can be rather noisy ! Their is a small cafe attached to the Hotel - walk under Marriots and theirs a Starbucks!! They are every where. The Hotel staff are very pleasent - only we didnt really stay in the hotel to appreciate it, and its facilities Juniors you just have to eat their - walk through the Marriots and Juniors is the other side and dont forget to eat their cheese cake its to die for - and unfortunately or fortunately we found Restraunt Street or Avenue - it full of all nationalities 2 blocks from the Paramount. Turn right and keep walking. When we go again we would prefer to be a bit out of Times Square rather than in it, but we had a fab time as alway with temperature topping 85oC

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CarleyTauchert
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights in April and location cannot be faulted, you can literally walk everywhere and you have Times Square on your doorstep, however the location comes at a price and that is room size. Our room was made up of a double bed with very little room for anything else. The wardrobe and cupboard space was small (and in NYC with all the shopping that isn't ideal) however it is only a place to rest your head a shower and the hotel cannot be faulted for that, the rooms were clean and tidy and the bathroom well stocked. Bathrooms need a bit of a spruce up but other than that I would recommend for location & price!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: TuppenceIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: We were on honeymoon and when we arrived our room was absolutely tiny. It looked like a small double bed with only just enough room to walk round the bed. Tiny wardrobe and 2 small drawers, storage space ridiculously inadequate. Asked to be moved to bigger room with bigger bed but had to pay a one off payment of 80 dollars! Second room was a little bigger as was bed but still hardly any storage space So we ended up with most of our clothes etc. In piles over the floor! No tea/coffee facilities in rooms. Rooms generally basic and a bit dull in decor. Probably would stay somewhere else next time. No free wifi in rooms either, we had to keep going down to hotel lobby. Fantastic location though, only 2 minute walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location...tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: leepixielee76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in May. The hotels location cannot be faulted it's perfectly situated in times square. It's clean and modern but the rooms are absolutely tiny! We had four to a room which had two double beds, with four peoples luggage it was impossible to keep tidy! I'd say this hotel is great if you want a base to explore new york but if your looking for a luxury stay then this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “All depends on the room you are given”
Reviews.Author: PeteCav
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Saturday in mid October and were given a room on the 19th floor. It was barely big enough for 1, had a 3/4 size bed and not a double. I could almost touch both walls with outstretched arms. The smallest hotel room I have ever had and I travel alot. I asked to move but they were full. Were moved to an acceptable sized room the following day which was fine. Other than that it was clean, staff were good and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: Janeybabydee
Reviews.Content: Our party of four stayed at the Paramount at the end of September for three nights. It was amazing! It was our first trip to New York and we picked the hotel for its location right on Time Square. It was just what we needed. The hotel itself was beautiful, especially the lobby and bar, and the staff were very helpful. The only problem we had was my sisters room. We know hotel rooms in NY are famous for their size (or lack of it) and were more than prepared. My partner and I were very happy with our room, we loved it. My sister and her husband however had a 'double' room the same as us but a 'single bed'. I know, I know, those smaller beds are still technically a bed for two but it was just plain uncomfortable. Also, needless to say my sister was a bit put out after seeing ours! But, the staff were great. They were full so couldn't do anything the first night but got them a new 'double' room (with 'double' bed) the next morning. Overall we found our time in NY and the Paramount amazing and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room and noisy”
Reviews.Author: rakdanit18
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation through Priceline (name your own price). It was a room to accommodate 2 people. When we got there, we were told our reservation was for a DOUBLE bed. Not such thing on Priceline. As we squeezed into the room and double bed, we hoped we could be comfortable. We had to ask for washclothes and face towels. The worst thing was at 7AM each morning there was a horrible clanking noise that went on for a couple hours. Thank goodness the fan SORT OF covered the noise. We believe it was the noise from the parking lot 2 lots over that raises the cars via an elevator beginning at 7 AM. The desk said they never heard that complaint before - BALONEY!! You have to have been deaf not to hear that noise. Staff was very unhelpful for any question or issue we had. I'd never stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy & Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ron C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights for a convention and absolutely LOVED our stay. As noted by most reviewers, the rooms are small by today's standards (common in NYC), but very clean, quiet, cozy & comfortable for the two of us. Besides, who stays in NYC Times Square to hang out in a room?!? The decor in the lobby, bars, and rooms is downright SEXY and we felt pretty "hip" staying there versus the other "old fogies" hotels nearby. I was a hotel manager in my previous career and a stickler for Customer Service. The Paramount's staff is incredibly professional, courteous, friendly, and attentive. The Night Manager on Duty (MOD) is World Class! Now, If I had to nitpick...I wish there was a few more amenities to accommodate a longer stay (E.g. a gift shop, valet laundry, Pool & spa, shoe shine service, better variety on the Room Service menu, etc.). Otherwise, it's an awesome hotel and we can't wait to stay again :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Dolcemon
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in if you want to be in Time Square. The hotel is very modern. The rooms are a decent size for NYC. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely welcoming and helpful. We return to the city we will most likely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fab location!”
Reviews.Author: KEMM82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon. (26-29 sept) The lobby is dark as previous people have said however this is part of the appeal of the hotel the sweet smell in the lobby also adds the ambience of the hotel. Check in was quick - however we were not aware of the $75 deposit we would would have to leave at reception during our stay. We were upgraded to a queen room as it was our honeymoon and we were really pleased with the room. The rooms were clean and smaller than average however We were hardly there anyway and so it didn't matter much to us. The location of the hotel is fabulous - you come out of the hotel, turn left and right ahead of you is times square (30 sec walk) We found the open top bus ride was a great deal as we could visit all of the main attractions over a 2 day period and hop on and off the bus for $54 each. Rockefeller is must at night! World trade centre is a place you need to visit. Central park is exactly what it says in the tin - a park! We took a pedicab around it - what an adventure. One issue we did have was the ac unit - it was so noisy yet we needed it on to stay cool. Overall the hotel is great and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs uo for the Paramount”
Reviews.Author: Sazupupandaway
Reviews.Content: This is a very well priced and convenient hotel in the heart of the city. The recent refurb has given the rooms a nice crisp feel. The staff are super friendly and offered great advice for places to eat. It feels a little dark in the reception and this theme continues into the rooms but you get used to it. Mind you with the BRIGHT lights of Times Square a couple of minutes away it gives your eyes a break. The bed was really comfy. The decor is pretty neutral and certainly wouldn't offend. I don't know I'd book the person who decorated the bathroom but it was an ok refurb that only slightly lets down the overall feel of the room. We had room only and swerved the expensive buffet breakfast for the Brooklyn Diner round the corner as recommended by one the concierge staff - they were spot on. Central Park is an easy stroll away; The Empire State is just down the road and the Subway takes you wherever else you want to go. I would definitely go back to this hotel if the opportunity arises. Area recommendations The whole of Manhattan down from and including Central Park is like being on a film set. If I'm honest the Statue of Liberty was an anticlimax but the Empire State, Central Park and almost everything else we crammed into our day topped my expectations considerably...

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, clean, small, need at least Queen size bedroom, clothes stolen from room, air cond extremely noisy, front d”
Reviews.Author: Cheyrou
Reviews.Content: Stayed the first week of September. Clean hotel and perfect location. Had free wifi in foyer which was very beneficial. Hotel staff nice and helpful. Stayed in queen room very small. Air conditioner extremely noisy and hard to sleep. Shirt stolen from room from cleaning staff not impressed. Conceige very good getting tickets however extremely expensive sometimes doubling the price!! The location is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yyyzzz111
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times over the years. The dim lobby is part of the ambiance. You either get it or you don't. The lobby and hotel have a modern, artistic design and decor. The lobby is amazing with plush chairs and the artsy huge staircase that leads up to the mezzanine restaurant that overlooks the lobby. Both are just fun to sit in. The location is great and the mini Dean and Deluca attached is really convenient. However, I am really disappointed that the latest renovation has literally cut the rooms in half. When I started staying here, the rooms were a normal size and great, with the all white beds and red roses. Now there is little clear space between the bed and the rest of the room. I will continue to stay here, for sentimental reasons, but they really need to rethink the room size as it takes so much away from the funky, upscale atmosphere of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a try”
Reviews.Author: HarryAnnie
Reviews.Content: An interesting alternative to the over-priced hotels in central Manhattan. A somewhat gloomy, but ritzy reception area welcomes you. Check-in is straight forward and usually quite efficient. The rooms are small, perhaps even tiny, and furniture is kept to a minimum. The decor is somewhat avant-garde, the bed usually comfortable, and half-bathrooms contain everything required. This is not a hotel for someone wanting to spend much time in. It is designed for those who want a central location (Times Square), a clean bed to crash out on, and more style and comfort than in a hostelry. With that in mind, the price is excellent. Forget the views from your room - if that's what you are after, spend another $300 and get something with a view elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great lobby and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Dena E
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is pretty good, with quite small but fairly well kept rooms. The selling points are the fantastic location in relation to Times Square, the beautiful lobby, great bar and snacks, Dean and Delucca adjacent to the lobby and a fantastic breakfast buffet in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first NY trip but shop around!”
Reviews.Author: siandee
Reviews.Content: I would sum the Hotel up as fine. It didn't wow me but there was nothing majorly wrong with it. Our travel agent told us this hotel was 4*..the location may be 4* but the hotel itself is a 3*. In my opinion it was not worth what we paid but maybe if you get a cheap rate it would be ok. There were 3 positives: 1. location! Times Square is 90 seconds away and you can walk to all major attractions which is the main appeal of the hotel. The road outside was very quiet and you never would know how close you were! 2. The room was clean and sheets changed every day. 3. The shower was hot and powerful even in the morning. However this was my first trip to New York and I expected the rooms to be small, especially reading some of the reviews and the room was VERY small. The bathroom was half the size of the main room. We only stayed for 3 nights but I don't think I could have been there for any longer. We had a double room and if you are a couple maybe consider twin beds instead. When we checked in the lady on the desk was on the phone dealing with a complaining guest..not a great first impression! But rather than ask us to wait, she checked us in while continuing the call which I found very rude. Overall, I would shop around for other hotels in the Times Square area and only recommend if you can get a majorly discounted rate. I would stay else where in future though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: louisNorfolk
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 days in NYC. Not a good time to visit as United Nations were in session and made this busy city worse than ever. Stayed in the Paramount near Times Square. Good location but thats all I can say good about this Hotel. The room was cramped no where to store clothes, no dressing table, had to do hair and makeup in bathroom. The air con wa so noisy couldn't sleep with it on but rooms were so stuffy needed it. It was dark and inpersonal in the reception area. Concierge were good but did let us down, we asked to book a Dinner Cruise, she could not get through so asked us to leave it with her and then she forgot to book it. I enjoyed NY but would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Claire B
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for new york sightseeing/ shopping. Modern hotel & really nice decor - you get what you pay for with the space, so it's worth paying for a bigger room if you don't want to be cramped in the smaller rooms. The bathrooms are small but worth it for the location. Kept very clean. Only downside is they charge for you to have any mail sent to the hotel which I've never seen before.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: Pat T
Reviews.Content: My family and I (3 couples) just returned from a week in NYC and 7 nights at the Paramount. The staff was wonderful; very accommodating and gave quick service. One of our party had to deal with business and needed to find a notary in the city - the concierge was absolutely "above and beyond" in his assistance. Our air conditioning didn't work and they immediately moved us. Prices are expensive (but it's NYC!) - but we made use of the close deli's and liquor stores. We all loved being a block from Times Square. Free Wi-fi in the lobby! And everyone should always carry earplugs when traveling... heating\cooling - it's never like home, so plan accordingly. The rooms were clean and always ready when we returned after a day of site-seeing. We had no issues at all and would definitely stay here again. Here's a great tip --- go the opposite direction on 46th Street - not towards Times Squares - fabulous restaurants on 46th. Get a Metro Pass to make use of the buses and subways! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just returned from a week long vacation in NYC. We stayed at the Paramount and had an excellent experience. Rooms were very comfortable and clean. Location of the hotel near Times Square & trains was perfect. Also several very nice restaurants were a half a block away. Couldn't ask for a better place to stay. Free Wifi in the lobby. Can't wait to get back. Bill & Casey H.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica C
Reviews.Content: Had a fantatic time at this hotel....got upgraded for free to a bigger room. Hotel service was brillant. Hotel is decorted beautifally..Very boutique!!OUR ROOM WAS QUIET COMFY BEDS, CLEANED BRILLANT EVERYDAY !!!FABULOUS HOTEL would definitley return!!!Stunning lobby area!!NEW YORK WAS A FANTASTIC PLACE TOO!! location was fab!!

Reviews.Title: “just back from NEW YORK had a fab time, hotel superb”
Reviews.Author: pamsteve091
Reviews.Content: had a great visit to new york, hotel was superb.ideal location, staff very helpful. hotel and rooms decorated very boutique style. rooms smallish but beds so so comfy. staff always on hand to give advice on directions, places to see etc. the cocktails in the library bar were an extra plus too! would definately go back

Reviews.Title: “By far the WORST place to stay in New York City.”
Reviews.Author: Julianne V
Reviews.Content: My co-worker and I stayed here for six nights while on a business trip to NYC. I booked the room based on the pictures (totally misleading) on their website and the reviews (obviously they only post the good ones). You can't even use the word small to describe the size of their guest rooms. They are glorified closets. We are girls and we were extremely uncomfortable. I don't know how a man would fit in one of these rooms. I demanded we be switched into a decent size room (I am aware that Manhattan rooms are small in general but this was ridiculous) and after 3 rooms switches, we ended up in a room the EXACT same size, but we then had to share a king bed. Worst service and outrageous prices for the size of these rooms. The bathrooms are the size of a half bath with a shower thrown in there. On top of the terrible rooms, the room service was horrible. Awful stay, we will NEVER book another trip here nor will we ever recommend anyone stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Too Noisy and in need of update”
Reviews.Author: Bevfly
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in good location,but had large groups of teens and was very noisy.Lobby was always very crowded and had to wait a long time to check in.Even trying to get to the desk for anything the wait was always long.The room was pleasantly decorated but quite shabby.Staff not very helpful as hotel was always busy and they never had time to help you.If you want peace and quiet then its not for you but if you want noise then its for you.On a budget then its maybe ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Itchie-Feet
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents for their first trip to NYC, based on Trip Advisor, price for a 4-star hotel and location. I emailed the hotel a few times regarding (i) the booking, (ii) ordering a gift in the room, (iii) emailed their return flight boarding cards, and each time they were FANTASTIC! So happy to help. My parents returned today and said that the hotel was brilliant - their only SLIGHT gripes were: Breakfast: expensive- seek alternative diner around the corner Wardrobe: drop from the hanging rail is short, so bottom of jackets are folded. All other room amenities were great, including hair dryer with socket next to a decent mirror! Noise: slightly noisey with air-con and general street noise - but then they are used to total quiet as they live in a detached house in a rural area. Other than that, they really couldnt fault it - rooms fantastically clean every day, great concierge service for info and booking tickets, literally next to Times Sq with bus stops, etc. For the price and location, this hotel is THE place to explore NYC - in their opinion, (but I did grill them!).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Maws_11
Reviews.Content: Most reviews comment on the small rooms at the Paramount. We were on honeymoon and were upgraded to a king deluxe room, and welcomed with some chocolate covered fruit and sparkling water, plus two complimentary drinks for the bar. We certainly got a great welcome. The room size must really depend on the type of room you go for, our room was more than big enough with a built in wardrobe and a small, but not too small, bathroom. The room was clean and stylish with a huge wall mounted tv. The air con was noisy enough to compete with the noise of the city outside, which I guess could be more annoying in the summer. The location is amazing, closer to Times Square than I imagined, next door to the Scientologists. A protest going on outside there made one evening more interesting. Being so close to Times Square for a longer stay could get tiresome, turn right out of the hotel and head up 8th Avenue for cheaper souvenir stores and some great delis. The staff are all very pleasant and helpful, the concierge(s) are all very knowledgeable. One small thing was when we had an early dinner reservation in the West Village, the concierge told us a cab would take 15mins to get there, however at 4-5pm all the cabs are heading home to Queens at the end of their shift, and it took us 45 mins to get a cab to go downtown, this kind of local knowledge would have been useful. But the restaurant held our table, so no harm done. The Paramount is a great, stylish and special hotel to stay at. By our UK standards the rooms are plenty big enough, I guess if this is an issue, pay the extra and go for a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!! Small rooms (like most of Manhattan)”
Reviews.Author: CLBRochester
Reviews.Content: This is a very elegant, reasonably priced hotel for it's location! I visited NYC to go to a Yankees game and shop in Times Square. This is a fantastic location, only 1/2 block from where all the action is in Times Square. The staff is friendly, the lobby is beautiful, the rooms are stylish and clean (but very small). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: SolVoyce
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week in NYC. We visited the city last year as well and thought we should pay a bit more for a newer hotel this year because we had a horrible experience last year in another hotel when we had mice and all kinds of miserable creatures in our room. We booked a superiour room from Hotels.com at Paramount times square and payed around 250 usd-300 usd/night. We asked for a hotel room with a nice view. Check out our pictures, to see the view from the first room we got. The first room was on the third floor. It was right to the ventilation system of the hotel, and the sound was literally like sleeping next to an airplane jet motor. At 4am in the morning, I had enough, so I went down to the lobby to get another room. No problem, the next day we got a fantastic room on the 15th floor. The room was clean, quite big and the bathroom was a good size for New York. The view from this one was much better. The staff was helpful and friendly. There are just a few details that are missing, in my opinion, from the hotel hitting the straight A from me. 1) I find it really cheap of the hotel to not provide free internet with the room. When you have paid so much money, internet should be included in all rooms, not just in the lobby. 2) I find it really cheap of the hotel to not provice free luggage storage between check out and the transfer to the airport. Two bucks a bag. Are you kidding me? This should be free! 3) No door man. We saw several times, how older hotel guests struggled to get in and out of the entrance doors. People with heavy luggage also had problems with getting in. Concidering how one or two hotel security staff/ordinary staff always stood in the lobby, they should have someone at the doors at all times. We helped out when we were present and other hotel guests did also. 4) The first room we had. We put so much money into this room, and it was really, really noisy!. It should not be classed as a superiour, it should be a budget room with half the price off. If the hotel wants to be the top notch, these simple things should not occur. Overall, we had a great stay at the hotel. The room we had after we changed was quiet and the location is really superb with Times Square just around the corner and the subway two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Mr/mrs m notts.Paramount is fine by us.”
Reviews.Author: Mrm45
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the paramount times square(2nd sept/9th 20/11)the hotel is fine as long as you upgrade to at least a queen room.We were put on the third floor it was noisy from the air conditioning we asked for another room and the next day were moved up to the 18th floor,the hotel staff were fantastic there was nothing they wouldnt do for you.The location is second to none turn left out of the hotel and within 1minute you are in times square,turn right cross 2 roads and your in the hells kitchen district where you can eat from nearly every cuisine under the sun even ethiopian,and its a good deal cheaper than times square.We would certainly stop here again.But please remember dont book 1 of the smallest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The Paramount was everything could ask for!”
Reviews.Author: Jeri C
Reviews.Content: A rather large group of us flocked to the Paramount for David Cook's cd release party at the end of June. Now, we are known to be a somewhat demanding, boisterous bunch, and the staff was absolutely fabulous in catering to our each and every whim. My friend and I even had a special surprise that they handled perfectly. While the rooms are a bit small, you are in New York, and as long as the bed is comfortable (it was) and the shower is clean and it works(it was and did) that's all you need. They could use a few more outlets in the rooms for those of us that travel in pairs and need to charge multiple phones,laptops,camera batteries and iPads. But other than that? Clean, plush and Luxe. And a great staff. I highly recommend this hotel, and am looking forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst of the worst to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: redcarnations208
Reviews.Content: So you can get a cheap rate at this place. Not worth staying here. My sisters got a great rate so I stayed in the same place just to keep things convenient. They paid $99/night; I paid $169/night. What a waste of my money--waste. Rooms are so small that even a child has no room to walk around the perimeter of the bed. Bathroom is a slit of a place. Cleanliness is nonexistent. Hotel location is not worth the price if where I sleep and bathe is so horrible.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but...”
Reviews.Author: italy_norway
Reviews.Content: nothing really wrong with this hotel, but on the overall our experience was not outstanding. The room was on the small side (but I guess it is what one should expect in new york) and, though renovated, there were some sign of tiredness, especially in the bathroom. In the middle of the 90s this was a really cool hotel. Now it has lost a bit of its charme. The hall still has a wow effect, but it is a bit too dark and noisy after a while. Also, when paying 300+ USD per night, I would expect to get free wireless in the room and free baggage storage. I know this is New York, but ... On the positive site, the hotel is in Broadway with many theaters just around the corner (if that is what you are looking for). I would have no problem going back, even when traveling solo, but I would probably first look for alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff but the Room was Awful”
Reviews.Author: mplanglinais
Reviews.Content: Since I was traveling alone, I booked a single room. I had requested a higher floor but ended up on one of the lowest. I had requested a quiet location but ended up around the corner from the elevators and right next to the ice machine. The room was small, even by New York standards. "Single" evidently means: unable to fit more than one person in the room. Really, the space was about the size of an average walk-in closet. The bed was a twin. I kept having to move my overnight bag to avoid tripping over it when I tried to get around the room. I realize not every room can have a view, but my one window looked out over some kind of maintenance space. It also looked directly across at other rooms, so I wasn't very comfortable having the shades open. Besides that, being on such a low floor with tall buildings around gave the effect of being at the bottom of a well; not much natural light was able to reach my little window and I couldn't have told you the weather by looking out because I couldn't see any sky. The room itself also needed considerable work. The glazing on the bathtub had worn away in large patches. Paint was chipping. The electrical outlets were almost inaccessible--in fact, one outlet was partially obstructed by the television panel so that only one of the two plugs could be used. And the heating/cooling was wonky. The room was freezing when I arrived and continued to be cold most of the night despite my attempts to adjust the thermostat. The next day the room stayed in the mid- to upper 70s even though I had the air set on 68. The air con was running. Constantly. But made no impact on the tiny space. The bed was uncomfortable as well. Besides being small, the pillows were so soft my head practically sank to the level of the mattress; they provided no support for my neck. Even though I used two (only two were provided). The staff was very friendly at check-in, however, and housekeeping was nice as well. And the location was good, just off Times Square. Still and all, I probably wouldn't stay there again unless they could promise me better accommodations considering how much I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location small room”
Reviews.Author: anjelcake
Reviews.Content: If you want a big room don't stay in a classic, if all you want to do is sleep and shower then go for this cheapest option. Despite the size of the room I can't praise this hotel enough, the location is fantastic for travelling around the city and for quick midnight shopping and snacks. The rooms are clean and well maintained, we may have just been lucky but we had a quiet room away from the lift. For people like me who love a cup of tea you can't do better than the little takeaway next door which is open all hours for soft drinks and best of all a slice of pizza-a cheap eating option. Times square isn't the best of places as it can be too crowded so get out of there as much as you can using the subway all lines are so close. My tips for places not to miss are Top of the Rock, the high line, staten island ferry, Brooklyn bridge, central park on a Sunday to see the roller skate disco and a row around the lake, there is so much to do for free. I would definitely stay here again, the staff are very helpful and courteous, as we have been to NYC numerous times we didn't need to ask any questions of the concierge but from what I overheard they were very knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Flawed but still satisfying stay”
Reviews.Author: aller et retour
Reviews.Content: There's no question that hotels in NYC are expensive, and if you want to stay somewhere near Times Square, the premium is incredibly high. Since I was traveling solo, I was able to book a Petit Room at the Paramount for an excellent price during the MLK holiday weekend. First of all, the location of this hotel is fantastic; within walking distance of all the sights in this part of town. The common areas are very chic without feeling overly pretentious. And while my room was tiny (to be expected in NYC), it contained everything one would need for a comfortable stay The main issue I had with my stay was that there were things that should have been fixed up but were not. From what I understand, the hotel has recently been renovated, and if that is the case, there is no excuse for some of the flaws I found - particularly in the bathroom. Chipped paint, watermarks, and sloppy tile work. This place has tons of potential, and if they would just go the extra mile to pay attention to some of these details, this place could be truly fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “this is a 2 star hotel /absolutely not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: dung t
Reviews.Content: The room is too tiny , no minibar , A/c too noisy and the bed is 200cm long X140cm wide for couple? the price absolutely not worth it! my room was about 290 per night

Reviews.Title: “Times Square in a legandary hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bryan_m11
Reviews.Content: This place might not be the place for everyone, it's in the chaos that is Times Square NYC. For that alone people may either love or hate this hotel. It is however a good solid place to stay with good service and everything that would be acceptable for NYC. The rooms are small, it's NYC after all but well decorated and include everything you need (though they could use a minibar). Ours had an extremely loud A/C unit but it's an old building and those sort of renovations don't happen so often. Also the water pressure was lacking for a hotel of that size. The beds are super comfortable and have lots of pillows and make you not want to leave. The hotel breakfast buffet was excellent, after eating there for 5 days it was still always a treat to have the food. The Strawberries and Melon were so fresh, they had a waffle maker and of course the all the usual breakfast stuff. The hotel staff was courteous and were always helpful. One must watch that if you have items delivered they charge a handling fee of $5 for each box. I'm not sure if this is a NYC thing or just the Paramount but I have had deliveries to other hotels and never paid this other then tipping the bellhop. They have free wifi in the lobby and restaurant but not in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: REMARAKI Posted by a Bookcyprus.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of my favorites in the heart of New York! I have stayed there many days. It is very clean, with polite staff and nice rooms. The only disadvantage is that the rooms are very small. The rates are fair. And the most important is that It is situated in the center of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Would shop around before booking”
Reviews.Author: Adam D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 3rd leg of our honeymoon. Location is great, right on Times Square, but that is about the only good point about this hotel. The lobby looks quite funky, and is dimly lit. It would feel chilled and relaxed if it wasnt chaotic every time you walk through it. The rooms are highly disappointing. (Ours at least - room 1540). It was tiny and incredibly noisy. Our air con unit was too noisy to have switched on, but even with it off, there was another noise that was probably other rooms' air con. There were also doors slamming all night. The bathroom was clean, but the shower was crap and when it eventually warmed up the pipes screeched. Also no tea/coffee facilities in the room, and drinks at the hotel were a bit of a rip off. I haven't stayed in another hotel in Manhatten so maybe this is how others are in the area, but if your only intention is to find a hotel in a great location, better to stay in a budget one and save your money as these rooms are surely no better. Certainly not 4 star standard, and not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: scotcharetti
Reviews.Content: First time in New York so location was perfect, right around corner from Times square- but certainly not noisy or disturbed by any noise.. We stayed for 4 nights as attending a wedding. Hotel - boutique style, very modern. Air conditioning in lobby fierce- freezing getting into lift! Our room was upgraded on arrival (?) and had already read reviews about tiny rooms so was prepared for the worse! Our room (410) wasn't as bad as expected! We had two Queen sized beds- we did sleep in individual beds to have more room each though (might not suit some!). As we were not in room for most of day it was certainly adequate. Another couple with us did get a tiny room though! Flat screen t.v and bathroom with bath & overhead shower. No view to speak of, but again i'd rather go out and look around! Did not eat in Hotel and bar prices within Hotel were expensive- but generally this is the case wherever you go. Hotel staff and concierge very helpful.- especially as hurricane was due to hit the weekend we were there ! (an unexpected extended stay due to all flights cancelled!) Plenty of bars & restaurants to suit all tastes within walking distance, Hells kitchen area provided a multitude of different cuisines. Huge selection of shows available- shop around for prices! Great value for money, would definitely stay there again (same sized room though please!). A travel guidebook to New York-very helpful to read in advance so you can plan your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Yakov72
Reviews.Content: For my 15th Anniversary, me and my wife stayed at the Paramount Hotel. It is great to be able to have a hotel room close to all the Times Square attractions and being able to go back, relax for a while and then continue visitig places. The room is really small, but nicely decorated. There isnlt much space for your luggage, but is good enough get a good night sleep and enjoy New York City

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SussexRotr
Reviews.Content: Hotel foyer was very 'boutique' decorated beautifully. Booked rooms late February early March and hotel confirmed we could all be on the same floor. This is not a cheap hotel consider upper 4 star. We were a party of 15. Arrived after a very long journey a little bit earlier than allowed to check in so rooms were not ready, said they should be ready approx. 4 pm (1 hour after official checking in time) but confimed that we may have to be split up into two parties so we would not all be on the same floor. When we arrived back to check in we found that each room that we had book had obviously been given to someone else as it transpired we were all on different floors! One of our party had been given a room with barely a double bed in it and was only offered another room when we complained, but this would not be until the next day!! So much for booking in advance. Drinks in the Hotel were extremely expensive $15 for 2 lemonades - even the receptionist bulked when we payed on departure. All in all not a family friendly hotel, looks nice in the reception area, but really the overall experience stops there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - great location, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Helen M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at the end of August for 7 nights - two of which I was travelling alone and 5 nights with a friend from home. Both of us had a great stay at the Paramount and would recommend it to anyone I know who is visiting New York for the first time. The room itself was rather small, but was nicely decorated and was kept extremely clean. The only thing I would say about the room is that there wasn't alot of wardrobe space, but other than that you have everything you need. The location is perfect for tourists - it's right on Times Square and there is easy access to various Metro stations, buses, and lots of attractions are within walking distance. Everyone who worked at the hotel was friendly, courteous and professional. The bar and restaurant staff were particularly welcoming - which was something I appreciated on my first two nights as I was a woman travelling on my own. The food and drink were a little on the pricey side, but both the bar and restaurant are very classy and stylish so it's what I would expect from an 'upmarket' establishment. All in all I had a great stay at the Paramount and would definitely return - the price may not be the cheapest hotel you can find, but you definitely get what you pay for in terms of location, style and experience. Helen and Andy, London, England.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: colin p
Reviews.Content: room was small but you dont need a big room in ny. room was nice and clean ensuite, wardrobe and free use of safe for valuables, was over there when hurricane irene hit so had to stay in room for safety,room was sufficient staff friendly no problems checking in or out, would definately use again on this experience

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: asrk89
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for one night. Check-in was very fast and efficient. Room was on the 19th floor. Previous reviews say that the rooms are very small; they are small but not cramped, ensuite bathroom and separate walk-in wardrobe with free safe. Very large TV. Room was very quiet with a nice view. Handy feature on each floor is weather information that lights up to let you know how to dress before you leave the hotel. Location was excellent, just off Times Square. A left luggage charge of $2 is applied if leaving bags in the hotel on day of check-out. Hotel is perfect for a short break to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carol9080
Reviews.Content: Having selected your hotel by chance, I am writing to express my gratitude and delight with our recent stay in your New York property. Our group was pleased, and perhaps somewhat astonished at the consistently excellent service we received. It's not that everything was fine during our visit: the battery was dead in our in-room safe, our shower head was broken, a mysterious large pile of dirty towels was deposited outside one of our rooms, etc. What was amazing was how quickly and efficiently these issues were resolved when brought to the attention of your staff! From the doorman to the front desk, concierge, housekeeping and even your engineers - all were courteous and accommodating. We had the good fortune to encounter a member of your staff, Crystal Grant, who went out of her way to assist us with room issues, suggestions for restaurants in New York, directions to attractions and who generally made us feel that the Paramount was our home away from home. Once again, thank you for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! Stunning...and the best location”
Reviews.Author: nellyweston
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Paramount Hotel late in the evening to be greeted by a very friendly doorman who welcomed us. The lobby is gorgeous, very welcoming opulent. Our room was beautiful, on the 9th floor with two double and planty of floor space, although it was a larger of the double doubles. We had a view over the front of the hotel and had no problem sleeping, yes air conditioning units are noisy but that is the nature of them. the beds are so comfortable and the pillows are just what you need after a long day in New York. The location is so close to times square, in fact we timed it, less than a minute walking . All the staff we came into contact with were very helpful and genuinely were concerned that we were comfortable. overall our stay at The Paramount was everything we could have wanted and much more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sara P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the paramount hotel with our young family (a 2 yr old and a 10 mth old) from Aug 18th - Aug 25th. We had a very early checkin of 3am. However we received the warmest, most welcome experience you could imagine. There was an expedia website issue where we were booked a smaller room. However the lovely lady and gentleman (sorry, can't recall their names) did not hesitate to not only upgrade us to a bigger room but also give us a king size SUITE for our first night which was awesome as we were very jet lagged coming all the way from Australia and needed such comfort. We were given a fridge immediately upon request and even given pots of boiled water during our stay for our baby needs. The staff went out of their way every time to meet our needs. I highly recommend this hotel to all families, couples, singles etc. The lobby music is absolutely AWESOME! The hotel location is the best. Very close to times square but away enough to get some quiet at the hotel. We also would like to give a personal thank you to the lovely Cheryl who we ran into at breakfast one morning outside the hotel. She was so warm, bubbly and friendly. It's for New Yorkers like Cheryl that visitors love coming back to this lovely city over and over. Thank you also for the lovely gift you sent for us in our room. The kids loved the fruit :) Beautiful City, beautiful People, beautiful Hotel. Will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Tobyyy
