Reviews.Content: We stayed in NYC for only 4 nights, so we didn't spend much time at the hotel. The rooms are fairly small, but clean, well equipped and completely sufficient for a short city getaway. The hotel's greatest asset sure is its location; just two minutes from Times Square, so no long journeys which take away your precious vacation time. We absolutely loved everything about the lobby; its design, the scent! If you don't want to spend a fortune on other NYC hotels and rather want a nice hotel with a great location, come here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly_scotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Paramount during a girly holiday to NYC. Excellent location so close to Time Square, but the room is very small and air conditioning noisy. Plus bar and restaurant quite expensive. Good value if all you want is a base but not very luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JulesVN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my 30th birthday. In my rating of the hotel they didn't have good they only had average or very good, so i went for average but it was actually good. The location is amazing and everything in New York is really easy to get to from the hotel. The rooms are very small but had plenty of room for me and my suitcase but my boyfriend would have liked a bit more room. The air con is quite noisy too but the room is very hot without it. The rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. The bar in the building tends to shut whenever it wants to though as we went to the one on the ground floor one night and it was closed so we went to the one on the second floor. The barman said to us that he was closing but we could go to the one on the ground floor which would definately be open!!!! Other than these things i enjoyed my stay there and would stay there again just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: TRACY S
Reviews.Content: I had an extremely postive experience at this hotel. It was beautiful and right in the heart of Times Square. When I checked in, there was a minor issue with the room and it was quickly resolved by the employee Nerma. She also upgraded us which was very nice. The room had a king size bed, flat screen tv and was a nice size. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Meg T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on August 18-19th with 3 of my friends. When we arrived at the hotel the outside of the building and the lobby were both very beautiful and clean, and we were very excited to see our room. Once we entered our room our spirits went way down!! Having viewed the pictures and read the room amenities we assumed that it would be a spacious, well equipted, beautiful room. The room was very tiny, and having 4 people it was very cramped. There was no room for us all to move around comfortably, we couldnt even move the small stained chair around. There was no fridge in our room so we had no way of keeping anything cool. The night before we stayed at a Quality Inn in New Jersey for 89.00 and it was far beyond in every way from the Paramount. Having gone on the trip with two past hotel employees of the Fermont, we figured that an upgrade or maybe a refund we be acceptable. However when we spoke to the employees behind the counter they couldnt have used the word no more!! No refund would be offered, its too bad we misunderstood their misleading pictues. While we were at the desk throughout the stay we constantly heard the same complaints. Would never stay at the is hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Donald B
Reviews.Content: I stay 2 to 3 times a year for business and have always had great service ...last week Nervea at the front desk was amazing. Thanks so much. d

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a brilliant location for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: Hurricane0000
Reviews.Content: The Paramount is impressive upon entrance to the foyer. Service is efficient and welcoming. There is a nice bar at the front for a quick drink before heading out, complete with friendly bar staff. Rooms are decent, if not on the small side - but this is NYC, its par for course. The biggest downside to the rooms is that the walls seem paper thin and a fair bit of noise travels from your neighbours' rooms, although really not a major issue in the greater scheme. The furnishings are decent but far from special however the room is still very pleasant to come back to after a long day of seeing NYC. Times Square is a stone's throw away making it an excellent hotel for its price. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for value in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “great valentine gift”
Reviews.Author: babyharlo
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel for my boyfriend for a surprise for valentines day ... first empression was its stunning not only that the location is fantastic ur right in the middle off times sq ...... we only ever had to get 1 taxi as i wanted to go to soho but u can walk anywhere in new york and enjoy the view .... am heading back next march for my 30th and staying in the paramount wouldnt stay any where else .....

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, but so clean & close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: irishjez98
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights while traveling for business and it was amazing. The room is seriously the size in the picture, you even have to sit sideways on the toilet due to the radiator, but it is so super clean! I'll take a small clean room over a bigger dirty one any day!! It is so close to Time Square and the theaters, the whole experience was amazing. The soap smelled nice, they check to make sure you have a room key before letting you in the hotel after 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic....dont let anyone tell you otherwise”
Reviews.Author: Joanne G
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weeks stay at the Paramount Hotel. (Couple late 20's) The Hotel itself is really nice, the lobby area is very funky with atmospheric lighting, funky tunes, comfortable seats & free wi fi access. The room that we had was a king size double.....as a result we had absolutely no issues with space or comfort - the room was modern with a large, very comfortable bed, flat screen tv mounted on the wall, fruit and water on arrival and plenty of space. The room was cleaned and towels replaced on a daily basis. The AC unit was noisey, but this was not an issue as we just cooled the room thoroughly before going to sleep, then left it off through the night. The location of this hotel is superb, times square literally left out of the hotel and 250 yards up the road. The staff were really helpful and anything that we queried or asked for was provided or dealt with. Overall we would definately recommend the Paramount Hotel.......we had a brilliant time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette B
Reviews.Content: The visit at Paramount Hotel started out with problem with the air condition, which was delt with immediately, the staff at the front desk(Nerma ) was very efficient. The room was clean tidy and comfortable. Tip: the concierge was helpful, they are there to help, Thanks Larry!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Stiggles
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel and amazing location. It is expensive but you get the service, comfort and access to all New Yorks sites! Myself and my mum stayed here and we were over the moon with the service and location. You get what you pay for! Lovely rooms with exstremly comfortable beds and very polite and helpful staff. I am planning to go here again this year and will be staying at this hotel again. I cant recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: Just a note to say that Nerma @ the front desk went above and beyond to assist me. Great stuff. SP Philadelphia

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: luckytravellar
Reviews.Content: max 2 adults per room, there is hardly enough room with luggage, otherwise good location for a short break. bar and restaurant poor

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Duncan M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at top hotels under virtually every brand in the business and I can say without hesitation that the service provided by the staff at the Paramount NYC was as good as it gets. They exceeded my expectations in several ways and I recommend them strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Great spur of the minute trip!!”
Reviews.Author: PMG
Reviews.Content: we accompanied our daughter who was on business & turned it into a 4 day holiday. The hotel was lovely - room small but clean, modern & very central - one min to Times Sq. Loved it & would definitely stay there again. The whole experience was everything and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: brantosl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I travelled to NYC and although it is hard to find affordable accommodations at all this hotel was reasonable and very close to everything. SHORT walk to Times square and subway, close to all theatre (Addams Family next door). I think the hotel has been fairly recently renovated. It's very modern and clean looking in all areas. Unfortunately no freebies (Wi-Fi, breakfast) but there are two computers in the lobby that will do the trick (or walk up to Starbucks/McDs nearby). The rooms are small but not cramped and the air conditioner made it delightfully cold after hot days of tired trekking across the big city. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand_Traveller_P
Reviews.Content: There no much more to say than the size of the rooms. The location is perfect close to times square, center of new york, close to subways. The bar is good, the lobby is a little bit dark, the staff is alright, but you can finde better places nearby, with bigger rooms, same service quality. For me, never more!

Reviews.Title: “Good location- small rooms”
Reviews.Author: emmamarie22
Reviews.Content: Booked into the paramount as a group for a wedding. The staff are v helpful. But be advised the price reflects the location not the rooms. We had a double booked and it was tiny!! Managed to upgrade to queen which was much better. US doubles are not the same as UK. if you are doing a normal NY visit where u spend no time in the room it's great, but if you book as you are wanting some luxury it's not the best. The lobby has free wifi, and looks amazing. The bar is very expensive, but there are loads of other bars close by. I recommend turning right out if the hotel walking in the opposite direction to time sq the next block over has loads of great restaurants and bars. Room do have a hairdryer, mirror is on bathroom door so it's hard if you want to use it and someone wants to come out if the bathroom. I would not recommend sharing if you are going with someone who you don't know. To sum this place up for me. Nothing wrong with it, but stayed in low cost good location hotels before (check out the pod hotel) but thought I would be getting luxury this time.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveller1300
Reviews.Content: I am a native New Yorker and I make several weekend trips to NYC each year to see family/go to broadway etc.. I stayed at the Paramount for the first time in August 2011. Paid almost $600 for two nights here for a double bed "superior" room. The room was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. The door practically hit the first bed when we entered the room, and the second bed was smack up against the far wall with about a foot in between the two beds. There was maybe 3 feet of space between the foot of the beds and the TV on the wall which did not work. The bathroom was tiny with no counter or storage space, and the room was right across from the noisy elevator. No dresser for clothes - just a half closet with two hangers and one draw under the safe. I requested a room change because, 1. TV was broken, 2. Tiny room for almost $300 a night and, 3. Didn't want to stay next to the elevator to hear drunks outside my door at all hours of the night. At first I was told there were no other 2 double bed rooms, and that my room was actually "large" for the hotel. Was then "upgraded" to a room with a king bed which meant my daughter and I would have to share the bed. Agreed to the change and at least the room was a little bigger and the bed wasn't smack up against the door. Closet was a full closet with 2 drawers instead of one, but still no dresser and the bathroom was as small as the first. Bed not very comfortable. On the positive side, the rooms were clean and the hotel was pretty quiet, and for the weekend it was okay. Staff was friendly and did their best to accomodate. Couldn't imagine staying for a whole week though. I would be okay with the small rooms if I paid under $200 a night. I know this is Times Square, but there is only so much I will pay for the location if the room quality doesn't match. This was the most I ever paid for a room in NYC and it was by far the smallest room I ever stayed in. I think the prices were elevated in all the hotels this weekend because the triathlon was in town. Not cool.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Shmancy...”
Reviews.Author: vkusnashka25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located one block away from Times square which means that you are in the middle of all the action but you don't have to suffer with all the noise in the wee hours of the night. If you get a room higher than the 7th or 8th floor, then you won't hear a thing. Rooms are tiny, as to be expected in NYC. We were upgraded from a Queen to a King Room and the place was still tiny. The hotel itself is very nice. The breakfast buffet was comped because we were a wedding couple, bride and groom to be exact, and it was very yummy. Not the biggest selection, but good quality stuff. I was stuffed afterwards. Although get there early as space in the restaurant is limited. We got a seat at the bar. Is it expensive, yes! Was it worth it? Ehh, we chose the hotel due to the nice interior and we needed to take wedding pictures. From a local's personal opinion, if you stay anywhere in NYC that is close to a subway (try not to be any higher than 85th street-Metropolitan Museum) than you are in a good location. You aren't winning much by staying in Times Square. Hotel seemed clean-didn't see any bedbugs. Toiletries provided were nice too :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drenfro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and have zero complaints! The hotel is beautiful and spotless! Our room was perfect and the staff were so helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “upgraded us for free”
Reviews.Author: bieber99
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the paramount with our 9 month old son, not knowin that the room we booked on the internet was to small for two adults and a baby. the very freindly guy at reception upgraded us for free to a larger room! very nice! the room was clean and they delivered us a baby bed right away. housekeeping staff, doormen everybody was superfriendly! i would defenitely recommend the paramount!

Reviews.Title: “Let down”
Reviews.Author: brendonaustin
Reviews.Content: Checked in Saturday 30th July ,had booked and PRE PAID a double room.On check in I was advised none were available and I had to take a single.Complained but they simply were sold out.Slept on a pencil bed bowed like a bananna.Have had a sore back scince.Upgraded to a Queen next night but didnt want an upgarde , just wanted what i book and paid for.They expected a thanks for the upgrade at checkout but didnt get one.Hotel is tired.Shower tiles were cracked and broken,trimming in bathroom rotted and broken away,no fridge in room.Wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: heliex
Reviews.Content: Do very good service and reliable staff very comfortable bed the location is the best in new york. you can walk to anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Treated sooooo well !!!”
Reviews.Author: mleotta1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paramount on a Sunday night, my first time staying over in NYC. Great front desk staff, So cool lobby and a fantastic breakfast buffet. Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “Loving it (still here) - I don't understand the negative reviews...”
Reviews.Author: kmbrown999
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old son and I checked in 3 days ago and are spending the rest of the week here, as he attends a Broadway Intensive workshop, and I mostly spend my days in the hotel working remotely from my office. WHAT A GREAT HOTEL... It is literally a 30 second walk to the heart of Times Square, yet because it is on a "side" street (46th), and midway between Broadway and 8th, is reasonably quiet inside. We're on the 7th floor, facing 46th street and pretty quiet except for just the loudest noises. The room is not huge, but it's not tiny. It is WAY larger than some rooms I've stayed in Paris and London. We have a Double-Double. Two separate double beds, and there is more than enough room for us, our gear, plenty of space (4-5 feet) between the beds and more around the room. There is no excess space and all the space is really wisely used. Our two duffel bags sit easily out of our way, but on the floor against the outer walls of the room. that's what I mean by no excess space. There is no room in the closet or under a rack or anything like that to put the bags, but we don't really need it or care. There is even a corner chair and reading lamp in here. A good 5-6 feet between the bottom end of the bed and the wall. Really just enough space, but not sprawling. The beds are GREAT - very comfortable mattresses and excellent pillows. The windows provide decent soundproofing. Hear very little outside traffic noises. There are double window shades - blackout shades and filtered light shades, or both can be up. The window even opens if you really want to do that. The Bathroom is comfortable in size, with a shower/tub, and nicely appointed. Two shelves for our stuff. Once again, space is wisely used... There is about a 6 inch space behind the bathroom mirror that holds our towels - before we use them of course. There is plenty of hanging space for wet towels. The rolling "desk/table" in the room is excellent. It's about 4 feet long and 15" deep, and can be rolled anywhere. I have it positioned now along the side of the desk and it is holding two laptops for me. Just the correct height for typing. I do not understand all the fuss people have made in the reviews about this lack of a "formal" desk. This is great, because I have it positioned EXACTLY where I want it, alongside the bed, looking out the window. When I'm not using it for this, I roll it against the wall and we use it to hold other stuff until I need to use it again as a desk. The closet has space for hanging things, two medium/large size drawers, a safe, and an iron and board. Once again, not a huge space, but pretty much just right for the two of us. The front desk staff were excellent. Check in wait was a bit long, but when it got to be my turn I saw why - very friendly, chatty, and focus on customer service. My package includes WIFI (which works very well in the room) and the "American Breakfast" which is also excellent, and served in a very comfortable and stylish 2nd floor restaurant. I had one problem with the A/C being kind of loud and not controlling correctly. The engineering staff came right up, cleaned out the filters, and everything worked fine after that. If you want a double-double (two separate beds), call the hotel yourself and ask for the "larger double double". I understand that there is another type of room for this bed configuration that's slightly smaller. Suggest that you don't just use expedia or some other service to make the reservation - do it yourself, the old fashioned way, to get what you want. Location as I've mentioned is excellent - 30 seconds from all the action !! I will definitely come back. I've posted some photos. Room, looking in from the door. The Bathroom. The Rolling desk set up for me to work on.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: codyandco
Reviews.Content: This hotel in just a stones throw from Times Square. Beautiful reception area and staff very helpful. Rooms clean but on small side. Corridors dark and grey, looked a bit like a prison block!

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: G4L
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Niagara Falls Canada to NYC (by train took 9hrs) and stayed in the Paramount hotel for 4nights Friday to Tuesday in July 2011. We arrived at 1pm but couldnt check in until 3pm therefore the hotel took our bags so we could go out exploring. It was a heatwave in NYC and very humid, but still managed to walk all the way to the Empire State Building (and up 6flights of stairs). The hotel is in a great location, just off Times Square, and Broadway. The lobby is very funky, dark and inviting. Staff are all very friendly. Food and drinks are VERY expensive in the hotel, but both times we ate there, we were impressed. There was a big whoops by the hotel staff on our 2nd day which involved them removing all our stuff from our room, including all our personal belongings from the safe (passports, money, keys etc) to cut the story short, we got all our stuff back, but it was human error by the hotel as they had accidentally linked us to another party who were checking out. We were refunded one night stay, and also given a free dinner on our last night. Rooms are small in this hotel, but it was fine for the 2 of us. The rooms are comfortable, quite modern, big TV and lots of channels to choose from.We were on the 10th floor and hardly heard any noise from outside. The guests next door were annoying but that wasnt the hotel's fault. We visited the statue of liberty, 5th avenue, central park, empire state building, ground zero and times square.. Lots of taxi's going round, but during rush hour 3 - 7pm, none wanted to go near Times Square. We recommend getting a subway pass, or a sightseeing bus pass. That way, you have options for getting around and getting back to the hotel. The subway station is 4blocks from the hotel - 10minute walk. We were going back up to Canada, and got the Newark airport express bus from Bryant Park for 15dollars each. Drop you right outside the terminal in 30minutes. Take plenty money, NYC is expensive, but its worth it.We had an amazing time! Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: supershark01
Reviews.Content: room good friendly staff no facilities eg kettle fridge tea facilities just beds and bathroom . getting about was easy from this hotel using busus and subway when we arrived in new york. we got the airtrain then on to the subway you pay $5 on airtrain and $39 for metro card which you have for seven days to use on the subway and bus we got subway to w50th street and walked 4 blocks to hotel about 5/10 minutes. coffee in the morning was from starbucks plenty of places to eat. places to visit empire state building . ellis island .liberty island.central park . maceys department store you get out of town discount of 10% on you total spend

Reviews.Title: “THINGS NOT TO DO URGENT”
Reviews.Author: a-murphy323
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Paramount, Times Sq, New York. Though this hotel is nice, and has been recently refurbished, it is not for a family. The room was clean but not suitable for 3 adults, though one being 15 years. DON'T - buy muscial tickets from the hotel, WHAT A RIP OFF>. They will tell you that you won't get tickets that you can sit together, they tell you they are going through a broker, what they don't tell you is, the customer services are also taking a cut and the cost is 100% on top of the cost of the ticket. Go to the threate ticket office on Times sq. Do go and see a show, might not be your thing at home but, Sister Act is amazing. DON'T - use the hotel cars. They charge you a arm and leg, and talk you out of using the Yellow cabs, sometimes double , the doorman will tell the cost is down to tolls and extra for paying by visa or mastercard. They are on a commision to get you to use their cars. RESTAUANTS - check if service charge is included on your bill, if it is not, your recipt will have a place to write what tip you want to leave. If you don't want to leave a tip, put a line through this part or you will find a amount could be added later, without your knowledge. THIS DOES HAPPEN.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location. Small room.”
Reviews.Author: HeidiNath
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great location for Times Square and the bus stops for the down town and up town bus tours. This was our honeymoon and lucky for us we were upgraded to the next room size. I dread to think what the smaller rooms were like as this was very small. There was one draw in the room that was useable. The wardrobe had two draws in there that were not able to open as they got caught on the door hinge so only opened a few inches. The wardrobe was only about a foot wide so we couldn't fit many clothes in and the useless draws were at the bottom. There was air conditioning but this was terrible and the humidity in New York is very high so you can not have a windo open. There was some mould on the grout in the bathroom. There was not any shelves for bathroom items so we had to keep everything on the floor. There was just enough space on the sink for the toothbrushes. The Hotel was very dark when we arrived but you do get used to it after a while. The maid comes in everyday to clean so that is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel for both business and vacation travellers”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveller20001
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms (NYC standard - small but efficient), great lobby and great location. Stayed for a work trip and would love to come back for vacation when I have more time to enjoy everything the hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel - Ideal situation”
Reviews.Author: bettyboop013
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Paramount Hotel for one week in July and it was a comfortable hotel in a central position for all attractions. The receptionists were efficient and polite both checking in and out and the rooms were cleaned daily with lovely towels and toiltriesw supplied and bedding changed daily. We were allocated a Broadway Standard room which was small but once everything was packed away it was adequate and you do not sit in a hotel room in New York. The gym was available to all guests f.o.c. and the bar and restaurant comfortable with prices similar to other N.Y. hotels. Another plus was that a digital safe was supplied in each room f.o.c. Like other N.Y. Hotels they use eco lighting which makes reading difficult in the lounges unless you are sitting next to a table lamp, but the lifts were quick and numerous. All in all. we would return to this hotel on another trip to New York anbd wouldnot hesitate to recommend it as good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: MrAndMrsB85
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paramount Times Square for our honeymoon, its a fantastic hotel, very stylish, modern, clean and friendly and only a stones throw away from Times Square. It will be our first choice hotel when we return to NY!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travellerkez
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, beautiful lobby/bar areas...small but lovely rooms. We would definitely stay here again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Dejan13
Reviews.Content: If you find a smart price is very good value for money! Quite good overall!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic perfect hotel in a wonderful location!!”
Reviews.Author: 2011EmmaH
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Paramount Times Square. We had a king size deluxe room. The room provided us with lots of space it was clean and really stylish. The hotel itself had a very modern trendy feel and played great music in the lobby. PERFECT location right in the heart of times square so easy to get anywhere. We picked a week where temperatures were at a record high but the air conditioning in our room was perfect and I was so grateful that it worked so well. Staff were really attentive and nothing was too much trouble. So helpful and full of advice. I love the Dean and Deluca Deli by the lobby such a good touch and perfect for a morning coffee. Rooms were cleaned every day, the bar was really cool and stylish for a drink and the food menu was brilliant aswell, I will definitely be booking my stay at the Paramount again in the near future. Perfect for a New York get away if you want to be central and stay somewhere clean and stylish with great and helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good location ,very dark lobby”
Reviews.Author: NancybellFalkirk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right at times square so it's really handy for if you want to" be in the heartt of it". The rooms are very small with tiny bathrooms. We were only there for the weekend so didn't matter.Tthe hotel lobby has very subdued lighting as do the corridors so gives a very gloomy atmosphere. This is a very busy hotel so be careful when checking out . We had two rooms for which we had prepaid but on our departure recieved invoices for both rooms.My husband went to reception to tell them we had paid. they told us to ignore the invoice. We thought that was things taken care of but my son did not go to reception thinking things wer sorted as it was me and my husband who had paid for both rooms, unfortunately when we got home we realised that they had charged us for the other room. . After a lot of e-mails and phones call our travel agent did get our money back. If we went back to NY would probably stay nearer to Central Park

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Frillypants
Reviews.Content: My husband brought me here at christmas for my 30th birthday present. Couldn't be better for location, 2 min walk and you're standing in the middle of Times Square. Stunning lobby, room pretty good but lacking the same wow factor. It was FREEZING when we were here and the heating didn't seem to be working, a maintenance guy did come and fix it but took ages to turn up. Otherwise our newly decorated room was small but lovely and very modern. We had to pay a huge deposit when we checked in- we did get it back but I didn't think this was a particularly welcoming start to our stay and not for those on a tight budget. Staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. Don't buy show tickets from the hotel booth- way cheaper to get them from the discount machines in Times Square- well worth the queue. All in all a nice hotel but it's best feature is it's location.

Reviews.Title: “a stylish Manhattan stalwart”
Reviews.Author: lytteltonbrando
Reviews.Content: I have been veering between upper east side B+Bs and The Paramount for over 10yrs. The latter is a reasonably-priced haven for mid-town Manhattan style and ease on a host of levels, with a wonderful breakfast thrown in for a few extra dollars @ booking. Design-led interiors are of a high standard, however space is not at a premium - so the venerable Paramount is the perfect start spot for those who want to experience NYC with all it has to offer - fortified at the start of each day with that very fine breakfast! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, nice people”
Reviews.Author: islandb8by
Reviews.Content: We were in New York for just one night, so all we wanted was somewhere decent to lay our heads at night and shower. My cousin found this hotel online. Considering almost every other hotel we looked at was booked, we chose the Paramount. I booked online and we had no problems checking in early. The room wasn't bad at all. Sure it was small, but with 2 double beds between 4 people (we obviously shared), it worked out just fine. I've heard of some places where just walking inside the hotel room was a nightmare. There was plenty of room for us to move about. The bathroom was fine too. The layout was fine. No complaints, except the shower handle broke when my husband went to turn it off (he was the last one to shower, hence, the only one to have this problem). He was able to shut the shower off, but freaked out a little when the handle came off. No one expects that! Oh and the elevators took FOREVER. Luckily we weren't in a hurry. When we checked out the next day, we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel for the cost of $2 per bag (I think). That seemed reasonable. We also only had one bag between the 4 of us, so the cost was no big deal. I'd stay here again. Right next door (attached to the hotel) is Dean & Deluca, which was convenient for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “won't go back...”
Reviews.Author: igormaximun
Reviews.Content: I was offer atrip for my Bday, 2 nights, what a disappointment. room are very small, but in NY everything is small. But bathroom need to be redone, The door couldn't close, the vent didn't work, the switch for the light was not always working...! A friend of mine had delivered me a bottle of champagne, no glass in the room, and when I ask for glasses it was charged !!! We checked out on tuesday morning, we wanted to leave our luggages, before we left, we got charged for that too. Parking at the hotel costed as much as the room...wi-fi in the lobby never worked... Too expensive for what you get , staff not really friendly. I really don't recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: rockinjenkins16
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights and I loved it. It was in the perfect location as I wanted to be in Times Sqaure and it was worth every penny. The staff are really and helpful. The rooms are clean, might be a little small for some people but it was base - it has a safe, iron, ironing board, hairdryer, mirror, wardrobe so at least it has everything you need. We had breakfast for 2 days we were there and it was lovely - you cant go wrong. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and If I visit NY again, i'll will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Eratolin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week in the begining of July as a vacation. The location is great, very close to the Time Square and all other theaters. The room is clean but very small. We booked a double bed room but the bed is only 120cm wide; for a week both of us had to sleep straight every night and felt tired and unrelaxed in the mornings. And since the room was so small, the aircon is just next to the bed. Every night it's a hard decision for us - it's too warm if we turned the aircon off, but it's too cold and too noisy if we let it on. The bathroom was clean; I have nothing against it, but the shower was somehow "strange" - water came out either from the lower tap or from both the lower tap and the higher shower head. By this I think we wasted alit water everytime when we showered but we had no way to fix it. Overall, it's still an OK hotel, but do expect too much as other 4/5 stars hotel. (I would still recommend this hotel to a friend for a short stay or for a single)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: alaska67
Reviews.Content: Our compliments to Leonardo, receptionist , he delivered a fantastic service. W.E. van der Sluis, from Holland

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and location to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: mdlegend
Reviews.Content: We have been here twice before and love the location. Sure, the rooms are small, but it is a hotel in Manhattan, what do you want, a palace.... If you want a place for a couple or two close friends to just sleep in a nice, safe, conveinent hotel, with great music and atmosphere, this is the place. If you want to pay $500 atbthe Marriott, I have been their across the street as well, then get a bigger room with no problem. Overall this is a great hotel, great door men, great that they store your luggage upon checkout for $2 a bag. E have never been tom the bar they have, but it sounds like a good time. We will be back. Mike D from Delaware July 22 2011 is when we stayed...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EdsonNYC
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at, the location couldn't get much better, right amongst Times Square and the Theatres. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are very modern and clean. Will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Stangerang
Reviews.Content: Hotel was amazing. Great location (1 block off Times Square). GREAT VALUE! Amazing Pizza place next door…close to everything. We took the train from the Airport and walked 6-7 blocks from the train station to the hotel. The rooms are small, so are the bathrooms so this is NOT for everyone (What do you expect in NYC, something huge?)… Mostly young couples, etc. Very retro, but new. The bathroom was not very clean (shower/tub) that was our only concern.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Nanc1202
Reviews.Content: The paramount Hotel combines the best of the past and the present. The facade is a tribute to the early days of the hotel, with ornate details. The interior is sleek and chic, yet suprisingly warm. Candlelight fills the lobby, which has comfortable and sylish seating. The staff is friendly and helpful. The accomodations are well priced for New York City. The rooms have comfy bedding and well utilized bathroom space. They are absolutely immaculate. Should you enjoy the breakfast at the mezzanine level restaurant, you will find a variety of healthy options as well as your standard favorites. We had cocktails at the bar-quite the hip place. Try the signature "paramount" cocktail should you want to imbibe- it was delicious. You really can't go wrong if you book this hotel- they go out of their way to make sure the guests are well taken care of. If I were traveling to NYC for any reason this is the only place I would stay! Feel free to e mail me at Nanc1202 if you want any other info!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for a Great City Break”
Reviews.Author: chestercherry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this perfectly located hotel for four nights at the start of our honeymoon.Yes,the room and bed were small but we did not take a cat with us so there was no need to swing one. The room was very clean, the staff very helpful and polite.This hotel is all about location, we stayed on the eighth floor and within 120 seconds of leaving the room we were walking into Time Square. The hop on/off tour bus had a stop a 3 min walk away and restaurant row and the gateway to hell's kitchen was only 5 mins away.The Library bar on the Mezzanine level was a cool place to either start or end a night out and Andrew the bar man certainly knew how to make some potent cocktails.Overall,we both reallyenjoyed our stay at the Paramount and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good with some minor negatives.”
Reviews.Author: gabbag17
Reviews.Content: Good location, very clean, excellent service from all staff. We had to pay for WIFI which cost us about $24 for three days PER DEVICE! Also there was only one bedside table & lamp which was surprisingly annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. would stay again AAAAAA”
Reviews.Author: cassdj971
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Jan 8th 2011. the room wasnt massive but had enough space for what we needed. the bath room was very clean and fittings were new. the service in the hotel was great so too were the bar areas. its just off time square n so great for sight seeing. the rooms were also quiet when you went to sleep. all in all a good hotel. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: ElenaMaslova
Reviews.Content: Cosy and comfortable hotel situated in the heart of New York. One can choose either to go to the Broadway show next door or to enjoy the view of the Times Square. The rooms are clean, well-equipped and the beds are very comfortable and soft. Though the price is reasonable and not very high.

Reviews.Title: “I have faith in hotels again”
Reviews.Author: Sade060
Reviews.Content: The past hotels I’ve stayed in were horrible experiences. This hotel made up for everything! The hotel is absolutely beautiful! The rooms and lobby décor make one not want to go home. I had a very busy day and as soon as I checked in all worries were gone. Every employee I came in contact with had such great customer service. I wish I was able to get everyone’s name, but I was only able to get a couple. Her name was Crystar I believe and she is a gem! She was so nice and polite. She held great conversation with us and most importantly made us feel so welcoming. She is a great star in this hotel team. I also had the pleasure of dealing with Ms. Brown. She was in the lobby and took great care of her team and guest. She is another gem in the hotel. She made sure my hotel experience was more then I could ask for. She made me and everyone feel so special as I watched her interact with her guest. I would love to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amidst the lights of Broadway!”
Reviews.Author: BostonRudy60745
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel is a breeze. No worries that this is busy middle of Times Square. As we pulled in the doorman approached us right away, gave us a valet ticket and asked if we needed assistance with luggage. The beds are comfortable, amenities are deluxe. My daughter and her friend liked the weather conditions alert by the elevators. The location is so ideal - walk to all Times Square entertainment, then a few steps away is restaurant row on 46th or choose the many restaurants on 9th Avenue. Checking out is fast, valet ticket stamped at the Front Desk, give it to the doorman, the valet brings your car over. Pick this hotel for a NYC weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Free condom and Mardi-gras beads... good tourist location though”
Reviews.Author: mytsigns
Reviews.Content: Needed to stay here on a sudden business trip. The room was TINY! I mean comical tiny. When I did my usual bedbug check (no evidence of those things) I was rewarded with a complimentary (unwrapped) condom and mardi-gras beads on the floor under the headboard. The room was not dirty per se, but my guess is it is tough for housekeeping to wedge into the room with a vacuum. Seriously maybe 7ft x 10 ft. Howling A/C. Was not able to change rooms. There is an ironing board hanging in the 'closet', but beats me how you could set it up. Maybe just lay it in the bed. The location is Times Square, so if that is the NYC you wish to visit, this hotel will put you there. Parked at an Icon garage using a coupon from their site. I lived in NYC through the 70s-90s. I have been in some truly stinko NYC hotels. The Paramount is NOT disgusting/awful, but there are many affordable alternatives that are better than this one. Perhaps requesting a 'normal sized' room at booking would make for a better stay, I don't know, and don't plan on finding out.

Reviews.Title: “Been Staying At The Paramount Since 1996”
Reviews.Author: DreamJobGuy
Reviews.Content: The Paramount was cutting edge in the early 90's. Although there are now a TON of "uber-hip" hotels in NYC vs. the ol stodgy ones that existing back when I started staying at The Paramount in the mid-90's, it is still holding its own. It has had several more renovations since the early 90's and you still can't beat it for its ease and convenience. As long as they keep doing what they're doing, the hotel will forever be my home-away-from-home when in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Orlatron
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location (about 50m from Times Square). It has a very impressive lobby and the exterior of the hotel is well maintained and attractive. Excellent proximity to Broadway shows. I had a Broadway Petite room, which was small but comfortable (The website does specify that the rooms are small so this was definitely not unexpected!). My only complaint is that the room was quite noisy. The air conditioner was so ridiculously noisy I had to have it turned off whenever I was in the room (In July!), and I could also hear the A/C from adjacent rooms. There was also what sounded like an exhaust valve going off outside my window about every 20 minutes 24/7. Nonetheless, I did manage to sleep, the room was good value for money and the staff were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nicely decorated but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: angysta
Reviews.Content: 100 meters away from Times Square, the location is just amazing! Well, our room was very small (that's probably due to its price, I found a great offer for a standard room, otherwise it's really expensive), around 10 square meters or less. The air conditioning was working but really noisy and didn't really cool the room down. We were on the last floor. I think it was 19th and when looking out of the window we could only see another building just about 2 meters from ours. Otherwise the hotel itsself is decorated in a modern style, very nice. I can't say anything about the bar or restaurant we didn't try them. But the staff is very kind, too.

Reviews.Title: “Native New Yorker vacations in city after 15 years living out of state.”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie23
Reviews.Content: Each visit I take to NYC is always visiting family and staying at their homes. This visit though we stayed at the Paramount. It was absolutely wonderful. Not one complaint! Convenient to everything the Big Apple has to offer. All my needs were taken care of efficiently, pleasantly and made me feel like I was there only guest that day! I can’t wait to go back and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great - But Cramped!”
Reviews.Author: rochbound
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Paramount many times over the years, but this was the first time back in a few years. Even though it was never bad, the customer service is 1000% better than it was a few years back and the staff is outgoing and friendly (evidently the cool and aloof persona from years back wasn't doing it). The food was great, the room was great (but yes it is small) but the bed is very comfortable and everything is so clean and crisp - love it. My only 2 criticisms is 1) the toilet is so close to the wall it makes the morning ritual both adventurous and challenging and 2) the drawers in my clothes wardrobe didn't open because the hinges from the wardrobe door stop them. I usually don't mention people, but I have to say, Leonardo and ESPECIALLY Nathalie went out of their way to help me. She checked me in and took a personal interest in my stay and my comfort for all four days I was there. At checkout there was a mistake on my bill (charged several times for internet). BEFORE I could catch it, Nathalie called up to my room and said she noticed it and was making an adjustment. That has NEVER happened to me before. Leonardo seemed to always be there with a quick hand if I needed help with luggage or maneuvering around the lobby, etc. But not just those two, everyone on the staff was friendly, helpful and took a personal interest in my happiness. What a refreshing change from the usual sullen staff I have had to deal with in my travels. It was so nice, that I don't care if I have a hole instead of a toilet in the bathroom, I will stay at Paramount again. Also, location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “It's my only hotel address in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: jzslavin
Reviews.Content: Have been a regular guest at the Paramount since it opened several decades ago ... and I must say it only gets better and better. Unique accomodations, attention to detail and excellent staff make my stays there pleasant always.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MACOLEMAN0
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a long weekend at the Paramount Hotel in Time Square. As a native New Yorker, I was skeptical of staying in Time Square and was not familiar with the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised on both accounts. The hotel has incredibly helpful staff from the front door to the library restaurant at breakfast; our every need was catered to. The room was comfortable, clean and open. Time Square itself is very safe and vibrant! It is so much like a European Piazza than I could have imagined. I would return to this property without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Serendipitous!”
Reviews.Author: ruthieb123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. We were very pleased with the whole stay! The reception staff was helpful and courteous, the housekeeping excellent. The location was perfect; we were in walking distance to everything; great restaurants on 46th between 8th and 9th, close subway entrances, theaters, Central Park...such a convenient place to stay ! After reading previous reviews, I was skeptical of what we might find upon check-in. Our room was very clean and neat; we had a spacious room with a full bed; absolutely no issue with walking around the bed. This was our first time in NYC and we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Location good hotel below average”
Reviews.Author: thelobbsters
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Paramount at midday to be told that our room would not be ready until 3pm; we booked in and were told that my credit card was required in case we incurred any charges for 'incidentals'. We left our luggage and started sightseeing. As we had been travelling for nearly 12 hours we were looking forward to a shower and change of clothes we returned at 2.30pm to be told our room was still not ready but could be allocated another one, which we accepted. The room was on the 4th floor and contained 2 double beds and from other reviews I think we got a good deal because it did seem cramped compared to what we have been used to in Europe. At night we found the room noisy, with people leaving the theatres and car park opposite and then the rubbish bins being emptied at 3am. The lobby was cool and well lit but the corridors and lifts were poorly lit making it difficult to see which buttons you were pressing. The majority of staff were helpful, some were rude and unhelpful, even the manager could not be bothered to answer a sent email to check when my incidental deposit would be returned. I was charged $13.95 for using the internet, which was separate from the $75 charge for 'incidentals'. On the day of our departure we rang the front desk for help to get our bags to the front door, after 45minutes we had to struggle down ourselves otherwise would have missed our taxi to the airport. After waiting another 15 minutes we checked to see where the taxi was, and was told by hotel staff that we had not booked one, we showed him the receipt and eventually one arrived. The $75 refund to credit card did not appear on the card for 13 days, although I was told it would take 2 days and after further phone calls was eventually told it would take 5-10 days. Our visit to New York was ruined by the unfortunate thunderstorms, which nobody could have controlled. The location of the hotel was good, only 3 minutes from Times Square. The Paramount was certainly unforgettable, we would certainly like to forget the experience, especially in a 4 star rated hotel and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: SCTraveler70
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room and found the room to be just fine. The location is fabulous and compared to other hotels in the same few blocks, the price was unreal! A nice little find which I will use often until everyone discovers it and the prices spike!

Reviews.Title: “Teeny Tiny”
Reviews.Author: elizcaz
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tooo small to even breath; air conditioning was not working. Location was great. Breakfast in morning was great.

Reviews.Title: “First stay but not my last...”
Reviews.Author: cniemec926
Reviews.Content: As far as NYC hotels, this was a great value at $233. per night. I have yet to see a hotel in the middle of Times Square with the style and comfort of the Paramount for less than $300. per night! The food is pricey but very good and the atmosphere of the bar is excellent! I was there for business but I got the double-joy of seeing David Cook perform right in the lobby for his CD release! : ) I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: vikkir5
Reviews.Content: from the second we stepped up to the front door the staff couldn't do enough to help. we were made to feel so welcome. the hotel is beautiful and we got free cocktails :) the rooms are a decent size and the concierge were all fabulous, really helped us a lot

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stacat
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for location in New York this is the place to go....you are within 3 minutes walking distance to Times Square. The rooms were spotlessly clean with everything you need for a city break. However the rooms are tiny and it lucky you dont spend that much time in them as cabin fever would set in. The conserige was brilliant, nothing was too much to ask. Hotel is very chic and modern and all in all we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: nan239
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located on Times Square!!!! Very small room. Weird smell on bed sheets! very good housekeeping service every day though. I mentioned it was our wedding anniversary upon the reservation online and that we needed high floor. They noticed the high floor request but no one said anything about our wedding anniversary, just thought it would have been nice! We were happy we had our room upon our check in before 3 pm. That's appreciated. Concierge staff are helpful. But they mentioned we couldn't buy the Hop on Hop off tickets on the bus directly and had to buy them at the hotel which was not correct. They sold us the Broadway show tickets at a ridiculous price while it was half the price at The Minskoff theatre or app. same price if we had Premium seats! Same thing for the comedy club tickets! We wanted to book with the concierge as for sure it is easier than buying directly on site and to have experts’ recommendations which were for both tickets appreciated. Larry the concierge was very helpful. But if we knew the price will be that expensive we would have definitely bought them at the theater directly. I work in the hospitality industry and from experience, I know that the rate should not be very different between the concierge of the hotel and the tour/theater etc. as the commission would be already included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Ameliaj1388
Reviews.Content: The paramount is in the most amazing spot - so convenient! The rooms are modern and comfortable, but very compact. The lobby is beautiful and the restaurant serves tasty and well priced food. The only downside is the incredibly poor service. The reception staff ignored me initially and when they finally spoke to me they did not listen and constantly interrupted me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: olovo
Reviews.Content: If you are a lover of European style hotels this is the one for you, this hotel gives you great service, youth oriented atmosphere, affordable rates and location, location location.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Snubb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend on a typical site seeing/shopping trip of New York. Rooms were well appointed and I was very pleased to see a (deep and full length) bath in our room. We did not use the restaurant or bar at all as we wanted to explore the city. All of the staff we encountered were polite and pleasant. Fab location. My only criticism would be the doors are very heavy so I was woken up each morning. Tip to anyone staying in this hotel- come out of the entrance and turn RIGHT- this takes you to Restaurant Row where food is incredibly cheap, do not buy food from Times Square as it is very overpriced. Would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: darrencrouch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paramount in January for 3 nights with my girlfriend on a shopping trip from England.. The hotel is very modern and is just off Times Square so is excellent as a central base for people visiting NY. We didn't eat at the hotel as the choice is vast all around Times Square.. Staff were friendly and the check in was fast.. Rooms are on the small side but there is so much to do that it was just a place to sleep.... Highly recommend this hotel for people on a short trip to NY

Reviews.Title: “Great location not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Naomi198
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the paramount whilst On our honeymoon this month, before arrival my husband called stating he wanted to make the stay special and asked for a upgraded room etc. On arrival we were told we had an upgraded queen room but had to wait till 3 as room wasn't ready. We waited for our room an hour but thought it would be worth the wait. We were very disappointed with our room we were on the 17 th floor and the lifts are very creaky and shakey! The room was so SMALL we opened our door and was literally on the bed we had to move a chair to put our luggage on the floor the cupboard is not adequate for hanging clothes as there is a unit with the safe inside so long items can't hang i'n the cupboard, we had been travelling for three weeks around America so needed some hanging space for clothes but they had to remain i'n suitcases. The air con is really loud when on and cold and when turned off room is instantly hot! The plug on the wall was hanging off as was the towel rail. Bathroom so small two people cannot be i'n there at the same time my husband is over 6 foot and quite broad so trying to have a shower was a challenge as it was so tiny! There is no fridge no kettle so can't make tea or coffee and although the rooms are cleaned daily the floor was not hoovered which isn't nice when you have been staying a week! Internet has a charge of 40 dollars for week and luggage holding has a cost too Bit of a let down considering we were on our honeymoon and asked for it to be special Bet bit of hotel the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyJameson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year with my father and sister during a family trip to New York City. We loved the location because we were very close to Times Square. We enjoyed the hotel bar a lot. The rooms were a bit small, but I heard that is typical in New York. We arrived a few hours before check-in but they were able to get us a room right away. The price was very reasonable for our location, so on my next trip to NY I will definitely check availability at this resort first!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have wished for”
Reviews.Author: kids1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paramount in Dec 2009 with my friend on our first trip to NYC. It's the perfect location. The only taxis we used were to and from the airport, we walked everywhere else. The beds were especially comfy and the staff were very plesant to say the least. Yes the room was very small (and we had a double double) but for the amount of time we spent in it it was perfect ans it was spottless, the entire hotel was. I did find the lighting a bit strange especially in the lifts but that was part of the hotels charm. Would recommend it to anyone and will hopefully stay there on my next trip to The Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Paramount”
Reviews.Author: doc092
Reviews.Content: Best location, comfortable, predictable, and friendly staff. Nice recent remodeling that maintained some of the original 1990s look and feel.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: IsraelDan
Reviews.Content: As a frequent guest at your hotel, I can honestly say that the service, design and total experience are great. I have recommended this hotel to my business colleagues and in fact one of them stayed here last night! Will continue to make this my home in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel if you just want a place to sleep. Excellent location near Times Sq. and theaters”
Reviews.Author: Annapolis2000
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and a great value at $100 on a Sunday night. Public areas well done and modern. I had a double that would be a bit crowded for two but fine for one. Bathroom is tiny, especially access to shower. Staff was accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but Rooms Were a Big Disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: 9NK4
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Paramount in December 2010, and overall, I think I'd give it a 3.5/5. The lobby was very beautiful, although a little too eclectic for my taste (I tend to like things balanced and symmetrical, and their lobby has a sort of "Alice in Wonderland" feel to it. Beautiful, none the less). Really excellent location as well, I didn't realize quite how close we were to Broadway until I got there. The concierge and bellmen are very helpful and nice, and recommended many great restaurants to eat and things to do. But one of the major disappointments in the Paramount is the rooms. I know NYC hotel rooms are generally small, but this was almost unbearable. The living space really wouldn't be so claustrophobic feeling had there been storage for suitcases and clothes. While they had a closet, it was very tiny, only able to hold maybe two coats, and they placed the drawers in such a way that you couldn't open them! The view was also not very appealing. I requested a room with a view, and they told me I had received a good one, but when I looked out the window all I saw was the parking lot next door. The carpets also need to be cleaned, they seemed dirty and old to me. While the Paramount has some major flaws in their rooms, they average it out with their superb ground floor and excellent service. Oh, and from the outside, the Paramount blends into the wall really easily, so keep a look out for it! My friend and I accidentally walked past it a few times the first day.

Reviews.Title: “To dark for me”
Reviews.Author: Homeboy_hols
Reviews.Content: We had been staying in a spacious hotel in Washington, this felt like a prison cell. The room was so small with no storage. As the room was so small we kept tripping over our cases. The hotel was gloomy, I think it’s called mood lighting, my mood was mostly depressed. I couldn’t even see the buttons in the lift it was so dim. There were no coffee making facilities and the wifi was about $10 per day. The only thing going for it was that it was near Times Square. Last time we stayed at the Hampton Inn, what a difference they had free wifi and free coffee available, and was light and aerie, wish we had gone back there.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend staying here”
Reviews.Author: MiaBchGal
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveler to NYC for work, and I'm also an ex-New Yorker (full disclosure). I normally try to stay away from touristy areas like Times Square for business travel, but every other hotel in town was booked, so I chose the Paramount. To be fair, I think that the common areas are fabulous. The hotel lobby is chic, the bar (which I used to frequent when I lived in the City) is lovely, and the gym is top-notch. But it's clear to me that all of the money spent by this hotel was on these areas only. The residential hallways need updating and some cleaning. The carpet is dirty and worn thin in most places, the walls are dingy and need touching up, and there's a pervasive stench throughout. The room itself is .. only OK. It's the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in anywhere in the world -- so small, in fact, that the only table in the room is on wheels and hovers over the bed. I couldn't identify the closet until I realized that there was a shallow metal handle on that colored wall panel. They've clearly replaced the floors in the bathroom, but the industrial-grade toilet and shower are unappealing. I had to call maintenance to fix both the see-through and the black-out shades on the window (neither would go up or down). When I left for work in the morning, I asked the staff to fix the light above the bed because it went out, but it hadn't been fixed when I got home from my work dinner (more than 12 hours later). I had to call a second time to get someone to fix it. Overall, it's not my favorite place in the city. There are many other places to stay where you can get a good feel for the real NYC without paying the small fortune that the Paramount costs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: SailingtoDelos
Reviews.Content: The Paramount is a jewel of a hotel. From the inviting entrance, friendly doormen and staff to the fresh, Euro-style rooms, I wouldn't change a thing. The beds are incredibly comfortable, too. We requested a quiet room and it was absolutely so, even though the hotel is just a couple of blocks from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Rodent in room!”
Reviews.Author: Terriinthewoods
Reviews.Content: Pulled up to hotel and a giant inflatable rat was set up out front. Found out that it was a union thing, claiming bed bugs in hotel. We had two rooms and both checked beds for bugs and mattresses looked brand new. Rooms very tiny. Next morning after I got out of shower, saw something out of the corner of my eye....tail going under bed. Got up on bed just like in the movies... Called front desk and they said someone would be up. Called other family's room and they could hear screaming in room beside them... Mouse running around over there. No one came in the next 15 min - called again, said I wanted put up in another hotel. Manager comes up, can't do it but can move us up to higher floor. Very nice and apologetic, just changed "exterminators", saw hole behind a/c unit. Came back to higher room and there was wine and a fruit tray with an apology. Manager did best he could but I would never stay there again!! Thank goodness my kids didn't see it! Though my 7 yr old daughter wanted to catch it and make it a pet.

Reviews.Title: “My next time in NY will be at Paramount Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Leandro77
Reviews.Content: Dear Friends, I really liked staying at Paramount ! Great hotel ! Cool decoration, very well located. ( at 1 step from Times Square !!! ) Special thanks to Catherine at front desk. Her attention with clients is amazing. My next time in NY will be at Paramount Hotel. Best regards. Leandro Ramos | Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first timers”
Reviews.Author: Daverawd
Reviews.Content: Very trendy. Rooms ok, not massive but central NY !! Best part is the location, 5 mins from almost most things. We walked everywhere, felt safer than in the UK!

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Ugurd
Reviews.Content: We visited NY again this April and had decided on a hotel with a central location, preferably within walking distance of some attractions and local transport. Paramount is such a place, just half a block from Times Square and four blocks from the big bus terminal at Port Authority (where we landed after taking a somewhat run-down minibus service from JFK). The hotel greeted us with rather load music in the lobby and a strong smell of perfume, especially in the elevators. These features don't add anything, on the contrary. We were a bit worried when we saw the gigantic rat outside of the hotel every other day proclaiming that bed bugs had been found on the premises. Another monstrous creature inflated by a small engine stood outside another hotel with the same message, which makes me wonder if someone has refused to pay up in a racket. Now to the positive things! Good-sized rooms with beds, bathroom etc of good standard. Next to the lobby is a small deli where you can buy breakfast (and plenty of other places close by). Half a block away you have a) Times Square b) a whole block of restaurants on 46th st in the other direction c) an Irish pub d) Red Lobster with great sea-food. The rooms are around 250 dollars per night which I think gives you good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oldhampat
Reviews.Content: Sandwiched between times square and hells kitchen,this is a great location. The Hotel is a funky modern,clean hotel with very attentive staff. You are right in the heart of the city and there is a subway at the top of the street,giving easy access to the rest of the city. We loved our trip to the Big Apple and this hotel played a big part in our enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: estabia
Reviews.Content: As per most reviews of this hotel, the rooms are tiny. Given that we barely spent any time in the room, we found it incredibly comfortable and suitable for our needs. Location was convenient for our first trip to NYC; we spent a lot of time around the time square area. For our next trip, we'll probably look at a less touristy area. We didn't visit the bar, but it looked like it had a pretty decent atmosphere and was busy til quite late.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, fantastic, Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: munch1111
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at The Paramount. Our stay was for our honeymoon. Would definitely recommend getting upgraded to a Deluxe King. We stayed in room 904 & had hairdryer, Iron, robes, ample storage space and the bed was so comfortable. Bathroom was smallish but adequate. The room was cleaned everyday, spotless, new sheets, towels etc! The concierge Collette was very helpful with all our requests so she deserves a special mention. I did approach her on a lot of occasions & she always went out of her way to help us, even phoning the Cruise line we had booked as we had misplaced the time it was supposed to be leaving at. We arrived back to our room on the 2nd day & the Hotel staff had left a chocolate cake for us with Congratulations wrote on the plate, a very nice touch! There is a retaurant Juniors if you cut through The Marriott Hotel world famous for Cheesecake & you will see why when you order one. Their sandwiches for lunch are also second to none order the twin roll ones you will not be disappointed. Its the perfect hotel, in the perfect location, no need for taxi's as everything you could possibly want is within walking distance. Would definitely book this hotel again if we return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL!”
Reviews.Author: dafydd2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed there as part of a wedding party. The receptionists are cold and unfriendly the rooms are tiny, you fall into the bed on opening the door. I wanted to use the iron in the room and there was only one power point, in the bathroom! Do not drink the bar, Manhattan prices! The only plus points were that the rooms were clean, the location great and friendly door staff.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: MsBarreto
Reviews.Content: When we first walked into our room the first thing we noticed was how small the room was. I know rooms in NY are typically small, but this room was beyond small. With reserving our stay we received free drink vouchers (which I highly recommend getting) for each night we stay. The bar there was very relaxing and more of a lounge. The waitresses were very friendly. Our favorite waitress, which served us all nights we stayed and asked for her by name, was Aida. She was friendly, helpful and went far and beyond to make sure we were happy. In terms of location Times Square is right outside your window. Once you leave the hotel, take a left and walk a few seconds Time Square is right there. When you stay at the Paramount I recommend you get the free drink vouchers and make sure when you go to the bar you ask for Aida by name, and if you can, let her know the young couple that stayed the last week of May, told you great things about her. Overall, my boyfriend and I are looking forward to staying at the Paramount again this year.

Reviews.Title: “amazing,staff,amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1071013Computers
Reviews.Content: i can not understand what other people said about this hotel,i honestly found the check in staff,door men,luggage guys,so helpfull,the rooms are cleand everday with clean towels,didint here any other guests,beds soooo comfy,my kids felt relaxed and safe here and the music in reception is funky and fab,amazing location,great irish bar across the street for my cider,allways hot water what more do you need,would definatley recomend the hotel and 100 % stay agin

Reviews.Title: “Small room, clean, expensive”
Reviews.Author: cwliew
Reviews.Content: Being in Times square, it was a great location. Its about 3 blocks from the main street of times square. We found the rooms to be pleasant and clean. We booked the cheapest room there, and 3 nights cost about A$1200 which is quite a lot for what it is. The rooms are tiny! You can't fit 2 people in the bathroom at the same time and you need to be a tiny person to not touch the walls all the time in the shower. If you have luggage and you want to open them, then you won't have much space to walk around the room. Unlikel australian hotels, this one lacks basic coffee/tea making facilities or even a minibar! Its basically a bed, a wardrobe and a bathroom. The rooms were clean - and everything else in the place was fine. We paid for wifi internet and it was fast. The view from the room was great - looking over manhattan. Overall, there are likely to be better "boutique" hotels around near times square, but this was definitely adequate. Just seemed a bit expensive to be paying $400 a night for a tiny room. We are used to staying at the W or similar, so perhaps I am being a bit harsh.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic is all i can say!”
Reviews.Author: nate230
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, the location was great, the lobby was beautiful and the room crisp and clean! The staff were fantastic and helped my fiance and I celebrate our engagement while on this vacation. Would stay at again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, pleasant staff, and nice bedrooms. 10/10.”
Reviews.Author: cornish_vacationer
Reviews.Content: Before this recent trip I read the reviews with mixed emotions - but the hotel was perfect for us. You can't beat the location (and whoever said it was hard to find was wrong!!), every member of staff was very friendly, most of the staff were efficent (but maybe a bit slow in the Library Bar), and it has a really good atmosphere about the place. The bedrooms are small - but they're not tiny! We had a King Deluxe double room, and the teenage kids had a twin Queen room and they were clean and tidy. Okay, so the bathrooms are small but they are more than adequate. No facilities to make tea or coffee but the coffee shop just off reception opened at 7:00 am and that saved me the effort... Good bed linen (no bugs here), and a very comfortable bed. The room was a little noisy because there were air conditioning units running; but not enough to unduly bother us. I won't hasten to recommend this hotel if you want to spend a few days in New York - I will definitley return!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rozzo6608
Reviews.Content: When I first checked into my room in the Paramount, it was a bit on the small side, the double bed felt like a single, however asked the reception staff if it would be possible to move to a larger room, they obliged without hesitation. The next room was perfect. You literally couldn't get a better location than this, you could see times square from the window! The concierge was a great help if you ever needed any tips and in general the whole place had a good vibe about it. The modern, classy reception area made it feel new and exciting. Would recommend to other people going to NYC anytime.

Reviews.Title: “No design connect between the decadent lobby and utilitarian rooms”
Reviews.Author: PurdeyHJ
Reviews.Content: Walking into the lobby, there is a wonderfully dramatic chandelier and beautiful floral display. However, there is no design connect between the lobby and the bedrooms. The bedrooms have a functional utilitarian feel. The colours are red and grey and the lighting is harsh. The air conditioner is very noisy and our room had additional noise from a machine outside our window. Whilst more spacious than the Hudson, the rooms are still on the small side. Bizarrely, in lieu of a normal table or desk, they provide you with a hospital-style bed table which apart from being unattractive, is perfect for bruising your leg if you roll over during the night. We pulled it away from the bed and had it at the side of the room, which looked awkward. Someone please tell them to put in a normal table or desk! Despite a relatively recent refurb, there is a lot of wear in the rooms. Our bathroom light switch was cracked, and the bath tub needed replacing. Like the Hudson, this hotel is expensive but doesn't both providing its guests with free wifi. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location but let down by some of the staff”
Reviews.Author: GavW_11
Reviews.Content: Paramount hotel was lovely, great location, little over a minutes walk to time square. Only problem was the heating in our room didnt work properly and as our stay was in january it was quite cold and we made 2 calls to reception and they told us they'd send somebody up but never did. Despite this i would recommend the paramount as it is a beautiful hotel, has nice spacious rooms, a lovely lobby area and 2 bars, which are quite expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kayg74
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel and very clean. Check in was a bit of a nightmare as our rooms were not ready and we had to wait 2 hours. We had a family room that had two double beds (they are small double beds not standard size). The room was not that small it was ok for us as we were only sleeping in it. The only problem was there is only one very small cupboard for your wardrobe! As others reviews have said the air conditioning units in the rooms are noisy. Cleaned to a high standard every day. The breakfast are lovely.They have a good choice of food, only thing i think it is a bit over priced. Concierge were very helpful and friendly. They recommended a great diner 5 Napkin on 9th Ave and 44 street. The lobby has club style music playing all the time at quiet high levels! If you like that kind of thing, great, if you don't it might get on your nerves a bit. I wouldn't say the hotel rooms have been refurbished to a high standard. The hotel is in a great location for everything. I would recommend it but make sure you ask for a room with two double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative reviews, this is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Brennan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week in NY, we had a lovely time and the hotel was absolutely great. Ok, so the room wasn’t the biggest I’ve ever stayed in, but it was more than we expected having stayed in city centre locations all over the world. What you gain in hotel location you lose in floor space, that’s just how things are. The room was spotlessly clean, with new towels etc every day we were there. The decor was modern and stylish, and the bed was really comfortable. The two Bars and the reception area are all very relaxed and boutique style, very eclectic and classy. There is a well set up gym, although if you have any energy left to use it after a day out in NY then you are a better man than me! All in all I’d recommend this hotel to my friends and next time I go to NY I’ll be booking in here.

Reviews.Title: “room 1418 very small”
