Reviews.Author: terryb72
Reviews.Content: Very very small room. When sitting on loo could touch all 4 walls. My wife has trouble with moving around and has to use a cane, the room was so small she found it difficult to move in the room. There is very little storage space for your clothes so if you are staying for more than 2 days some of your clothes will have to stay in your cases We had to upgrade because of the room size and when we were leaving room 1418 the maid ask if we wre checking out we said "no moving to another room" her comment was, "room to small" Both rooms were very clean and all the staff very helpful and great location Can only rate it average because of the room we were given

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tracycUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights to see New York. Fanatstic location, just 200 yards from Times Square, right in the centre of Manhatten. Lovely room but a bit sparse for clothes storage. Large bathroom with walk in shower. Ironing board, iron, hairdryer and electronic safe all provided and included in the price. If you are not leaving til late there is a luggage storage room. Very helpful concierge. One thing to be careful with is, if you are paying cash the money will also be held on a card and you will not have it available in your bank for a number of days as they take your card on check in for security and they automatically use it to pay for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, will definately use this again.”
Reviews.Author: vcaroundworld
Reviews.Content: Myself and three friends booked one room with two double beds for a 5 night stay and have been very happy with this choice. We bought hotel and flights for £600 each person. From very poor choices in cities such as London and Dublin, we are always dubious with star ratings on city hotels as they can be very deceptive and we insisted on a 'four star' rated city hotel as 3 stars always end up being the grubby hole in a run-down building. I think that in usual terms 4 star would require more features and facilities but in real terms of a popular city this is exactly what we expected (a standard 3 star hotel bumped up to 4 stars purely because of its location). We loved the boutique feel of the place, check in was quick and simple and all staff we encountered was polite and helpful. Yes, when we first saw the room we found it rather amusing that 4 grown women would need to be well organised to cope in such close quarters for 6 days but alas we managed. We were very happy just because it was very clean with no signs of disrepair. And yes, we couldn't unpack everything but again this didn't bother us. With some stuff unpacked, the room and bathroom immediately looked like a bomb hit it and bless the cleaners each day who worked hard to put the room right each day. Yes, the bathroom is tiny, only suitable for one person at a time (not an issue for us) but the shower was nice and again very clean. No, there was not a mini bar or bathrobes and the TV channels were limited but the safe was great and the tolietries were well stocked. The air conditioning was the only problem we found as we did need to turn it off as the last person was going to bed because it was generally too loud to sleep with it on but the first person up switched it on again and we never felt too warm during the night. It is the location of the hotel that is the massive selling point. I do not believe that you can get any closer to Times Square on this level of cost. Our room was at the back so no street noise and there was very little noise from the corridors or neighbours. On the last day, we had already enquired about left baggage and were happy to pay the 2 dollars per bag from 8 am until we picked them up again at 4 pm, i think that's a bargain! Ultimately, we expect a city hotel to be basic for our price bracket and this has definately been the best we have stayed in so far!

Reviews.Title: “Total rip-off, do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: VladJor
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend in the Paramount hotel for 8 nights in May and would not recommend it to anybody. Upon our arrival, we were given an apparently single room with a single bed. We returned down to the reception desk to point out there has been a mistake but were told that this was a DOUBLE room! We urged the not very helpful reception girl to talk to the manager and had him go and check the room for himself to see 2 people just simply cannot fit in, even if they are skinny like we both are. After long arguing and waiting, we were given an upgrade (with a lot of "you should be happy" and "you are lucky we found you an available room", no apologies at all) with certainly a slightly bigger bed but the room was so small we could not open our luggage on the floor, so they had to stay closed in upward position, not to talk about jumping over them when we wanted to go to the bathroom. Nice welcome for 300 USD a night. The next morning we were told we would get another upgrade to a bigger room. We wanted to move to another hotel, ready to accept the cancellation fee, but could not find any nearby hotel that was available for the entire length of our stay. So we stayed in Paramount. Our 3rd room was OK, very small but compared to what we have seen before it was acceptable. The rooms have no minibar (beverages would be useful) and the "closet" is so small we were wondering why they wasted space on it. The air-conditioning regulation did not work and ventilation was very noisy and disturbing in the night. Also, we found a 2 USD fee for storing a luggage and 13 USD daily fee for internet use just outrageous, in a hotel of this price category. We both travel a lot both for business and leisure but have never seen this anywhere else in the world ! The hotel prides itself to be a "boutique" hotel but having a shoe-box sized rooms and dim lighting with a very strange smell and loud music in the lobby is, sorry to say, just NOT enough to qualify as a boutique hotel. To be fair, I have to say the hotel was extremely well located and all 3 rooms we have seen were clean although very simple. The beds (mattress and pillows) are comfortable. Unfortunately, the pro's end here. To sum up, the hotel is a total rip-off, not worth the money. Do not stay here, you can get better rooms and service for the same price in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience for my students”
Reviews.Author: RHamilton46404
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel! The staff was courteous and went out of their way to make certain that all of our requests were met. I took a group of Midwestern college students to New York. I wanted them to have a true New York experience. Staying at the Paramount assisted me in my goal. Our stay there exceeded our expectations! It is convenient to the subway, restaurants, and theatres – all at an excellent price. Because of the wonderful experience we had at the Paramount, I have recommended it to colleagues and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel. Would never go back. Ridiculously small rooms. Lots of errors made.”
Reviews.Author: JB82
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start with this hotel. It's classed as a four-star hotel but I have no idea why. The only thing going for it was the cleanliness of the rooms. Almost everything else was terrible. We booked the Paramount Hotel as the first stop on our honeymoon (second stop being in Mexico). We thought a four-star hotel would be enough for our needs considering it was our first trip to New York and wouldn't spend a lot of time at the hotel. Well, we couldn't spend time there even if we wanted to. The rooms were so small that there wasn't enough room for 2 adults to comfortably relax in them. So claustrophobic! When we checked in the hotel charged our credit card $75 security deposit. That was fine - standard practice. However, they then charged us for the cost of our room without telling us even though we had already paid (in full) for our room. It wasn't until we checked our credit card balance that we found out what they had done. We were $500 down on day one of our trip. I understand that people make mistakes but when we brought it to the attention of the reception staff they were less than sorry. We never received an apology and we were made to feel like we were an annoyance. We were told it would take 7-10 working days for the money to be refunded. The money has now been refunded (now we're back in the UK) but the $500 was intended for our 'spending money' whilst we were away. Thankfully we had other funds but it could have easily left us short of cash. So, when we got into our room we found the TV wasn't working and had to call the maintenance man. Then, the window was faulty and wouldn't shut. Not what you want when you're right on Times Square and can hear EVERYTHING! Maintenance man had to be called again. ROOM - tiny, tiny, tiny. There was just enough room for us to shimmy around the edge of the double bed but that was it. Facilities were pretty basic - like I said, I have no idea why it's a four-star hotel. The room was clean so that was a plus. The en suite was very small as well and because of that you could hear everything when your guest/partner was using the facilities. The room had air conditioning but it was so noisy that you wouldn't be able to sleep with it on. If you're planning on visiting the Paramount in the height of summer, beware. STAFF - with the exception of the bell boy/porters the staff were pretty unhelpful. They did the absolute bare minimum. When mistakes were made there was no apology or urgency to rectify things. Instead, you were made to feel like you should apologise to them. LOCATION - the hotel is literally a stone's throw from Times Square. Great if you want to be in the buzz of everything. But again, be warned, it's hectic and manic and if you're the type of person who needs to chill at the end of the day then this is not the right place for you. Overall, as the first stop on our honeymoon, this hotel was rubbish. It really spoiled our trip to New York and was a definite source of stress. I would never ever stay there again and would definitely not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: candice2411
Reviews.Content: So i had my reservations about this hotel from reading the reviews and all i can say is, it couldnt of been better in my experience. Only downside was the rooms were small but it is to be expected in city hotels. After all your only sleeping there. The room was cleaned everyday which was nice too. The hotel inside is beautiful with a big chandelier, and we were checked in straight away. On arrival to new york we were worried as it looked so big and complicated however we went to the concierge desk and they gave us a map, gave us tips, told us places to go and couldnt of been more helpful. A few metres away and your in times square so the hotel had a perfect location. Close to all the attractions. Would highly reccommend it and upon my next visit to New York ill be sure to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: ol38
Reviews.Content: 40 min standing for Check in Smallest room I ever saw - 40 cms max around the bed. +/- clean Air conditioning Extremely noisy

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: LALynnie
Reviews.Content: I'm in NYC 10-20 a year for business, staying at all levels of hotels depending on company budget, policies and deals. I know what to expect from each grade of hotel. I wound up at the Paramount due to a client deal that covered my room and tax. Even if it were free again, I'd never stay here a next time. The room: NY hotel rooms are small but smart hotels offer storage and work solutions that maximize space. This had nothing. I was in 1841 which felt like the maid's room - and as I learned from the room guide, it probably was since the 18th floor was the original hotel's attic. The room was spartan: bed, one nightstand, a chair. No desk despite sufficient space for it (also no real dresser). A sad lopsided floor lamp. There was some rolling tray table that fit over the bed or in front of the lone chair. Great concept if every guest is over 5'8". I'm 5'4" and this was completely useless, too high. I had no place to do work. The closet was entirely taken up with a clumsy two-drawer cabinet that left only a 4" space to hang clothes...space further reduced by 1/2 because the ironing board was also stored there. So if you want to hang anything longer than a shirt, you can't. The bathroom is terribly outdated, with cheap 1980s metal fixtures. The room was dirty. Not in need of dusting or vaccuuming but a deep serious cleaning. It had two nasty decorative pillows on the bed that I couldn't toss on the floor fast enough with as little touching as possible. The toilet this disgusting black ring around the bowl at the water line. The toilet should've been replaced. It looked like mold was starting in the shower. The shower curtain didn't even reach the floor so water ran out everywhere. The ceiling vent in the bathroom hasn't been cleaned in ages and was full of black dust. I hated touching any surface in the room. I had no washclothes (my colleague had them daily). I had a $10 travel hairdryer; my colleague got a full-sized one. I was so busy on business that I didn't bother to try and change rooms. And the room was simply rundown. The rolling tray table was chipped. The walls were gouged, needing spackling and repair. Several doorframes were corroded at their bases. On the very last morning, I saw that one wall had been cut open for someone to reach an electrical box and hadn't been repaired but instead left peeling and fraying. Even the room service hangtag was beaten up, dirty and frayed - it looked as if no one had been in this room in a decade. The room condition was a disgrace. It was also unsafe: the marble threshold (the piece of marble that serves as the transition on the floor as you step from the bedroom into the bathroom) was abnormally high on the room side and I tripped the first time I went into the bathroom. The height of the threshold is probably in violation of NYC laws. It took nearly 5 minutes to get hot water in the shower. So I'd turn it on, do many other things and then come back to find it suitable. And a small but important point: someone had filled the peephole with gum or something. It was unnerving. If I had decided to spend one more minute than I needed to in the room, I would've alerted the desk to have it fixed. But the dismal condition and user-unfriendliness of the room kept me out of it as often as possible. Which cost the hotel several hundred dollars since I'm normally a room service user. Instead, I ran out as quickly as I could. A final point was check-in. Because of my travel schedule, I arrived too early to get my room - which was fine - but the woman at the front desk said she'd check me in and all I needed to do was stop back for the key. She saw that the room and tax were being covered. She asked for, looked at and made note of my photo ID. Oddly, she didn't want a credit card imprint although I would be responsible for non-room/tax costs. All set, she said. I returned 8 hours later to get my key before rushing out to dinner. What I encountered at the desk: --first, the man (Sean) couldn't find my reservation --once he did, he insisted that "there is nothing noted that the room and tax are paid for" - I kept reiterating that I'd already checked in and it had shown up at that time; he kept claiming otherwise --finally he found the room arrangements note but said the woman earlier hadn't taken my photo ID documentation. Useless now to argue with him. Plus, as should've been done originally, my credit card imprint was taken --I decided to use a particular card that's both a platinum-level Visa card ($8000 a day limit) and a debit card. Sean refused to use it as a credut card - despite the fact that it's noted as such on the card itself and had he run it as credit it would've been approved - and would only take it as a debit,. Which as he explained, required that a certain amount be withheld to cover incidentals in advance. Which wasn't appropriate but again, it was uesless trying to get him to understand. While the amount was nominal (and as explained, I had no interest in generating any additional costs in the hotel), he seemed to have no understanding about such cards or in even running the card as credit to see he was wrong. I've charged multi-day stays at better-quality hotels on this particular card with no problem but apparently it was too difficult for the Paramount. Instead, this guy wasted my time as I headed to a business dinner, This place is a dump with service to match. There are numerous comparably-priced hotels in the area that are better-designed and better-maintained. Use them instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: shazwar
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New York with my friend in May and it was our first trip there. We chose The Paramount Hotel because of its location as we didn't want to be walking miles to get to Times Square. It really is in a great location just round the corner of all the hustle and bustle of Times Square, and just great for all the theatre's. The hotel it self is a very trendy hotel, and yes the other reviews are right it is very dark in side, but seeing your only there to shower change and sleep, it really doesn't matter!! The staff all seemed very helpful and on our last day the concierge was very helpful. The beds are to die for and i had the best nights sleep in ages and didn't wake up with a bad back!!!!! The bus tour which is hop on hop off is well worth the money, it gets you to all the right places and you learn so much on the way. We ate out every day and the Olive Garden restaurant near the ticket booths was wonderful, but be prepared to tip everywhere you go even on the buses!!!!! Macys is a must if you like shopping, 11 floors in fact, so be prepared to be in there for a few hours and if you go to customer services you can get a 10 % discount voucher to use for 30 days but you must have some id on you!! We only stayed for 3 nights and it really isn't enough time to explore everything without rushing around, so that means i will have to go back!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE - DO NOT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: AUSSIENESE
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip thinking that we were going into a "renovated" hotel near Times Sq but this is -- hands down -- one of the worst NY hotels I've ever stayed in. The rooms are small and stuffy. Also, most of the "renovated" elements are simply unfinished. It's like a rundown motel pretending to be a hotel. Also, they seem to be on an energy-saving tip but it makes everything worse. The light in the bathroom take about 20mins before it gets to full brightness. The shower is a slow trickle and it takes about 45mins to get hot water coming out. Also, the hotel is very dark inside and the lighting in the corridor is extremely dim. Finally, let me say a few things about the "Dean and Deluca" cafe that is attached to the hotel. The staff seem to be angry, rude ex-cons and cafe itself dirty (nobody picks up the trash or cleans the floor). The worst thing of all about this hotel -- the price. It is simply ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: Aman1804
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect and if you stay here then you wont need to take a taxi anywhere as it is a very central location. The whole look and feel of the hotel is contemporary. The hotel staff are very friendly. We were staying on a bed and breakfast basis, and the breakfast was delicious - fresh waffles, bagels, fruit, yogurt, cheeses, juices, bacon, eggs and sausages. The rooms were cleaned regularly, and towels changed everyday. I felt very safe in the hotel and had no issues with it cleanliness. The rooms are a bit tight, but then it depends on how much time you are going to be spending in your room. The hotel also has a bar attached to it, which was always rammed with people. Also the conceirge service are very helpful and we used them very often to find out which films were playing at the local cinema, which restaurants to go to and how to book trips. There were a few people outside, claiming that the hotel was full of rats and beg bugs, but we took no notice and didn't have any issues with any of these. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, smelly rooms. Two stars at best.”
Reviews.Author: steveBusiness1
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all the 4 and 5 star reviews for this hotel. While it's not a bad value, it is not better than a two star hotel. The room was tiny and smelled bad. Not room for a desk. It was smaller than the small rooms I had in boutique hotels in London, Paris and Beijing. I was traveling on business and thought I'd save the company some money since it seemed to have good reviews. I should hace read them more carefully and looked at the photos online. While the room was reletipvely clean, they did not change the towels or even give me new soap. Had known I would have paid more for a better hotel. This is a budget tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and friendly, but still chic”
Reviews.Author: julie1957London
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Paramount several times over the past few years, but am never disappointed with the welcome and service. My teenage kids think it is the coolest hotel, and are deeply jealous that this trip i went without them. It is a great location, close to Times Square and lots of good restaurants. But the hotel restaurant is worth staying in for. The staff are always friendly and helpful, and go just that bit further to help. The hotel is still a hidden gem with regards to value for money. I have reluctantly stayed at other hotels in New York, but none have measured up to the Paramount.

Reviews.Title: “I very much enjoyed my stay at the Paramount Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blaricum
Reviews.Content: A (reservation) mistake from Expedia brought us to the Paramount Hotel. We were helped by a fantastic "frontdesk" assistant called Nerma, to upgraded rooms. Thanks expedia for making the mistake, we will definately go to the Paramount again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and great location.”
Reviews.Author: kjk40
Reviews.Content: We were aware that the rooms in most New York Hotels were small and were prepared for the worst. The room was small but with adequate space. The beds are small for doubles but very comfortable. Room was clean and towels and bedding changed daily. Our room was quite noisy as was at front of hotel and could hear the bin lorries, sirens and carpark across the road from about 5am. We found the staff to be very helpful and loved the coffee shop next door for take out breakfast. The foyer area is extremely dark but we ended up quite liking it! Had read about the bed bug situation on here before went and we were horrified to be greeted by a big billboard outside the hotel about them. However we found out that this was being carried out by former employees with a grievance and the hotel can't stop it. We certainly had NO problems with bedbugs! The Paramount Bar built on to hotel is extremely expensive and the staff in there were quite rude, the Library Bar staff were lovely but again incredibly expensive. The location is absolutely fantastic and the only things to say about the hotel are the room could have done with a mirror near to a plug, bed could have been bigger. Wi-Fi costs and cahsrged $2 to look after bags before departure. None of these things were a big issue for us and they looked after our bags free when we arrived as not supposed to get into room till 4 and we were there at 1. When we first arrived we were very apprehensive because of the signs outside and did take a sheen off of the excitement but was all for nothing so please don't panic if you see it!! If was going back to NY would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in vibrant heart of New York's Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: NatalieBB
Reviews.Content: The Paramount hotel is a trendy landmark midtown hotel situated in the vibrant heart of the Theatre District in Manhattan, NYC. It's guest rooms are clean and neat with modern furnishing including an iPod audio docking station and HD flat screen TVs. My 17th floor room was perfectly sized, had good views over the city and lovely little touches like snug toweling robes. Try and get a higher floor room as they tend to be more roomy. The decor at the Paramount is quite striking and includes a dramatic Philippe Stark staircase. The hotel lobby seems to buzz with people and music and the Paramount Bar, with its glamorous crystal chandeliers, is great to unwind and enjoy some cocktails, before or after catching one of the fabulous shows on offer just across the street. The second floor piano lounge Library bar is also worth a visit. It was impressive that all I had to do was walk across 2 streets to see the brilliant play, 'That Championship Season' at the Bernard Jacobs Theater featuring none other than Keifer Sutherland, Jason Patrick and Chris Noth. Seeing these brilliant actors in the flesh, working their magic was just surreal. One could literally walk across the road and see a different play every night if you wanted, staying at the Paramount- it is one of the most conveniently located hotels I've visited. A room service breakfast menu is available and Dean and DeLuca are conveniently situated on the ground floor of this hotel and I was I enjoyed their yummy snacks and coffees. The guy behind the counter was pretty funny and kept shooting off hilarious one- liners. The venue offers good value for money in terms of its modern rooms and amenities, vibrant atmosphere and the best location for experiencing the best of NYC's Theater District.They also have a convenient express check out system which eliminates the need to stand in long queues when leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Small room and mildew smell”
Reviews.Author: SFtraveler1957
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Friday afternoon for two nights. Arrived at 1:30 pm and was pleasantly surprised to find that my room was ready. Staff was friendly and helpful. However, room was very small and smelled like mildew. You mainly noticed it when you first walked in the room but it was not overpowering so I didn't bother to ask for another room. The hotel is definitely trendy, and the location is great. But the rooms are very small - I suppose that might be common for NYC. There were several things that made the room not that great. First, there is absolutely no shelving in the shower, so shampoo & soap had to be just plopped on the floor. The only shelving in the bathroom is directly over the toilet, so of course something dropped in. And the toilet is unusually low and the water level rather high, so....you do the math. There were exactly three electrical outlets not counting the bathroom. Of those, one was used by the lamp, and one was under the headboard and not easily accessible. There's no wired internet - only WiFi. The storage closet was very small. Two people in this room would kill each other. LOL They also arranged at $20 shuttle to Newark airport, which got there ontime but was packed to the gills.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and great location”
Reviews.Author: emilycowan
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Paramount Hotel for our honeymoon. The staff at the hotel could not do enough for us, always smiling and friendly and willing to go out of their way to help. We had particularly good service from Leonardo on the front desk - not only did he spend time helping us with any queries but even noticed when we came in and out of the hotel and smiled or waved. He really went out of his way for us and we are very grateful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fantastic hotel with character and good location and 5* service.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms, would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: PIIX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to NYC a minimum of twice a year and thus we have stayed in many hotels throughout the city and this must be the worst hotel we have stayed in for the following reasons. Upon entry to the hotel you instantly notice that it is very dark (a comment expressed by many other guests/people). The reception area looks as per the pictures, beautiful; it has the checkered black & very dirty white carpet with multiple seats which does looks great until you see the signs stating no luggage or drinks in the carpet area, why? what is the point of that? Seemed very unwelcoming! When we checked-in (after waiting ages for the clearly understaffed reception desk) we were, given a complimentary upgrade to a larger room as it was it was our first stay with the Paramount. This was well received. On the way to our room (unescorted, not even offered) the hallway had graffiti on the walls; very classy establishment!! Upon entering the room, all I can say is what are the dimensions of the standards double rooms like??? Again the room is exactly like the pictures, what an amazing photographer to make them look fresh and roomy. The room was very clean but is tiny, i don’t care what people say about NYC rooms being small etc, as i have never experienced anything quite as small, so thank god for the upgrade because we needed the extra double bed for the bags. Next was the bathroom - wow, climbing over the basin to push the towels on the rail out of the way, to get the toilet was a daily event. And then pull back the curtain and here is the shower. Again all very clean but - tiny. To sum it up it felt like we were staying in a small grey box, i just could not wait to get out the room. In addition, stupidly we accepted a room on the lower levels which resulted in a generally noise stay specifically from the fans. This is also the first hotel I have ever stayed in NYC where they have charged for Wi-Fi ($13 pd), which is really bad policy when the small cafe next door is free, as per the most of the city – but we did get a complimentary passcode after pointing this out to reception. Also this is the first hotel which I have been charged to leave luggage ($2). Granted this is minimal but with staying in so many others it just felt they were trying to squeeze every penny out of you they can!! Good points the hotel is very clean, in a brilliant location and the staff were very friendly, helpful and always working with a friendly smile. The concierges are excellent in organize events for your party. With all the money they have spent in recently refurbishing this hotel you think they would spend a bit more money on light bulbs, unmarked wallpaper and bigger rooms. To summarise if you want location and don’t care about the size of rooms then this is the hotel for you. But based on the money we spent – I wished we went elsewhere as there are many hotels of similar standing and price which are far better and just as central to TS or further afield in desired.

Reviews.Title: “Chilled out, comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Bill-bob1985
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late Friday afternoon to be greeted by friendly welcoming staff who were quick to deal with our check in. As it was our 1st Wedding Anniversary my husband asked if there would be a chance of a room upgrade, the lady on reception found us another room for the weekend with a small charge. The hotel lobby was very chilled with dimmed lighting, comfy sofa's and funky but soft 'wine bar' music. The room itself was very modern and just the right size. We had read reviews previous to travelling saying the rooms were very small but ours was perfect. The bed was soooo comfy and just what you needed after a long days sightseeing. The only downside of the room was that it smelt a little bit like sweaty feet when we walked in and we couldnt open the windows and that the air conditioning unit was quite loud, this wasnt a huge problem as we didnt need it on through the night. The consigerge were brilliant, very helpful and knowledgable. We enquired on a few occasions for directions, ect. The hotel was litterly just off Times Square, i thought it would be very noisy but it wasnt. So location was fantastic, perfect for shops, sights, Broadway shows(We saw Lion King, WOW! what a show!) and close to one of the main subway stations 42nd street. The hotel had a bar downstairs on the street level, which we also visited, this again was very relaxed, although quite expensive and the waitress was lovely. Definatley a good way to end your busy day. Also there is a coffee shop attatched called Dean and Deluca that did coffee and cakes. The only downside of the hotel is that there are no stairs only lifts which in a morning is terrible as everyone is on their way out and although there are 4 lifts, been on the 3rd floor, each lift was packed as they always went to the top. We found the trick was to press the button to go up, get in an empty lift and go up first! it was quicker than waiting for a lift you can squeeze into, one day it took us 15 mins to get a lift! Not Good! Overall our experience of the Paramount was brilliant and as for New York, what a place! We would definatly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Warm Responses from Staff”
Reviews.Author: kendan4th
Reviews.Content: The Paramount Hotel and it's staff did an incredible job during my 4 day day. In particular, the manager on duty, Christine, staffers; Nerma and Natalie were extremely nice and confident whenever approached regarding the few issues I had. Issue; my shower did not work properly Sunday night and they assured me it would be fixed and it was before noon Monday morning. The staff often smiled and energized thoughout the day and offered tips around the city as well as pointed out details regarding the hotel that made my staff very comfortable. I would HIGHLY recommend The Paramount Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SLW23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the Easter long weekend (although at the time of booking we didn't realise it was Easter!), and were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. After reading many reviews on the size of the rooms, dimly lit lobby, I was a bit aprehensive.... but upon arrival, I was glad we had booked here. The lobby, while a little dim, was funky and I didn't have a problem with the light. Our room - a renovated broadway classic - was perfectly proportioned in size. In fact, it was larger than what I had expected after reading some reviews. It's location is definitely a selling point, and we were able to access everything we wanted to see easily. We probably only had two issues the whole time - upon checking in we were given key cards to our room, only to find once we entered that it was someone else's room still... The clerk had gotten our room number wrong by accidentally swapping two of the digits around, which was a bit off-putting to start. We also chose one morning to put the 'Do Not Disturb' sign on our door before we went out, as we had hung quite a number of our clothes in the bathroom to air and didn't want anyone to enter, however when we returned later that day, housekeeping had entered nonetheless. My understanding was that if you put the Do Not Disturb sign up, you don't want the room to be disturbed - whether you are in there or not. We were back in NYC the following week, and had planned to book at this hotel again, but a week obviously makes a difference to the price - the same room would have cost us $120 extra per night. I'm not sure how that worked, as our original stay was the Easter weekend, and the second would have been mid-week and not Easter! We chose to stay at the Wyndham Garden on 36th st, and while nice, we would have preferred to stay at the Paramount again.

Reviews.Title: “The Stay of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: mccaflo
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to New York celebrating my 70th birthday. Location was 1 minute from centre of Time Square. This is an older refurbished hotel, rooms are smaller, very very clean, beds and linens were awesome and then there is the service. When is the last time you stayed in a hotel in a very large city where the gal who registered you remembered your name every time you walked through the lobby. That gal was "Natalie". She in particular and the rest of the staff made my 8 day holiday unbelievable. How do I describe my visit to the big apple?????? "If I rolled every holiday I have ever had (and I have had many) into one large ball, it could not hold a candle to my trip to New York and the Paramount Hotel made it all possible. Try this hotel, you will not regret it. Flo McCafferty Surrey, British Columbia, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Good Service, Adequate Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kmhtjsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 night break from the UK and weren't looking for a hotel to spend all our time in, as we had NYC to explore! However, we wanted something that was nice for the time we were in it. I loved the lobby - it is dimly lit, it does have loud music and is pumped full of fragrance (which I think they should change) and it creates a great atmosphere! The cocktail bar has a similar feeling to it, the restaurant (we only had breakfast there) is quieter but looks over the lobby, the team there are really helpful and the buffet breakfast was delicious. We were "upgraded slightly" (receptionist's words) and the room was a perfect size for a city hotel. The strange thing about this hotel was that it seemed as though a lot of money had been spent in the communal areas and yet corners (such as leaving old light switches in the rooms, painting over old doorframes without sanding them down and other things that anyone with an eye for detail would have sacked a decorator in their home for) were cut! The best thing about this hotel is the location... it was fantastic for TImes Square and all the shows, as well as restaurants and the bus tours.

Reviews.Title: “Low light of our US trip”
Reviews.Author: crook123
Reviews.Content: BEWARE!! We had 3 separate bookings at this hotel, and planned to use this as our base on the east coast. We only used 1 booking. The lobby is trying very hard to be a nightclub - very uninviting - loud music, funky smell and very low lighting. Staff not helpful and couldn't care much about travellers predicament. Our first stay (2 nights) was uncomfortable. the room was 2 double beds and way too small for 4 people. You had room for 1 bag on the floor and had to walk sideways between beds. We had a room outside the lifts and heard them not only open and close all night, but rumble up and down the shafts as well. When we complained, they told us they would upgrade us to a suite on our return in 3 days. When we returned, we not only did not get an upgrade, but we didn't get a room at all! At 10.30pm when we checked in they advised us they had sold out of rooms, even though we told them of our check in time and had a confirmation number. They told us to try a certain hotel and we could walk there (with 2 tired kids and 5 bags). They didn't book us a room there as the new hotel new nothing about us, and gave us the last room, which was a total dump! We got no compensation from the paramount for this, (we were told they should pay) and they weren't concerned about us possibly having nowhere to stay, late on Easter Friday night - we checked and everything decent was full. Upon talking to the manager the next day to cancel all further bookings, he told us he would give us a suite next time and to come back. Sorry, but we were promised this before and didn't even get a call advising us that they had no room at all! The only good thing was its proximity to Times Square, however you don't need to be this close to enjoy it. Poor service, accommodation and experience. The lowlight of 5 weeks and 10 hotels in the US!

Reviews.Title: “Remeber its NYC !”
Reviews.Author: kingrox
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights at the paramount in april. the hotel is in fairly good condition (its trying hard to be a little retro and funky) the lobby is large but for some reason its very, very dimly lit. the rooms are in good-ish condition .... We had 2 double rooms with 2 queen beds in each room... i was freaking out about the size of the rooms b4 i arrived after reading all the reviews here on TA - However, whilst they were certainly small i didnt expect anything else, and they were workable, - considering we were in the centre of NYC. The rooms were of a reasonably clean standard however they were far from perfect, our shower could have done wid a damn good scrub.... the staff in the paramount are very stand off-ish to say the least (typical of NYC tho!) The best thing about the paramount is the position.. its really good! 2 mins walk to the dead centre of times square and all it has to offer the tourists. I would definately recommend this spot (46th and 7th/8th ave) for first time visitors to this amazing city....the subway is easy to use and the 42nd street station is only minutes away. there are heaps of ripper resturants nearby in resturant row / times square or hells kitchen. johns pizza (great) is only 6 mins walk away as well. just a side note.. whilst we were there there was a giant blow up rat stationed at the front entrance of the hotel... warning the punters of bed lice and rodent infestation... this was of course a little disturbing !! *we found or saw none of the above little critters during our stay. overall the paramount has a great spot and the room rate was pretty good for new york city standards. i researched high and low for days for the best spot to take the family in NYC and this is what i settled on.. i would carefully recommend it - just be aware that it is NYC and things are always not quite what you may expect if you are a first time visitor... A BIT OF GIVE AND TAKE IS REQUIRED TO MAKE THE MOST OF ANY VISIT TO NYC ... Remeber its NYC !!

Reviews.Title: “Room too Small”
Reviews.Author: cassie1565
Reviews.Content: We found our accommodation for 2 adults inadequate as there was only 2 small drawers and one had a blanket init there was only 1bedside table and no writting surface.We would stay in the Hotel again as the staff were very helpful at all times.We felt we should have been offered to upgrade after we complained on the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but no luxury”
Reviews.Author: kzdallas
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location if you want to be right at Times Square and the theaters. It was an easy couple of blocks for us to go to theater, eat, shop, and see all of the activity day and night in Times Square. We also felt safe late at night walking from the theater as we were in the middle of the crowd. Plenty places to eat -- fast food, delis, Sbarro -- that sort of thing, and tee shirt shops, gifts, etc. The hotel itself is old; it has been renovated, but the rooms are still small (typical of many hotels in NYC, however). But there wasn't even a desk or bureau in the room. The TV on the wall, one chair and lamp, two beds, small bathroom, energy-saving lights that took a long time to get bright enough to put on makeup. The hallways are quite dark. Ditto for elevators. People are very friendly and helpful. For the price, I would much prefer the NY Hilton on Ave. of the Americas. Prettier, bigger rooms, much bigger lobby with restaurants and shops. But the Paramount's big asset is its proximity to Times Square and the theaters. Had another great meal at Angela's Rock and Roll Deli on 6th Avenue just South of Central Park. Great breakfast last year and lunch this year, both at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “The smell is unbearable.”
Reviews.Author: AnnoyingTravelCompan
Reviews.Content: They "scent-brand" their hotel. In other words, clouds of sickening, tacky perfume waft through every inch of the first floor and hang on your personal belongings long after you leave. Visually, this place tries to be hip, but fails. The location is good though. And the service adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: greenday41
Reviews.Content: I didn't think this hotel was that special in the beginning, but when I stayed at the Hudson in April there was just no comparison. I just kept wishing I was at the Paramount instead. It was clean and the rooms really aren't that small, they were quite spacious and very comfortable. The bathroom was big and mostly clean. The location was brilliant. The staff were all helpful and friendly, especially the door staff. Compared to the Hudson it was very quiet, not noisy at all. There was nothing bad to say about it. I'd recommend this hotel to anybody going to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great, location, great pillows, shame the staff only pay lip service to problems, but do nothing about it”
Reviews.Author: JulesRW
Reviews.Content: Arrived with 10 friends, for 3 day stay. Beds and rooms too small to accomodate families, ( one of our families a group of 3 was given 1 single bed for all 3 on first night!!!) No wardrobe space, in fact, did I say, no space full stop! One families case was tampered with and our personal belongings (toiletries) were removed. The hotel staff were not concerned and although they claimed to involve security, we waited for security but they didnt turn up. Even though they knew we had a flight to catch! Generally a nice modern hotel from a foyer perspective but the rooms and service let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: viet_mai
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, the staff were friendly, helpful and were willing to go that extra mile to please there guest. Its less then a minutes walk to time square which is the centre of all the transport links. Shops, restaurant and everything you could think of is just a stone throw away. The hotel was clean, tidy and very quiet... there was free access to the gym and the maid came in every day.. However the downside is the room and bathroom are very small for 2 people, but that didnt really bother me as i was only in there to wash and sleep as i spent most of the time elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice hotel, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CraigWright
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this hotel for a week mid April and whilst the weather wasn't as good as last year this hotel was very good. Location wise it is in a prime location literally a 2 minute walk from Times Square. The hotel itself is very modern looking both inside and out and the staff where very helpful and friendly. I cannot comment on the food as we did not eat here instead we found eating out better for both choice, quantity and price. The rooms themselves whilst certainly not the largest in New York where clean and modern looking with cable tv and basic amenities. But if you're like us you dont come to New York to sit in your room but just to sleep there and you come for the sights. In which case the bed itself was very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room if you can get an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Croissant34
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 15th April for 6 nights. Originally booked a standard double room which was nice but NOT for two people. A 'standard' double bed is smaller than a UK double and a squeeze for two people - more like a single and a half, but the bed was cosy (in fairness we had been travelling since 6am and were shattered so could have slept anywhere). This is the only issue we had as we felt to sell the 'double' rooms here to two people was pretty misleading and unfair as the double is NOT a standard double bed. The double room is literally that - a bed with space to put your luggage down but no space to walk around. A double only has one bed side table and is very close up to the window were the air con vent is. Asked for a room move/upgrade but were told there was nothing for the 15th but to try again the next day. We were moved to another double, but this was even smaller in size, with the bed against the wall and a tiny bathroom so we moved back. We mentioned this was our honeymoon to reception the next day and were given a complimentary upgrade to a king size room which was a huge room with a much bigger than standard UK king bed - it's a super king size bed and one of the comfiest beds we have ever slept in. If you want an upgrade, go early so you can get the rooms on people checking out. Our new room was massive, however, small rooms do exist and numerous people did complain over the lack of space Rooms were cleaned nicely everyday. Great cocktails on the 1st floor bar with friendly barstaff and a lovely reasonably priced coffee shop downstairs which is a chain. The hotel is literally 15 seconds from Times Square and is a great location. After the 1st night you don't notice the noise of the streets outside. Only thing that is not mentioned is checkout is 12pm and if you need to store luggage until your flight, it is $2 per bag and does not include small bags which you can attach to suitcases. We would stay again as it was a great location and a trendy, clean hotel, but will definately book either a twin double or a king.

Reviews.Title: “wrong room + 2am wake up call!”
Reviews.Author: 190727Ali
Reviews.Content: We originally wanted to book the New Yorker but they could not accommodate us as we wanted a 2 x double bed room so our daughter could spend the 2nd night with us as she was visiting us from New Jersey. We arrived at the hotel to be told there wasn't a 2 x double bed room available and we could have a king room for the first night, then change to the correct room the following day - we were offered a complimentary breakfast for all 3 of us on the 2nd morning as compensation. The "King" room was extremely small with no desk or wardrobe and the 2x double bed room wan't much bigger - there was just about room to move around the room if we were careful. The walls were thin enough for us to be able to hear the conversation in the neighbouring room until the early hours (not their fault, they were only talking, but we could hear). We eventually managed to get to sleep only to be woken by our phone ringing at 1.50 am (no reply when we answered) and 5 minutes later there was a knock on the door. When I opened it I was told by the man in a grey uniform that there was a mix up and he had been asked to check whether the room was occupied. On checking out next morning we asked why this had happened and the receptionist had no knowledge of anyone being sent to check our room - does this mean their security is lax enough to let anyone wander around knocking on doors or are they just totally disorganised? Why should they need to know if we were in the room at 2am? We won't be using this hotel again (and that's without the bed bug protest outside).

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever.”
Reviews.Author: AbbieATL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not just uncomfortably small, the staff is extremely rude and neglectful. I had gotten an autographed Phantom of the Opera poster during my trip, and I stored it high on top of my suitcase so the cleaning staff wouldn't accidentally hurt it. Well, I returned the next day to find a pile of clothes on top of my poster, leaving it completely crumpled up. I contacted the staff to file a complaint and hopefully get a little compensation (since the value of my poster was diminished since it was crushed) and they were completely unhelpful. It was a fight just to get them to let me file an incident report, and then the worker I dealt with while filling out my report was EXTREMELY rude. They told me that they would get in touch with me soon about the ordeal and my compensation...it's been over a year and I haven't heard a word. Seriously, DO NOT stay at this hotel. It's awful.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay--great Times Square location with nice but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tar Heel Bill 92
Reviews.Content: I recently was in Manhattan on 3 separate occasions with a group of colleagues/clients and customers, and we stayed each time at the Paramount Hotel near Times Square. Each visit was a single night, so we had quick trips through Manhattan! The hotel is superbly located if you want a Times Square location--it is just a single block away. (Normally I detest such touristy locations but my colleagues and clients love such a location!) The lobby sets a very chic, contemporary and minimalist mood from the moment you enter the property. My colleagues and clients all loved it. Rooms are definitely on the smaller size, but that is pretty standard for Manhattan in my opinion. All rooms had the same design sensibility, with a very minimalist style and chic pops of color--very utilitarian but also very stylized as well. Bathrooms were all a wee bit on the cramped side, but everything worked very well. Single queen bed rooms felt a little smaller but still had all the essentials. Double rooms with 2 double beds definitely felt bigger and roomier. The hotel upgraded me for all 3 visits with a suite, and the suites were very nice--a roomy living room and the same size king bed single room with small bathroom (plus an extra bathroom for the living room). For $209 per night as the group rate, I felt the Paramount gave us a very good deal, especially when compared to other Manhattan hotels in the vicinity. Service was fairly prompt and pleasant. Twice I needed someone to come up and turn off a radiator in my bathroom, and twice someone came within 10-15 minutes to take care of the problem. Room service was prompt and fairly decent, if a little expensive, something you expect in Manhattan, after all. The Dean & Deluca in the lobby entry area was very convenient, as well. All in all, I've stayed many times for work at the Paramount, and they didn't disappoint again.

Reviews.Title: “The only place in NYC we will stay from now on.”
Reviews.Author: Anmurillo
Reviews.Content: I am not a letter writer, but after our amazing experience at the Paramount I had to write a review! The staff were amazing, kind and funny. The room was so comfortable, the bed and pillows made us sleep like babies.. We loved the Paramount.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in the middle of Times Square and convenient to Metro and Central Park.”
Reviews.Author: The_Boulevardier
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to friends who want to stay close to all the action of Times Square, want easy access to the Metro and Central Park, and do not mind navigating through hordes of tourists to get to the best NYC has to offer. The price was great for the room size offered. The hotel is located in a prime location too. The reception staff was great, super friendly and very helpful. A++ to them all. But, the first night there was a lot of noise in our 3rd floor hotel room from what sounded like someone was pounding on vent or steam pipes. It could have also been from mechanical equipment located outside our window. We had to move to another room the next day, but the staff was super helpful. The second room was on a higher floor and much quieter. The hotel also seemed a little "worn." It seems like it is ready for another remodel as the decor and mood seemed a little outdated.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION, EXCELLENT HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: Plumbobs
Reviews.Content: After booking the Paramount Hotel, and after reading some of the reviews,we had reservations, but we had not need to worry. Our trip to New York was our first and was to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. The hotel had upgraded our room to a Superior Deluxe King Size and on arrival we were pleasantly surprised with the size. The room was well equipped and had ample room, so I can't understand what all the moaning's about! The room was cleaned daily, with fresh towels and linen. Although we didn't eat in the hotel, I understand that the restaurant is good. The location couldn't be better. Two minutes down the road, and you're in Times Square. Lots to see and do and everything is on your doorstop. Staff were very helpful. We would have no hesitation in return to the Paramount....Thank you for making our stay a happy one!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in heart of NYC!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trish8182
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the location of this hotel is second to none!! 50m from Times Square and in the heart of the action!!! The hotel is beautiful, very warm and inviting!! The rooms are fantastic, no issues with size at all... comfortably fit 2 large suitcases and a multitude of other bags... Dean and Delucas downstairs is very handy!! Great coffee, snacks and pastries!!! All the staff at the Paramount are lovely and happy to help with any queries. Really is an exceptional hotel and cant wait to travel back to NYC and book our next stay here! Have already recommended it to friends and they have booked there stay here! Only suggestion I can make to improve is free wi-fi!!! That would be awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at your hotel. Great location just 2 min walk to Times Square. The staff was exelent and very friendly. The hotel and the room was clean and treandy. The european brekfast buffet was to die for. I would defenitly come back.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: scottish_scrooge
Reviews.Content: When we booked to go to New York we looked at what hotels were available near times square. This hotel came up with a fantastic location, good reviews and a price half that of other hotels in the area. When you enter the hotel you have a real feel for a boutique hotel, dark (whatever time of day), club type music, and trendy dressed staff. Check in was a breeze and we were told we would be on the 18th floor. We rode the elevator (small lift, and 3 of the 4 were working during our stay). When we entered the room we expected it to tbe small given the reviews on here but hadn't really appreciated just how small it would be. The room had no drawers, dressing table and a tiny closet. The bed was up against one wall and you could touch the other wall when in the bed. When out of bed it was a struggle to have 2 people in the room getting ready at the same time. The bathroom was actually a good size and the room overall was clean (more on that later though!). The staff were friendly and the hotel overall was in decent shape. Within the hotel is a small bakery shop where you can get water/croissants etc. and faces out onto the street - a good place to stop by for breakfast. To get to Times Square it's literally a 30 second walk out of the fron door. Amazing location. when we checked out we left our bags with the concierge ($2 charge per bag) and went to spend our final day in New York, when we left the hotel we say a giant rat warning about bed bugs in the hotel (check out our posted pics on here for evidence). Not sure what it was all about but I'm glad we weren't staying another day in this hotel after seeing that. Overall the hotel plus points are the location, the down points are the room size and potential of bed bugs (yeuch!). All in all don't regret staying here but don't think I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply the worst hotel experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Southernboy82
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is the first time I have ever written a review, but the paramount hotel was so bad I felt I had to comment. Firstly, the rooms are tiny, with virtually no hanging space and are very dimly lit. Our first room had a fly infestation in the shower, we asked to be moved, and although the bellboy was prompt and helpful, there was no apology or offer of any compensation for the infestation or inconvenience of having to move. Our second room had a wet room style bathroom, and the drain was blocked enough to flood the bathroom floor. There were also more flies in the bathroom (not an infestation, but one is still too many). There were mildew marks on the door, and no fan in bathroom so there was a constant damp smell throughout the room. On our final night, I was told that my credit card was declined, and after speaking to a very unhelpful receptionist, it turned out they had been charging $75 per day on a PREPAID room as some sort of security deposit, without ever telling me it was happening. Avoid this place at all costs, you're better off sleeping in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paramount as part of a six day trip to NYC. Check-in was very swift - despite reception staff not initially being able to find my reservation. That small matter was cleared up, and no further problems. The room was excellent - I was already aware that it was not the biggest room in the world, so the size of the 18th floor room was not a surprise. It was fine for me, but maybe for a couple or more would have been too small. THe room was extremely clean and modern. The housekeeping staff were excellent, always clean when I returned after a day in NYC. The hotel was close to subway - very convinent for sightseeing. One of the main supports of my visit was to see hockey, and an easy 15 minute walk to MSG. I would fully recommend hotel, and would definately stay there on a return visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Azubaid
Reviews.Content: Not the biggest rooms of New York hotels, but when you're on vacation you shouldn't be in the room unless you're sleeping! Though it's literally half a block from Times Square, we could still hear the sounds of New York at night (trucks, the occasional car horn, and the occasional drunk) The staff made up for any shortcomings in a restful night's sleep. Natalie, the receptionist who checked us out even convinced us to stay at the Paramount during our next visit to New York with her professionalism and positive personality. Prices are definitely the best in the area and worth every penny. Thank you Paramount for a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location / No Minibar in the room”
Reviews.Author: Nedim_g
Reviews.Content: + : good location, design hotel, not expensive - : found hair in the bathroom, small rooms, no minibar in the room !!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: juliancaso
Reviews.Content: Our experience in the Paramount Hotel was good. The room was incredibly small (never seen something like this in my life). Me and my girlfriend couldn't open our bags at the same time... But as we were on vacations, we didn't worry so much and enjoyed NY! The location is amazing, half a block from the heart of times square.

Reviews.Title: “A really good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bryzo40
Reviews.Content: The last reveiwer from London should retract their review, They have obliously never stayed in New York before, Rooms on the whole are smaller as space is premium. The bed bug protest is a union protest against the owners who in 3 locations in Manhatten are using cheap/ non union workers to move asbestos. the protests are city wide, the bed bug thing is using a non substanciating review on trip advisor. The hotel is clean, fashionable, staff are attentive. ( if you arrive anywhere at a busy time the staff WILL BE BUSY) Its a good place to stay with a fantastic location. it is not budget it is not particularly cheap. Its New York. Due to illness i had to return home 3 days early and the staff where particularly helpfull and did not push for any payments for cancelled nights. Karen in particular helped me through a particularly stressfull time. In a New York hotel most of us look for clean, reasonable price, service, LOCATION and a wee bit History. This hotel fits the bill. Certain people are just negative no matter how much positive you throw at them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel6444
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one weeknight a few weeks ago. The location is very close to Times Square and easy walking distance to everything. It was also easy to grab a cab from here, going uptown or downtown. The rooms are very small, but clean, and it is perfectly fine for a couple of nights, especially if you are not planning to stay in the room very long. However, I was not impressed with the customer service - doing the easy checkout, I did not receive a bill. Realizing I needed a bill for an expense report, I have called the front desk and the Accounting department for the past week requesting one. I still have not received an email or phone call back. Very disappointing, considering it would take all of five minutes to email me a bill. Don't expect this hotel to go out of their way for you. Also, the room service and bar do not open until 5 pm, and don't expect them to serve you at 4:59 p.m. either.

Reviews.Title: “What a confortable, agreable and warm place, Paramount Hôtel”
Reviews.Author: mount_11
Reviews.Content: The Paramount hotel is a beautiful and very clean place well located. Your personnel including doormen are kindly professonal. I booked for a journey and I passed an agreable night at your hotel by the comfort of your bedroom, bathroom, dining room...etc; every thing for me was clearly clean at 100%. The choice of your various breakfast is healthy, delicious and plentiful. Excelent idea no loss time, the day of departure the check out was done earlier in the morning by an envelope slided under the door. I recommand Paramount Hôtel

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, leave it alone.”
Reviews.Author: smphilp
Reviews.Content: The initial surly attitude of the staff set the tone nicely, for what would be a memorable for all the wrong reasons 6 night stay at this hotel. Booked with my girlfriend for a stay based on the fantastic location and on the face of it good value for a standard double room. The room was tiny and the bed even smaller still. If we spooned we might just have both got on the bed. We returned to speak to the manager who produced a well used sheet specifying bed sizes, obviously a complaint they received on a regular basis. After no small amount of complaining they did agree to move us to another room, which was cleaned to a higher standard (wasn't sure of the relevance at the time) and a larger bed for that evening and the promise of a move to a larger room the next day. The following morning we walked out of the hotel to see a large inflatable promoting the fact the hotel had received complaints from guests that had been bitten by bed bugs. We returned that evening and switched rooms to a larger room with a queen bed where we remained for the remaining 5 nights. The shower was weak, the water temperature tepid at best and the sink slow to drain. You could also not sit on the toilet properly as it was squeezed in next to a radiator. There was no fridge / mini bar or tea / coffee making facilities in the room. On closer inspection, thankfully when we were packing up to come home we noticed the room itself remained very dusty and had obviously not been cleaned properly for some time. Dust was laying thickly on the tops of the pictures / tv and along the coving. We did receive 4 free drinks tickets to the bar, but the cocktails were not great either. All in all, if you can choose somewhere else nearby as you will wish you spent a little more on a better room or look further afield. It was handy being so close to TImes Square but with so much else to see in the city this will quickly wear off.

Reviews.Title: “Victim of rip off ?”
Reviews.Author: Oggy7224
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in December after a Carribean cruise. A reward after my retirement after 30 years as a Police officer. We arrived very early on the Friday morning and were quickly checked into our room. A good start as we wanted as much time as we could to explore New York. We had booked a double room via a travel agent who we have used for many of our holidays. On entering our room we were confronted by a single bed. I asked a chambermaid on the floor what type of room this was, and she confirmed it was a single room.(She did not see my partner in the room.) I returned to the reception and spoke to the lady who checked us in. I stated that there had been a mistake and we had been given a single room, and the room was not a double room as stated on the booking form which i had with me. At this point she stated that the room was a double room. I pointed out the fact that if it was a double bed why was there only one set of pillows, and invited her to come and look at the bed. She merely stated that she had worked there 6 years and she knew her rooms. I informed her that i had spoken to a chambermaid who confirmed to me it was a single room. On being confronted with this she changed her tact by stating that i had got what had been ordered by my travel agent. Basically she put the blame on them. I stated that the room was not suitable, confirmed to her that it was a single room and a double room had been booked. She checked the system and stated that a twin room was available for an extra $30 per night. I reluctantly accepted this offer. I returned to my partner who was still in the single room. Outside was what turned out to be one of the senior bell boys. I asked him what type of room i had been given. He could see my partner. He would not say what type of room it was. On returning to the UK i spoke to my travel rep, who along with a New York agent confirmed a double room had been booked. Despite being contacted several times the Hotel have refused to reply. To me that says it all. I can only assume that this was an attempt to extract more money from their visitors by the Hotel. In fact they only got $30 extra off me for the two nights as i made my feelings known to the staff who said i could have the room for £15 per night extra. As i knew that this was a con i did not eat, drink or spend any more money at this hotel. If they had offered an upgrade when i arrived, showed me the twin room, i would have taken up their offer. They would have got the $60 per night, plus breakfasts drinks etc for two nights. My travel agent has refunded my extra outlay at this hotel as gesture of good will.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to NYC this weekend to be full on tourists. We stayed at the Paramount which was the perfect choice. The location couldn't have been better. Half a block away from the heart of Times Square. Block away from the Imperial Theater where we saw Billy Elliot and enjoyed a pre-show meal at Sardi's. We arrived at the Paramount at noon on Friday and got a room right away. This room had view of the wall of the next building so we asked to get a room with a view. It wasn't available until after 3 so we checked our bags and went visiting with friends until check-in. The room was exactly what we wanted! Much bigger than the first although still small, which was to be expected. VERY comfortable bed! Cool room. Friendly staff. Perfect location. Great price. Paramount - a must for the NYC Tourist who wants it all.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Fault It!!”
Reviews.Author: spryio
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight travelling from London and were staying at the Paramount hotel for 6 nights. When we checked in we were immediately upgraded to a King Deluxe from a standard double and were over the moon and very impressed with the service of Lorenzo. The room was on the 17th floor, 1709, and was clean, spacious as was the built in closet and the en-suite bathroom. All facilites in the room, including the iPod dock, tv and safe worked without any problems. The room was cleaned and we were provided with new towels daily. On top of the fantastic room and hotel itself, the location is just amazing. You are bang in the middle of Times Square which is close to all theatres and shops as well as subways (which we used all week to take us everywhere for $29pp weekly). While there we saw the Addams Family musical, which is right next door, and found it to be a great show. Something else we did which I would reccomend (if you have the time) is a night out to Atlantic City. The guy at the Concierge told us to book with Hamptons Luxury Liners, the coach is $5 return and you get a $5 token for Resorts Casino (so you basically go for free). This was a great recommendation as it was just as he had said and saved us a lot of money by not going on the Greyhound bus! In summary the Hotel is great, the location is fantastic and all the staff are helpful and very friendly. If we do ever go back to NY the only place we would stay would be the Paramount!! p.s The burgers in the hotel are AMAZING!! and the Patzeria next door do great food all day and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, teeny tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Laughable
Reviews.Content: Location is great - central mid town and easy access to everything and everywhere. Lobby and bar are great, standard rooms are very clean but are TEENY. I mean you can almost touch each wall with out stretched arms! Had a great trip even though the rain was torrential - !!!! Would I return - YES why wouldn't I return - it's New York but the Paramount Hotel, mmmm maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Located in the Heart of the Theater District”
Reviews.Author: lurcherm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of the theater district, easily within walking distance of Times Square, and Restaurant Row. The hotel is modern in theme and upscale in decorations. Rooms in most New York City hotels are typically smaller and this one is no exception. However, what it lacks in size, it makes up for in quality and staff friendliness. The bar, restaurant and amenities were high priced but considering it's location, it is reasonable for the area.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ldv04
Reviews.Content: Me and my Girlfriend stayed at the paramount for one week (1st week of March) I decided to contact the hotel before I left home to see if there would be anything they could do to make my trip that little bit more special as I was going to propose during my time in N.Y. I received an email from Madeline Coleman (Hotel employee) who was very humble in her email and seemed to actually care about the hotels customers, not only that Ms Coleman upgraded my room to a King size and supplied a congratulations cake and champaign. Wow, I couldn't wait to get there. Once we arrived the staff were very pleasant and understood that I need my upgrade to be hush hush. We got our upgrade and the extra's of which were excellent. As for the room, cleaned everyday, Few problems with the heating, and the walls a very thin (if you catch my drift) restaurant was awful (service was very bad) Over all we would welcome a return to the hotel, location is excellent as with the staff. Thank you guy's!!! Mr Cunningham

Reviews.Title: “Great location - be beware of bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: serap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paramount for 1 night at the end of our trip to the States. We had booked with another hotel, which was fully booked when we arrived, so we were sent to the Paramount instead. The hotel foyer is beautiful and it is excellently located just next to Times Square. The room was very small, but really well decorated and kitted out - it had a really funky look to it and the bed was comfortable. I did feel a little claustrophobic when getting ready in the morning, but they have done the very best they can with the space. The hotel in general was very trendy, with almost a nightclub atmosphere which for me was little impersonal, but still a good experience. The staff were very helpful - especially the door-men, who ordered cabs and gave us local information. The main problem was that upon leaving the hotel in the morning, we were met with a giant inflatable rat warning us that there had been complaints about bed bugs at the hotel. Sure enough, later that morning, a bite came up on my leg. This is obviously a problem that the hotel need to get rid of as soon as possible. Also, not having free WiFi is quite irritating, as so many hotels in this price bracket now do - and the hotel that we had originally booked did (we always choose hotels with free WiFi where possible).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Times Square”
Reviews.Author: chrispragid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel early March. All i have to say is Oh My God! The service was amazing! The room was beautiful! Great location! Highly recommend this hotel! I cannot emphasize enough how good the customer service was. Absolutely impeccable!

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Fun Mom / Daughter getaway”
Reviews.Author: elainethepetsitter
Reviews.Content: We stayed March 13 - 17, 2011 and had a wonderful stay. We had a room with 2 beds that were extremely comfortable and a step-in shower stall that was perfect for my senior mom. The housekeeping was exceptional, spotless everyday. We felt safe the whole time at the Paramount. Everyone was very friendly - doorman, checkin, luggage guys, etc. This was my second stay at Paramount. The first time was with my husband, and when I saw the shower stall I knew it would be easy for my mom to get in and out. A big issue when we travel. Great location in Times Square. Don't worry about the room size in NYC, there's too much to do and see to fret over such things. A few of my favorites: Patzeria's take-out pizza next door (friendly guys!); Junior's bakery hostess cupcake and Junior's challah bread sandwiches; Edison cafe for breakfast (cash only and very affordable).

Reviews.Title: “Second Thoughts”
Reviews.Author: walterdenise3boys
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Paramount once before and I found it not a bad place to stay. I had to do a 2 night business trip in Manhattan and thought I would try it again. I had checked in early and knew there would be no room available. The person who preregistered me was extremely friendly and said that she is going to give me a nice upgrade. So later that day when I go to check in, i am given the room number. 3rd floor??? thats not always a good sign for an upgrade. I walked into the room and it was TINY. In fact very bare with this bare wall next to the bed. It appeared that the room didnt even have a window. But I was mistaken, there was one off to the side that had NO view at all. So I thought to myself, This is a "nice upgrade"?? I decided to call the front desk and see if there was a mistake. Couldnt do that as my phone didnt work. So I go downstairs as it was not very far away and the person said yes that was an upgrade. I would have hated to see what they were going to origionally put me in. I went back up to the room and had problems signing onto the internet. So I decide to call the front desk from my cell phone. Well that was a mistake. After ringing 50 times, it goes to a rude operator, who doesnt want to listen and transfers me again. It rings back to her and she was busy gabbing to her friend as I could hear it in the background and then she just hangs up the phone. It took almost 15 minutes until I got someone. So for a business traveler I would have NO use to use this hotel again. For a family traveler, you couldnt put more then 1 person in the room as they are so small. For a hotel that trys to gain new customers you should really work on your customer service and when you tell someone you are going to give a "nice upgrade" then give them an upgrade. By doing what you did you lost a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Jewel in the heart of Times Square!”
