Reviews.Author: Bluespetal
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised to find and stay in this lovely hotel! The people could not have been friendlier or more professional, the rooms were like little bedrooms but so lovely! I have stayed in some of the most expensive hotels in NYC and beyond...and would not hesitate to recommend or revisit the Paramount. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous service, good location though!”
Reviews.Author: tobyoclinton
Reviews.Content: Where to start? We arrived and were given a single room, we rang down to reception, politely we know these things happen but we were told we were wrong it was definately a double. I had to take pictures and show them and they still wouldn't accept it. They did relocate us and the next morning we spoke to reception to just highlight our worry that this would be happening to other customers (we are travel agents and don't want our customers experiencing this kind of thing). We were again accused of being wrong and the receptionist couldn't understand our main issue was with the customer service. Throughout whenver the original or subsequent members of staff on reception saw us they averted their eyes and we didn't once get an apology. It may seem trivial but the staff throughout were either rude or plain ignorant. I must say there was a doorman who was very helpful and friendly but one in a million in that place. I must say every room we saw was very clean and well presented. yes the rooms are small but most are in the same price range in NYc. I'd say you get more space but worse standard or smaller space but higher standard with similar hotels. Location wise you're 30seconds, literally, from Times Square but a hotel can't rely purely on this. Overall a very disappointing stay due to the customer service, it's amazing how a view on a hotel can be really affected by that. Not great either when I'm an agent and am supposed to offer this hotel as an option!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location in Fantistic NYC.”
Reviews.Author: ZOOMER87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastically located off Broadway and Times Square. It was a great base for you to stay a and to go on to explore this fantastic city. We stayed in a double room, which was well kept, cleaned and maintained daily. Despite the fact that the room itself suffers from lack of room space and wardrobe space, the comfy bed makes up for this. The rooms look trendy and chic which we admired. Me and my wife are the 'get up on go' type of people, therefore we did not rely on the staff that work here, but where required they dealt with any enquiries professionally and promptly. Furthermore, the lobby is very stylish and sophisticated, and filled with a pleasant aroma in the air. On the down side, we would have liked to have tried breakfast here but found the price of it rather expensive, so therefore we had breakfast in and around many cafes that were dotted around nearby. If the hotel, decided to make changes to price of breakfsat they could be on to a winner! To sum up we wanted a place which was conveniently located, clean, modern and boast a comfy bed. All in all, we got that. So if you share the same requirements then look no further than Paramount Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfy Bed, Loud HVAC”
Reviews.Author: GringoWim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 14 year old son stayed here a few weeks back, and I must say I really liked this hotel. My only three complaints would be: 1. As others have stated here, the loud heating unit. When we arrived in NY, it was about 30ºF outside, and when we arrived in our room it was a crisp 62º. We cranked up the heat, and eventually the room warmed up, but we too were awoken two of the three nights we stayed here by the heating unit. We had a suite, so it was quite spacious. And anyone complaining about the room size didn't take the time to look at the rooms on the hotel's website. You can tell how small they are by the photos. That's why we opted for a suite. 2. The hot water was a bit hit or miss. One morning I had to take a very lukewarm shower, more towards chilly. Then my wife took a shower 10 minutes later and her water was fine. Maybe they have boiler problems? 3. My biggest beef, eventually resolved by management, was that when I made my reservation, via the hotel website, my rate (around US$375/night) included breakfast for all three of us. Considering the breakfast costs US$28 (or thereabouts) I thought that would be a nice savings. Granted there is are numerous cafes and restaurants in the vicinity, including a Dean and Deluca in the hotel lobby, where you can eat for much less. Anyway, when I asked the receptionist at check-in about breakfast, she said it was not included on my reservation. After accessing the hotel website in front of her (love my iPad!) she finally went and talked to the manager and promptly gave me vouchers for daily buffet breakfasts for all of us. And the breakfast layout is actually quite nice, with lots of pastries, fresh eggs, waffles, etc. All in all, our room was quite nice, the concierge was helpful several times, the staff always seems to be smiling, it is a very intl. clientele this hotel caters to. And being half a block from Times Square is nice. In addition, 46th is "Restaurant Row", (try Becco one block away, the ossobucco is to die for) you could spend a month here and never eat in the same restaurant twice, all within about a 4 block radius. We ate Italian, Vietnamese, Southern BBQ, a delicious hamburger, etc. all within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. I can definitely recommend the Paramount, bite the bullet and pay a little bit extra for a larger room, and keep your fingers crossed that they repair the noise HVAC.

Reviews.Title: “bad service, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveler3342
Reviews.Content: This hotel will let you down if you are looking for customer service. Hotel workers look for a quick buck without going an extra mile. There is no ice machine available in the hotel other than 4th floor. They place buckets next to the ice machine without proper sanitation. It looks dirty and no covarage for the buckets at all. I tried to get a clean bucket for 30-45 mins without a luck. I went from bar to all the way to hotel management and finally gave up and fill the ice in a target shopping bag. The room and bathroom were extremely small. So, I would suggest you to go to Interercontinantal instead. That is what I will be doing next time.

Reviews.Title: “How could it be better?”
Reviews.Author: ancat
Reviews.Content: We just have spend 4 night at the Paramount. 4 perfect nights. The room was perfect, big enough (I do not understand the complain about the size of the rooms! Please come in Europ and taste the standard size of the rooms...), very very clean, beautiful and well furbished! The bed was just unbelievable!! I slept better there than in my own bed! The location is perfect and absolutely not noisy at all. We never heard any noise from the streets or from the other rooms. And we sleep all night with open windows!! The concierge was very Nice and hepfull. The only little minus we have is about the price of the WIFI... Come on guys! 15 dollars a day when it s free WIFI in almost all restaurants, subway and all over Times Squares? You can do better, for sure. Anyway, despite this little minus, we had a perfect stay, in a beautiful hotel, in the best location.... And for a very good price!! We will definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Times Square and good price”
Reviews.Author: mrrussellcoight
Reviews.Content: The Paramount is a 2 minute walk to Times Square which is great, The rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. Front desk staff were friendly at check-in but did vary at different times. The only issue was our TV remote did not work, now I realise that this is a minor issue but at the end of a long day/night out it is good to be able to lie on the bed and catch up on what is happening in the rest of the world. I won't go into a long description of the process but basically it took 4 calls to reception, a day and a half to get the problem solved and that was done by upgrading us to another room. We challenge anyone to find a better value quality hotel in such a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aldenir
Reviews.Content: Stylish and very well located hotel (in the heart of Times Square), however, my worst stay in NY. Me and my sister found just one bed in the room (the smallest hotel room I've ever seen, we couldn't even walk in the room) and we complained and asked about a change but there was a total indifference on hotel's part. I would care more for my guests, therefore, I do not recommend the hotel to anyone. Try a not so well located hotel but more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: thekop96
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 night stay at the Paramount Hotel. Must be said that the lobby area is one of the nicest and most trendy that I have seen at any hotel - the smell in the lobby is so nice (can't descibe the smell in words but it just puts you in a good mood!). Staff very friendly and helpful - our key card wouldn't work in the door when we first went up to the room but when I went back down to reception the girl sorted it in seconds. The room on the 4th floor was tiny, but that's to be expected in NYC hotels. It was a very clean room, however, and the maids serviced it each day. There was just one thing we found to be a little disturbing - the water pipes were extremely noisy, they made quite a loud banging noise (so much so that it actually woke us up on a couple of occasions). Not sure if it was just the part of the hotel we were in though. Overall a nice hotel and would certainly recommend it for a short stay as Times Square is literally outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: NausetBeach0
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a night in February. The Hotel is perfectly located just a few blocks from Times Square. Rachel checked us in and was very personable and helpful throughout the process. The Hotel is very hip and stylish with a chic lounge/bar off the lobby. I booked a double room and it was the perfect size. I loved the stylish decor of the room and it came with all the proper amenities; flat screen tv, ipod docking station, comfy bed, in-room safe, and wi-fi. Although small, the closet was well thought out and serves it's purpose. This is definitely a Hotel I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel. We had rats in our apartment!!”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyMc85
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Paramount we was allocated a room which was tiny. I had read reviews on here about the rooms being small but this was litterally shoe box sized. We complained as we had paid for a bigger room than the optional cheaper smaller ones. They said they allocated the tiny room to to us by mistake! (AS IF!) We was swapped into a nicer bigger room and thought we can now enjoy the rest of our trip. Wrong. On the second to last night my girlfriend was packing her case when she noticed all the hershey chocolate bags had been tampered with. Upon further inspection we had found that a RAT or Mouse had been into her suitcase, ate through 2 of her bags and ate a large chunk of her new york chocolate. It had then spat out all the silver foil into some of her boots and other clothes. I wish this was a joke but we was disgusted! We went to reception and they gave us another room to sleep in (which was crawling with bed bugs) and told us they was getting an exterminator in to sort the rat problem out asap. They offered us a free breakfast and gave us a refund for one night of our 7 night stay. I would not recomend this hotel to anybody unless you want a night that resembles a bush-tucker trial!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Loaction, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Travelfar123023
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Paramount for 6 days. (on the 5th floor) The hotel is perfectly located (right in the middle of Times Square) but at the same time just around the corner. The room was small - (to be expected in NYC) but the bed was very comfortable and the bedroom was spotlessly cleaned everyday . We also found the Reception staff to be very friendly and knowledgable and no question was too much bother to them........ Our only complaint was this: Not only was the heater very noisy, it was stuck on HOT for most of the time - so much so that we kept waking up in the middle of the night as if in a sauna..... The engineer was supposed to have fixed it - but it didn't seem to make any difference as I think the whole system in our room must have been broken. In the end we even asked if the heating could be switched off altogether........ as we figured we would rather be cold than boiling hot all night long. (I seriously felt like camping out in the corridor one night as it was a nice cool normal temperature!) but obviously I didn't. One other complaint- The reception and bar area is very smart/chic/hip? and beautifully done out - and yet the view from our room was overlooking an inside courtyard which had an 'upside down' plastic chair placed in the middle, with an empty beer bottle next to it? This was our view for the whole week - and I'm surprised that nobody moved it (it didnt go with the general nicenesss of the rest of the hotel)!!!! So would I stay here again? Yes I would, but I would advise anybody who isn't happy with their room to persevere in efforts to get moved to another room. I wish we had asked to to be moved on the very first day! p.s. coffee/tea making facilities would have been nice (but then I suppose the place downstairs wouldnt make so much money?)

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT LOCATION AND HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireGirl7
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to New York which was planned for our 40th birthdays!!! The hotel was really good, if we had any issues, the reception staff would promptly sort it out (the only issue was we hadn't enough towels - 3 in one room). We'd read on trip advisor that the rooms were small, which was somewhat true, but it's New York, where space is a premium, so it was adaquate for us. But the best thing about this lovely hotel, based in a beautiful building, was the location, just minutes from Times Square, where the shops, restaurants and things to do, stay open really late, so we got our sight seeing out of the way during the day, then stayed close to the hotel, in Times Square, in the evenings. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lauraebassett
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, well staffed and friendly. The check-in was quick and painless and Lorenzo went above and beyond for us. The beds were comfortable and the showers were fantastic. I highly recommend the Paramount to anyone staying in the Times Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations, kids and parents wanted to stay longer.”
Reviews.Author: AllSeasonsTraveller
Reviews.Content: We visited New York for a last minute night in the city with our 4 kids over the winter break and had a fabulous stay at the Paramount. We had two rooms on the 8th floor and the hotel and it's staff were wonderful. Although the room with the king was a bit bigger than the room with two doubles but we found both rooms to quite inviting and up to the highest standards in terms of furnishings and amenities such as flat screen TV, wifi, and super comfy bedding. Even though the hotel seemed quite busy during our stay we found the staff in the lobby to be friendly and outgoing from our check-in to dinner reservations and sightseeing questions. We really liked the hotel's location - only a short half block walk to Times Square and the heart of midtown. Getting to the theaters, museum's, restaurants, and shopping was very easy from the Paramount. We also loved the vibe and energy of the lobby and lobby bar and the convenience of the Dean & Luca coffee shop right to the hotel. We will definitely stay here again and highly recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “First time in New York and what a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jamiep1984
Reviews.Content: First time in New York and what a wonderful hotel! My girlfriend and I arrived by airport shuttle! (Much cheaper than a yellow taxi), the room was ready by 3pm not a big wait. Unfortunately the room they gave us was a very small room on the 17th floor, one person might have struggled to stay there. We quickly returned to the reception and were able to switch to a bigger room on the 3rd floor which was so much better. It’s obvious they make sure customer service is paramount (pardon the pun) but I found that some reception workers were slightly arrogant. The room was equipped with all the usual suspects you would expect a 5 star hotel to provide, 32’’ flatscreen tv with a wide selection of popular channels and a ipod docking station which could also be used as an alarm clock. Rooms were clean and comfy. Bathrooms small but hey wasn't planning on having a party in there. The hotel has a very chic and classic styling with dimmed lighting to strange furniture gracing the hotel lobby; the door staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The location is excellent, you are minutes away from the heart of Times Square and not far at all from all the central major attractions New York City has to offer. Before booking check out their website and if you use Twitter make sure you follow @nycparamount for all the latest news like I did, also by keeping in contact with them this way they were able to provide an excellent deal on WIFI which was a massive help in organising what we were going to do that day. We are already planning our return and will be staying at the Paramount for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: jencooke
Reviews.Content: First time in New York and couldn't have chosen a better hotel. The location is half a block from Times Square and all the fun that offers. Theatre land is on the doorstep...Addams Family, Robin Williams (March) and Billy Elliot all in the same street as the hotel. Dean and Deluca on site - cup cakes to die for! Didn't use the restaurant or bar but staff gave us vouchers for $10 off the cost of the $28 breakfast if we wished to take it up. Next door is a takeaway deli, ideal for early morning/latenight coffee and snacks. Next door to that is the headquarters of the Church of Scientology - there was an hilarious demonstration one day outside there, with about 8 protesters put behind barriers with Police presence. One of the protesters was a burly fella and he was dressed in the skimpiest female clothing - if he was pre-op then the op wasnt needed as it was absolutely freezing! Arrived late on day 1 of our stay and the hotel was packed out due to valentines day coming up. Read reviews of the size of the rooms before we left home and our room was tiny. No where to put the 2 large suitcases we had, so off back to reception we went. Anca was on the desk and this girl saved our holiday for us. She was unable to find us an alternative room that night as it was fully booked but worked hard to find a solution, which she did. Next day we were moved to a bigger room with 2 doubles. Several times during our stay, Anca would approach us and check all was ok. Whilst waiting for our transfer to the airport, Anca came into work to start her shift. She came up to us and started chatting as she knew we were going home, I went to give her tip for her efforts and she refused, stating that it's her job and that's what she was there for...PARAMOUNT GIVE THIS GIRL A PAY RISE! Rooms were clean and comfy. Bathrooms small but hey wasn't planning on having a party in there. Free printing of boarding passes with plenty of computers available. Half a block to the TKTS ticket booths on Times Square 50% discount on that days shows, Hop - on Hop off bus stop and vistor centre...Great hotel and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: jitee1948
Reviews.Content: Had reservations about going to this hotel after reading reviews about it however I felt that the hotel was perfect for our visit. The room was not as big as I would have liked but it was adequate. The only other fault was that there was no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Would highly recommend this hotel and would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Magstar053
Reviews.Content: We arrived in NY very tired after a long journey, We were really disappointed with our allocated room, as it was small & very noisy because of an adjacent building's air conditioning system. We were offerred a much better room as soon as we informed reception we were not happy. Lorenzo on reception couldn't have been more helpful. A clean, well run hotel with good service all round. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: magsfeb2011
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel stayed from the 17th -21st Feb. We actually won this break and had a choice of 4 hotels and we were delighted with our choice as it is not even a 2 minute walk from Times Square. On arrival there was 4 people at the check in desks and even though there was quiet a few in front of us we were in our room in minutes. Got a free upgrade which was great . Cannot understand why people complained about the room size as all you do is sleep in it. Anyway our room on the 6th floor was big enough and would have fit single bed in with the king if required. Rooms were bright and airy and spotless . The cleaning staff came in everyday also. Did not eat at the hotel as we were out from early till late everyday but the coffee in the coffee shop within the hotel was fab as were the cakes. Hotel was also within walking distance of all the shows on Broadway. Will definatly stay here again should we York again :) Had a late flight home and did have the option of paying to check out late but didnt bother as we were able to store out bags for $2 per bag.

Reviews.Title: “clean, small but great lobby - you just can't recreate a previously great stay”
Reviews.Author: jacksondc
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here 4 times. the first was the best - the original iteration....charcoal walls, dramatic downlighting, wonderful vibe. the 2nd/3rd were the worst - bad renovation that took it to a motel 6/bad holiday inn experience. this one gets closer to the original, but not dramatic enough and not taking care of the facilities. the carpet is fine, the sink was bashed in and uneven. the rooms were hideously small, even the king deluxe which was 180 sq foot, some with a curved shower in the corner to conserve space. i can only imagine how small the rooms are with the one twin bed in them. YIKES! the window was broken so it was windy in the room all night. Plus a bar that closes at midnight. Won't return to this hotel. Front desk was pretty wonderful, however.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL, awesome location and fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: katedil
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at the paramount hotel for a week before xmas (15th - 22nd) We had never visited america before let alone new york so there aren't any hotels that I can compare it to just from our experience we found the staff so helpful, it was my boyfriends birthday while we were there so they upgraded our room for free! and gave us drinks vouchers!! the location couldn't get much better, literally a 1 minute walk from times square!!! the room was gorgeous, the bed huge! You could roll over 4 times without falling off it (we did this ha!) i've seen a few reviews saying the rooms are small but we didn't think this at all. it was perfect for us! the only small thing was the bath but with so much to do showers become your new best friend so you can get out quicker and do more!!! we are hoping to return to the paramount in september. DEFINITELY would reccomend staying here to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “it was mediocre”
Reviews.Author: _kayyyyy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and the hotel rooms are SMALL!!!!! First arrival there, the register counter was Small, there was ONE person working so we had to wait a little bit. Because we ordered our room through hotwire we didn't know what type of room we were getting, so when the representitive said standard I sounded kind of shocked. I've read reviews that standard was small but once he heard me sound iffy about staying in a standard room, his first reaction was sorry we're all booked out. Which i found kind of rude. It seemed like he just didn't want to go through the trouble and just said all booked up. He didn't bother checking or even letting me ask if we could switch. However, the lobby was very nicely decorated but once we got up, the hallways were TINY and dark. The elevators were also dark and small. Looked kinda shady. And as reviews said the room was TINY, I mean i expected small but not THAT small. I opened the door, and reach out and could already touch my bed and I'm 5"1. Literally the space between the bed and the walls was within my arm's reach. Not to mention the washroom was the size of my walk in closet and I live in a condo. However, if your just planning to just SLEEP in your hotel room, the price is great and the location is great. There was one thing though the heater was LOUD at night, it felt like i was going through a warzone at times. If your a very light sleeper, you might have trouble sleeping. If your planning to spend more time then just sleeping in the hotel room, you might want to reconsider a bigger room or a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Crystar the receptionist went above and beyond...”
Reviews.Author: NYC-Vacation2011
Reviews.Content: Recently, my apartment in Manhattan suffered water damage and I had to book a last minute hotel room for two nights. When I showed Crystar the pictures of the damage on my phone...she upgraded me to a nicer room, gave me two free drink certificates. I would definitely be sending my friends who visit NYC to the Paramount Hotel. It's nice to know that I wasn't just another guest...she went the extra step to turn a bad situation into a much better one. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Rooms , but Modern & Adequate”
Reviews.Author: DEFoodSnob
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location is very good; easy walk to the heart of times square. Room was modern and clean, and even the gym was nice. Cons: The Elevator and hallways are extremely dark. The standard room, about 10x10 is small, even by NYC standards and comes with a small bed (smaller than queen), you get about 3 feet of space around 3 sides of the bed. No desk in the room, no dresser, other than a little round table, no room to set anything. Internet is not free. No coffee maker in the room. No Bible in the room. The bathroom has a pedestal sink, so again, no room to set your toiletries. When people were loud in the hallway, you could hear them in your room. So if you just need a place to sleep it might be fine, but if you’re a business traveler like myself, it just lacks the space and basic items you would expect in any hotel, especially a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ahawaii1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was about 1 block away from Times Square. It was hip and fun. The room was clean. The mattress however was very worn in. Not comfortable. Overall, I would stay here again though. The restaurant in the hotel however had terrible service, the waitress was awful, I called to let the manager know and he offered to give us a full refund.

Reviews.Title: “Great room accomodations, not so great staff.”
Reviews.Author: corykool
Reviews.Content: I was traveling solo and needed a relatively inexpensive place to crash for the night. Found the Paramount online, and the rooms looked great and the price was right. Upon a lack luster greeting at the front desk, I was told I would need to walk two blocks in the snow to get toothpaste because they were 'out of kits' at the front desk. Further, the girl at the front acted totally put out when I asked if she could put my Netflix movie in the outgoing mail (the envelops sometimes get stuck in hotel mail shutes). I know it was a lot to ask [sarcasm], but give me a break. Next day, after asking about and getting the password for the wireless internet, I spent at least 20 minutes trying to figure out why I couldn't log in. Turns out, after speaking to support, its NOT FREE. Why did you give me a password? So bizarre - poor customer service. Overall experience left a bad taste in my mouth, but the rooms were nice. I'd probably not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Debsies
Reviews.Content: We couldn't fault the staff, especially those on reception. I want to mention "Cathy" and say a very big thank you to her for all of her help and for being so kind. Will definitely be staying at the Paramount on our next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Affordable and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: HouseLover77
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Paramount because it was literally right across the street from where my company "suggested" I stay (Marriott), but since it was almost $300/night and I wanted to add a couple personal days to my trip. The Paramount was over $200 dollars cheaper and I had not quams. Convenient to restaurants NOT part of Times Square (its on Restaurant Row/46th street-go towards and past 8th Ave.), has all of the on-site amenities you might need, a block from the pit of Times Square and several subway lines. No problem getting airport shuttles and/or taxis to pick up/drop off. Easy walk to Madison Square Garden (down 8th Avenue) if inclined. A few notes for those who might care: the Queens-sized bedroom only has a shower-no tub and does not have street views. Neither matter to me, but having read other reviews on this site, some do. The heater was quite loud, but it was working overtime as I was there during the Jan. 26/27 storm. Highly recommended, especially for price. I didn't buy breakfast, but settled for a latte and bagel elsewhere. There is an nice on-site Dean & Deluca's.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: hotoma
Reviews.Content: My husband had a meeting in New York, so we made it a long weekend & stayed here for 2 nights. It's a great hotel, and the location is right off Times Square. Can't be beat. They had upgraded us, for no particular reason which was fun, but we figure the upgrade must have only been the bedsize (from Double to Queen) because the room was miniscule. I can't compare to other New York hotels in the same class/location/price range, so maybe this is the norm.Being in NY after all, the idea is not to spend too much time there, right? But we happened to be there on a very awful day weather wise and were looking forward to a nice hot bath. The bathroom was on the same scale as the rest of the room (tiny!), and the tub was chipped and scratched. The hot water also ran out very quickly-nowhere near a tub-full! The staff was friendly, helpful & courteous, which was important to us.We only had a light meal in the hotel, which was very good but expensive ($13 for one glass of wine!) But overall, a very pleasant clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: vavab
Reviews.Content: For a couple of days in ny this hotel is very good. it is located btw 46st n 8th ave (2min from times square/broadway). The rooms are small but nice and clean. we stayed for 5nights and was absolutely satisfied with the hotel. Especially the service from Nathalie and Luis Calle was great. Paramount Hotel will definitely see me again ;)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & affordable with great location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler0195
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying in the Paramount, but the first time with our children. The location is unbeatable, convenient to shows, restaurants, Time Square, and Subways. The rooms are comfortable, with a modern decor. Kids enjoyed the large buffet breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep we have had in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: CMFQUEENS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and we stayed in a suite room 1026 I believe. It's a beautiful hotel and the space of the room was very generous for a New York city hotel. It was actually bigger then some of my family's apartments who live up there . It's very chic & clean. Our suite had two bathrooms an seperate living room. The bedroom portion completly closed off to the living room area with an additional door that requires a key for maximum privacy just in case if you were to have someone staying in the livng room portion (couch is very comfortable & a pull out.) Windows are double pane and open on top and bottom & living room has a mini fridge. It is very modern and furnishings are top notch, t.v. also swings out from the wall in the bedroom for maxium viewing when your in your cozy mode. Rooms also have central AC/Heat which you control. It's loctaion is wonderful and within walking distance to everything includng transportation. The staff was exceptional and worked in a timley manner, and Luis at the front desk was superb! The beds are amazing.....so much so that I had to find out what kind of mattresses they were using so I could look into purchasing this same kind for home. When I needed a few things from housekeeping they were right on it...my wait was only a few minutes. The water in the bathrooms seemed to stay hot forever, although it did take a long time to fill up a bath due to slower running water, but I didn't mind the wait. Overall my experienece was great. The only down falls to this hotel would be the extra charge for the business center/Internet use...I feel it should be free. But it is $3.00 for 8 minutes. They tell you at the front that it is $3.00 for 15 minutes but they are mistaken. We stayed for 3 nights and 4 days and have zero complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel at a decent price in the middle of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: mtsmith131
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, and for the price I cannot see how it could have been better. It is located on 46th Street, about 15-20 seconds walk from Broadway. Its location makes the rest of the city easily accessible and while we walked a lot, it was easy to walk to many places in the city from this point. The rooms were nice, though a little small. The same goes for the beds: nice, but small. Either the presence of a small locked door between our room and our neighbors, or the thin walls, made it difficult to sleep at first, as our neighbors were fighting about the condition of their luggage. However, this issue quieted relatively quickly, and the rest of the experience was enjoyable. The bathroom was quite large for a small room, but everyone was clean and looked new. The television was difficult to get working, but was flat screen and stylishly attached to the wall. The staff was helpful when we asked about places to get dessert in the area. Otherwise, it was a quick, but happy, stay!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to a great hotel in a fab location, this is the one for you!”
Reviews.Author: StephJ91
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed in the Paramount from January 29th to February 2nd. We arrived around 3.30pm and were greeted in reception (I think it was by Rachel?), she was extremely helpful and willing to give us advice on anything we asked about the hotel. We'd been booked into a single room (mistake on behalf of the travel agent), but were upgraded to a twin without charge or even having to ask! The staff were all very helpful and friendly and check in and out was quick and easy. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect, you are literally 100 metres from Times Square! The location couldn't really be better! Our room was on the 7th floor, and after reading some reviews on here I was expecting it to be tiny, but to be perfectly honest it was perfectly adequately sized, we had plenty of room for our suitcases and the shopping we accumulated throughout our trip (trust me, it was a lot!). The bathroom was a little on the small size, but it was was perfectly serviceable. At night when trying to get to sleep you could still hear some noise from outside, however you're pretty much in Times Square, so I guess that's to be expected, after all, it is the city that never sleeps... Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Paramount, the only thing we could fault is having to pay steep prices for internet access, maybe offering free wifi to guests would be a winner? Just a thought as I know a lot of other hotels in the area do... Steph.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you care about your health”
Reviews.Author: Gwilliam2011
Reviews.Content: I am the CEO of a large Internet company. On a business trip to New York City, I stayed at the Paramount, where I stayed several times in the past. I always liked the lobby with its stylish designer chairs, and other design elements of the hotel. This last trip was a disaster: the rooms in this hotel lack power outlets. If you're coming with a laptop, forget about recharging it. In every room, there is typically just one power outlet beyond reach beneath the main bed and you will need to kill your back and crawl all over the floor to find it, and then you will need room service to get you an extender. I've had to go through this painful procedure in former visits to this hotel. This time it took room service 90 minutes until I was set up to work. The rooms themselves are microscopic and inconvenient, those with claustrophobia, be warned. You will only have a few inches of room around the bed. New York is infamous for its overpriced accommodation but the Paramount takes value for money to new lows. My key criticism is about the heating in the room: it was insufficient, and at nights, the bathroom was almost freezing, due to poor insulation. After 3 nights at this hotel, I returned back home with pneumonia and was hospitalized for a week. I believe the cold room had much to do with it. I am never again returning to this hotel. Perhaps not as bad as the horror hotel in the movie with John Cusack, but the rooms in the Paramount hotel might very well kill their guests. So be warned, and stay away from this hotel if you care about your health.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, great value, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: flyingdjango
Reviews.Content: The Paramount is a great boutique hotel close to the action of Times Square but just enough off of it to feel as if you are out of the cheesy tourist traps that characterize midtown. The rooms are small but well designed for functionality so you don't feel cramped. But the best part is the warm and helpful staff that will bend over backwards to assist you with any problem. All of the staff here is helpful but Anamaria needs special commendation from me as you really went above and beyond to help me in my last two stays here. Thanks Anamaria and Paramount.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for short solo trip”
Reviews.Author: amp94596
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed here since the mid 90's. But, I had heard that it had been remodeled with new beds and bath tubs. No longer was the mattress on the floor. The service was excellent, the staff very helpful and I had a great night sleep each of my three nights. Now, the rooms are very tiny. You can barely get around the bed. But as a solo traveler it was fine. Plus the location is great and much quieter than right in the center of Times Square. What a difference a block makes. I got a rate of $169 which is an excellent value in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyc_commuter
Reviews.Content: I work in NYC so it's rare I have to stay in a hotel in NYC since I live only an hour away. But I had decided to book this last minute due to the freezing rain conditions in and around NYC last night. It is in Times Sq but not in the middle of all the noise so I was glad for that. Lobby and bar are very nice. Rooms are on the small side but otherwise very clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were also small - if you are plus sized you may want to ask for a room with a bathroom that is bigger (if they have rooms w/ larger bathrooms). But everything was clean and worked perfectly in the bathroom and in the room itself. I would definitely stay here again, too.

Reviews.Title: “Very high value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: LilRobb
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the heart of Manhattan, it would have gotten a superb review, but my shower head was broken and they weren't (understandably) able to fix it during my one night stay...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Chels078
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying here after all the pictures but not what I expected. They knew 2 people were checking in and are room was very small and the beds were also small. It sucks that you would have to pay for a suite just to get what you would get in a standard hotel room. Also at a standard hotel they give you a free business center and let you print but not here you pay a .35 cent usage fee and .25 cents per page and they only let you put a min. Of $3 and they dont give you change back. I also in hotels I've stayed at got free holding for my bags to walk around here they charge $2 a bag. I mean I come to new York a lot and never had a problem with any hotels ive stayed at. The room doesn't have a desk to eat or do any work. The closet you can really only put tee shirts in because theres a safe on the bottom half. Hanging out in the front of the hotel they kept asking to see my room key and if I went to the community bathroom they asked me to see my room key like I was not a guest and just using them to use the bathroom. This hotel just seemed to nickel and dime people. My bathtub the paint was chipped and there were hairs in it. It's seem like they just put all there money into entrance area were it's visible to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped Noisy Room, however Hotel is in Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RegorC
Reviews.Content: Hotel was picked by our Travel Agent, only saw Trip Advisor comments after booking made, first and last time we will make that mistake. Following reading previous write-ups we requested and received a room upgrade from double to twin, many thanks to the Paramount staff for that. However the room was still very cramped and tight. Also part of the way through the week we stayed a group of Students were booked into the rooms around ours, as you would expect the parties started straight away in their rooms and the corridor. Needless to say the noise was bad. Security responded and calmed the youngsters down once we and other complained. With regards to the room generally there was little cupboard space. Shower Room was small and cramped. We were disappointed that there were no coffee and tea making facilities. The maid service was good with the room maintained in a good clean condition. However the view was of a brick wall and razor wire. The hallways and lifts where dimly lit making for a very depressing aspect and caused some difficulty in identifying our room number. Not sure if this was meant to add to the ambiance or to hid the rather shabby decor. There is a large selection of Restaurants and diners around the Hotel. The Restaurant and Cafe in the Hotel are pricy, however we found the cafe pleasant for a quick cupper. However we would recommend the dining options in the Edison a few doors along the street. Hotel location is great with all the excitement of Times Square and the theatres very close by. However overall off our group staying at various Times Square Hotels, with similar prices, agreed that the Paramount was very disappointing and found it hard to agree with a four star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Trispen2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights from Jan 22nd 2011 with my husband and 6 friends. After booking the hotel in October I was a little worried by some of the reviews posted Dec and Jan, especially the comments re the room size, I needn't have worried. We had all booked queen superior rooms i wouldn't recommend booking below this standard as the room wasn't huge but it was big enough, me and my husband were lucky enough to enquire about an upgrade which we were willing to pay for but the guy who checked us in (wish I could remember his name as he was brilliant) gave us this for free. You could not complain about the size we had plenty of room for us, two large and one small case left open and lots of shopping room number 837. The bathroom was very small but perfectly formed and I found the space to put all are bits and bobs another complaint I had read my friends in the queen rooms had larger bathrooms. The wardrobe is small but for 5 nights I don't mind living out of a suitcase, the light switches etc are a little dated but if you want the Plaza stay at the Plaza if thing's like that bother you. I have paid alot more to stay in New York in the past for a similar size room all be it larger bathroom and not as good a location. Location wise you couldn't ask for more, yes you can hear the traffic so take some ear plugs if you are a light sleeper but I still didnt find it noisey considering how close we were to Times Square, this hotel is only 19 floors even so the previous hotel I stayed in was on the 36th floor and you could still hear the traffic that's New York. I found all of the staff very welcoming and friendly I didn't encounter one rude person from check in, door staff, cleaning staff etc. I would recommend this hotel and have given it a 5 rating based on everything we got in comparison to the cost and will have no hesitation staying again next time i go to New York.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!!!restaurant not soo good!!”
Reviews.Author: gemrust30
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel was perfect....there was a lovely little pizza shop next door that served english tea to take away for only a dollar..much cheeper than hotel and they didnt add nyc tax or service charge.... The hotel was lovely,rooms a good size and maintained every day...our room was very quite but the view wasnt as good as we were at the back of the building..the beds were very comfy:) we decided to eat in the restaurant on the last day,so we asked what time last orders were,was told 11pm,we arrived about 9.45...our order wasnt taken untill 10.30 and was told chef wasnt happy as he was about to close the kitchen..when we eventerly got our starters which was only as cesar salad that we had to have main courses at the same time.we had to agree as they came out any way.....half way though the meal we were givin the bill and not even offered pudding....as a sous chef my self and my partner is a chef as well we would not allowedto be able to do this in england!!!!service was poor as well and we had to pay 18% service....myself and my partner was not inpressed and did reuion our last ite in new york!!!all because of a private party that wasnt starting till later on..... if your going to see a show i would go to the ticket booth in times square much cheeper than the hotel,...other than that if i was you i'd eat out!! also the fact that u have to pay for wifi thats abit of a con too!!!

Reviews.Title: “very stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeanlouisx
Reviews.Content: It's a very stylish hotel and it's such a feeling to stay in a 1928 historical hotel, all the comfort you need and the perfect location, ok i read lots of comments and yes the room can be small but very well done and lovely! I loved it! Yes I recommended it! J-Louis

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: bez3789STHelens
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have stayed in the Paramount and with all the hotels and places to stay in NY we were yet again not disapointed. We were staying here for my 30th Birthday and our wedding anniversary, I contacted the paramount before hand via facebook to confirm our reservation to which they were very helpful, On arrival we were given a fantastic upgrade and free drink vouchers. The room itself was modern, clean and had plenty of space..the bed was so comfortable I struggled to get up..!! Room was cleaned daily. All of the staff at reception, in the bar, the concierge and cleaners were so friendly and couldn't do enough for you..The hotel itself is perfect in location for all the main sites and restaurants, and also close enough that if you want to avoid high taxi fairs you can easily use the airtram and Subway from the airport as its only a few blocks away...Can't wait to return to New York again and without hesitation will be staying at the Paramount.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: alfahad
Reviews.Content: i got the best treatment and cheap prise from chatheren at the frontdisk

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this place.”
Reviews.Author: siestabeachsunset
Reviews.Content: Noisy hallways and unfriendly attitude from hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms slightly bigger than a shoe box, & beware of concierge desk.”
Reviews.Author: Ivan_Malta_Malta
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, just a couple of hundreds metres from Times Square and from all the Broadway theatres. The rooms are unbelievably small, mine was 3x4 metres and with a 'wardrobe' 16 inches wide. If you're there for one or two nights maybe you'll be fine but anything over that don't even consider it. Luggage space? Forget it! Trying to bend down in the shower to pick up your soap bar? Forget it! Beware of the Guys at the concierge desk. On our first day we thought that the best people to enquire about theatre tickets at, would be the guys at the concierge, cause usually being a resident at their hotel one would imagine that they will get the best deals for you. Oh yes, how wrong I was? We bought tickets for Mamma Mia for $200 each, I knew that they were advertised at $140 from the theatre (not to mention $80 from TKTS boot), but the guy behind the desk told us that these were preferential tickets and we accepted the deal. We collected the tickets from the box office right before the show started, and guess what? The tickets were marked at $141 and we were seated almost at the last row. Preferential tickets all right, maybe for the guy at the concierge desk who committed this daylight robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Clean & Comfy, What more do you need??”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaLondonUK
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews i was a little worried to stay here... HOW WRONG WERE THEY?!, This hotel was in the best location anyone could want! It was down a clean side street off of 7th avenue/times square with theatres both next to the hotel and in front and no noise from the busy streets at all! (coming from someone who was on a low floor near the streets! ) The rooms - Had the best beds i've EVER slept on, Yes the rooms were a little small but we were hardly in the room (being so close to everything!!) .. Unless you have 5 or more people in the room i dont see this space being a problem at all!! The staff were so kind and helpful and the cleaners came to our room every morning, and we had new sheets, towels and flannels everyday! And after a busy busy day we were having lay-ins but the cleaner just simply called the room to see when she was able to clean it which was VERY kind of her! All in all i'd give Paramount Hotel 10/10! And WILL stay here again. I also recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be close to everything, clean and comfy rooms and polite staff!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Brillant.......HIGHLY recommended !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kim8611
Reviews.Content: From the minute we got out of the taxi outside the Paramount Hotel and the doorman was so pleasant I just knew this was going to be a lovely place to stay. I was right. The room was small but for the time we spent in the room it didn't matter. The room was absolutely spotless. Bed clothes and towels changed every day. I was worried after reading a few of the reviews about the air conditioning being quite noisy and when we arrived it started going off every 20 minutes and it was noisy but my boyfriend rang reception and within 5 minutes a maintenance man was up and showing my boyfriend how to turn it off and on and onto hot and cold and the noise was gone. Everything about the hotel was amazing. Amazing location a 1 minute walk from Times Square and a ten minute walk from 5th Avenue which is perfect. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location poor service”
Reviews.Author: cadguy77
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel and flights through our travel agent said good location 4 star. Booked twin room found on arrival means twin bed in New York, not enough cupboard space for one suitcase full of clothes never mind two. i.e. one bed. When my wife went back to reception to complain she was not offered an upgrade which we would have reluctantly paid for but told that the problem lay with our travel agent not the hotel. After having a shower I found the floor near the window to be soaking wet, rang reception who sent someone who found the radiator/ac to be leaking. after fixing they sent room service to dry floor they did so by putting three towels on the floor these were there for the 4 night stay and no other method of drying the floor was used and again no offer of room change. All said and done concierge very knowlegeable and polite, but service very poor. Would recommend this for location only.All sorts of traffic at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scrambz
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here as part of our Honeymoon Trip from South Africa to the States. we were recommended the Hotel by friends of ours that had stayed there earlier in 2010. So after good reports from them our expectations were quite high. The first thing we noticed as we arrived was how good the location was. If you are a tourist and looking for an easy location, this place is perfect. Half a minute walk to Times Square, we even walked to Macy's, Empire State building as well as to and from Central Park. It just works well from a tourists point of view. The Hotel staff were really efficient and friendly, we arrived earlier than check in (we arrived at 9am) and they were more than happy to help with a smile on their face. The actual hotel amenities are good and the lobby and bar are are modernly decorated and have a nice feel to them. The Rooms are small, but, if you have stayed in NYC before, nothing is ever going to be huge. Although small the rooms are well appointed and the furnishings modern and of good quality. If you want some more space, its probably best to get a room with 2 double beds and not the room with the king! (we stayed in both). The rooms with 2 double beds affords you the opportunity to place your bags on the 2nd bed and then saves you foot space around the room. All in all, we loved our stay at The Paramount. I would recommended it to anyone going to NYC. On the same trip we stayed in a hotel double the price and although the room was bigger, the hotel couldn't compare. And lastly, Dean and Deluca downstairs make excellent coffee!!

Reviews.Title: “Was worried after reading some reviews, but hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy_Salisbury
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online before reading trip-advisor and then started to get worried become of some (a small proportion) poor reviews. Thankfully it was fine. only issue we had was a wait on arrival because our rooms weren't ready. We paid a reasonable price for the rooms and this was no huge issue. I read some complaints about the room sizes. We had the basic double room, and it was the size of a normal double room. You're slap bang in the middle of Manhatten! what are some people expecting? I thought the bathroom was quite big, it included a bath and a shower. Maybe i'm just used to UK sized rooms or something. The only thing we noticed in terms of size was there is nowhere to hang up clothes, but then we did have an ironing board, so it didn't really matter to us. Anyway, it's all flash and expensive, but i guess the main reason you'll be staying here is to be in the right location, and it's just perfect for tourists! i'd stay in the same location if i returned. It's a nice hotel, prices are high because of location rather than having suite-type rooms, but i guess that's what you would have expected anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: BlueMoonKiki
Reviews.Content: It was a lovely hotel in an excellent location. Rooms were not massive but in New York who wants to be in their room for any length of time other than to sleep. 30second walk into the heart of Times Square, 2minutes away from Port Authority Bus Station (where buses are going the the shopping outlets etc) and many many restaurants very close! Trendy, clean and we would reccommend it! Thank you to the hotel, you sold NYC to us, we will definately be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kristi35
Reviews.Content: For someone who wants location at Times Square and Broadway, The Paramount is it!!! Had great service from the staff, modern rooms, walking distance to all 3 of our plays made our stay was great!!! Turn left out the main door and at the end of the street is the middle of Times Square and turn right out the main door and up a block (between 8th and 9th), quaint little restaurants that would make your mouth water!!! Made our trip to NYC an awesome experience!!! Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Solo002
Reviews.Content: A thoroughly enjoyable stay at The Paramount, in the smallest hotel room I have seen in a long time. Being a solo traveller, the size didn't matter because everything I could have wanted was right there. The bed was like a cloud and after a day in freezing weather, the room was warm and comfortable. Room service was possibly the best I have encountered - fast, friendly and helpful. The only thing I would mention is the position of the room meant that I could smell cooking so woke each morning to the smell of bacon frying.

Reviews.Title: “This is why The Paramount is my hotel of choice in NYC”
Reviews.Author: bfriedman68
Reviews.Content: I travel the entire country for business and spend an avereage of 200 + nights a year in hotels. I normally stay at one of the large chain hotels when I travel; NY is the exception. For the last few years I have stayed at The Paramount, it is always a value, always clean, staff always helpful. I checked in on 1/11 for a 3 night stay and when I checked in on the 11th, my room was extremly small, I know NY hotels are small but this room which was billed as a queen would have been better suited for a double of single. I called the front desk to see if there was another room available or a larger room and I would be happy to pay the difference. I was informed by Lorenzo at the front desk that the hotel was booked and that he would have me upgraded to a King room on the 12th at no charge. Lorenzo's attitude and can do attitude to accomidate a guest was superior and in my opinon took the Paramount from a really good hotel to a great hotel. If you want an Awesome hotel, that is clean, accomidating, an extremly good value and in Mid-Town (Times Square), I recommend The Paramount.

Reviews.Title: “I had the misfortune to stay here”
Reviews.Author: KLIMKE253
Reviews.Content: I was transferred to this hotel at the last minute by ecruising.com. unfortunately I had to saty here twice within the space of two weeks. The rooms are so small there is hardly room to put the luggage. My wife and I were put in a room with 2 single beds, when we asked to have it changed they out us in a room with a small double bed that we couldnt sleep in. I then asked to have it changed and the reception people were just dreadful. Finally we managed to get a semi decent room. This place is only good for the location. Also as we were staying over New Year it was very expensive for what you got. I would definitely not recommend satying at this hotel unless you want, small rooms miniscule even and to be attended by rude staff. The restaurant is very average as well and was booked out for a private function while we were there. All in all a dreadful experience

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION & SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Mshelton06
Reviews.Content: A friend and I traveled to NYC for the first time and Paramount was a great addition to our trip. We first arrived and had previously booked a standard bed and the hotel attendant upgraded us to a double bed willingly at no charge. The rooms were nicely decorated and quiet being so close to Times Square. The rooms are definately not HUGE but big enough for four suitcases and an absurd amount of shopping bags. My only complaint was not having a fridge and free wifi. Other than that I would HIGHLY reccomend staying here. For two young women for the first time in NYC it was affordable, safe, and location was PERFECT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not to my liking”
Reviews.Author: sunflowersunflower
Reviews.Content: I was at the Paramount just last week. The deco is nice, but the rooms are so small. There is no table to write on or to put your lap top on. Beds small. No slippers given, no toiletries, the housekeeping is always asking you if they can make up the room every time you leave the room. NO fridge or even a kettle to make a tea/coffee. Front desk is rude and snappy when you ak a question. The only polite person I found was the door man. I would not recommend it, the hotel is over priced only because it is close to Times Square. Delia- Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “i like it big!!(rooms)”
Reviews.Author: DOMINOGO
Reviews.Content: we were served by natalie who was very nice, profesional and helped us out immediately with better rooms . great service, great staff and an amazing hotel. will be staying here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: HenrietteSchultz
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on the reviews, why we were very dissapointed, when we checked in only to discover that we had got a tiny room next to the elevator. We didn't get much sleep that night so next morning, I went down to the reception and asked if there might be any possibility of a transfer to another room. That male receptionist saved our holiday! The same afternoon we moved into another room, and we were so surprised when we opened the door. We had been transfered to a spacious suite with a wonderful view. My daughters were in the seventh heaven and I do think I shed a happy tear! We enjoyed the continental breakfast almost every morning primarily because of the great varitey of dishes but also because of the superb service delivered by the staff. The location is great, we went out to see several close broadway shows and were able to walk around in the evening without having to worry about taking the metro or being depended on taxis. All in all a great experience, if returning to NY we would definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Brett033
Reviews.Content: We were booked in there by our travel company, ecruising of Australia, because we would be able to gain acess to Time Square for new years eve. Unfortunately, the paramount hotel is near Time Square but not near enough to gain access. Perhaps this was the fault of the hotel or maybe it was the fault of the travel company but this was only the beginning of the issues. We were provided a room which was the smallest I have ever seen in a New York hotel. There was no room for a chair, there was no room around the bed and the bed itself was small. My daughter and her frieind were given an even smaller one. While we were trying to make some progress with access to Time Square with hotel management, my friends were harassed by hotel staff for loitering in the lobby. The only reason we were there was that management was abysmally slow in dealing with the access issue which they did not resolve anyway but wasted an hour of our time. A simple and quick no is so often an acceptable outcome. We found that there was what could most politely be described as a general disinterest from the hotel staff towards its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Less than average”
Reviews.Author: becads
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in NY near Time Square before I knew what to expect of the hotels in medium price range within the area, but this hotel did not cut it. Thee was an unusual and slightly unpleasant smell in the lobby. the staff in teh check in were great, very friendly and happy to assist. We had booked a double room after revieiwng the room selection on the website, when we opened the door we thought they ahd a made a mistake, the double bed was nothing more than a king single and tehre was no space left in the room for 2 adults plus luggage. the staff quickly rectified this, but placed us in room which had a noisy air conditioning unit that kept us up intermittently throughout our stay. We also had to straddle the sink to be able to use the toilet. the walls were paper thin and we could hear everything going on in the room next door inclduing there 5am rise one morning. After checking out for a few dasy to travel elsewhee we were re-accomodated on level 4. the room was a little bigger and we did not have to straddle the sink to use the toilet, but there was still the issue of the cluncky air conditioning unit which sounded like rats clawing away at metal....not pleasant. When turned on the unit was so loud that you could not sleep and so we spent another 2 nights in the confines of a hot, noisy room with paper thin walls. This hotel is a 'never again' on my list of choices when I stay in Times Square again

Reviews.Title: “Slick NYC hotel ft away from times square...”
Reviews.Author: tonio14
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded expectations upon arrival, we was given quality service from our check in to check out, the staff, to name just one would be hard done by the hotels long line of staff but natalie stud out, all had great patience & answered every question we had... The room was as good as what we paid for, very modern as was the lobby, & to say we've stayed in two other decent hotels before in new york, this was second to none. Overall we stayed for a week, & for a week staying with this hotel was very satisfied, it made the whole experience just that bit more special! Other reviews that were downgrading it on its room size etc, i think ask for a bit to much, pay in the thousands & get a room the size you want it exactly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was average value for money”
Reviews.Author: Corinna06
Reviews.Content: Room was small and since it was near Times Square we heard sirens and honking throughout the nigh which made it very difficult to get any sleep. The internet connection did not work most of the time but our money was refunded back to us for the internet without argument. Washroom was very small with no fan in it and no shower water pressure whatsoever. The toilet was leaking in the back. The food at the hotel was over-priced which forced us to go out to eat, even in the bad weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, snobby staff & lukewarm shower”
Reviews.Author: Trippety
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a package deal with British Airways for a good price. The hotel is in a great location - 2 min walk to Times Square, in the Broadway area, amazing pizza place next door. The hotel lobby is impressive - grand lights, flowers, seating areas, cool club style music playing. The staff are not very friendly (especially compared to all the other nice people we met in NYC) and come across as quite snobby and stand-off-ish. I had emailed the hotel a few weeks before to which I had no reply. They also didn't have our booking (despite presenting them with a British Airways Hotel voucher). In the end it turned out they had made a spelling mistake. I also had to provide them with a credit card even though we had paid for the room in full via BA and had provided them with passports. The room was small, which we had expected. However there were 2 of us and we only had a queen bed i.e. inbetween a single size & double!! V small!! There was just about enough room to put our two cases down! The bathroom was small, but supplied with towels and toiletries. Big down point though was that the shower was in an alcove, which meant the bathroom light didn't shine through - i.e you had to shower in the dark! :/ Even with the dial onthe highest setting the shower was lukewarm - not enjoyable. That said the room was designed very pleasantly and was trendy. Flat screen TV on the wall with lots of channels. You could hear the taxis, people etc when in your room, even at night, but that's to be expected when you pick a hotel very close to Times Square. We used the luggage room when we had checked out, which was only $2 per bag and the bellboy flagged us a yellow cab for our ride back to the airport. (BTW we hopped in a yellow cab on the way to the hotel with no effort or queue). We used the safe in the room (free use) which was good. Overall, a good location but I wouldn't recommend this hotel - don't be fooled by the fancy lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great service, can't wait to go back!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: miabella58
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze!!!!! Natalie was wonderful and I hope they realize at the Paramount how lucky they are to have her on there team!!!!!!!!!! In comparison to hotels in New York City I wouldn't call this small. It was clean, and met our needs since we were out most of the day. The bed was a king and was great sleeping, We wanted to stay another day and Natalie got us the best rate that by the way was well worth it, considering the prices for this type of hotel in NYC. As far as location this is the best!!!Located right in times Square we came out the hotel door and the broadway shows we had tickets for were within feet. Make a right out of the hotel and you are on restaurant roe. Anything you want or need is right their. I can't say enough about Natalie. It was a wonderful stay and I have been to many hotels in the area!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel until you actually get into the room”
Reviews.Author: Polleywally4985
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the paramount hotel were that it was stylish, very fashionable with helpful staff. That is until you leave the elevator and walk into the hallways on room levels. Dimly lit, shabby carpet and drab decoration were the first indications that the effort had been put in downstairs were a cover for the less than impressive decoration within. Our room was upgraded, but given we had booked the hotel for our honeymoon based on the website pictures, tears were shed. The room was a dull grey, and whilst comfortable, I would dread to see the smaller room we had booked. The bathroom was a disaster. A cheap steel sink barely fitted between a small bath/shower with dated tiled walls in grubby white with an out of place red section. I would never go back and would suggest that if you want somewhere worth the money, go elsewhere as this is a let-down.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, but you wont sleep!”
Reviews.Author: jossieliverpool
Reviews.Content: Just got back today from this hotel, i was there from 5th jan 2011 and allthough it was a modern hotel near times square, the rooms were soooooo small we couldnt open our suit cases in them, without putting them on the bag first. We complained and got a upgraded room, which wasnt much bigger, but they agreed we would only have to pay for 2nights upgrade instead of 4. But the problems didnt finish there, every half hour the heating kicks in and the raditors make a bad banging noise, so we havent slept for 4 nights right through! My sister and her husband also came with us and they had the same problems with the room size, so were upgraded, but there heating kept going off in the middle of the night, they called the maintenence man out twice to fix it (which they were charged for!!!!) But we complained and got this charge scrapped. Their tv also didnt work, but knowone fixed that. Over all it was an ok hotel and near everything, so if you dont think your going to be in the room for long then this would be ok to book, but just be prepared that you wont be sleeping very well. Plus just a tip - if u wish to store ur suitcases downstairs with them because u have to check out, they charged us $16 and then wanted a tip for putting them in!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ben1WinnipegCanada
Reviews.Content: I am writing to tell you about the excellent service we received from your Assistant Front Office Manager Katie Hayari-Barea. My family had booked two rooms for a seven night stay with your hotel from the 14th of December to the 21st of December. We had booked through your reservations call center. One of the rooms we reserved was to be a handicapped accessible room with a bath tub. We had the call center call the hotel direct to ensure a room meeting our requirements could be supplied and had the call center detail our request on the reservation. After calling the hotel the call center assured us a handicapped room with a bathtub was available. Two weeks before we were to arrive, we called the hotel direct and confirmed that our reservation was on track and that a handicapped room with a bath tub was available and we were assured that the room was reserved. We arrived at the Paramount to find that the hotel does not have a handicapped room with a bathtub. Without a bath tub to place my bath chair in I had no way to bathe. Assistant Front Office Manager Katie Hayari-Barea was called and she made every effort to find a room in the hotel that would meet our needs but unfortunately none of the available rooms had a bathroom doorway that was wide enough for a wheelchair and in any event there were no bath tubs to accommodate my bath chair. Obviously it was a very stressful situation for us, we had flown from central Canada to find we had nowhere to stay. After exhausting all options at the Parmount Katie Hayari-Barea found us rooms at the Double Tree where a handicapped room with a bathtub was available. Katie gave us a truly heartfelt apology and we believe she truly emphasized with our situation. While arrangements were being made Katie and Aundrea Kudrna offered us a drink in your lounge, which we gratefully accepted as we had had a very long and stressful day. The sign of a great hotel is how it’s deal’s with difficult situations, it’s response is what set’s a great hotel apart from the competition. How Katie treated us makes you a great hotel, she did all the right things. She realized a mistake had been made and she made it right and she should be recognized for being the excellent manager she is. We were truly grateful for everything she did for us and we wish her well in her future endeavors with the Parmount hotel. Aundrea was also very kind and considerate as were the lounge server and the lady bell hop who watched over our luggage, all their efforts were greatly appreciated. Please share our comments and thank your staff once again for the great service. We will certainly recommend your hotel to our friends and business associates. W Johnson Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great from the start”
Reviews.Author: JPP98
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Paramount was great from the start thanks to the Front Desk Staff ( Nathalie / Crystar) Their friendly , courteous and professional manner made for a very nice beginning to a great stay. The room was clean and comfortable and the Hotel location was perfect. Our only complaint was the staff at the Library Bar who were more concerned with closing the Bar ( early ) than taking care of 2 ( after Show ) customers. Overall the Hotel was great and we will definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: jayfish911
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is amazing right in time square. The standard rooms are pretty much just a bed. The bathrooms could also be a little cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location-Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Boh02
Reviews.Content: Tis hotel has an excellent location right behind Times Square and near many theaters, museums, bars and restaurants. Being in a very touristic district the type of all eateries and bars is less typical and more commercial.The rooms are surprisingly small!

Reviews.Title: “poorest service ever”
Reviews.Author: lol100
Reviews.Content: my 2nd visit to new york, and just wanted a pre xmas break with my daughters.we booked a room for 4 adults 2 double beds , the room to be fair was of a decent size for a city hotel, however after taking of my shoes i noticed the carpet was soaking wet, and damp creeping up the walls , i insisted on movng rooms , and there was no questons asked which made me assume they already knew about this problem. the 2nd room they give us was fine until i noticed the beds where smaller and could not possibly accomodate fur adults comfortably,. on request of a move once again to a larger room i was told the hotle wasalready overbooked , once again after insisting they move me or refund my money they agreed and sent up the manager with the key and a drinks voucher, he did not apologise and was extremely rude, he did not even offer any help with the cases but merely handed me the keys and walked away. in general you a cannot really tell who the staff are at this hotel. i find it very poorly run. in comparison to my last stay at the W lexington ave . To sum it up Poorly refubished rooms very dull and unwelcoming lobby very unwelcoming staff not place you want to return to at the end of a long days shopping(i didnt even use my free drinks vouchers) I would never return to this hotel if it was the last one available great location though if your ot bothered about the above

Reviews.Title: “There are better options”
Reviews.Author: Sickgin
Reviews.Content: The maid service doesn't announce when they're entering your room. Coffee machines must be in short supply as my room had none, just a note that said I can pay for room service to bring me some (hurts the wallet). Concierge was NEVER avaliable, there was an option to leave a message, but mine were never returned. Billing is a nightmare. All in all, the marriot is near-by as well as the holiday in. both cheaper and better staffing, as well as having more creature comforts in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff. Queen rooms too small.”
Reviews.Author: fairenoughgudge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paramount for 3 nights earlier this month. The location is excellent, being less than a block from Times Square. The lobby is great...seems like a small nightclub lounge with cool furniture and a chilled vibe. Rooms are a bit on the small side if you opt for a queen sized one. Pay the extra to upgrade to a king if ou can. Also renovations don't seem to have been done very well, with peeling paint and poorly fitted doors. The staff were great...especially Catherine who resolved a problem with our bill without any fuss. All in all, if you look beyond some small issues with the decorating, this is a highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TOO Close to Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: Duggars
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy sleeping...and sleeping comfortable, DO NOT STAY HERE. The honking outside woke us up at Midnight. Too much traffic in the area since Times Squares half a block away.
