The rooms were small and internet was $15...PER DAY?!?! We also had a problem with the room being too warm and thermostat didn't work. WE had a tech come check it out and we had to CONVINCE HIM to just turn the switch off in the heater cause it wouldn't stop radiating heat. We'd crack a window to get a nice breeze but then the noise from downstairs would be even louder. Lose - lose situation. Only good part was the pizza place next door.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms, not very clean”
Reviews.Author: paul777
Reviews.Content: Rooms and beds are small. Rooms were recently renovated but the paint is peeling off already. Could be cleaner, especially the bathroom would benefit from thorough cleaning. Location is great for Broadway shows but I'd rather walk a few blocks for a better hotel. Given the maintenance level, this hotel will be a dump soon....

Reviews.Title: “Been visiting the Paramount for 20 years”
Reviews.Author: Steve60640
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for business and pleasure. This past weekend was my first stay in their redesigned rooms. The new style is crisp and clean and opens up the room a little bit. From my experience, rooms at the Paramount are larger than those at most midtown hotels. The location is perfect-- less than a block to Times Square and with easy access to many Metro lines. The bed, pillows and linens were super comfortable. The lobby always has such a cool vibe, even when packed with unruly tourists. I was stranded at the Paramount during the holiday weekend blizzard and the staff was so accommodating, allowing me to extend my stay for one night, then two, then three. I would heartily recommend this hotel to any and all. It's the only place in New York I'll stay, because it's comfortable, consistent and so cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: kelseyhibbs
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience staying at the Paramount Hotel in NYC. My boyfriend and I were celebrating our anniversary, and just needed a room for 1 night to explore the city and do some shopping. The front desk staff were SO helpful and kind about everything, and even upgraded us to a larger room! The location was perfect if you want to explore the city...we were in walking distance to so much of the city, and not just times square. The price is great compared to many other hotels located in times square and staff was professional and kind. The next time I stay in the city, I will defiantly stay at the Paramount again and have already recommended it to my friends who were thinking about heading to the city soon! I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, and cannot wait for my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend. If you frequent NYC you will see the value and amenities”
Reviews.Author: DallasTraveler1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline. Was surprised to find better rates on the hotel site after I purchased. I then looked at trip advisor and read a few reviews which made me nervous. I was traveling with my partner and 2 children, 2 & 5. We had to circle the block once because we didn't see any signage but upon finding the hotel, we were very pleasantly surprised. The valet/doorman greeted us with a smile in the chilly weather and helped us unload the car. We had a room booked with one double bed and since we had the two kids we needed to upgrade. I was concerned about the availability and price. At check in Crystar was AWESOME! She was friendly, accommodating, knowledgeable and efficient. The hotel lobby was very modern and trendy. The room was also very clean and nicely upgraded. It was spacious for a standard NYC hotel. The vibe was upbeat and energizing. I would put this hotel on par with some of the W Hotels brands like Aloft. I traveled to NYC for years and this hotel was terrific for the price! If you are expecting something much more glamorous and spacious, then pay $200 more per night up the street. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for location and money”
Reviews.Author: caymantraveller72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is half a block in from Times Square so in a great location to get around with ease. The hotel room was quite small but very clean and quiet and more than we expected from a hotel in New York. The bathroom was very clean and the shower head was very high which tall people will appreciate. The beds were a little too soft for my liking but the sheets and comfortable were fabulous after all day of walking. We were on the fourth floor and our room was in the back of the hotel so the view was nothing too look at but with the blinds down, it wasn't an issue. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. Everybody in New York that we encountered were wonderful and helpful. Would definitely stay here again if Times Square was the area we wanted to be in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: basketgirlsteph
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the Paramount Hotel and enjoyed my stay. I have traveled to NYC five times in six years, all for pleasure. I have stayed somewhere different each times and although I've been lucky to have never had a bad experience, the Paramount was a much nicer hotel than all that I've stayed in so far. I was initially concerned that staying within a block of Time Square would be a mistake. I thought a hotel so close to such would be too kitschy and loud (both visually and in noise), but I was wrong. Paramount was a classy and modern looking hotel. The lobby felt glamorous and chic and the room, although it was small, was clean and modern as well. The staff was helpful and kind and helped make it a great experience. The only downside was the hotel charging a $250 deposit on a debit/credit card (to hold the room). We only stayed one night and instead of crediting that deposit as payment, the hotel had to charge a new charge for the stay and told us the $250 deposit would be credited back to our account. The time line of this is "up to the bank" and could take as long as three days. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Very,Very Disappointed,Never recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sulobo
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through Expedia. There was a snafu on the room booked.I got the classic room with a fullsize bed.instead of the Queen bed. Went up to the room . the bed was almost 3/4 the size of the room. I am 6-1 and 250 . I went downstairs and told the front desk I would have to sleep on the floor . I told them of my problem with the Expedia and thought I was getting a queen. They charged us 30 dollarsmore for each night. The thermostat did not work the first night and when it did work it was noisy as hell. The faucet handle on the sink was loose and the water dripped all night. The shower was very small .We could hear the door opening next door all night . The only thing good was the location . For 350.00 dollar for a night , Ripoff

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Crystar. She is beautiful and very professional!”
Reviews.Author: Mark293
Reviews.Content: We had a problem with an Expedia booked room. Hint to self, always book with the hotel. Crystar was very accomodating and resolved the matter quickly and efficiently. She is the reason I would consider staying here again. My 17 year old son says she's hot!

Reviews.Title: “Excrement on the Bathroom tiles”
Reviews.Author: JedKensington
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel for 5 nights via an agent. The website looked great. The hotel and rooms looked clean bright and fresh. Unfortunately, this could not have been further from the truth. The hotel was very dark. It didn't matter what time of day it was, there was very little natural day light. To say the place was dirty was an understatement. The room we were shown to had excrement on the bathroom tiles, the bath had several hairs in it and the base was chipped with chunks of ceramic missing. The light switch sparked as I flicked it on. In the bedroom a cold wind howled through the window and there was no sound proofing. Not really acceptable in December, we were freezing! The window surrounds were thick with black dirt with surplus to requirement screws lying around! The linen on the bed had black dirty marks on them. There were loose wires hanging out that appeared to have been stuffed behind some sort of plastic base in the corner of the room. The general state of the paint work was tired and chipped. This hotel should not have been rated a 4 star. I have since been advised that it has been down graded once already. We complained to reception and were shown two other rooms of the same standard by Katie Hayari-Barea. She agreed with our concerns in the rooms and said they were not acceptable but then threatened to have security throw us out because we were complaining? I would like to add that at no stage did either my partner or myself use bad or abusive language. I cannot comprehend how this hotel has got so many positive reviews. I can only assume that the majority of these must be fake. We ended up moving to The Novotel in Times Square. It was really nice. Clean bright and reasonably priced and the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but prepare to be robbed (of your 'security' deposit) !!!!”
Reviews.Author: hmltnangel
Reviews.Content: I will always give credit where credit is due for anywhere I go. I have stayed at some lovely places and some poor places and am always honest about the service. First up we booked our trip through a travel agent and then got a call from the agent to advise the hotel had said they were out of rooms so we couldnt stay there. Oddly enough I managed to book a room 20 minutes later on the hotels website so I know they were just trying to get out of paying commission to the agents! First evidenceof robbing right there and I wish I had paid attention. Well fast forward to our trip date, we arrived and to be fair were checked into our room pretty quickly. We were told by the desk clerk that the full amount would be taken from the our credit card at that point - fair enough. What we didnt get told that we were also being charged $75 PER NIGHT Security Deposit for 'incidentals' . Now I have heard of security deposits and they are normally a set amount (say $100 or so) not PER NIGHT. As I said we didnt get old that they were doing this - the hotel just charged it without notifying us and not even putting it on the reciept we were given at the time! Pathetic Service right from the off! Well we then got to our room - room 1143 - WHAT A HOLE! Ive stayed in cleaner, more comfortable and BIGGER rooms in a £50 per night B&B in the UK. The worst of it is ..... we had booked a SUPERIOR QUEEN!!! I pity the fool who books a standard room here. Where to start with the horridness? How about Wet Carpets that were obviously still wet from cleaning? Wet Towels - still wet from laundry? No Security Bolt on the door? The wall where teh TV was ... well it was just grotty! Or maybe the tiniest bathroom you have ever seen in your life? Or how about the unvacuumed hair lying in ALL corners of the room? Lets just stop there - it was filthy. Being too tired to move rooms that night we bedded down and got some sort of sleep. Next morning we sampled breakfast which thankfully was quite tasty. A small positive then we headed to reception to discuss the awful room. The lovely lady on the desk advised we would be moved to another room as soon as it was available (3pm) We then went for a wander around NYC which as always was a pleasure. Arriving back at the hotel we were give our new room key.... 1130 and went to see what nightmare we would be sleeping in this time. To say it was an improvement is like saying rain is an improvement on snow?! At least this time there was no wet carpet or towels but sadly there was still hair in the corners of the room. Also a big dirty black mark on the bed covers was spotted right away. The bathroom - was a lot bigger than the other one but this was only because the room was obviously a disabled access room. so nothing particularly good about the room! It was at this point I decided to check my Credit Card (on the fairly decent - but very expensive WiFi) and noticed the amount the hotel had taken from it (including that silly deposit - yeh like I am going to spend $1600 on a hotel room then run away without paying a $10 room service charge?!) I immediately asked at teh front desk why they had done this without telling me and apparently this was a common problem for staff?! IDIOTS! Fortunately our time there finished without much further ado and I arrived home safe in good old scotland! A few days later I noticed the Security Deposit being credited back to my card.... let me ask you some simple maths..... what is 4 x $75 ? You would probably be right saying it was $300. 4 Night Security Deposit. How then can they explain $225 being returned to my card? Apparently $75 is the tax on 4 breakfasts? Doubtful. When I emailed the Paramount I got told it was correct but they would get their accounting dpeartment to contact me to explain how 4 breakfasts adds up to $75 tax. They havent done that yet despite 2 reminders and that was 2 weeks ago! I seriously recommend people not to visit this rather poor excuse for a hotel as it will ruin your trip! If the Paramount wish to speak to me then you have all my contact details!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: tatenet
Reviews.Content: Close to Times Square, elegant boutique decor, stylish if compact rooms, chic mezzanine bar and restaurant, and some of the friendliest service on Manhattan. I've been staying here for years, every time I come to New York, and the Paramount continues to delight and impress. Convenient and classy, always feels like a welcoming home from home - and at a decent price. Catherine behind the desk and Richard on the door deserve special mentions for their helpfulness and professionalism. You may not have acres to spare in the rooms, but I'm happy to return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and European”
Reviews.Author: johnee99
Reviews.Content: 2 day, last minute business trip to NYC. I am a Starwood Platinum, but had to book last minute so I was booking the room on price. I do about 150,000 miles per year for business travel. PROS: --Great service and Dean/Deluca was convenient --Location is great --Pretty cheap price --Good WiFi CONS: --No good public space to work--everything a bit too hip. Not really comfortable for the business traveler --No desk/workspace in room. Literally had to work on a tray over the bed --It was loud --Pay for WiFi Overall if I needed to, I would stay again. However for business travelers, this is not an adequate hotel. CONS:

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: senorita08
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Paramount, and found it a great place to stay. It's right off Times Square, though a block to the west, so its not noisy. The closest Subway is a few blocks away, so its a bit of a walk, but most of the lines pass through Times Sq station, so you can get all around the city from there. Concierge is helpful with Broadway show tickets - though go and check the box office first as they won't charge the commission that the hotel does. We were there for Thanksgiving, and they helped us find a lovely restaurant to eat in. Beds are really comfy (especially after a long flight!). Library Bar is a nice place to have a drink before heading out to a show or for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Little space at a premium”
Reviews.Author: joebecquets
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for two days to attend a conference near Times Square. I decided to try something else than the usual suspects (Hilton, Marriotts, etc.). My choice went to the Paramount Hotel. If you don't need Internet (14.00$ /Day) or a businees center (not a row of paid-by-the-minute computers along a secluded wall), keep on reading. The service is good, the location is great, the rooms (at least mine) are small... extremely small to the point of being ridiculous: 90 square feet (9x10) where a double bed, a chair, a (small) round table and a night table have been stuffed (frankly, you have to admire the ingenuity of the hotel for putting so much furniture in a cramped space.) The television is obviously hanging from the wall. Actually, this is the only piece of decoration hanging from the wall since there is no picture frames, no by-the-number paints, no nothing but a greyish wall. If you are entering too quickly in the room, you will fall on the bed (approximately 33 inches away from the door). Once you have moved laterally to the left side (since moving 33 inches forward will get you on the bed), the entry door will have enough room to swing closed and you will be able to see the beating that the door has taken over the years. With such a small space, no wonder the door and the walls have been bumped into repeatedly. The bathroom is small but OK. The location is great, a few hundred feet from Times Square (but so are numerous other hotels). If you are claustrophobic, avoid by all means. For the others, find an alternative and, if nothing else, what the heck!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you're a midget with no clothes and a need to hang around elevators for a long while ig”
Reviews.Author: ellecram1950
Reviews.Content: The hotel double bedrooms are the smallest I've ever stayed in, with a 3/4 bed, fit for one but sold as a double bed for 2. The wardrobe space wasn't even big enough for a couple of nights clothes and the bathroom was smaller than one you would expect in a caravan. Don't reserve a room if you have slightest need to walk around the room or have claustrophobia. Not suitable for anyone wider than a matchstick The reception staff couldn't have been less helpful if they tried! On the plus side, it is clean and a great location for seeing the sights, central and close to public transport and many eating deli's and cafe's.

Reviews.Title: “Old, dirty rooms that try to be "trendy"”
Reviews.Author: jbmlove16
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, however the rooms left a lot to be desired. My room had water stains on the ceiling, as well as stains all over the white chair that was in the room. The sheets had rips in them. The bathroom mirror had some sort of mystery substance on it (probably needs to be replaced) and the shower did NOT look clean. The towels had stains on them and were very old and tattered. The heater made a VERY loud clanking noise all night that definitely ruined any semblance of ambiance the room attempted to have. Overall, I would never stay at this hotel again, nor would I recommend it to someone else. It was a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: jessicasbrown
Reviews.Content: On looking for a hotel to stay at in NYC, our main concern at first was location and secondly comfort and value for money. We stayed over thanks giving weekend so were aware finding a decent value hotel in a good location might be tricky but then we happened about the Paramount Hotel. It is just round the corner from Times Square - no more than a 30 second walk out of the hotel and you can see the bright lights from the windows so we couldn't have asked for better. From Times Square you can get to everything you would want to within walking distance and nothing really takes more than half an hour apart from The Statue of Liberty, Ground Zero etc which we caught a subway to but walked back from. The hotel itself from the pictures looked just as lovely in real life. I was a little apprehensive before I went about room size as this seemed to be something a lot of people commented on but it was perfect! The bed was absolutely huge (we had a standard kingsize room) and the space around the bed vast and more than enough room for all our many purchases! The bathroom was small but adequate and perfectly equipped with a showe/bath, wash basin, toilet and lots of towels (something a lot of hotels cannot seem to get right). A flat screen tv with many channels adorned the wall and the decor was simple, clean yet modern and warm. We used concierge once to ask about posting mail to the UK and they were most helpful. They seemed to know a lot about shows and the local area! The lobby was striking and one of the more unusual ones I have seen. It was quirky and eclectic in its decor so probably not to everyones taste but I liked it and enjoyed eating breakfast one morning on the mezzanine floor over looking the lobby. Breakfast was nice (we opted for the buffet) albeit a little expensive for what we actually ate. Unfortunately we never made it to the bar but it looked great. The only bad experience we had was with the elevators - one broke on the second day and was never replaced and out of the remaining three, another broke leaving two on the last day which, when we were trying to get our luggage down, made it very difficult as every elevator that arrived was full of people! Oh and the fact we had to pay to leave our luggage once we had checked out I think was a little cheeky as we would have left the money as a tip anyway! Overall a lovely hotel and would definately go back there if and when we make it back to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: memphisbluesagain
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a superb 12th floor room as one of the receptionists took a look at me and thought that boy needs a bigger bed! Brilliant hotel, the bed was superb and the rooms clean and tidy. We love the Big Apple and we shall be back next year, I promise at the Paramount. These two Brits just cant get enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Jonesy
Reviews.Content: Prior to our trip I followed The Paramount Hotel on Facebook and told them that we were looking forward to staying with them and that we were going to be getting married next year and that our trip was to sort some wedding stuff out. We found the hotel very easily on arrival and it is literally a stone's throw from Times Square. On entering the hotel the lobby is stylishly decorated with comfortable eclectic chairs and sofa's and soft lighting. On checking in we met the most helpful and friendly member's of staff who on checking my details congratulated me and my fiancee on our forthcoming wedding - they had obviously made a note from my comment on Facebook. As a mini present to us we were advised that the hotel had given us a complimentary room upgrade to a king size room! I was very impressed by this little gesture. The room was very clean and decorated in a simplistic yet trendy manner. Room included flat-screen TV and alarm clock with iPod dock. The room was of good size and the view wasn't too bad either. The bathroom was small and has an unusual style. The sink was a metal one in a cone shape and the toilet reminded me more of a public washroom than a hotel room. Bathroom came with full size bath with shower. One evening we decided to grab a drink in the bar on the mezzanine level which again was stylish and had a classy decor however BEWARE... a round of 5 drinks cost just short of $80!!! These are New York prices so just be warned before ordering! Room rates are a little on the expensive side but again location was right on Times Square so the prices reflect this. Overall, I would most definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service in great location...”
Reviews.Author: Amandalou86
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 5pm after long flight to be told only room left was not ready as it smelt of smoke. Being non smokers we were told of we waited two hours the room could be ironised and we could check in. Having booked the room 9 months earlier this was fustrating. We came back at 7pm and were given the room only to find when we opened the door two guests were already in it! Reception had made a mistake and magically another room was now free for us to use. I complained about this and we were given free breakfast vouchers for the delay and mix up which we were then charged for when we checked out! Not happy at all. Hotel in central location and fab for exploring! Rooms very small but clean and modern. No tea or coffee on rooms and signal on tv bad. Despite good location would not use again because of rubbish service, lack of communication and ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service though a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: Marydoudou
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in this hotel for our honeymoon. We got upgraded to a higher floor and a bigger room by Anamaria who's been extremely helpful all along. The room was clean and spacious and recently renovated. Fantastic location and great view on a typical NYC neighbourhood. Would definitely go back though it is not for everyone's wallet - they do have a lot of special offers though.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay- won't be my last”
Reviews.Author: brchodzin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paramount November 17-21, 2010 as a combo business/leisure trip after having stayed on a vacation in July. I was just as impressed with this stay! This property is in the most perfect location (in my opinion) just steps from Times Square, tour bus pickup, and several subways, and equally importantly from Patzeria Pizza and Junior's Cheesecake! It is within five minutes' walk from most theatres and Rockefeller Center, ten minutes' walk from Central Park, and the proximity of all public transportation makes this a PERFECT place to stay. Yes, the rooms are smaller by some region's standards, but are more than adequate and right in line with other Manhattan/Midtown properties. The beds are comfortable, the hotel is very clean, the decor is modern and the rooms I've stayed in have had a safe, iron, ironing board, updated climate control and bath amenities. (don't know if that's true for all rooms or not) I have to make special note of how the staff made this stay even better than it could have been. EVERY person I encountered had the warmest smile, friendliest attitude, and could not have been more helpful. The front desk staff are lovely and efficient, the concierge staff are SO knowledgeable about the city and so helpful, the doormen are great, and on and on. I’d also like to especially recognize Christopher Lore on the Security team. My friend and I had an unfortunate incident with a driver trying to “bait and switch” us regarding a car rate, and when I ignored his demands for more cash, he physically blocked me with an arm to the chest and became very aggressive verbally and physically. Christopher took control of the situation and removed the man from the property, saving my friend and me from any further harassment or embarrassment. What a great asset to an already great staff! This was my second stay at the Paramount and most certainly won’t be my last. Thanks to all, and happy holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to My Trip”
Reviews.Author: colin_travers
Reviews.Content: I just want to thank Lola who greeted us upon our arrival at the Hotel, she was full of life, friendly & funny & put up with all our nonsense. It also helped that she was exceptionally good looking & certainly made the perfect start to our short stay in New York.Greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “The staff of the Paramount is really very professional and helpful (especially Lola at the front desk)”
Reviews.Author: jeronimo23
Reviews.Content: The Paramount hotel is located a 1 min. walk of times square/NY. The hotel is really good value-for-money. I would like to point out the very friendly staff, especially at the front desk. Lola is a highly professional receptionist who really helped us to get a double bed room instead of the one we had. Such employees make "the" difference. She is the reason to be back in this hotel. And also the very friendly and helpful guy who is responsible for getting cabs for the hotel guests - thanks guy's. Kind regards.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: musicizme19
Reviews.Content: There may be posher hotels in NYC, but the staff at the NYC Paramount Hotel were absolutely brilliant. Together with the location and the ambiance of its decor, this makes the Paramount Hotel, near Times Square, a great place to stay. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in New York City. Brian & Susan Cox, Beccles, Suffolk, England.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Paramount was exceptionally nice.”
Reviews.Author: Electraglide2005
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Paramount is the location. It's 1/2 block off of Times Square. Personally I prefer the older, more classical places. This hotel was recently renovated to a very modern, contemporary look.. However, it still retains a lot of it's classical charm. Pro's: *Location *Atmosphere *Service (excellent by any standard) *Parking (secured valet parking) *Value *Proximity to dozens of the best restaurants in the world within a 5 minute walk. I'd personally recommended the Brazilian place right down the street. There's also a small pizza shop right beside the hotel that was perfect for a late night slice. Con's *Size of Room (hey, it's New York after all so they are going to be tiny. I will say that even though the room was very small, it was done as nicely as possible. The bathroom put me in mind of what I might find on a cruise ship. The sink was tiny and there was no room for toiletries. The toiletries had to go on the shelf above the toilet and you had to be aware of the lid, which my girlfriend makes me anyway, so as not to leave it up and possibly drop something in.) *Access in by car. As with most NY hotels, it's on a very narrow street with traffic weaving every which way. They do have a sign out front for you to stop at and grab a bellman but it was very busy. There was also construction right up the street from it which messed things up. But again, it's New York so what do you expect. *People from the Church of Scientology trying to get you inside for their "open house" every time we walked by. I would highly recommended this hotel to someone that wants to experience midtown and Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “I Froze...I will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: sparklingwater2
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you like cold unheated rooms...no joke. My room was usually around 62 degrees and the heat would not go on. The hotel explained to me everyday that I complained that by city ordinance they can't turn the heat on until the weather outside is below 55 degrees. One night they kept telling me wait until about 6:00 pm because the temperature was dropping and they expected the heat to turn on around 6. It never did. I thought this was odd because the lobby was clearly heated and when you walk through the front doors you get a blast of hot air blowing on you, but apparently they can't heat the guest rooms. It was a horribly cold. The first time maintenance came into my room to check on the heater the first thing they said was, wow, it's cold in here. Exactly why I was complaining. They can't bring a space heater to your room either because those are also against city ordinances. Cross this place off your list to stay. The staff was very rude about the lack of heat as well. They clearly didn't care or had so many people complaining they just didn't want to bother with me. I would have left the hotel but unfortunately I booked it on a site where you pay for the room in advance, which is never a good idea, for exactly the reason I experienced here. You're pretty much stuck there.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel inthe perfect location near times square, quite basic but expensive”
Reviews.Author: travellingman062
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when visiting new york city for a few days. It is quite trendy and "arty", the rooms are very small, and our one was in need of redecorating, the view from our window was a scaffolding tower in the back yard! Staff are quite helpful and friendly. There is a nice bar restaurant . Breakfast not included in our room price and it was expensive. Luckily there is a nice deli attached next door that does reasonably priced food. Many facilities cost extra that you normally would not pay for. ie storing luggage costs $2 a bag. But this seems to be on a par with other new york city hotels, so do not visit on a budget! They have a business section with pcs and a printer. Again this is expensive to use, although they do allow you 15 minutes free internet to check in at airport on line . But you have to dismiss these criticisms when you realise that you are 2 minutes walk from times square, and all the theatres on broadway are a short walk rather than a cab ride. So, overall we give it a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: writeway
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this great boutique Hotel in Times Square on a long weekend with girlfriends. The room was beautifully decorated and very well maintained. The room was NYC small, but certainly large enough for 2 double beds and room to move around. The bathroom was tiny...but adequate and, again, very clean. We paid a premium because it was Marathon weekend in New York....but all hotels had high prices that weekend. Excellent location for going to the theatre and restaurant row. Very easy to access all subway lines. Great lobby to meet friends in.

Reviews.Title: “Nathalie at the front desk was great!”
Reviews.Author: weddingbizchic
Reviews.Content: Thanks Nathalie for your great service. Rooms are super tiny and a little hard to maneuver, especially for a business trip, but the service is above average for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: globaltraveler97
Reviews.Content: The Paramount Hotel New York is both a very cool, hip boutique hotel and a place with great staff, all of whom are always trying to insure your stay is good. THe value is excellent. This was my third stay, this time for five nights for business. Everyone was as friendly as possible and I am definitely considering it my hotel wehenever I come to NYC. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lamonte
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two of our friends arrived at the Paramount on Nov 11 for a 4 night stay for a pre-christmas shopping/siteseeing trip. We booked a complete package through expedia. We were promptly met at the front door by hotel staff to take our luggage. Check in was extremely quick and very courteous. Our luggage was brought to our rooms within 5 minutes. Room was small but very clean, comfortable and modern looking. Room size was not an issue for us because we only showered and slept there. We were shopping and siteseeing 16-18 hours each day. Our friend's room came with a smaller bed than ours. They went to the front desk and asked to be upgraded. The hotel quickly upgraded them for the 4 nights for just 30 bucks. The best feature of this hotel is its location. This hotel is literally a 2 minute walk to the heart of Time Square. Broadway plays, shopping, restaurants, etc. just minutes away. Overall, I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Willing to answer any questions you may have.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION...SMALLEST ROOM...HUGE NOISE”
Reviews.Author: BCH-BCN
Reviews.Content: I travel very oftern to New York from Europe for business. Traditionally I stay in hotels belonging to important corporation as Hilton, Sheraton, Marriot being the first one my clear favorite in price-value relation. I tried Paramount for the first time as a friend of mine recommended me the hotel but I did not have a positive experience. I will summarize the postive & negative points: + amazing location in the heart of Times Square + design - rooms are very very small, even on the biggest ones as the king size bed room I had - noise isolation is horrible so if the room is located towards 46th St there is noise all night - air conditioning makes huge noise so you have to stop it if you want to sleep - washroom is also very very small - limited front desk personnel which leads to important queues I would not recommed for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: efro
Reviews.Content: All staff were very friendly. The hotel's lobby was nice, the halls were a little dark, looked like they could use a reno. The room was nice, however very small. The size wasn't really a problem for me though as I was travelling alone. I found the price to be reasonable for such a great location. Times Square was about a half block away, so it was perfect as this was my first trip to NYC, it also made it easy to access the subway, and was quite close to the rockefeller center, central park, MoMA, radio city to name a few... I would recommend this if travelling solo, but if not I would look for a bigger room elsewhere. The washroom had no counter space which proved a bit of a challenge for getting ready in the morning... girls need counter space! haha.... Finally, I just wish they had coffee makers in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we'd stayed anywhere but here”
Reviews.Author: Frankie058
Reviews.Content: The rooms were incredibly tiny and the corridors dark and dingy. Not at all like the photographs. Reception staff were pleasant, however, the night time security staff were surly and aggressive. Take my advice stay anywhere but here it's basic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for short city break!”
Reviews.Author: LeftmyheartinNYC
Reviews.Content: The Paramount Hotel was perfect for our trip. We arrived late and was offered a room upgrade free-of-charge. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. The room was very clean and well presented. It was cleaned well and restocked each day. Beds were incredibly comfortable and there was no extraneous noise. We were slightly concerned about the size of the room before we arrived, having read previous reviews, but we very happy with the size when we arrived. Although not very spacious, there was plenty of room for us and 3 large suitcases! The concierge was excellent, as were the bar staff. The location couldn't be better - right on the Times Square block, which meant fantastic value for money for the stay. The reception/bar/mezanine area was very well kept and just as they appeared in the website photos. We normally stay in a Times Square hotel that we have always been very happy with, but it is currently closed for refurbishment, so we decided on the Paramount - and we will stick with it from now on. Down to the little details, the Paramount was all we wanted for the trip, and we will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Infestation!”
Reviews.Author: clairewebber
Reviews.Content: A group of us checked in the hotel for a weekend of fun. It wasn't fun when I saw the bed bugs crawling on the pillows. Asked to change to another room because of the bugs and was told there was no room left in the hotel. Had to move to another hotel the last minute, which was a big hassle. The room was small, and the bathroom looked more like a prison hole. The friends who stayed there got bitten by the bugs and were itchy weeks afterwards. Sometimes it was hard to detect the bugs until they crawled on humans to feed. I was glad I moved to a better hotel and even got a free upgrade to a room with Time Square view. Sweet. On top of that, I did not get any bed bug bites.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, I had to change because the first one wasn't enough for me, my wife and the luggage.”
Reviews.Author: MarceloFraga1975
Reviews.Content: The location is really great, the staff is polite, but the first room I stayed in was so small that there was no space to open the luggage other than over the bed (which was REALLY small, fortunatelly my wife and I like to sleep close). We asked for a change, what they promptly did the following day, but we were set in a room for people in weel chairs. A colleague travelled with us and stayed in another very small room, in his case the worst was the bathroom. If you needed to use the vase, there was no space for the legs because of the heater (seriously). In essence, it was a very pleasant stay, in an extraordinary location in Times Square, altough I left with the feeling that there are better options for the same price or less. But it's a hotel with a very modern and stylish design, and the staff was good. A final note: I bought a new pair of sunglasses that disappeared. I wrote a report to hotel security about it, but so far I didn't receive an answer (that was on saturday, nov 6th).

Reviews.Title: “Small but trendy. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ands1
Reviews.Content: Busy reception. Stylish lobby, but bustling. Room (2 double beds, 3 of us sharing) way too small for 3. Flat screen, iPod player but a charge for WiFi when there are buses with free wifi! Tiny wardrobe ie six hangers -all full=overstuffed. Small bathroom, so whole clothes/getting ready tricky for 3 girls. Only tried air con one (it was October) it is the noisest air con I have ever heard - you could only use it if you were going out, it really was that bad. Rooms at the back have no street noise, which is a big plus. Otherwise felt safe, and fantastic location next to Times Square. Pricey for room size. Annoyed at having to pay $2 per bag on checkout day to store our luggage until taxi for airport 4 hrs after checkout time - I think for an expensive hotel this should be a 'given' as part of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Hotel Room in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Upintheairtoomuch
Reviews.Content: This was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Even for NYC standards it was tiny. I even paid for an upgrade so it would not be the smallest room they offered, but still it was probably 10' x 12'. The heat in the bathroom was always on and poured into the room. You tried to counter with the AC which was noisy and either on full blast or off and the temp was never stable. The bed was tiny also. If you are at all clostrophobic (and I am not) don't stay here! the only upside was that the staff was friendly and the neighborhood is great.

Reviews.Title: “Had a FAB time!!”
Reviews.Author: pumpkin2225
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paramount for my son's 17th birthday a few weeks ago. It was during half term, so a very expensive time to travel to NY. My son and I stayed at the Paramount for 1 week and really enjoyed the hotel. On arrival our first room was very small and did not have a great view. I called Reception and spoke to Nathalie, explaining that we had come on the trip for a birthday and was there any chance we could change room. She immediately agreed to change our room, and when I got to reception she also gave my son free internet access for the week, which was great. What more could a 17 year old want when Facebook exists. Nathalie also gave us an upgrade to a twin double room to make our trip all the more comfortable and enjoyable. The hotel is in a great location, Times Square, Broadway, walking distance to 5th Avenue, Empire State Building, Rockerfella Centre, Central Park, Maceys! The list goes on............ Nathalie was also very helpful telling us what subway to get on for different locations which was really useful for getting Statue of Liberty, Century 21, Soho etc. Every where we went was great, and we loved Tick Tock Diner, 34th St 8th Ave (near Penn Stastion) who do a great breakfast and were very friendly. But we did not have a nice experience at the Broadway Comedy Club who bullied us regarding change we were owed! We had a fab time and my son had a birthday he will never forget, which was made all the better by the service and standards of the Paramount Hotel. Thank you Nathalie & Paramount. Anike & Kaz

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in great location....but I can't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: dms11
Reviews.Content: The Paramount is a trendy hotel in a great Times Square location where you are more likely to hear French than English in the elevator. It is also historic, which means small rooms and smaller bathrooms. But I had four problems that would prevent me from staying there again. (1) I specifically asked for and was told I was getting a room with a view. My fifth floor room had a view of a skyscraper if you looked up....way up. But most of the view was of a wall with barbed wire that made me feel more like I was in a prison cell than a hotel. (2) The worst problem was the heating/AC unit. I cannot sleep when the fan keeps going on and off all night long, and always choose the fan "on" setting to prevent that. However, no matter which setting I used, the fan kept shutting off and on quite noisily every hour. I got very little sleep as a result. Glad I was only there one night! (3) Shower had very little water pressure and unadjustable shower head. Also, no washcloths. (I understand I may have been able to request a washcloth, but that is hard to do when you are stepping into the shower and on a tight schedule.) (4) I went to Bar 46 for a glass of wine. Nice little bar, great service and good wine. But when I asked if I could take the glass back to my room, I was told that was "illegal" and had to take it back in a paper cup instead. That has never happened to me before in any hotel. Does room service bring you wine in a paper cup? I doubt it. That was a real bummer and put quite a damper on what had been a pleasant bar experience up to that point. If none of these things bother you, then this may be the hotel for you. But I can't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Hans009
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms in this hotel are rather small, the main reason for remembering The Paramount is the friendliness of the staff. You almost feel like coming home. The trendy lobby with it's pop music gives a grea feeling as well.

Reviews.Title: “Natalie and Lola made my day at the Paramount”
Reviews.Author: rosenest1980
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great hotel, I just left the Edison Hotel after one night due to the fact they have not cleaned or re-modeled since they opened in 1936. Walking in and being greated by two gorgeous women at the front desk, Natalie and Lola, They made check in experience a Utopia, they gave me the rundown of prices and room selection as easy as 1,2,3. The rooms are clean and new, I feel like a new person that I am now in my room. I think Paramount did a great job on the renovation and the hiring of Natalie and Lola, looking at the two women Is a great way to start off your day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time”
Reviews.Author: brogers1035
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to visit New York to watch our Rangers beat the Yankees. We chose the Paramount because of it's location in Times Square. Everything was close by and the customer service was great. The rooms are a bit small but they gave us a free upgrade when asked if we could get a larger room. They also have a nice bar in the lobby where we watched a couple of the playoff games. If great customer service is what you're looking for then I definitely recommend the Paramount.

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: chloe1975
Reviews.Content: I came to NYC for a meeting. My first stay at the Paramount Hotel. What a great hotel. Usually I stay at the W but moving forward I will be making my reservations at the Paramount. Whish you had hotels like that in other states ;)

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Paramount!”
Reviews.Author: coolworld72
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to NYC for her birthday. Made the reservations at the Paramount Hotel and let me just say, it was WORTH IT. We had an amazing time. Hotel was beautiful, the location perfect! Front desk staff was so helpful! They upgraded us to a suite once I told them it was my wifes birthday!. Thank you Paramount!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lovenyc1987
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Great customer service. Lovely rooms and great food. We will be back next month!

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy, trendy, AMAZING location!”
Reviews.Author: Nellie_Nestle
Reviews.Content: We were literally expecting a tin can after reading many reviews, but we must say we were very satisfied with the size of them room - there weren't any real issues with it, except that maybe the luggage is kinda type on the floor space, so at times you may trip and fall in the dark! LOL We arrived to New York on Thursday evening and departed Monday afternoon. Check-in was a tad slow - about 20 minutes to get settled in. The location was excellent, and really our only reason for selecting the hotel. We got the deal with the tickets via expedia, and sincerely would not reserve via their website - I believe that would be a rip off. Minor complaints I personally have - the cleaning staff did not clean our room one day, and when we arrived in the room around 8pm after being out all day we had to call house services in order to get someone to clean up the room. The front counter is really busy , and the one night we attempted to watch a movie, and the pay per view was not working *we later found out that it was de-activated by the previous guests in the room - I think that their kids were trying to order porn, perhaps?!? LOL . I guess it's a good feature for them to have that, but inconvinient for us, because several times we called down and there was no answer ; followed by "we reactivated- try in 5 mins" - followed by more calls, which turned into 30 minutes later it working. Asides from those small inconviniences, I liked it . The rooms were trendy, cozy, cute, clean. Overall we were happy!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: trendytraveler53449
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband decided to take a trip to the city for a little weekend getaway. We ended up finding this hotel on Expedia and decided to check it out. The staff were amazingg! When we arrived a very nice and professional front desk agent took care of everything we needed and provided us with directions to a great restaurant near by. The Paramount made our weekend in NYC the best it could be. I will be letting all my friends and family know about there fantastic service!

Reviews.Title: “A complete and utter rip off”
Reviews.Author: RichardCWilliams
Reviews.Content: My room is tiny and two nights are costing me $700. The room is so small that the base of the coffee table and upright lamp overlap. WiFi is $24 for 4 nights per device a outrageous when you think that most coffee shops offer it for free. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. I feel screwed.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average. It's a bit of a dive.”
Reviews.Author: marniemac
Reviews.Content: Just checked out today after a week at the Paramount. Next hotel is going to feel like a six star resort I'm sure.... Now I get that staff have attitude in NYC but these guys were so freaking rude. I actually got an electric shock TWICE from the electrics in my room. Did they care? Nope. Did they fix the problem, move me to another room...? Nope. An electric shock is serious business people - and they couldn't have given a damn. Plus I had to blow dry my hair in a colleague's room. Thank goodness I had someone I knew well enough to ask. And no, I didn't have a choice in where I stayed or would have happily checked out. Pros Rooms were pretty clean. We had 11 rooms booked in total and mine was by far the best (thank god!) which is saying something. My room was spotless but I saw colleagues' bathrooms and yuck. Not somewhere you'd want to shower. But this was the pros list, wasn't it!? Location. Near Times Square. Could be seen as a plus. Is a pretty rough spot though. We were woken one morning by blood curdling screams from the street below. Welcome to NYC! Breakfast. Was fine. Avoid the eggs though. Oh and the coffee. But Dean & Deluca downstairs do a pretty good coffee (Aussie style). Cons Taking your life in your hands when switching on electrical equipment Rough location (but it is central) Staff who are beyond rude and have zero care factor No fridges in rooms Teensy tiny rooms (but it is New York) If you want somewhere clean and cheapish that you will spend zero time in, then knock yourself out. If you like staying somewhere halfway decent, don't do it to yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Good location small rooms but very well maintained”
Reviews.Author: rowrow99
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but overall A very pleasant stay in a great location with good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: wicked66
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very small rooms (literally). When I arrived my room wasn't ready and I was offered a different type (even smaller- without a table). To compensate me, the hotel's front desk person immediately offered me free breakfast ($28/day) and free wireless ($15/day) for every day of stay (3). The hotel is REAL close to most of Broadway's theaters

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, best for new years, sightseeing, great value”
Reviews.Author: pixieloz85
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Paramount Hotel twice and loved it just as much both times. First was for New Years and then just for a shorter trip the second. The rooms are very small which isnt really a problem as this is pretty standard in New York. Also you are never there. Its a great base because it was so close to everything so if we did a bit of shopping or needed a bit of a rest we could walk back with ease. Its right next to Broadway also so great for shows. Subway is about a 5 min walk too. Staff were very helpful and had a room available so we were able to check in early. There is also a dean and deluca cafe downstairs and many bagel places close by for a cheaper breakfast option. New Years tips. If you havent been to New York before for New Years they block of Times Square in the early afternoon. Its a case of either be locked in our out. So if your in you pretty much cant leave your viewing post from 2pm until after midnight. Not so great when its -9 outside and your hungry or need to use the bathroom. Staying at the Paramount however we could enter in right near Times Square by showing our room key. This meant we could have the option of being right next to the action but being able to come and go. Also they opened the gates when the ball was dropping so we ran right in the middle of the action at midnight :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Front Desk Personality & Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: NATEDEE
Reviews.Content: I haven't ever stayed at a hotel with such great customer service like Nathalie and Lola provided when I checked in and throughout my stay. They both have great personalities and made me feel very comfortable by joking around with me while pulling up my reservation. Nathalie takes service with a smile to another level and honestly it's people like her that would make me not only stay here again but recommend the Paramount to others. The people working at the front desk of most other hotels just do their job but Nathalie and Lola went above and beyond to make me feel at home. Hopefully their manager sees this review and recognizes them both for this because trust me, it's not commonplace at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to land”
Reviews.Author: ShamanCuervo
Reviews.Content: The Paramount combines the right amounts of atmosphere, location, charm, artistic flair and great staff to sustain itself against tough hotel competitors in Manhattan. Special thanks to Nathalie at the desk, and gracias for the dim lights in the elevators. My room was comfortable and I had enough room for morning yoga. Breakfast there is quite good, and the coffee is done right. I go to Manhattan to do TV, and need a good place to land. You're going to hear the famous New York trash trucks no matter where you stay, but the Paramount is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: visakman
Reviews.Content: Hotel rates are high, which one expects in New York for quality. What I did not expect to pay was an outrageous daily charge for wifi connection ;when you are paying around $450 a night , the least they can do is give free wifi access. I questioned the staff about this and was advised to complain: so I am ! One other point, this is the only hotel I have ever been charged for post check out luggage storage..,, it just left an impression that the managment were out the screw the last dollar out of you. I will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: MarkyB73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3nights after spending a week in Boston. Picked this hotel due to location for times square. Arrived at 3pm to be told our room was not ready. The kind lady on the front desk explained it may take at least 30 mins to find a room. She was aware of the difficult journey we had already had (late train), and offered us a buffett breakfast voucher for the delay in getting a room which was a nice touch. The room itself whlslt on the small side had enough space for 2 double beds, and enough closet space. All in all the hotel is very modern internally and all staff we meet were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in the area for less money”
Reviews.Author: planktonrules
Reviews.Content: PROS--Clean and good location (very near most theaters) CONS--Rooms are tiny, walls very thin and amenities you expect to find are absent I did not hate this hotel--it's just that I've stayed at several other nearby NYC hotels that were much better values for the money. Typical amenities such as coffee makers, ice buckets, refrigerators, etc. are absent--and the tiny rooms have almost no space at all for clothing or suitcases (as Henny Youngman used to joke "the rooms were so small that the mice were all hunchbacked!". My biggest problem, however, was the level of noise in the room--you can easily hear those in surrounding rooms and outside--even though I was on the 14th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: brandy621
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 2 night stay at The Paramount and really liked the hotel. It was in a fabulous location! You just turn left out of the hotel walk to the end of the street and you are literally in Times Square. It was so nice to be centrally located and made it easy for stops back at our room between outings. The hotel and room were both decorated really nice. I was expecting the room to be much smaller than it was based on some comments on this site but was pleasantly surprised. We had a corner room with a king bed and had no problem with hotel noise at all although the city noise (sirens, horns, etc...)did wake me up several times each night. Both my husband and I thought the bed/pillows, etc...were one of the most comfortable beds we had ever slept on. I was also really worried about the bed bug problem in NYC and saw no sign of them in the room (I did check the mattress very closely several times a day) so that definitely a good thing although we did still take precautions and kept our bag/clothes off the floor and bed. We did not use the hotel restaurant, bar or concierge so I can't comment on that. There were a couple of things I think that are worth mentioning. We originally made the reservation for one night. About 5 days before our trip my husband and I decided to see if we were able to stay another night and if they had a room available. I called to double check our reservation and ask and the first thing they say is that they have us down for 2 nights (this was before I asked about staying another night). I told her that I have the email confirmation in front of me and it only says one night and she tells me she has us down for 2 nights in the computer. Well...since I was calling to add a night anyway it was no big deal and it worked out but I was thinking -what if I never called and got there to check in and they had us down for 2 nights when we only wanted one - that would have defintiely been an issue. The other thing was that on our reservation we had a king bed and confirmed it when we called but when we checked in we were told it was a queen and there were no more kings available. I then showed her the printout I had brought of the reservation and she was able to "somehow" get a king for us. The other thing and I obviously can't be 100% sure is that I think the valet people might have knicked our car somehow. I didn't notice until halfway home and the reason I'm pretty confident it was them is that it is a brand new car and we've only had it a month so I've been really careful about it so far. Overall, we did like the hotel and would definitely stay here again despite the issues. I think the location and niceness of the hotel override any issues we did have.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjcvh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend had stayed at the Paramount on two previous visits to New York and insisted we book there for our trip. The hotel is in a great location just off Times Square. On checking in we received a free upgrade from superior queen to deluxe king room. The room was small, but we had not expected it to be large and we did not intend to spend much time there so this was not a problem. The room, and the rest of the hotel, was very nicely decorated. The walls seem fairly thin, we could hear other guests talk. We did not visit the hotel bar or restaurant. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayellHerts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for two nights prior to boarding a cruise ship. This hotel is well situated next to Times Square. The room which the four of us shared was not huge but then New York hotel rooms rarely are. It was ok, room wasnt particularly cosy but the service was good when I rang down for help with the safety deposit box. Couldnt get anything on the tv apart from stuff that we had to pay for. Didnt eat or drink anything here so cannot comment on that. Found the communal areas very dark. Probably wouldnt choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Girls get away that was great!”
Reviews.Author: Maggy96
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location for us - close to Broadway plays, good restaurants, great shopping and transportation. We did it all - and enjoyed every bit of it. The staff was upbeat and helpful - the bar and deli were great. I am ready to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lac48
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paramount 15 years ago and it was such a chic hotel. I stayed there this weekend and it has gone done hill siginificantly. There was no one at the front door while I was trying to carry in my bags. We waited in a long line while trying to check in even though there were people behind the front desk not helping any customers. The rooms are miniature. The enamel on the tub in our bathroom was peeling and there was no room in the bathroom for toiletries. And finally when we were waiting for our car after checking out, there was spit on the wall in the foyer. Really?! We went to Soho to snother hotel on Saturday night which was less than $100 a night more and we're treated like royalty. Champagne when we checked in. The rooms were georgous and the staff couldn't do enough to make us comfortable. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Houtson
Reviews.Content: Location fantastic just off Time Square. Staff pleasant, room very clean with excellent maid service. Nice lobby. Paid extra for superior queen room and although nicely made out it was really small - just enough room to walk around bed and tiny half wardrobe - bit of a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent comfortable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: HotelFareham
Reviews.Content: We found the Paramount Hotel really nice, very clean, service was excellent - the room was a little small but was not a problem to us as we only slept in the room and out most of the day., The bedding was very clean, nice flufffy white towels that were changed every day and the room kept spotless. The location was excellent as situated in the middle of all what was going on and couldn't ask for anything better. We did not eat in the hotel so cannot give an opinion - If we go to New York again we would definatley stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish interior, fantastic staff, unbeatable location.”
Reviews.Author: ttmDyfed
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES - The Paramount has an incredible Manhattan location, as it is only literally a minute's walk from Times Square and Madame Tussauds, approx 10 minute walk to the Rockefeller Center and 20 minute walk to the Empire State Building and Central Park. - The hotel itself and its rooms look very sleek, stylish and clean. The hotel has a luggage storage facility which was a great help for me as I had a place to store my luggage until my transfer to the airport after I had checked out on my last day. -My room was equipped with many extra features such as: hairdryer, iron and board, safe, wardrobe with drawers and hangers, multiple electric sockets, large flat screen television, CD radio player with alarm. - The staff were very helpful, socialable and friendly. One particular member of the reception staff, a young man named Lorenzo, virtually saved my holiday when I realised my tour operator (expedia) had made an error with my room booking and he corrected it hassle free when it was not his nor the hotel's responsibilty to do so. NEGATIVES - The only real negative I identified during my time at the Paramount was the air conditioning system in my room. The system was fairly loud, and disrupted my friend from sleeping on our first night. Every night after the first night, we attempted to use the controls to switch off the system, but it was hit and miss as some nights it would switch off and others it would not. - Wi-Fi access was available, however it was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: teelucien
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind spending $300/night for a 10 ft X 10 ft room with a double bed that is 3 ft from the door, then this is the place for you. The bathroom is equally small, has no counter tops to put shave gear, etc. just a couple of small shelves above the toilet. Be sure to close the lid in case anything falls from the shelves! Don't put on too much soap when showering because with the low water pressure you might take a long time getting it off. This has to be the worst hotel room I've ever stayed in. Were I not with collegues, I would have moved after the first night. One would think that for $300 per night, they could have repaired the buckling wallpaper and cracked ceiling texture in the room. Also, the deadbolt on the door didn't work. The only thing positive I can say is that I didn't find any bedbugs. The place was built in 1928 and I found the lighting dim and depressing throughout the place. When they say location, location they were talking about this place because I can think of no other reason they could ask as much for a night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a classic hotel with a modern feel.”
Reviews.Author: Oakdrums
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It looks like a classic older building from the exterior in the midst of the theater district. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The room was beautiful, well appointed and quiet. I really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, clean, great hotel, customer service & location!”
Reviews.Author: eiralill
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded our expectations. It was beautiful, hip, trendy and very clean. The service was also very good. One bad point: On our reservation we had requested a bigger room, however, upon arrival it seemed that the hotel had not received that information. Thankfully, being upgraded was no problem, but the lady at the reception desk told us that we were being charged extra for that. Obviously we were not happy about that and a couple of days later we ended up talking to other guests in the hotel, who told us they'd complained about the size of their room and were being upgraded free of charge! Naturally, I complained with Manager of the hotel who waived the extra charge in the end. I think we had the deluxe room, which was really nice. It truly resembles the photos of the hotel posted on their website and everything in the room seemed brand new. The beds were super comfortable, too. The only downside of the room, if I had to mention something, was the fact that the airco was a little noisy and the view of the room was of an adjacent building. But for us it wasn't a problem. The location is PERFECT since it is super central. We would definitely go there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123walker
Reviews.Content: The Paramount is a design Hotel at the Time Square. It is perfectly located in the Center of NYC. Alltough it is designed by philippe starck it is not all well done. The Rooms are very small and clean. For us it was the perfect choice we had a wonderfull time and where able to relaxe after a long day in the city. I liked the modern still of the Hotelrooms and Loby. There is a Cafe in the same building which is perfect to start the day with a large coffee. I would recommend the Hotel to pounger people who rater like a modern styl then a classical hotel flair.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: raposaraposa
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel - going to stay there again and again! Great location! Friendly, helpful staff! Clean and nicely designed! AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exciting Location, but that doesn't justify and Excellent rating”
Reviews.Author: DTNPROMAN
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location in the Theatre District and the excitement of Times Square, but the hotel itself is only average. When I checked in, i was given a room with two double beds on the 4th floor. The room overlooked a brick wall with barbed wire on it, so I immediately went back down and asked to be moved to perhaps a higher floor not overlooking that. I was moved to the 11th floor facing the street, which was fine. I would just suggest that you ask for a high floor at check in so you will not feel like you are in a small cave. The room is nothing extra. The ceiling in my room had extensive water damage that left the texture missing and large water marks over it. The A/C is not central, so you either choose the loud noise of the box window unit with it blowing out cold air next to the bed, or turn it off and the room quickly becomes stuffy. The closet is very small and there is not enough room for the clothes to hang their full length, so my suit and shirts were dragging the bottom. There is no counter space in the small bathroom, although there are a couple of small shelves mounted above the toilet. The beds are comfortable enough. The price might be a draw. If location is more important to you than the facilities, you will be happy here. If you plan to spend much time in the hotel, you may not be so pleased.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL - VERY CLEAN, GREAT STAFF, BEST BED EVER!”
Reviews.Author: tleach2010
Reviews.Content: My husband had to go to NYC for a conference and invited me to go and we would stay the weekend – as my birthday present. I was not that excited about this hotel as many of the reviews indicated that the rooms and bathrooms were too small but he got a great price ($292 a night on hotels.com) and promised that we could move to another hotel for the last two nights if this one wasn’t okay. Our flight was very delayed and we didn’t get to the hotel until 2:30 am. The staff was very gracious (I had called before we left town and requested an upgrade to a king room if possible and was told if any opened up that I could for a $40 surcharge), they upgraded us to a king room for no extra charge. The room was extremely clean, the bed and linens were definitely luxury 4 star worthy!! The bathroom was also extremely clean – with a fabulous soaking tub. The room was much bigger than any hotel that we have stayed in the past (in NYC). It was a corner room, which I think made a difference. When we were leaving our room one day we did see one of the standard rooms (with the double bed) and it appeared to be very small – I would spend the extra money to get a queen if you can). The air conditioning was great and the CO Bigelow toiletries were to die for! The first night we did smell some smoke but I think someone that was staying in a room next to us must have been smoking when they came in late that night. I mentioned it to the cleaning lady in the hall way the next morning and she said that she would change all the linens in our room for us when she cleaned – which was very nice! We never smelled it again but the front desk said they could move us if it we wanted. We were on the 6th floor and never had to wait for an elevator, overall the hotel is quite and we could have slept all day! The location is perfect but if you want to catch a cab it is difficult - even for the doorman. Since it is on the same street as a couple of big theaters all the cabs that went by were full - we ended up walking a up a couple of blocks to catch one. There are so many great things about this hotel, the super chic lobby area, the Library Bar & restaurant (great place to have drinks and not feel like you are at a club), the fitness center rocks, the room service was fast and great food, the sports bar is also a great place to have a drink and watch all the people go by (the entire front is glass), and the Dean & Deluca that is right off the lobby had the best cupcakes ever! Most importantly the staff was extremely gracious and hospitable. A bit expensive but every bit worth it, we can’t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: lishus
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on a quick girls trip to NYC. The hotel lobby is lovely and very modern. The rooms have been updated. The linens appear new. The rooms are quite small. The bathroom had been remodeled and was very modern but small. Considering we use our rooms in NYC to sleep and clean up the size of the room just has never been a concern. Times Square is only a block away. We were within walking distance of shows and excellent restaurants or the subway to get anywhere we wanted to go. We were only on the 3rd floor and were at the back of the hotel but I did hear sirens and some traffic. If it had been enough to keep me awake I had earplugs but didn't use them. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location for a few days in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Waysiders
Reviews.Content: Very trendy foyer! Hotel will take your car at the door and valet park for you - quite expensive but v convenient - ask for parking package when booking. Rooms are small but immaculate and quite stylish. 2 mins and you're in Times Square. Lots of reasonably priced restaurants a couple of blocks in the opposite direction. Great base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rob850_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paramount in August 2010 and thought it was an amazing hotel mainly for it's location but also it's style. I have to agree with the other reviews the rooms are very small, when we arrived after long flight and what seemed an eternity at the airport I have to say I was a bit dissapointed with the size of the room. Once we had a good nights sleep got up unpacked it was actually not an issue and we were in the most vibrant city on earth we did not plan on staying in the hotel much. The hotel bar was nice and if you have pre booked theatre tickets you get buy one get one free on one round of drinks the night of your performance just show the bar staff your tickets. The best part of the hotel was the location out of the main doors turn left 1 minute walk your in the heart of times square which has an atmosphere I have never felt in a city before, but it's not just close to times square we felt we could get anywhere in the city easily seeing our hotel was so central and most of the time we could walk there. Staff were very friendly concierge booked a couple of trips for us and reccomended some places to eat and reception we very helpful, especially when concierge was closed they booked my shuttle bus pick up for return to the airport. All in all a great holiday always is better with a great hotel and if you are not bothered by small rooms you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely overrated!”
Reviews.Author: europeanexplorer_cat
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights and paid a fortune (the daily rate on my bill varied from $199, what would have been a fair rate, to the absolutely ridiculous amount of $379 per night). Yes, the location is great but if you expect a "design hotel" then you are on the wrong track. The lobby is sort of cool but the rooms are below average standards. I booked one of the more expensive rooms (Superior Queen) since I was warned that the cheapest rooms are literally the size of a shoe box. The shower was infested with mildew but the house keeping didn't care despite a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “finally found a sensational hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: drunkinjuly
Reviews.Content: As a regular NYC traveler, I decided to book a room close to Broadway, and found this hotel online at a great price. As a married couple in our thirties, I was also attracted to the chic and modern look, as every other hotel we've stayed at for the same price is typically dirty and small (and usually I don't get worked up, as we usually don't hang in the room anyway). Well, needless to say, the decor and lobby were beautiful, and the staff was great right away. We were even offered a nicer room (the room was perfect, hip, decorative, and extremely exeeded my expectations) at no cost. In retrospect, I actually wish we did the valet parking, as it wasn't much of a difference parking in a 24 hour lot. There's little touches of coolness scattered around the hotel, and the bar was nice with a great view of the broadway shows (my wife saw Jordin Sparks from the lobby bar and ran out to get a photo). All in all, we'll DEF. be back. Also, it's perfect walking distance to central park, many cool irish bars we found, times square (much better without the through traffic), Rock center, and of course, Broadway! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “great location but small rooms with no storage space”
Reviews.Author: woodsy1504
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paramount Hotel for 5 nights with my son on 8-13th September. the hotel is a block away from Times Square and there is a subway station round the corner. The rooms are small with very little space to move around. The wardrobe is a small space which also contains a small set of drawers/a safe and ironing board. Clothes do not hang properly. As space is limited our cases, clothes and shopping all ended up on the floor which decreased the circulation space further! As there are no facilities in the rooms to make tea or coffee we used the Dean and Deluca coffee shop every day. All the staff were friendly and helpful and the concierge service is great. We went to the Italian restaurant next to the hotel and found the staff, well one waiter in particular to be unpleasantly pushy! The location of the hotel is so good I would recommend it on that basis bearing in mind the problem with the rooms..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJWelshGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paramount NYC on 11 & 12 September 2010 (We had booked the Marriott Marquis over a year ago, but our Travel Agent messed up)!
