The location is excellent, it is right on Times Square and is right in the middle of all the action. The Hotel Reception is dark and dingy and smells of incence. I think it is supposed to be trendy, but looks seedy. I was there with my husband & parents and we had 2 rooms on the 7th floor. The rooms were very small with no space to open up suitcases ( we had been on a cruise for 10 nights previous to our stay so had large suitcases). The walls were painted a dark grey and looked more like a prison cell than a hotel room. The bathroom was tiny. The airconditioning was so loud that we couldn't have it on (and it was over 28 degrees C on 11/09). The view was of an alleyway housing other rooms' a/c units which were so loud that we couldn't sleep! The bedding was not that clean either. As it was Fashion Week the prices quoted for this hotel were a rip-off, but we were trapped because of our T/Agent's mistake. There was a bar and the prices were astronomical, but in fairness, all of New York was like that (take lots of money)! There was a cafe linked to the Hotel and whilst not cheap the breakfast food/coffee here was very good (Dean & Deluca).

Reviews.Title: “Last minute booking”
Reviews.Author: aydiosmio1
Reviews.Content: Decided on a last minute trip to New York. I'm glad I was able to find a room for a decent price, especially right in times square (I booked it through a 3rd party site). Arrived before noon and they couldn't find our reservation. I work at a hotel and it happens, but they found it and we came back after three to check in. Room was clean, nice size bathroom, view of buildings, and comfy pillows. Its a nice hotel with modern decor and dim lighting in the public areas, giving it a hip ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Indifference does not equate with Assertive”
Reviews.Author: greatlake155019
Reviews.Content: After 10 hrs driving we finally got there at 3.30 pm, check in time is 3.00pm, our reservation was 3 rooms for hree nights made 1 month in advance, only one was ready, we were assured all the rooms were on the same floor and the other two will be ready in one hour after three hours we were told the rooms were ready but not on the same floor, we were told we can be on the same floor the next day but we will have to move our bags to their storage for 1.50 per bag and we will be out of a room for three hours. The phone in one room was not working and had to be replaced, all three elevators quit at the same time and we were on the 12 fl. there was no ice on our floor, we later found out only one floor had ice. Now all of the problems above may seems minor since they were eventually resolved, but they were magnified when you have a front desk staff that were rude and idifferent. I think they were lying to us our rooms were not on the same floor and not ready because they were selling them to the highest bidder, the rooms were small and uncomfortably, it was the labour day weekend and it was busy but is'nt service is what a Hotel is all about?

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience that was Highly Recommended by Expedia.com”
Reviews.Author: FrequeTravler
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to the US Open. It was supposed to be special. Our first time at that event. One of my friends was staying near Times Square, and his hotel was full. I went to Expedia where I usually get good advice. They highly recommended the Paramount Hotel. I am never trusting Expedia again. The hotel was full. It had a tiny ugly lobby full of people with their luggage. So no hope of early check in. Then to check my bags with the bell boys took me half an hour (waiting in line). I could tell that they were losing everyones bags. Then to my horrible suprise (I paid over USD 250 per night) they gave me the smallest hotel room I have ever seen (and I travel through Europe and Japan often). I could barely walk into it. While the room was clean and quiet, it was so small, and the bed so uncomfortable for that price, that I woke up with back pain every day. The staff was rude, which is typical in NYC, but only at the hotels with no standards. Stay at the Hilton, Westin, the W, or any other hotel with standards nearby. The elevators broke and we had to walk down the stairs. I brought this up with the staff and they could not care less. This is my first time writing a review for a hotel ever. I felt like I owed it to the people of the world to stay as far as possible from this horrible establishment. I almost feel compelled to leave my phone number here...

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: mini0
Reviews.Content: Stayed for seven nights in September, 2010. Booked a Classic double room on bed only basis. Pluses. Two minutes to times square. Room on sixth floor facing street was very clean and modern with large bathroom. Heard very little noise from street. Sound proofing in room excellent. Four very fast lifts. Ice machine on fourth floor. Very helpful staff. Cons. Double bed a little small and very limited eardrobe space.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Stay”
Reviews.Author: HARVARDBOY28
Reviews.Content: The inside reality of this hotel does not match the outside perception of these previous reviews. This hotel has really gone downhill since my last stay 4 years ago.The staff at the Paramount has become very seedy and unwellcomming. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “CELL BLOCK 784”
Reviews.Author: GIZZMOCt_Usa
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews carefully. We booked "The Broadway Classic" but were STUFFED into "The Petite". The room measures 9X10 with a 3x4 Bath. The bed called a double is 4x61/2.(two pillows were wider than the bed and hung off the sides) There is hardly room for one adult. My wife and I are both 6 feet tall 200 and 150 lbs. We had to keep the suitecase in the bathtub. The airconditioner is attached to the outerwall under a window and blows very cold air over the bed or none at all.The window views another room across a narrow alley. We placed our shoes on the window sill as we needed the space in the narrow closet for our jackets. When we begged to be upgraded to better accomodations ( we would have paid any additional charges) we were told nothing could be done. Several other "Guests" were also complaining. My understanding from others is that "The Broadway Classic" was just as small. They should Specialize as a Hotel for Singles under 125 lbs or Circus Midgets. The lounge doesn't open till 6:PM and the restaurant Bar at 5:PM One other thing; we arrived before noon and requested an early reservation but were told they didn't assign rooms till 3:PM and would call my cell phone when they had a room for us ..they never called and by 4:30 we were given CELL BLOCK 784.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Sharan07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic in terms of location, just a few minutes walk from Times Square, allowing easy access to local restaurants, shops, tourist ticket offices and broadway shows. The atmosphere was great, and the hotel lobby was a welcomed retreat from the busy streets, this stylish and contemporary space was incredibly relaxing. The rooms were also inkeeping with the style set out in the lobby. The highlight of the hotel though, has to be by far the staff, who were all very welcoming and pleasant. Service was fantastic, in particular the restaurant staff, who were prompt, friendly and great for finding out more about the city. I would most definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay reminded he of how seedy...”
Reviews.Author: SuitcasesPacked
Reviews.Content: Recent stay reminded he of how seedy crowded and dirty the Times Square area can be. The hotel is fine as others said very small rooms functional. Bathroom tub was chipped but otherwise ok. Asked for a quiet room got floor 12. You can still hear the street and when folks close their doors in the rooms near you you can hear it very clearly. Odd experience with front desk trying to get in our room pretty late night. Not sure why they thought it was empty we had keys and the bill when we left made it under the door ok. Ps if want to leave bags $2 per bag and depending on time of day/crowd maybe little wait.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Deborah69
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel about 22.30pm. When we got to our room we couldn't believe the size of it, After staying in New York 4 years ago we were expecting a large room with tea/coffee making facilities. Oh no. The room was SO small we almost fell on the bed when we opened the door. The bathroom was equally as small. The bed was meant to be a double, more like a single. Wardrobe? no where to hang clothes, just the same as no where to store your suit cases. We had to climbe over them! We went to reception to ask to change rooms but none available till next day, fair enough. We did have to pay extra, we noticed several people doing the same as us. When we got back from our day out in New York we were looking forward to our new room. Opened the door and low and behold, the room was slightly bigger than our last room. Still no wardrobe space and we had to keep our clothes in our cases. The bathroom was just as small, shower had no go in it. The air conditioning was noisey and didn't seem to work very well. Although the staff were friendly, the corridors to the rooms were drab and the rooms were just too small. We would not stay there again, however, it is is a good place for the theatres and Time Square. I would say the room would be adequate for one person.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: reds820
Reviews.Content: Trey And Crystar were two of the most helpfull hotel staff I've come across in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Anamaria!”
Reviews.Author: MarinaAvalonLB
Reviews.Content: Anamaria at the check-in desk was very kind and courteous. She was able to get us in early (we arrived before 11am) and she was able to upgrade us at no extra cost. She was very professional and always had a smile on her face! She was the BEST employee at the hotel! Thanks again for making our stay better than anticipated! She should get a promotion. She knows how to deal with guests....btw, I own a hotel in California...wish I could steal her:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: hazelbrasseurToronto
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after a 3 day stay at the Paramount Hotel and although the room was a bit small....my daughter and I were very comfortable. Room was immaculate. We found the staff to be exceptionally friendly and eager to please. Perfect location for shows, museums and of course shopping! Can't wait to go back...highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: fcfdlombardi
Reviews.Content: Checked in to spend one night, room was small which we expected but clean and crisp. The amenities were up to date and clean. I would stay there again, the staff were very helpful. Close to everything restaurants, Times Square and theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: born2ctheglobe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work in August, I've stayed in many ny hotels and the paramount is up there especially for the 3star level. I didn't have the room size others did but I think this is because I got upgraded from a double to king size bed. The women at check in was great and was able to do this for me after I agreed to make a donation to charity. The donation was well worth the upgrade for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Medemeah
Reviews.Content: For those who want to be a few steps away from Times Square and the center of Manhattan, this hotel is definitely a good choice (subway, theaters... it's right there). Few things you need to know thoough : - Refuse rooms on the last floor (19th), too small (we stayed there the first nights and couldn't open our luggage on the floor, besides there was a terrible smell in the bathroom, so we moved to the 15th floor very easily). - Try to get a room high enough so you don't get too much noise from the street below. Times Square is hectic, with lots of traffic and tourist activity. For a quiet place, choose Greenwich Village...

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with tiny rooms - good location though”
Reviews.Author: Jass_V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Times Square. You walk out and everything is available. However for the money you pay you get a tiny room. If you don't mind living out of your suitcase then this should be adequate. They seem to be nice when checking in etc e.g porter don't charge for keeping your luggage etc. However after checking out the porter will charge $2 for each item of luggage you want to keep behind. This is the most I've paid for a room and its also been the smallest room i've stayed in! your basically paying for location. There are other hotels which are nicer and cheaper nearby, wish I'd known beforehand. internet access is not free but 3 min walk to starbucks offers free wifi so bring your laptop!

Reviews.Title: “Service is good”
Reviews.Author: tangtang06
Reviews.Content: Front desk ladies are very helpful and nice, and they presented high quality services.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, great service”
Reviews.Author: FGarza
Reviews.Content: Great, great location, half block from Times Square. You can walk to most of the main Broadway theaters. The room was quite comfortable. Superb attention from staff, specially Nathalie from Front Desk

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL- 5 STAR!”
Reviews.Author: LadyDiana1
Reviews.Content: A 5 star hotel…..location, location, location!!!! Amazing it was our first time to New York and an ideal base for a weeks visit; we couldn’t believe our eyes when walking out of the hotel entrance straight into the centre of Times Square. A very clean and modern hotel with very friendly staff. I have already recommended this hotel to family and friends and will be returning on my next visit. The rooms are on the smaller side, but this isn’t an issue as the modern design and room perks more than make up for this. One of the best hotels I have stayed in, a top hotel- 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel very well situated”
Reviews.Author: Malkolino
Reviews.Content: Room small (like almost everywhere in N.Y.), but very clean, staff very friendly. Located near Times Square, restaurants et theaters. Perfect for a short stay in Manhattan. We can really recommend this Hotel. Irene + André, Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Central, nice, clean, ridiculously small rooms”
Reviews.Author: max_from_Italy
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Paramount Hotel NY for a week in August, 2010, travelling from Venice (Italy). The hotel location is fantastic, practically in Times Square. The lobby is nice and elegant, and the personnel is welcoming. The room cleaning is OK (the towels and bed sheets were changed daily), and I could not find any evident sign of dirt or dust around. The bed (a double one) was comfortable, although somewhat short. I did not have breakfast at the hotel, so I cannot provide my judgment on this issue. There are some major negative issues one should be aware of before making a reservation in this hotel. The rooms are awfully small. Since I was aware of this issue from earlier TripAdvisor reviews, I booked a 2-double-bed room (we were a party of two people sharing the room), hoping that this would provide us with some more comfort. We were assigned room 1621, right in front of the elevator. Well, once we and our luggage were inside the room, hardly any other space was available for moving (actually, there was room for opening only one piece of luggage at a time!). The bathroom was incredibly small: the basin was a 30-centimeter diameter steel one, compressed between the wc and the bath tub/shower; there was almost no room to place the personal bath stuff and the towels in use; an old-styled sticky nylon curtain protected the bathroom from being flooded when taking a shower; an hairdryer was not available (although according to internet information it should have been). The cupboard was ridiculously small as well. Not only was it unsuitable to accommodate the clothes of more than just one single person, but it was also so small that suites/dresses could not be fitted in their entire lengths within. An iron with ironing board were indeed available, but they were useless due to lack of space to accommodate the board once it was opened. An armchair was present, which had to be used to accommodate some of our clothes. A desk with chair was not available. Given that this 2-double-bed room is meant to host AT LEAST two people (if not 3 or 4), the room size was totally unfit, even for 2 people only. This was quite annoying, given the fact that the room rate was much larger than that of a standard double room. The room was also very noisy. This was not due to cars, but to outside air conditioning systems. The noise was continuous at every single hour of the day. Given that the hotel was renovated in 2009, it is incredible that it was not equipped with soundproof windows. Max

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service and Chic Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Nanc1202
Reviews.Content: The Paramount is a rare gem in NYC. The exterior has a classic old world facade, and the interior has an eclectic air of chic warmth. There are people waiting to greet you, direct you and help you in any and every way. The proximity to all things New York is perfect- we did not have to cab it all. The rooms are on the smaller side, but adequate. The bedding is plush, the bathrooms used the space smartly. We indulged ourselves and had the breakfast buffet. It worth the money if you eat more than a bagel in the am. I would tell anyone traveling from outside the US that this hotel offers more than any of the upscale "chain" hotels at a much more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Alana Helbling, rocks!!! She helps make The Paramount Hotel NYC the posh place to bring friends and family.”
Reviews.Author: iheartnyc54
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Paramount for four nights last week. Alana made the trip smooth and well worth inviting 20 friends and family. Everything was well prepared for our arrival and the hospitality was excellent. We plan to bring a larger group next year, thanks to Alana's professionalism and care. The Paramount is perfect, if you want a NYC experience without the hussle and bustle of oversized hotels. It was quaint and quiet. perfect after the long days exploring Manhattan. A1!!! Alana Helbling, rocks!!! She helps make The Paramount Hotel NYC the posh place to bring friends and family. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: northwestloco
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel and very professional staff. We had the breakfast package which is a good deal. Natalie check us in and was very courteous and was able to get us early check in. So ask for Natalie and she will point you in the right direction. Times Square is just down the block and at night I felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, good value”
Reviews.Author: mec456
Reviews.Content: We just got back from New York City and we chose the Paramount based on reviews concerning it's great location and we agree, although our room was small (we travel light anyways) you couldn't beat the location right off Times Square. We did have a problem with our room the first night, had to be moved because of flooding (due to air conditioner malfunction) but they upgraded us to a king room the next day and didn't charge any extra. We got a better price by booking online thru Red Tag Travel than the other hotel sites. We bought 7 day unlimited metro passes the first day and took the metro everywhere, what a great way to see the city, a main station is just 4 blocks from the hotel and lots to see on the way. You are right next to Broadway theatres and lots of pubs and restaurants. If you can put up with the small rooms (we didn't spend much time in it) the location and price makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever :-)”
Reviews.Author: Ady010
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Paramount Hotel on the Wednesday pm to the most friendliest staff ever. Stayed in superior Queen room which was ample for the two of us. We were delighted with the cool decor and immaculate room. Fabulous bathroom. It was really hot and we were so thankful for the air con which was kept to cool so that the room felt comfortable at all times. Room very quiet. We could not hear any other guests in the hotel or any noise from outside. Concierge very helpful and gave us a map with directions to ground zero and how to get there on the subway. We were able to print off our boarding passes on the last day also for the airport. Nothing was trouble for the staff at the hotel. Also able to leave luggage on the last day whilst we had a walk about whilst waiting to depart for the airport. We will stay at the Paramount again and cant wait to return. Thank you to all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: gypsygirl1212
Reviews.Content: I was enchanted with the decor. Our room was chrome with shades of grey to black with splashes of red that gave the stark minimalism a "Pop". Our room was well designed with little spaces behind the bathroom mirror to hold the towels. Everything was sparkly clean and well thought out. The staff were delightful. Our doorman helped us with our luggage, our taxi and directions. When we departed he even suggested he hoped to see us back for our 47th anniversary. Natalie at the check in/check desk was professional with excellent "people skills". It was just a wonderful experience and was right across the street from the Imperial Theatre. To be complete I did think that a $13.95 charge to use the internet was excessive. Hence, we did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION with excellent rates!”
Reviews.Author: TXGIRL02
Reviews.Content: You read a lot of complaints about the room size, but we had no problem with it. This was our 2nd trip to NYC, so we knew what to expect in room size. Who stays in their room much while in NY anyway?! The important thing is it's clean, the staff is friendly and helpful. We had a great stay at the Paramount Hotel. Bed was comfy with great pillows. Bathroom was small, but clean and stocked with plenty of towels and toiletries. You could not ask for a better location than the Paramount Hotel. We walked to Madison Square Garden for the Tom Petty concert (excellent concert btw). Only a few blocks to Jersey Boys (highly recommend). Just steps from Time Square and Restaurant Row (Bourbon Street is excellent & Amy's Bakery just around the corner). Just steps to the Gray Line bus tours. And don't forget to step into Dean & Deluca for coffee and desert. We would definitely stay at the Paramount Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “CANNOT WAIT TO COME BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: tkg04d
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this hotel. We came WELL before the check-in time, but pre-registered the room and dropped our bags off. They DID NOT charge us anything to store our bags on check-in day. They DO charge $2/bag on check-out day. We had 3 bags and thought the $6 was WELL WORTH being able to spend more time in the city bag-free. Check-in time is 3pm and we were in our room by 2pm. The room was on the 15th floor (Queen Room) and is spacious for NYC standards, very clean, very well decorated and comfortable. We will request that room next time we stay. The location is FANTASTIC. It does not get any better. You are half a block from Times Square with shopping and lots of food options. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but we did have a few drinks at Bar 46, which is adjacent to the lobby at the hotel. It is a nice and comfortable place to have a few drinks. Dean & Deluca is also downstairs. Their pastries and such are pricey, but the coffee was well priced. The gym on the 2nd floor is very nice and has a street view, which is nice and better than having to stare at a wall. As far as the few negative reviews of this hotel, the only thing I will agree with is the AC was a little loud when it was on. Other than that, I'm not sure what other people are looking for in a Times Square hotel! We booked this room for $159/night about a week before we arrived and realized you absolutely cannot beat that price. I actually expected a MUCH smaller room and was plesantly suprised. The Queen room was more than enough room for my husband and I. I also expected a bit of street noise, but that was hardly a complaint. You are VERY close to Times Sq, but on a quiet side-street, which was nice. I felt safe walking in and around the area as well. Bottom line is: the concierge, front desk, lobby & baggage staff are very helpful and accomodating. The hotel is beautiful and provides just what you need for a stay in NYC. You're only other options are to pay 2 or 3 TIMES as much at a "chain" hotel (Marriott, Hilton, etc) or stay in a hostel with shared bathrooms.... I'll stick with the Paramount EVERY TIME!

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Paramount Hotel for everything.”
Reviews.Author: ayrespr
Reviews.Content: I had a problem with the electrics when I first arrived and this was dealt with by Crystar both efficiently and professionally. Then disaster struck when I lost my cell phone. Yet again both Crystar and Nathalie did everything they could to help and both with a 'lovely smile' too! I hope to visit New York shortly and look forward to staying at The Paramount again. The service I received from everyone was FIRST CLASS and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend The Paramount to both friends and family.Thanks Again Phil Ayres- London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but problems with the room and service”
Reviews.Author: itsafrogslife
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positives - the location is fantastic. JFK to 50th Street on the E Train, then a four block walk to the hotel. The location is half a block from Times Square in Broadway's theatre district and handy for a multitude of subway lines to make travelling to the rest of Manhattan and further afield a breeze. Unfortunately, in our experience the hotel was let down by the room. We were two people staying in a room with a Queen-size bed. Unfortunately there was only a bedside table on one side of the bed, and nothing on the other side for someone to put a glass of water, a watch, a pair of glasses, or anything else. We had to move the room's one chair and squeeze it in to act as a makeshift bedside table. It's a good job that we did, because otherwise there wouldn't have been enough room to lay the case open fully on the floor. The bed itself was comfortable, but the air conditioning unit was very loud and often woke us during the night when it kicked in. When we arrived on the Friday we reported that one half of the double lock (the bar that stops the door from opening wider than a few inches) was broken, with one half missing. Two days later it hadn't been fixed. We also reported that the door stop was missing, and it was only the bin (trash can) that was stopping it from hitting the wall. This was fixed the day we reported it, along with the double lock when we complained it hadn't been fixed since we had arrived. We also reported that a screw was missing from the plate that keeps the door lock in the door which meant that the door sometimes wouldn't close properly when the plate came away from the door. This was only fixed the next day when we complained again. When we're paying this much for a hotel we don't expect to find so many room defects, and we don't expect to have to ask more than once for anything to get fixed. Really poor show, which means we won't be using this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Room was so extremely small it was uncomfortable for only one person”
Reviews.Author: Tabbygray
Reviews.Content: Please pay attention, I am giving a very honest account of the room. I was so shocked and dissapointed when I opened the door to my room. There was no chest, no dresser to set items on. Inside the clothes closet were two drawers. Attempting to move normally in the room was difficult. There was a small table in the corner of the room and (seriously) you have to turn sideways to maneuver between the table and the corner of the bed!!! I am a short person, only 5'4". I wanted to know the approximate size of the room. I held my arms out at full length and they reached half way across the room!!! Then I did that one more time and touched the other wall. There was one chair in the room and there was only about a foot or so between the chair and the bed. Extremely disappointing. How in the world they took the pictures of the room that I saw on the internet I will never know. I learned a valuable lesson and will ask the size of the room next time. I asked the front desk person the size of the room and she said, "Approximately 10 ft x 10 ft". I was so disappointed with the room size.

Reviews.Title: “Paramount Hotel experience happiness PARAMOUNT”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep6372
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paramount Hotel in NY in Feb 2010. Location is just perfect for business and leasure travellers as its right there in Manhattan near Central Park. Wonderful place, clean, best service. Visiting again in August 2010.

Reviews.Title: “BEST NEW YORK LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: franks338
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location --the staff is very warm and friendly--the hotel is spot clean--excellent security at night -you cannot enter without showing your room card--the buffet is not to be misssed --alam at buffet is a great server--and allie the hostess will make your experience a great one--also at check in catherine--is the best--she inquires about special needs--and then calls during your stay to see if you are happy--one of the best hotel experiences that we had--Harvey & Rosie F

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location- in the heart of everything!”
Reviews.Author: brchodzin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paramount for three nights beginning on July 26. To be in the theatre district, there is seriously NO other property in a better location! Half-block from Times Square and no more than five blocks from any theatre, it was heaven. The rooms are small by many standards, but comfortable for NYC. The bathroom was also small, but was fine for myself as a solo traveller. A family with children would definitely want to upgrade to a double room- I had a queen room and there would have been no room for a roll-away or crib. The bed was VERY comfortable and the linens were of great quality. I also very much enjoyed the modern but minimal decor in the room- it was clean and relaxing. I did not eat at the restaurants or bars but did find that Dean and Deluca downstairs adjacent to the lobby was crazy overpriced, even for NY standards ($4 for a bottle of water, $5 for a cupcake) but the hotel is so close to everything, there were at least three stores within one block where you could buy drinks or snacks. Also, if you're a pizza fan like me, you will NOT find any better than Patzeria which is next door to the Paramount! Junior's Cheesecake (and deli) is also just across the parking lot, for amazing sandwiches and their famous desserts. I had several questions for the Concierge staff and they were all incredibly helpful and accommodating. Same with the front desk and bell staff. The lobby is lovely with a GORGEOUS chandelier and cute, mismatched furniture. If I had to make a complaint, it would be that the air conditioner is prohibitively loud. I’m a person who sleeps with two fans and a noise machine running, and it was disturbing even to me. I also felt a little disappointed that there is a $2 “storage fee” per bag charge at the bell desk. For $250/night, they could have held my bag without charge for the two hours until the shuttle arrived. Aside from those two nitpicky things, I absolutely loved my stay and will consider this property for all future trips to New York. Thank you Paramount for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Hicham_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is chic, right next to Time Square. The staff is really friendly specially the hotel receptionist Nathalie who was absolutely great and responded to all our questions and made our stay absolutely amazing!! Room is clean and quite classy. Really worth it! Would return there

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Starlett18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my mom as a birthday gift to her and we loved the hotel! As most NYC hotel rooms our room wasn't huge but it was bigger than other places I've stayed in the past. Good size for the 2 of us. The location is perfect! Close enough to all the action but far enough away to not hear any late night noises. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “It was one of the best says I've had.”
Reviews.Author: carolinabluesky
Reviews.Content: We were helped by Xani and everything was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Charged for breathing”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaVada
Reviews.Content: The location is great, right next to Times Square, Broadway, several subway stations nearby. -The room: I stayed in a double room for single use. The room was so narrow there was no space for a night stand. The closet was minuscule, almost inexistent. And the wall was peeling. Bathroom was alright. Clean, reacently refurbished. But the worst part was the air-conditioning. The one air-con cell was just below the window, right next to the bed. It was extremely noisy. So much so, that it woke me up every time it was on, which with the heat wave was every five minutes. And, the air hit me straight while sleeping. So much for "fully refurbished rooms". -The food: the offer is very limited, especially for non-meat eaters. The price is alright but then they add a huge gratuity and tax. I ordered dessert (cookies & cream) and the chocolate sauce was rotten! I was still charged for it, of course. -The wi-fi internet: while most hotels offer this service for free (or is secretly included in the bill), I had to pay $75 for it! - Concierge: not only the concierge was quite unattentive, I received a package and was kept for me. I was charged $5 for keeping it for a few hours! A larger package would have cost $10 or $15 per day! - Luggage storage: they charge you $2 per piece of luggage. I never saw something like this. - Receptionists were quite nice and helpful, I must admit, especially a lady called Chrysta who spoke my language (Spanish), as were the cleaning staff. This is a somewhat run-down hotel that's seen better times but is still cashing on old fame. The intention to milk guests for their last penny is quite evident. This hotel is quite a disappointment. Try the Marriott across the street instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Comfy Beds!”
Reviews.Author: njmar
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at The Paramount in June 2010. The location is exceptional being so close to Times Square,Restaurant Row, Rockefeller Centre, etc.. We enjoyed dinner at two of the restaurants on Restaurant Row during our stay. The play we attended was at the Gershwin Theatre which was just over 5 blocks from The Paramount. The staff was friendly and helpful. At the time of booking through our travel agent the hotel would only guarantee "a run of the house" room and our travel agent put in a special request for a room with two double beds. Upon arrival we had been assigned a room with one double bed. The staff checked availability and upgraded us to a room with two double beds so we were pleased. We found the room with two double beds to be fine for us with enough adequate room and the beds were really comfortable with lots of pillows! The air conditioning worked really well as it was very hot when we were there. Late one afternoon when we returned to our room the air was not running and you could really hear the people next to us very clearly. And they were talking in normal voices not yelling. So I would imagine that if you stayed there when the air conditioning was not running you would hear alot from the rooms next door which would be a drawback for sure. We never did eat at the restaurant there.. We enjoyed the library bar for a relaxing drink before dinner or later at night. We really enjoyed our trip to New York!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in NYC - The Paramount Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nanita30
Reviews.Content: The lobby was bustling with activity. The ambiance and the staff were very welcoming. My check in was flawless - the front desk folks and everyone else I met were charming, polite and totally customer focused. I had a single room with color and style. The rolling table allowed me to "create" my own space so that there was plenty of room to move around in. The room was very clean, the bathroom spotless and the bed extremely comfortable. My wake up call was on time! You can walk anywhere from the hotel's location. This was my second stay here and I'd stay again. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: beverleylafferty
Reviews.Content: On arriving late from the UK, we had a problem with the location of our room, however, the following day the Hotel Manageress, Barbara, (who was courteous and charming) rectified the problem and the rest of our stay was delightful. The hotel is modern but pleasantly different and the bedrooms were spotless. The staff were extremely helpful, obliging and eager to please. Our trip was memorable, "Thank You" Paramount Hotel. Mrs Beverley Lafferty

Reviews.Title: “The staff was awesome.”
Reviews.Author: roguedta
Reviews.Content: Rachel at the front desk was absolutely great! She helped me out when I first arrived. Then, there were some issues with the valet (saying that I had parked a car there). She contacted them and ended up taking the charge off of my bill....without be having to fight for it. I will definitely stay here on my future trips to NYC (which happen at least once a month). Thanks again Rachel!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Everything about this hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: jellybeans39
Reviews.Content: It started with check in with Amanda and never let up. We had a fantastic stay and couldn't have asked for anything more. The staff was friendly and helpful from the desk staff to the doorman to the maids! Everybody was great and we felt like we were welcomed guests visiting old friends! My daughters loved the decor in the lobby and our room. The beds were very comfortable and the A/C was great! The room was clean, quiet and we had plenty of room. We thought Amanda, Lola, Leo and Ana Maria were terrific. The hotel is across from Billy Elliott, on the same block as Adams Family and a block from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of additional costs”
Reviews.Author: BerlinGesundbrunnen
Reviews.Content: Very small room, but also very good price due to special offer for re-opening. Bathroom a bit cold in winter because it has no separate heating. Phone system/voice mail didn't work, but made peopel believe they left a message. Prices for additonal services are outrageous: watch out for per minute charges for local calls, the very expensive breakfast buffet, and exorbitant charges for room service!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met, location, NY VFM, friendly staff and functional room.”
Reviews.Author: Dempseg
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on Trip Advisor before selecting hotel, so had a good understanding of what to expect. Yes the rooms are on small side but so are far more expensive hotels. Location close to Times Square and Broadway, we took in the show - Billy Elliot, which was in the theatre over the road from the Paramount. We had little contact with staff following a welcoming check in but what interaction we had was very helpful and friendly. We stayed for 4 days prior to moving onto Las Vegas and it could have been a problem if we would have wished to empty suitcase and hang up all our clothes but with the iron board and iron we managed adequately. The room provides all the facilities of any top hotel in US – which all EXCLUDE Tea / Coffee making, but the cafe on the ground floor opened early and provided food and drinks that we would take back to room. This was our first trip to NY and what a City! Bike ride in Central Park well worth 2 hours of exertion (although in June it was a very pleasant 80F). We also decided to take the bus tours of which there are a few but we settled with Grey Line and took the options of 72 hours for downtown, uptown, Brooklyn and night ride – negotiated at $50 total. Basically you can use any time jump on, jump off and use within 72 hours. Open top double deck, with guide, it was a great way to get your bearings, sightsee and take photos. There is a map provided with places to see at each stop to hop off and on for picking up next bus and as they run so frequent there is little waiting time. Metro is of course the most efficient mode of transport but let’s face it you don’t see much in a dark tunnel. Also amazed at the amount of walking the locals do and the lack of persons using private cars, so the traffic is mainly commercial (taxi / deliveries). We also found the people proud of their City and helpful throughout and will most certainly visit again and yes would include Paramount as hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: shellhutch
Reviews.Content: After I booked 2 rooms at the Paramount for my family's trip to NYC I started reading reviews here and I got nervous. People talking about how small the rooms were and other complaints had me worried. Well there was no need for me to worry! I just returned home from a 4 night stay with my hubby and 4 teenagers. We had 2 double rooms and we were very comfortable, even with 3 crazy boys bouncing off the walls some nights! So if 2 adults, 3 15 year old boys and a 13 year old girl can all be comfortable in the rooms.....anyone can! We even all ate breakfast together in 1 room most mornings! The bathroom size was just fine, small but not unreasonable. The staff was all helpful and pleasant. The reason I only gave a 4 out of 5 is because we did have some problems at check in. We arrived at 3 and were told our rooms were not ready. I completed check in and they took my cell number and told me they would call when the rooms were ready. They said it would be no more than an hour. At this time I also found out there are no ajoining rooms in the hotel. Well I had called the week before to request ajoining rooms and was just told to ask when I check in but that they could not promise anything. So I was suprised to hear there are no ajoining rooms at all. But anyway we went off to explore and 3 hours later I still had not received a call. We went back to the hotel and at first I was told only 1 room was ready, but as she was getting our keys another man came and said the 2nd room was ready. We did get 2 rooms close together, only one room between them. But after a 5 hour drive we really wanted to get to our rooms and clean up, so having to wait over 3 hours for the room was a bit rough. Everything else was great though, location couldn't have been better. We were in NYC so my daughter could take dance classes at Broadway Dance Center and it was less than a 5 minute walk. Easy access to the subway for our trip to the Yankee game, 10 minute walk to the Gershwin to see Wicked, and nightly stops in Times Square for desserts!! We are planning more trips for my daughter to take classes so I would book rooms again at the Paramount...and this time would not be worried a bit!!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT 4-5* HOTEL IN FABULOUS LOCATION !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: michelletelford
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent from Belfast and I stayed in this hotel on the 15th May this year with 3 girlfriends for 3 nights . This was my second stay in New york and i was very impressed . As soon as we entered reception it had the wow factor huge ultra modern reception the four of us stared in amazement , we were greeted by very friendly helpful staff who made us feel very welcome . We then made our way to our room which was very stylish spottlessly clean , bright , modern , very good facilties - tv , ipod dock , alarm . Good size storage , bathroom is quite tight with a good size shower . The four of us shared one room we had 2 suitcases each we were very comfortable and we coped very well , yes the room is small but not a uncomfortable small . All rooms in New york are small but for all the time you are in them it is more than adequate . There were 5/6 lifts operating and while the hotel was very busy we never had to que or wait . The location was fantastic a 2 minute walk will lead you straight into the centre of times square , you really couldnt get any better . In my opinion there are three things that matter when travelling to new york and that is 1. Location and 2. Standard and 3. Value for money . this definately has them all . I will return to this hotel in the future . And as a travel agent i will recommend this hotel to all my clients .

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern but rooms really are just too small!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May 2010 and hotel was fine. Room was clean and decor was modern. Location is great, 2 minutes walk to Times Square which is great for subway access, restaurants and Broadway. Those are my main criteria in a NY hotel so I was mostly satisfied. I expected the rooms to be small. But somehow not quite this small. Fitting in 2 adults and 2 suitcases and leaving enough room to get changed was a serious challenge. It was ok for 3 nights but if any longer it would drive you mad. We clicked to upgrade room if available for a discounted rate (standard option if you book on their website) and I just assumed that would happen but there was no availability. As previously mentioned aircon is far too loud in the room. I usually have no problem sleeping, noise and trafffic has never crossed my mind befroe but I couldn't possibly sleep with the aircon on. Resorted to trying to chill the room during the day but you still need something at night as room is so small and stuffy. Had to leave window open which has it's own noise and feels a bit odd a few floors up in the city. Shower pressure was also pretty bad. Lobby area etc was nice enough. Dark and trendy. Had a big seating area on carpet with a sign saying no food or drink which seemed odd. Tended to get asked rather rudely to show room key on way into hotel which I wasn't keen on. Granted some hotels do it but this was constant and it felt almost accusatory like my husband and I were trying to sneak in or something! Have stayed at about 6 hotels and 2 hostels in Manhattan now and would rank this somewhere in the middle. Definitely the smallest room though! If you book early and get the nearby Novotel for the same price I would definitely recommend that instead.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surpried and would return!”
Reviews.Author: TIMO5555
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three day trip to New York. I had two rooms at the Paramount. One single and one two bed. I was amazed at the hotel for how old it was. I typically do not like older hotels because of age and mustiness. However the Paramount was all I wanted. My single was a very small but adequate room. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel with its good pricing for New York. I will reurn and stay at the Paramount. The comfortable beds were what really sold me at the end of a day in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MrsKBatley_WestYorks
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant, just around the corner from Times Square. The staff were helpful, friendly and always about and willing to help. I believe it has recently been refurbished and the rooms are very clean and stylish. I also found the rooms to be a decent size too, larger that other rooms I have had in the city. I can recommend the pommegranate mojito in the hotel bar :-)

Reviews.Title: “very happy, only a few minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: travelingismyjob
Reviews.Content: i would definitely stay at this hotel again! i went with a friend and booked a room with a queen size bed on booking.com and when we checked in, the employee upgraded us to a king bed free of charge. there wasn't much floor space but we didn't need that much. everything was nice and clean and i could tell it was newly renovated. checking in and out was very simple, smooth, and fast. the only things i didn't like were the water pressure (drip, drip, drip) and the A/C, which wouldn't change when we turned the set temp down. i honestly couldn't have asked for a better location for our money. we were on the same block as the Marriott Marquis. good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....but”
Reviews.Author: kenphchan
Reviews.Content: Lobby is a little too dark but it's still ok Front desk is very helpful. Room is very small but it's still ok for the price. Shower area is extremely small but still managable for a skinner guy like me. Anyone over 180 lbs will get stuck in there. The worst part is the ceramic wall of the shower.....dirty.... They should clean it up more carefully. I hope it's only a careless mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms too small!”
Reviews.Author: Serendipity_Usa
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Times Square/Broadway but the smallest rooms that I've EVER stayed in (and have traveled around the world). I honestly don't know how they could get into and clean the bathroom! The bed was super comfy and the service was fantastic from the front desk. I thought the AC was broken and a maintenance man was there in under 10 minutes to fix it. Turns out, I just didn't know how to use the controls...and the room cooled down nicely. The only serious drawback - and it's a dealbreaker for me - was the size of the bathroom, just TOO small!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Times Square and Theatres”
Reviews.Author: jbwkk
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, saw that I was with my son and upgraded us to a larger room. Rooms aren't big, but clean and comfortable. Very close to Times Square and the Theatre district. You can walk to everything which is good, because parking a car is $$$. Nathalie at the front desk was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but annoying room mix-up”
Reviews.Author: IrishWeather
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during business trip in June 2010. Although I had booked a double room I was - unfortunately - given a single room. As I didn't have my exact booking details to hand, I did not question this until after I checked out - more on that later. My room, therefore, was a single room on the 19th Floor ( a Broadway Petite, I believe its called). If you get a good rate for it, this room could be fine. It was certainly clean and well finished. The bathroom was also fine. However... the wardrobe is very small (not a problem if you don't unpack). There was also no room for a bedside locker, so the alarm clock and phone were perched on an annoying shelf above the bed. The bed itself was also very narrow (a standard single, to be fair) and was very uncomfortable. The air-conditioning in the room worked perfectly, but was very noisy - so much so that I had to turn it off and open the window instead. The TV in the room was great - almost as big as the bed - with a great range of channels to boot. When I made known my annoyance about the mix up in rooms after I checked out (by which time I had a chance to retrieve my original booking details) the management of the hotel were very quick to offer their apologies and have offered me a complimentary night in a superior room on my next trip to NY. I cannot fault them on this. The best thing about this hotel however, is the location. It is literally only steps from Times Square - a fantastic place to base yourself for any stay in NYC. If you get a good rate - I would recommend this hotel - just be sure that you have your booking details to hand and get the room you paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying here again without any hesitation”
Reviews.Author: novascotianewyork
Reviews.Content: Just today returned from a wonderful five years in New York City. For its three stars (surely it deserves another?) the Paramount packs well above its punch. The welcome is excellent: we were met by the porters as we got out of our taxi, and Lola (the lady at reception) could not have been more helpful with us checking in and ensuring a good start to our stay. We were upgraded to a superior room which had tremendous space and was quiet, despite the hotel's busy location just around the corner from Times Square. The downstairs deli offers good options for breakfast and daytime snacks while the upstairs has a high-level cocktail lounge. Night-time checks of identity prevent noisy nights in the hotel ensuring a good night's sleep. Really, we wouldn't hesitate to return to New York, and there is no question that the Paramount would get our custom.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: paul_legend747
Reviews.Content: we arrived in the hotel in a relatively small room but enough space for everything you can bring. we then got an upgrade to the suite which was amazing, had everything in there and was very comfortable! would definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, thanks Rachel”
Reviews.Author: S&RBurt
Reviews.Content: Rachel and the others at the hotel are sweet, smiling and helpful and went out of their way to make our stay happy and pleasant. The standard rooms are a bit small for more than one, but the next grade up is a good medium sized room in fine shape and cleanliness. I'm picky about cleanliness and updated rooms, and I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded every expection-staff was impressive”
Reviews.Author: katrinanelson
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. From the moment we checked in with the front desk manager, Patrick, to the end of our vacation, this hotel staff exceeded every expectation. We felt the hospitality from all staff members. We got an unbelievable rate for this hotel room and could not believe how close were were to the two Broadway shows webought tickets for and we were1/2 block from Times Square. Thank you to Patrick and all of the hotel staff for making us feel at home in New York!

Reviews.Title: “In the business...”
Reviews.Author: thescript
Reviews.Content: From the title of my review, I am a former hospitality employee who knows the business. Spent many years in the front office and now will be travelling frequently. I was privledged enough to have Catherine check me in...very friendly, professional and helpful. Room was great, think it was a deluxe king... next time I am passing through I hope your hotel has a room available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from the staff”
Reviews.Author: rojas0202
Reviews.Content: I stayed in june 2010 for a few days in nyc, it was very pleased with the help i received from catherine a lovely new yorker she recommendations of places to go and see on our free time made our stay a breeze she was very professional the best, our food was great and the rooms where clean. I will for sure stay here again and tell all my clients and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Walk up The block and be in Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: Monmakhon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best one I stayed at in the city so far. The next time I travel to New York City this is the hotel I will be staying in. Recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy boutique hotel in the heart of theatre district”
Reviews.Author: Crystalized
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for a conference and wanted to stay at a hotel with a bit more NY character than the "big box" hotels where the convention was. Not only was my room cheaper, but it was much cooler! Plus, I had a nice 6 block walk everyday which I quite enjoyed as it let me see the evolving sights of Times Square everyday. The hotel has a great location (nothing like walking across the street or just 2 blocks to see a show!) and my room was spacious and COMFY. I will add that when I made the reservation I specifically asked if all the Queen rooms had bathtubs and was told (erroneously it turns out) yes. I am in training and needed a tub for soaks. Fortunately the helpful front desk clerk made it happen. If that had gone the other way, my experience would have been totally different.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but TINY rooms”
Reviews.Author: just2_of_us17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel purely based on price and location. We were able to find a rate of $130USD/ night and to be honest I dont know if I would have paid much more than that. The rooms are SUPER tiny and a bit clausterphobic. I usually wouldnt have minded so much since it was just me and my bf but the double bed was hardly enough space for both of us and the hotel was sold out of queen size rooms at the time. There isnt much space for anything in the room let alone your bags. The hotel made an obvious effort in designing the lobby to attract tourists but the rooms hardly measure up in terms of value. However good service, fairly clean and great location. If I were to visit NYC again I would probably look for an alternative unless I got a really good rate here, no more than $150/night. Good luck and happy travels!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, everything we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: mlhypki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paramount Hotel Times Square over 4 of July and it was absolutely delightful! The staff was so nice and helpful, and they gave us an upgrade to a King-Sized room! Since we had arrived several hours before the check in time, they stored our bags for us and delivered them to our room within 5 minutes of our return. They also gave us great recommendations on restaurants, all of which we loved! The location was great, right by Times Square. The room was very clean and had all the amenities we required. Also, our room was on the 14th floor and very quiet. Noise was never an issue, even on 4th of July. The only drawback was that the electrical outlet in our bathroom wasn't working and I had to dry my hair in the bedroom area. Overall, it was a fantastic experience at this hotel and I would ABSOLUTELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBudMontreal
Reviews.Content: Anyone interested in staying in a chic boutique hotel with the BEST location ever, stay at the Paramount! Spent 3 nights in June with my mother and loved our stay. The lobby was chic & trendy ("hip" piped-in music and fragrant floral scents wafted through the air) , rooms were very modern, very comfortable beds and space was adequate for two (they make good use of limited space - remember ALL NYC hotels are small). Location couldn't be better...times square and theater district at your doorstep. Billy Elliot & In the Heights across the street and Adams Family a couple of doors down.A great plus is having Dean & Deluca coffee shop downstairs...would bring our morning cappucinos to our room while getting ready for our fun-filled day. Must try "Patzeria" pizza place next door...fantastic & inexpensive slices to go. All is all, The Paramount is a wonderful choice and now that I've stayed there, I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Unique, Upscale, Hip Urban Oasis”
Reviews.Author: LoriB52
Reviews.Content: When you are done for the day leave the hustle and bustle of Time Square and step into another world when you enter the Paramount Hotel. Urban chic meets Art Deco when you enter the cool, inviting lobby of this oasis. Our entertainment suite was so hip and modern yet had a touch of Art Deco. This corner suite had fabulous views, dark hardwood floors, sleek, modern couches, large flat screen TVs, a separate bedroom and 3 bathrooms! At breakfast on the second floor, we sat in comfortable, upholstered chairs next to low tables which overlooked the street below. Later in the day we enjoyed a cocktail in this same lounge area. The staff was so pleasant and helpful yet unobtrusive. If you are looking for somewhere relaxing and unique, go with this suite. Location is convenient to everything; heart of the theatre district, Time Square, shopping,and sight-seeing. Walking distance to many of the area restaurants on Restaurant Row.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kouroufexi
Reviews.Content: The hotel with the best location,if this is your first time in New York, you can go by foot to many attractions. The staff is helpfull, some rooms are extremely small, but the staff could upgrade us as soon they had availibility with no charge. The rooms are clean but there is no fridge or coffe maker. There was neither free internet, we had to pay $3 for a 5min access, or around $15 per day. In general a very nice hotel on Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Prar46
Reviews.Content: i was in New york with friends in April for 9 days and i've stayed at the Paramount and it was great!! the room is not big, but for us who wanted to know the city was good enough. the location is great with, times square just around the corner. it was great after a long day of walking, to have dinner and then relaxing in times square, or just go to the M&Ms store for desert!!! its a great location to go to the theater, to see a musical. its just a few minutes walk to the Rockfeller center, the MoMA and Port Authority bus terminal. if i return to new york city i will stay again in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, clean rooms, great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: CBLB503
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to New York City. The hotel was in a great location, friendly staff, clean rooms and great breakfast buffet. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: brookeatndc
Reviews.Content: I had a very comfortable stay and this ideally located hotel. The service staff were terrific especially Anamaria at the Front Desk who always had a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JS-AVL
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay at the Paramount Hotel in New York. From the moment I walked in the door, every staff member I interacted with was friendly, helpful and professional. My room was extremely clean, and I loved the modern design. The hotel is in mid town, so I knew not to expect the same size room I might get at a hotel outside of Manhattan. But even by Manhattan standards, the room was plenty big enough for me. The bed was delightfully comfy, and I appreciated having the iPod docking station next to the bed. A very nice touch. When I checked in, they upgraded my Queen room to a King, and they also gave me complimentary Wi-Fi in my room, as well as 2 complimentary breakfast vouchers. Since I was travelling on business, my company would have paid for the Wi-Fi and breakfast, but it was great to have a few less things to worry about putting on an expense report. The breakfast was in the 2nd floor level restaurant. You could choose to order from the menu, or enjoy the buffet. I had the buffet, which included delicious fresh in-season fruit, scrambled eggs and roasted potatoes. (There were quite a few additional options, but I can only comment on what I had. The rest did look very good.) The coffee at the restaurant was outstanding. Both the hostess and my server remembered me on my 2nd day, and welcomed me back for breakfast. Another nice touch. My only complaint (and the only reason I can't give this 5 stars) is that I couldn't get coffee from Room Service before 7 am. It's not a huge deal, and probably not something that anyone else might even be aware of. But my morning java is as important as my morning run or morning shower. And since I was up by 5:30 am each day I was there, the 7 am timeframe didn't work well for me. But other than that, huge thumbs up. I highly recommend the Paramount Hotel NY. Great staff, great rooms, great service. The next time my work takes me back to NYC, I plan on staying at the Paramount again.

Reviews.Title: “Your money's worth”
Reviews.Author: gracy19
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, 100 m off Times Square, in the middle of the Theatre District, between 7th and 8th avenue; close to restaurant row. Clean room, friendly and very helpful staff, Carlos, the doorman in particular to name but one. You can get tickets to all the Broadway shows from the concierge. Restaurant and deli on the premises. I was located on the 19th floor and though you could hear no sound from surrounding rooms, there was noise from some machinery working on what I presume is the roof. Luckily I had earplugs in but that's the only negative point I could mention. I figure that the rooms on the lower levels wouldn't have that problem.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy decor, amazing service.”
Reviews.Author: RachelMac012
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel the lobby is immaculate, mismatched furniture, music blaring, a grand stair case that leads to the second floor, and a one of the largest chandeliers I have ever seen. The que for check was about 15 min wait, seems as if everyone arrived at the same time to check in. I got a little impatient, but the young lady who checked me in was extremely kind and immediately recognized that I was waiting so long apologized and thanked me for my patience! I felt great and couldn't have gotten a better first impression of the staff. I booked in for a queen size room, comfortable and clean. I was in times square for my boyfriends birthday weekend, the hotel had just what we needed clean rooms, bar, concierge (who i never got to meet) and front desk staff that was great with recommendations to near by night life. Door staff was a friendly guys always greeting with a smile and ready to assist with a taxi. Yes the rooms are smaller than most, but in times square I got my moneys worth and will stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great service, friendly & helpful”
Reviews.Author: worldfamousandiking
Reviews.Content: the only down points were in the small touches, we only had 1 bathrobe between 2 of us, the TV didn't work (or was too complicated for us to operate) the bathroom was a little small for the size of the room (we had the executive kingsize room) but the room itself was great. charging guests 9.99 per day for internet i thought was a bit cheeky, and not being able to sit in the sports bar (unless we were using the table service) even though we were guests was a bit bad, so all things considered the hotel was amazing, i'd reccomend it to anyone, it is BEAUTIFUL, the location is amazing and the staff were all FANTASTIC, we stayed at the hotel at the same time as Miley Cyrus and NKOTB, so a celebrity following too. we had a great time there.... thanks to everyone there

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Alonbs
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location great service, very friendly front desk agent (Anna Maria). All-in-all. -----> very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “All about the location. Clean, friendly, comfortable, very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Julie_c2003
Reviews.Content: Our experience was quite good. Nothing major to complain or compliment on. The staff were friendly and the reception experience is really lovely. Positives: location, only a short walk to Time Square, 2nd floor cocktail bar, gym is great for size of the hotel and feels secure (they have at least 2 or three security staff on the front door after dark and were very vigilant on asking to see room keys. On the down side, rooms were tiny, you really can't swing a cat in there and infact the showers would be lucky to fit you in if you have shoulders. That said, we booked in advance and the rates were reasonable....$250 Australian dollars on average. We did try to stay on for another night and the prices would have been at least $150 more so do book in advance. We moved on to the Chelsea Hotel after that and if I had to choose, I'd say Hotel Chelsea but don't expect the service...it's more about the charm. Depends what you want but for a hotel in Times Square, I would recommend for sure. Down side, hard to say but the staff in teh front bar at the hotel seemed miserable. Oh and in hotels they tag on 18% gratuity as a matter of course.

Reviews.Title: “let the front desk know about internet over-charging”
Reviews.Author: deelorocks
Reviews.Content: Internet users: there's a $9.95/day internet charge at the Paramount, which is fine - only your room will get charged this fee for EACH DEVICE that's connected. On checkout we were surprised to see a $20 charge for one day of internet - $10 for a computer, and $10 for an iPhone. Natalie at the front desk was more than helpful, recognized the ridiculousness of the situation, and quickly credited our account. I've stayed at this hotel on multiple occasions, and it's a great hotel for the money, in the heart of Times Square. Rooms are tight (it's NYC, get used to it), but make up for it with good interior design. I already have reservations for another stay, in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: CMH1296
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on 46th street, one block away from Time Square. The one block distance is just enough to give you a little breathing room while still having access to everything. The lobby is chique and modern. The staff is well-groomed and courteous and got us checked in quickly. We had a King room which was comfortable. Shower had good water pressure. We ordered burgers from room service which came quickly and were excellent. The next morning we had breakfast on the 2nd floor restaurant. The breakfast buffet was great. Express checkout was easy and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms were a pleasant surprise compared to the poorly decorated lobby!”
Reviews.Author: chgdmymind
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is 'tacky.' There's no two ways about it. Needs to be redone by a 'real' decorator. The rooms were small, but let's face it. If you're in NYC, you aren't there to stay in your rooms for any length of time. I found the beds to be delightfully comfortable & clean with nice bathroom accessories. I did check under the beds to see if anything had ended up there before we left and it was apparent that they have not cleaned under the beds in a while. I managed to lose my backpack in a cab, and the staff tried their best to help me resolve the situation and keep my head screwed on tight. I appreciated their concerns and assistance. The hotel was situated in as good of a location as any, if you are there to tour the whole city as a whole. I would certainly consider staying here again. The deli which is attached to the hotel is delightful, as well as the yummy pizza place two doors down. If you don't do anything else while in NYC, see Jersey Boys if it's still playing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, nice staff and an incredible location”
Reviews.Author: tinnaosk
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this Hotel. We stayed on the 16th floor in a Renovated Broadway Classic with one double bed. The room was small but that didn't matter at all. I wasn't planing on staying in the room except for sleep and to relax. The room was clean and very chic. The staff was incredibly nice, I have never before used the concierge service this much before, they were so willing to help you just couldn't not accept their help. Every time we came into the hotel or left the hotel during the day there was always someone there to open the door for you. When we left there was also someone there to get us a Taxi. The location was also amazing, we only had to walk about 200 meters to get to Times square and 4 blocks to the subway. Actually 3 blocks to three different subway stations on 50th street, 42nd street and Times square. I would without a doubt book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get a better location”
Reviews.Author: kazzcloud10
Reviews.Content: Just back this morning from a 5 day trip with my daughter to the Paramount Hotel. I did weeks of research through the net and trip advisor to find the best hotel/location/reviews/price and settled for the Paramount and was delighted with my choice. Following a hair raising transfer from Newark by Super Shuttle (I'm not the best car traveller in the world and the driver was weaving in and out of the busy traffic in the heat thought I was going to pass out !!) we arrived at the hotel. The hotel is a couple of minutes to Time Square next door to one theatre and across the street from another. The reception is cool ,calm and dark on arrival we were given an upgraded room this was on the 9th floor the window looked into the back of the hotel with no real view and was quite dark but was a large room and very quiet. Sheets and towels were changed every day and room had it's own air conditioning. During our stay we had breakfast at the Dean & Deluca coffee shop attached to the hotel that sold bagels, croissants, cakes etc. The only negative comment I have about the hotel is their bar charges we only had one drink in the hotel and after receiving the bill it was the last too! For a vodka and diet coke and a malibu and coke it was a whopping $27!!!!! That's over £9 a drink which I think is excessive I had a $20 out the shock must have been written over my face as the bar tender told me this included a service charge. New York is a fantastic vibrant city I would definitely recommend the Top of The Rock tour which we did on our first day which gives you a fantastic view of the city and lets you get your bearings. We also bought a Gray Line three day hop on hop off ticket from an agent in Times Square. Tours were informative and the ticket we bought covered the night tour as well buses were frequent tour guides did mention tips but weren't over pushy some guides were great and New Yorkers we had another one who was African! and therefore a bit difficult to understand. Definitely do the night tour they start at 6.30 stop at 9 and are over 2 1/2 hours long best time to go is around 8 8.30 as it's just beginning to get dark we had a great guide on our last night who came complete with CD player and played Frank Sinatra New York as we were driving through the city. During our visit it was very warm and humid. The upstairs of the bus was great to get a lovely breeze even though it was a warm one! If you wish to go to see the Statue of Liberty can't really recommend best time to go we went in the afternoon and had to queue for tickets and were told that there was an hour wait after you had purchased your ticket so were standing out in the sun for that length of time - then you have to go through airport style security. I just wanted to see the statue up close so we never got off at Liberty Island or Ellis Island and just got the boat back and was glad too when I saw the queues of people waiting to get back. To sum up had a great time I felt very safe and there is a highly visible police presence. The Paramount is a lovely hotel and I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends and family. Never saw the famous Brian mentioned in all the reviews. :0(

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Only to visit places around it.”
Reviews.Author: junglelight
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Paramount is living around the corner from times square. It is best address for a tourist or a visitor to manattan offices in in midtown manhattan. It is not exactly a budget hotel but is worthwhile to pay that extra bit for the location. That is where the good part ends. Once inside its doors there is a lot of gloom set off by the particularly uninviting lobby. The rooms are very small on space and the lack of space is accentuated by the lack of natural light. The staff is matter of fact and doing its job...which is less than being welcoming and doing that extra bit which brings a smile to your face

Reviews.Title: “Not worth more than $100 per night”
Reviews.Author: habs1984
Reviews.Content: I saw the reviews on trip advisor and thought i'd give this place a shot. The place itself was clean and pretty hip but that's about it. The room was probably the size of two janitor's closets.. all it fit was a full bed.. not even queen size for $320 for one night and such a small space, i'd hope the amenities were good nothing was included in the price A/c was very loud in the room internet was $10/ day of $0.35 per minute in the business center there was only ice on the fourth floor the storage for our bags after check out costs $2/ bag the concierge forgot to make our reservations as the our restaurant - (we tipped her well unfortunately) She was also unprofessional and dealt with several guests at once Our door key stopped working the lobby was always crowded with "groupies" and busy the elevators took forever to get there - we had to wait a long time to find one that wasn't busy the thing that bothered me the most was when we went to the front service and the manager was talking to the employee, they continued their convo without even apoogizing and didn't aknowledge our presence. She looked at us, didn't smile nor say hello and continued talking (manager) The place is nice but they need to train their employees and maangers and change some of these details in order to attract guests who will leave happy there was no toothpaste, mouthwash in the rooms - not even a bottle of water I don't mind paying extra for a hotel room that has good service.. but charging for these tiny insignificant things is an indication of the type of crappy service this hotel has to offer overall, i'd never stay there again Crowne plaza is pretty close by and it's a much better hotel which is concerned with is reputation if you have high standards for service, look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money for the room”
Reviews.Author: highlandsusa
Reviews.Content: Room was very small with only a shower. The bathroom had no vanity to put your items. The top sheet had holes in it. I was tired and did not want to go out for dinner after a show. The restaurant only served bar food. In addition they charged me more on the tip and I was satisfied with the service only. Wanted to ask for info at the travel desk and the man was on the phone and continued talking for 5 minutes without even acknowledging me! So I gave up and left. The lobby looked like mismatched furniture and definetly was not cheerful. Pieces did not match at all and it was very "dark".

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2272
Reviews.Content: Was traveling with 3 others and had booked two rooms months earlier. I called the day before checking in after receiving an email saying I only had two guests and one room. I was assured the reservation was for two rooms, 4 people total. Upon arrival at 3:30 pm(check in is 3pm) we were told only one room was ready. We were assured that the second room should be ready very soon-no more than 30 minutes and that we would receive a call as soon as the room was ready. 3 1/2 hours later-no phone call, upon returning the woman at front desk said she was just getting ready to call-which I did not believe. Rooms were decent for what I had paid, but would never had paid what they were going for at the time of check in-the rates had doubled. The rooms were decent, what you would expect for NYC. The only plus was the close proximity to Times Square and theaters. I have been home for a week and have had nothing but horrible customer service when calling to speak to someone about a $170 charge on my credit card from the hotel that cannot be explained.
