The woman in accounting has been nothing but rude and very unhelpful. Several calls have gone unanswered. I would never stay here again nor recommend it to anyone for the simple fact that there is no organization to the business and all staff members are very rude and did not make me feel welcome at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: KatieScarlettO
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at the Paramount back in the early 90s and absolutely loved it. I hadn't been back in the interim so I missed the 'down' period others have referred to. I returned last month based on recent reviews here on TripAdvisor and I knew my husband would love it - he's a contemporary guy who likes 'different'. The Paramount and the staff did not disappoint. The location is ideal, the lobby is wonderful, our room was immaculate and roomy enough for the limited amount of time actually spent in the room, and the staff was above and beyond wonderful. The room was also very, very quiet. We heard limited hallway noise and no noise from bordering rooms even though they were occupied. One of the benefits of old, solid buildings. We arrived at the hotel at 730am and requested to leave our bags - they checked us in!! It made our day just perfect and we couldn't possibly have assumed such gracious treatment. Throughout our stay the staff was genuinely friendly, chatty, and ready to serve. I've given the hotel four out of five stars for two reasons - first, the halls are a bit too dark. I'd like a bit more light for wandering long narrow hallways without exterior windows. Second, during my last stay the decor in the rooms had a bit of a softer feel (i.e. Vermeer headboards with a softer edge to the color scheme) - now they are a bit harsh with the full-on contemporary edge. My husband would not consider this a demerit though - he loved the black, red, white, chrome combo. I would absolutely return to the Paramount and hope to do so soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Clean! Chic! - will always stay here x”
Reviews.Author: fagil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I looked at many hotels wishing for a central location, cleanliness and a little bit of chic! This hotel certainly has the Wow! factor along with friendly staff. It managed to meet all our requirements (I have to admit to being pretty fussy but I happily could not fault this hotel ) x We were delighted with our room which was kept spotlessly clean by the house staff, clean linen and fluffy white towels daily! It has a lovely quirky fun feel, you are steps away from Times Square, the Theatre District and Restaurant row so after sight seeing all day we would go back to the Hotel, freshen up and it was 'All' on our doorstep. The staff were lovely too - thank you Robert for all you help and advice, thank you lewis for the laughs at the door, thank you Leo Cathryn Shalom and Diane for making us feel at home also a big hug to Auranda for help with our booking x A great place to stay no need to look any further - The Paramount has it all xxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: arewethereyet22
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Ireland to NY to get married in May. We had 86 guests travel from Ireland, UK, USA and Australia to attend the wedding. About 65 of these guests stayed at The Paramount Hotel and the only negative comment we heard was that a couple of guest rooms were on the smaall side but these issues were sorted out within the first 2 days. My husband and I were upgraded to a suite and it was absolutely fabulous and spacious which came in handy for the hair and make up on the wedding day!! The bridesmaids and I were suprised to be sent a bottle of champagne and strawberries from the hotel on the morning of the wedding which certainly took the edge off the nerves!! The staff are an absolute credit to the hotel. I cannot fault this hotel and I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Calling it "boutique" or "European" doesn't excuse everything ...”
Reviews.Author: ElenaAP
Reviews.Content: I was booked at the Paramount for a business trip - but I left before even staying the night. The good: lovely decor, Times Square location (personally I hate the area, but I can understand why tourists might like it). Not sure what else? The bad: TINY TINY TINY rooms!!! I've stayed is some small rooms - especially in NYC - but this was ridiculous. The toilet was, literally, right behind the heater. You couldn't even sit on the pot properly!! - you'd have to sit sideways to take care of business. There's about 2 feet of space between the edge of the bed and the wall, and the room really is completely consumed by the bed. Not the cleanest place either, the lounge chair had black soot all over it. The wall covers were shabby (didn't this place JUST get renovated??) The view from the room was horrible and just made it seem even dirtier. I get that you're not always going to get a gorgeous skyline view, but I didn't want to look out to see rolls of toilet paper and garbage. See pics. For a business trip, this was completely unacceptable ... so I left and re-booked at an SPG property.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a flash!”
Reviews.Author: Beatdoctor
Reviews.Content: Great location and service. Plus they have NYC's friendliest doorman, Brian!

Reviews.Title: “Location doesn't get any better - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: nimmel
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. Our room was small (including bathroom) - but we didn't go to NY to spend all our time in the room anyways. Bed was comfortable. Service great. Rooms and lobby were clean and modern. Location doesn't get any better! Half block to center of Times Square. Also on the same street are some great little boutique restaurants with jazz club, blues club, etc. Just turn right out of hotel lobby instead of going left to get to Times Square. These restaurants have excellent food, are intimate and are much better than franchise restaurants. There is a good little bakery with gourmet coffees and delicious pastries right beside hotel. Close to Theatre district. I would stay here again and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again, just not on a work trip.”
Reviews.Author: jenlmartin
Reviews.Content: Pros: I had a king room and this is one of the largest rooms I've encountered in New York City. The location is great, there's a Dean and Deluca off the lobby, and the rate included internet access and breakfast. The hotel had a very modern vibe and was a nice break from the typical chain hotels. Cons: The tiny bathroom had practically no counter space. There also was no desk and only a rolling, hospital-like table that went over the bed - wrong height for eating or work (and the size didn't work with the chairs either). The air conditioner was EXTREMELY noisy and the fuse blew in the bathroom after 1 minute of hairdryer use. Also, when I checked out I was charged for internet and breakfast so be sure to check your bill. I would stay there again, but for a work trip I need a better desk setup.

Reviews.Title: “Firstly the Bad!”
Reviews.Author: Backpackernomore
Reviews.Content: Firstly the Bad! The safe in our room did not work. The shower rail was broken. Only some of the lights worked. The air-con stopped working. A 0830 telephone call from house keeping on the Saturday and then again on the Sunday to ask if we wanted the room cleaned (we had the do not disturbed sign on the door) Secondly the Good! Safe fixed but only after having to go reception in person as phone constantly engaged. Air-con never fixed and again it took me another two trips to reception, as after my first report no one came to fix it. As a sorry they then up-graded us to a Deluxe King room. Verdict! As others have said and I agree it is a great location and yes the standard rooms are small, but we expected that. The lobby is funky and cool. However this is where it stops, as the rooms (even our King) was bland and looked tired. On the web site they say you get bathrobes but we never had any in either room. What is the point of the “do not disturb” sign on the door if house keeping then call you! To the credit of the staff they did sort out the problems with our room to a satisfactory outcome. I would stay again as over all it was safe, clean with helpful staff, just let down by our first room, which really should have been checked out better before making it available to be occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Perfect! Mod Tokyo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mistermark8
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on a business trip, which to my surprise many stars were bring accomadated at the same place from which ive known. this place is right next to times square and in the perfect location. i did find however different rooms varied in size, and I happened to get lucky with the bigger of them. i love that the location is right off times square so theres no need to pull the blinds to shield your room from the big led displays all over downtown. perfect place and would be excited to stay there again. and the beds were really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for children”
Reviews.Author: PranayG
Reviews.Content: First the good things - Convenient location and a very helpful and cooperative staff in coffee shop. That's about it! This hotel is an absolute no-no if you are traveling with kids. When I called up room service to request for warming up of milk, chap first refused stating that he was too busy attending other orders, and then said the hotel doesn't allow use of microwave to warm milk, and recommending going to the pasta shop next door to use their microwave!! In this tour of 20 days, I have stayed in 6 hotels, and not one ever refused to warm up milk (or provide a microwave in the room). Housekeeping was also not upto the mark. Bathroom sink has leaky taps, making everyday use a mess.

Reviews.Title: “Really small rooms but great service”
Reviews.Author: WaikikiTdot
Reviews.Content: The only thing that saved this hotel for me was the fact that it is located at Times Square and the staff is excellent. The rooms are like a closet. I still had a great time as when you go to New York, you're only using the hotel to sleep for a few hours so I did not complain about the size to the concierge. However, trust me and the other reviewers about the hotel room size. I do not recommend it. I made the mistake of ignoring their reviews as I thought these people were the types that complain about little things. When I first opened the room, I was surprised with the size. I have never seen something like it before, even by New York City standards. I have stayed at the London NYC before for the same price. There is no exhaust fan in the small bathroom so when someone uses the washroom, the room stinks as it is very small to begin with. I only used this bathroom to take a shower and ended up using the lobby washroom for the other personal matter during my stay to keep my room fresh. After a great night out in NYC, I was on my way to my hotel room around 2:30 am one night in the corridor when I heard amusing sounds (people having sex). I was laughing in my room. I also heard someone next door farting many times. I know management will say that I booked a small room but let it be known that this is not a standard hotel room. They should specify that the hotel room is only good for one person. I saw other rooms in my floor (15th floor) and they are the same size as 1524. Like I said, I had a pleasant stay because of location and the staff. The hotel is in the middle of Times Square. The lady who checked me in and the doorman was very nice and friendly (Checked in 5:30 pm on Saturday, May 22/10). However, they need to add more staff. There is a constant line-up with people coming in. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you're single but not if you're traveling with a partner. Try booking their two double rooms but never the standard double rooms. Also to management: You need to add more staff. I was there last weekend and there were only two staff checking-in visitors and there was always a line-up. The wait is about 10 minutes per person as the staff tries not to rush with each customer for a pleasant experience, which I appreciated. After a long wait, the lady (Latina lady) was very friendly that I forgot about my discomfort of waiting in line for 10 minutes. The whole weekend, each time I exit the hotel, there is always a line-up. When I needed something, I had to line up for 10 minutes. In my check-out, I had to line-up again for 10 mintues. This was unusual. I am very easy to please and am very patient but this experience leaves something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: Cowboy_H
Reviews.Content: We returned last week from a 6-day trip (5 nights) to New York. This hotel has been recommended to us by our travel agent, and yes we liked it. As so many people before us, I can only confirm that this is really a nice hotel at an excellent location in the middle of Manhattan. On arrival we have been upgraded from the booked double room to a 2 double beds room; which was very nice as it allowed us to have a bit more space to put some clothing. The beds are very comfortable with clean sheets in a stylish decorated environment. The water is hot and the towels are a good size. And yes dear readers, the rooms are small, the view is not worth taking a picture but this is New York. Anyway, there is so much to do and so much to see in New York that the time spent in our room was rather limited.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortably small rooms”
Reviews.Author: lgoose
Reviews.Content: My husband I recently stayed at the Paramount for long weekend. We were disappointed to discover the room was so small that it was difficult to even walk around the bed, nevermind trying to get ready in the mornings. The double bed seemed no larger than a twin, making it impossible to sleep comfortably. The service was mostly helpful but cold and impersonal and the ammenties were nonexistent. Everything is an additional charge at the Paramount! I would not recommend this hotel to a friend, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: Katv79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paramount in may 2010. When we arrived at the hotel we where friendly welcomed by Lola. When we arrived at our room ( standard) we found the bed a little too small. When we asked to have a bigger bed, there was no problem and LOLA gave us an kingsize bed and bigger room!! The room was large, good bed and very clean. The location is super, a few meters from Time Square. If , one day, we go back we will stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: annewiddecombe
Reviews.Content: For the price, you won't get a better location. Perfect for Times Square, Broadway, Shopping, Central Park and MOMA. Very comfortable bed, great breakfast buffet and no outside noise if you keep your windows shut. However, you may want to think again if you are either a large person or travelling with lots of luggage as the standard rooms are tiny. Our standard, double room would only achieve single room status in the UK due to the lack of room around it. But if you acept this, and your priority is a central location then this you won't get a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, classy, AMAZING LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: laincm88
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the location. Two short blocks from the center of Times Square! There are Broadway theaters all up and down the street, even right across from the hotel! Wonderful staff, provided us with early check in and held our bags for us for a few hours after check out. The lobby is spectacular. Gorgeous chendelier and staircase. Elegant! It looks like a super expensive hotel but it's not. The rooms were modern and nicely decorated, although a little on the small side (BUT, this is normal for NYC! You have to expect small!) Bathroom was small. I felt like I was showering in the closet. But who needs a huge bathroom? You didn't come to NYC to take a shower, did you?!? Beautiful flat screen TV. Would stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Superb staff”
Reviews.Author: MattMorrisuk
Reviews.Content: My time at the Paramtount hotel was very enjoyable. The hotel has recently been renovated which is very noticeable, the rooms were cleaned regularly and maintained to a good standard. As my stay was during May 2010 I was unfortunately stranded in New York due to the Volcanic Ash, at this time I really must praise your member of staff Catherine. The service that she provided for me was nothing short of the best that I have experienced in a hotel - she is a true credit to your establishment. It became clear during my visit that the Paramount maintains a high standard in all elements of it's existence, whether this be physical appearances or staffing.

Reviews.Title: “Been awhile and I was very pleased”
Reviews.Author: pkdouble007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Paramount. I used to stay here frequently when I was quite younger but over the past 10 years decided I outgrew it and stayed in places like The Soho Grand, or Royalton, etc. but this week conferences, etc. had pushed four star NYC prices to the $400's so I stayed at the Paramount - first time in 12 years. It was great! I walked in, the staff was very friendly, the lobby looks great, and they upgraded my room. They have clearly refurbished the place. There are plenty of lifts for the 19 or 20 floors they have so waiting was never a problem. The room was nice and clean and they had a free electrical outlet by the head of the bed - I typically do some work in the evenings on my laptop and it drives me MAD that other hotels haven't figured this out - the only free outlets are by the little desk across the room. The Paramount has clearly solved this. It was a bit hot outside but the air con worked instantly and cooled down the room. Bathroom was clean and the shower was easy to figure out - another issue I have - all the strange approaches to hot and cold water, shower vs bath. Anyway, everything was clean, worked well and the location is fantastic - a nice 1 block stroll to Times Square. The WIFI was $9.95 vs $15 per day at most hotels and it was quite fast - I streamed an episode of "V" no problem. I thought the all you can eat breakfast was too high priced at $28, so I walked to the Blue Fin, and spent $26. Big savings! Paramount - I underestimated you. I will stay here again even when the rates of other NYC hotels are down.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - VERY SMALL ROOM”
Reviews.Author: miniparklane
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from New York Paramount Hotel. On arrival we were given a key which did not work - went down to get key changed and managed to get into room. The room they gave us was a single room. My husband and I had booked a double - went down again to reception and was told that was what we had booked and that was that. I explained to an unhelpful receptionist that we were a couple and had confirmation with us of a double rioom. Another older receptionist told younger one to give us a double room which they did. The room we were given was very small and dark with a view of scaffolding. To be fair it was very nicely furnished and clean with very good quality bed linen. Room was cleaned very well each day. The wardrobe was so small we had to hang most of our clothes in the shower!!! Location of hotel is excellent - close to all restaurants and times square etc. We had the most wonderful time in New York in spite of bomb scare. Had the room been larger it would have been perfect. Lucky people who had a complimentary up grade!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: pickles44
Reviews.Content: The lobby here is very hip. The staff makes you feel welcome. I loved my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a complete delight!”
Reviews.Author: MaryE44
Reviews.Content: I was searching the internet for a steel in NYC and happened to call my brother. He stayed at the Paramount several years ago and loved it. My husband and I took a chance and booked on line. I don't think I'll ever stay at another hotel again when traveling back. This place is charming! Right off Times Square. The lobby is beautiful, the staff VERY attentive. The room was a little small but well thought out. Who stays in the room though when in NY. We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “New favorite Times Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ltgmead
Reviews.Content: My 14-year-old son and I stayed at the Paramount this past Saturday, May 1st, the evening of the Times Square bomb scare. I can't say enough good things about the hotel. We arrived about 3:00 and were upgraded from a double room to a suite. The staff was friendly, helpful and efficient and the room was clean, modern and quiet. Despite the turmoil in Times Square that night, we had a great time. We walked down 46th street past 8th Avenue for dinner along restaurant row. Tons of great choices. As we came back towards the hotel around 7:15, the police were starting to close off the area. We were told there was a car on fire and some concern that it would explode. There was no sense of panic. We then walked up 46th Street towards Broadway and were fortunate enough to be able to see the show we had booked - The Addams Family at the Lunt-Fontanne, further up 46th near Broadway. After the show, the police very efficiently moved the crowd away from Broadway. We were so glad we were staying close by at the Paramount. Others either couldn't get to their hotels or couldn't get in. We felt very secure that evening and the next morning when the staff told us everything was again clear. Before heading out, had a very nice, but slightly pricey buffet breakfast in the hotel. That would be my only small gripe. Otherwise, location, rooms, staff and value were great. We will definitely come back on our next theater trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mrsparker3
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our room at the Paramount. We booked a queen and were upgraded to two doubles. The room was very clean, beds were comfortable, and the location was great for theatres. It was a small room but it had everything we needed, and for the price it was great. We usually stay at a club in Manhattan for almost twice the price, and the rooms aren't a lot bigger there. I will stay here again when traveling with my daughter or friends...my husband likes things a bit more plush! The only negative was the A/C: either I couldn't figure it out or it was broken...but I didn't call the front desk about it.

Reviews.Title: “Late Christmas vacation”
Reviews.Author: ummmm_10
Reviews.Content: I cannot say that it was the best vacation I even had but it was very good. I have no complaints about the Paramount hotel. It was exactly what I had paid for. I do feel that I have to mention that staff was very very nice and helpful, particularly Musa. Wifi was not free (9.95 for 24 hour)

Reviews.Title: “The Concierge team were stars”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFarnhamUK
Reviews.Content: Our teenage daughter and friend just spent 15 days at the Paramount-the last 5 days enforced by the volcanic ash cloud over the UK. They really enjoyed their stay, rooms were good and location excellent. But the best were the concierge team who were so helpful with advice, bookings and arranging travel for them. For two young girls alone in the big city it was a huge help for them and real peace of mind for their families.The girls said the team were the stars of the show!

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: dredd123
Reviews.Content: For the money you can stay at nicer places just as close to Times Square (like Hotel Grace, for instance.) Rooms have been re-furbed, but still feels jaded. Noisy air-con. First room we were offered stank of stale cigarette smoke despite supposedly being a totally non-smoking hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful though. $9.95 per 24h for wi-fi is a rip-off. There is free wi-fi a hundred yards away in Times Square itself.

Reviews.Title: “Get a Suite...”
Reviews.Author: d16rr702
Reviews.Content: Paid $309 for a 1 bedroom suite..... I think they are all the same, end of the hall 2 rooms in the corner. 1 room has the bed/bath the other a super comfy fold out couch and full bath. Excellent HD tv in each room. Hotel staff is excellent, I tried to confuse and aggravate them a few time with my groups crazy requests but they were pros and handled all with ease. Convenient parking right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great place to stay in Times Square with a cool hip flair”
Reviews.Author: MOTOVIBENYC
Reviews.Content: This is the home of one of the most famous door men in Times Square: Brian, his service is outstanding along with his personality. The location is great for the visitor of the Broadway Shows or the business person servicing the Fashion District. The Staff is always ready to help and is very friendly. They have 2 great bars and the rooms have a Metro flair. I have stayed at the Paramount about 10 times in the past year and it is very nice to come back to a place that appreciates their customers. They also run great seasonal specials and I have stayed there for under $ 100.00 a night on some occasions. It's great place for the business traveler or visitor!!

Reviews.Title: “Alice - Perfect for NYC!”
Reviews.Author: OportoSpring2010
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to NYC. We really didn't know what to expect as the reviews always say contradictory things about hotels ... First impressions: great! Anamaria welcomed us and when asked about the size of the room the agency had booked for us, she told us it was small but as we were staying there for 9 nights she immediately and kindly upgraded it to a larger one! What else can we say? Perfect location, kind and efficient staff. Really enjoyed our stay there! If we decide to go to NYC again, The Paramount will certainly be our immediate choice!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The hotel and The Doorman Brian!”
Reviews.Author: piper_ferguson
Reviews.Content: Brian was The Friendliest Doorman in New York! I would definitely stay at this hotel again next visit to NYC

Reviews.Title: “Moosa was great but not the concierge”
Reviews.Author: TimCSA
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms with hot wire for 4 people. We were a family of 3 travelling with a friend. When we arrived, we had 2 rooms, each with 1 bed. When we explained our situation, Moosa said there would be an extra charge of about $40 a night, or he could waive the charge in exchange for us posting a review. Naturally, we agreed to the review. Check in was easy. Moosa was excellent and efficient. Our many bags were brought to our room by the hotel staff very quickly. The room was a bit small, but met our needs. It was a bit tight with our bags. We were staying in New York for a couple of nights on our way back from a 9 day vacation in China. Everything was good until we needed to leave and tried to arrange transporation to the airport. We went to see the concierge who was quite rude. We knew what the price of a cab would be, but due to our bags, thought it might be difficult to get a van on the street, so we were looking for alternatives. She presented us with the most expensive alternatives. In the end, we paid a bit more than we would have liked but the driver made it worth while, certainly not the rude concierge, who gave me an "I told you so" attitude.

Reviews.Title: “The pits.”
Reviews.Author: corpkid
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to say much other than this was perhaps the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Rude staff, incredibly gross rooms (the mattresses are ON THE FLOOR). Just beat up, old, and not even worthy of one star. Location is good if you are tourist. That's about it.

Reviews.Title: “The home of Brian, New York's Friendliest Doorman”
Reviews.Author: outbackkid
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. The room was new and the staff friendly. Particular note to Brian the Doorman.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect special accomidations”
Reviews.Author: EviesMom
Reviews.Content: I was really excited when I saw great rates to stay at the Paramount for this May. It was going to be my husband first trip to New York City and I was excited to have him stay at a place that is so highly recommended. Unfortunately, to travel I needed special accomidations. It took me two days to reach a hotel manager to see if they could accomidate me. I left several messages with my phone number and name and never recieved a call back. I probably should of given up after leaving 3 messages, but I was still hopeful and optimistic. In the end, I finally reached someone who pretty much said that they couldn't guarantee that they could provide me the accomidations I have to medical have. Unfortunately I will be staying elsewhere at a hotel that is more understanding.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in times square”
Reviews.Author: germainerichmond_VA
Reviews.Content: I came to spend three days in New York with friends, and we stayed at the Paramount Hotel in New York City. We didn't know what to expect, but were quiet surprised. The hotel was right there in Times Square. The location was fantastic! The staff was very pleasant. They were available at any time. The room was a pretty good size, I was expecting smaller, but was pretty satisfied. I will return in this hotel without hesitation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chocotv
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, rooms where all right, a little bit noisy though. The location was excellent (half a block from times square) and half a block from the tour bus (Red Line) and a fairly decent distance from the MOMA museum and Rockefeller center. The concierge Natalie was really nice to us and solve all of our problems in a really efficient way.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish, modern hotel, ideal location and a great gracious, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jadesong
Reviews.Content: The Paramount, newly renovated is ideally located in the center of New York's Broadway and priced very reasonably. It's contemporary decor makes it a great place to meet and greet people as well as sleep in great comfort. It is small enough to be intimate and personal but large enough to offer full service. The staff is friendly, gracious and willing to be helpful in every way from t\he doorman to the manager. I would recommend it without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean but room very small.”
Reviews.Author: midwestmOm41
Reviews.Content: Great location. Beautiful lobby with friendly staff. Room was very small with little storage space. Friendly doorman Brian helped with luggage both upon arrival and departure. No in-room coffee service. We were on the third floor and did not hear street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best doorman in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Blue11111
Reviews.Content: Of all the doormen in all the cities in all the World the Paramount Hotel has the best of the best of doormen in BRIAN!

Reviews.Title: “Catherine”
Reviews.Author: iceman45
Reviews.Content: She very polite she was always on point with all my needs in the hotel i would love to come back and bring more friends. Everyone was very sweet but Catherine stands out the most in the group.

Reviews.Title: “Has its ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: McKaiger
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Location. You couldn't find a better location for a hotel if you are travelling to New York as a tourist. It is literally a half block away from Times Square, where all the tours of New York start. Service. The doormen were A+++. We weren't the typical business or wealthy guests that seem to be at this hotel, but they still treated us as if we were, and made us feel very welcome. Con's: The hallway heading to our room (301) looked like it was the scene of a violent crime. There was plastic covering most of the floor, heading up to one of the other rooms, which was taped off so no one could enter. It stayed like that for the 3 days we stayed there, and would have been nice to seen cleaned up. The strong perfume smell in the lobby was a bit aggitating aswell. I had a bit of a cold while we were there, and the perfume really bothered me. The only other issue we had was with our reservation. We were positive that when we reserved it over the internet from the hotel's website, that we included parking as a part of the package. As it turns out, when we got there it wasn't included, and were told we would be able to get it for an additional $40/day. We said fine, had them valet the car, and when we went to check out they tried to charge the normal rate of $50/day. It took 15 minutes and some bartering with the manager on duty (asian guy) to knock off $30, but we compromised and he was nice enough to honour the previous agreement. (after making me feel that I was completely wrong and that I was lucky he was doing this for me) I would recommend this hotel because you can't beat the location, just try and make sure you spend a few extra bucks and get a better room (we had 2 double beds, which was quite small). Also double check your reservation to make sure you get what you think you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Home of NYC's Friendliest Doorman - Brian!”
Reviews.Author: LoDoDiva
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing and very accommodating, but Brian continually goes out of his way to make all of our experiences fabulous! He is always extremely friendly and makes you feel like a VIP.

Reviews.Title: “Be Advised”
Reviews.Author: MimmyD
Reviews.Content: Booking through a site that does not let you specify bed size is a mistake. I learned this the hard way by booking when I couldn't know the hotel until I booked it. Supposedly the bed would accommodate the number of adults specified - in this case, two, my young adult daughter and myself. Astoundingly, the bed in our very tiny room was a mere 47" across (standard double is 54"), and barely fit us. We made it work as we are average sized; but it would not have worked for my husband and me. I checked with the booking site and they said we should be guaranteed a queen; but after they checked with the hotel, their position changed to this bed size is "run of house", whatever that means. My advice is to be clear about exactly what size bed you will get. Aside from that infuriating debacle, and a really piddly shower; the hotel is actually very lovely. The less-than- double bed was quite comfortable. Rooms - even the tiny 10X12 we had - are nicely appointed, and use tiny space well. Location is excellent, and staff were very good. We did not eat there or visit the bar. I would certainly return to this hotel, with better arrangements for room set-up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel--small room”
Reviews.Author: Sumnerj
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location; the staff (including Brian the Doorman) provided wonderful help when needed; the lobby is a trip; bed is comfortable; bathroom is small, nice design, and functional; room is very small; only complaint is only two small drawers in closet for clothes.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place to Stay and Great People that work there.”
Reviews.Author: davidbSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Friend and I wanted to do a theatre weekend in NY and we chose the Paramount Hotel in NYC for accommodations. WELL... I can only say that it was Great. When we got to the hotel on Thursday we were greeted by the front desk goddess "Catherine" !!! She was so pleasant and helped us get our great weekend started. The rooms are perfect and you can not beat the location. If you are going to NYC you should stay at the Paramount. It is a great place and we enjoyed ourselves so much, thanks in a large part to the Paramount staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience. Clean. Classy. Efficient Staff.”
Reviews.Author: mkreid
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Right in Time Square. Rooms are small, but very clean and updated with modern decor. Staff was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Don't believe older reviews!”
Reviews.Author: c7C
Reviews.Content: We read the TripAdvisor reviews, and were a little apprehensive, but decided to give it a try because the location is terrific. We were so glad we stayed here!! The hotel is neat and clean, and quiet. The rooms are a little small. We choose a room with 2 double beds, thinking that would give us a little extra space for suitcases, etc. The room was right across from the elevators, but we NEVER heard anything. One night, a group of kids had a pizza party out in the hallway, outside our door. We saw them when we got home after a play......but we NEVER heard them once we were inside the room. The interior design elements of the room are excellent and so very innovative. The beds, well.... I would have been happier with a more firm bed. On the second day of our stay, we **almost** ran out of the supply of body wash...but there was an extra bar of soap. I am not sure the toiletries are replenished each day. We also had enough towels, but it seemed like there were more towels the first day than there were the second day. Maybe they just supply extra towels as you start your stay! The fan created a draft across the beds, so I covered some of the fan vents to shoot the air towards the window instead of the bed. That worked ok. Some people have complained about the fan noise.....but it seemed normal to us. We used valet parking, and that was seamless. After unloading, the car was parked somewhere, and we were told to allow 30 minutes when we wanted to have the car back. We didn't need to car until we checked out, and it was delivered in less than 5 minutes. The valet parking charge was only a few dollars more than the garage across the street normally charges for 24 hours of parking. The car was delivered to us in excellent shape, and Jed, the doorman helped us back up and was very helpful. We'll be back again and again and again. We were out and about town during meal times, so never ate at the hotel. There are many fine restaurants and theatres that you can get to in five minutes or less. Did I say "Great Location" yet??????

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly and helpful staff who welcomed us warmly.”
Reviews.Author: mrsgeezil
Reviews.Content: We were registered by Amanda, who greeted us warmly. The room was spotless, comfortable pillows and mattress. Great quality in the amenities, especially the soap and shampoo - most pleasant scents. Excellent breakfast selection and delicious food. Our waiter and the chef, Alan and Jesus, obviously liked their work and were proud of it.

Reviews.Title: “Brian is the friendliest doorman in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Miami63
Reviews.Content: The doorman, Brian, is so friendly, warm and helpful. He made our stay extra special!

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a space shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: DeeJayBlue
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, and the rooms were neat and clean, but we've never ever stayed in such a tiny room! OMG! It was almost funny. I could reach one wall laying in the king bed and my husband could reach the other on his side! YIKES! I'm talking S M A L L! Big plus is location, however. Perfect if you want to be in the heart of the city that never sleeps. All the excitement was right out of your front door. We loved that part. Bottom line. If you're just looking for a clean, comfortable bed to sleep in this is a great option that gives you a perfect location to be right in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicoSherry
Reviews.Content: All the people there were wonderful! Robert, at the concierge desk, made our visit to The Empire State Bldg. extremely enjoyable by letting us know, and purchase express tickets for our visit. He also suggested we do The Top of the Rock during the day and The Empire State Bldg. at night...a winner! And he recommended some great places to eat. Chevarlo made our breakfast experience wonderful. From check in to check out everyone was so helpful and polite. We had a great suite and enjoyed our rooms so much. Room service was good and the food plentiful. The location was wonderful and we walked to see The Lion King and Mary Poppins. Couldn't ask for a better experience in the Big Apple...can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable contempory hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gelbelle
Reviews.Content: My husband booked the NY trip as a surprise for our 8th wedding anniversary, so once I found out where we were staying, I trawled through the reviews. I chose to keep an open mind and was glad I did. The lobby is spectacular and the staff are very friendly. We upgraded our room on arrival, at a nominal cost per night but what I hadn't banked on was that it was the size of the bed that was being upgraded and I of course expected a larger room too. The room was cosy but sufficient, that was until day 3, once the cases were spilling over with washing and the shopping bags had been accumulated. The room suddenly became oppresive. Kyrstal at reception did take on board my concerns and kindly offered a change of room on a lower floor. We travelled with another couple who had a much larger room on a lower floor, so guys I guess the lower the floor,the bigger the room. I would reccommend the Paramount and would stay there again without a shadow of a doubt and I am a pretty picky traveller. Overall, the room was very clean, sufficient for a few nights and the staff were very accommodating. Thenonly downside, not enough wardrobe space.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Eddy52
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Britain to the US and after a seven hour flight and what felt like an equal amount of time being processed through security checks we finally made it to the hotel. On arrival we were immediately greeted by Brain (definetly the friendliest doorman in all NY) and shown through to the lobby area which was beautifully decorated in a contemporary art-deco style, which is very appropriate given the laid back and chilled atmosophere. When we eventually got the room we found it to be very clean and tidy and whilst a little on the small side it was still nicely furnished and had everything you could need to enjoy your stay. The main feature and selling point of the Paramount is it's location; literally 200 yards from Times Square and just a 10 minute walk to the high end stores on 5th Avenue and about the same from Central Park. As well as being surrouded by a diverse variety of places to eat. Apart from the array of shops we also visit the National Art Museum which was an excellent exhibition. We would also recommend the 3hr river boat cruise that takes you around the whole island giving a spectacular perspective of this amazing city. Can't wait to go back...a brilliant hotel and an amazing place where you simply don't have enough time to take it all in.

Reviews.Title: “Sheik and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: am2529
Reviews.Content: We stayed with one other couple for two nights over the weekend and got a great deal on a King Deluxe room. The hotel lobby was beautifully decorated, and the rooms as well. The bed was comfortable and the room clean! I needed extra robes and toothbrushes, and housekeeping was quick to deliver any requests. The two issues: The fan for the heating system was loud and kept me awake. Upon arrival we were early and checked our baggage with the hotel to walk around while we waited for our room. There was only one person working, and it took a long time to check in our luggage. Upon check-in, we were told they would deliver our luggage in 15 minutes to our room. We had to wait well over an hour for our luggage. They need to add extra staff on weekends (we checked in on a Friday and I would assume that this is a busy day for check-ins, and therefore should be adequately staffed). However, that being said, it did not in a nay way, damper our opinion of this hotel. Great price, perfectly located and beautiful accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “A decent refurb let down by inattention to detail”
Reviews.Author: MozLondonEngland
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Paramount Hotel a number of times before but a specific problem with my two most recent visits (Sept '09 & March '10) has convinced me to look elsewhere for a business location in NYC. On both occasions calls / deliveries to the hotel were told that I wasn't resident there ! I suspect that this is due to a policy of holding all rooms booked together under the name of one lead traveller thus preventing the reception staff & 'phone operators from indentifying a individual resident in the party. When the problem occured in September I alerted the management and was given an apology and an assurance that it wouldn't happen again but unfotunately it is exactly what happened during my recent trip a matter of days ago. Add to this some inconsistencies in housekeeping (bath towel delivered on some days & not on others, no plug in sink etc.); variable bar service (one bartender happy to make espresso martinis one evening and a blank refusal on the part of another the following evening as "I'd have to turn the machine on...") and internet at $9.95 a day which resolutely refused to work and I'm unconvinced that The Paramount's expensive refurb job is matched by the quality of service one could reasonably expect.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, service and best comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: SunnyPilot
Reviews.Content: THE BEST Location you can ever expect, what a surprise hotel. Great Service, typical NY Hotel room size but trendy and CLEAN!! Breakfast is good, great bar and lobby. Highly recommended....

Reviews.Title: “Best experience I had in NY hotels”
Reviews.Author: bmmoore32
Reviews.Content: The Paramount Hotel gave my wife and I one of the best stays in NY city that we have had in a long time. The paramount staff was coutesous and willing to help with any situation. The rooms were clean and quainte with a nice view of the city. The best part of the experience was the doorman Brian. Brian was very freindly and willing to go the extra mile to make that first impression memerable. My wife and I will be using the Paramount Hotel for every stay in NY city.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, perfect location, amazing ambience.”
Reviews.Author: ericdfrank
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Paramount and was beyond impressed with this hotel. All the staff was courteous and polite. Their entertainment director, Rob DelliBovi, was extremely helpful and hooked us up with all the right places to go. The rooms were immaculate and it was a perfect place for an NYC getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: What2010
Reviews.Content: I was initially concerned about my stay here as there were so many differing reviews, however, I neednt be worried, the room was perfect (note we did upgrade to a queen room). Yes it was small but we were hardly in there anyway (who wants to be stuck in their room in a great city like NY). There was a few problems initially with the heating but they sorted it our for us straight away. The staff are friendly and welcoming and very polite. The location is perfect and even better is that the No 1 restaurant in New York (on trip advisor) is right next door! Would definitely recommend and stay again thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, Helpful Staff, Hipster Vibe”
Reviews.Author: t00t
Reviews.Content: Great decor in the lobby and the rooms, and although the rooms were a bit small, they had all the basics. The location was fabulous and the staff, especially Jed, was extremely friendly and helpful. We were pleasantly surprised by the well equipped fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: eciym
Reviews.Content: Great staff, wonderfull interior design, located perfectly on times square, Just now as you exit Brian the ever helpful and polite doorman will take the door for you and then the wonderful tones of Frank Sinatra eminate from across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Darling!”
Reviews.Author: Nattly
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, ideal location and friendly staff. Special mention to Chris M in the downstairs bar who is a fab barman, great fun and introduced us to the Eldertini - uh oh, that might have been dangerous! Chris for employee of the month :P

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with NYC Character...Not a "Big-Box" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sussexnative
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned today after a 3 day trip to NYC. We spent two nights at the Paramount and found it to be a very clean hotel with charm and character, unlike the big and often bland chain hotels that tower over Times Square. At the Paramount we actually felt like we were staying in NYC. The staff was great and the location is tremendous! Walk out the door and to your left is Times Square. We had dinner and took in a show all within 2 blocks of our hotel! Many reviewers have written about the small room size. If you are concerned about room size I would suggest you spend a little extra for a deluxe king room. We found the room to be more than adequate. Our bed was very comfortable and we were well rested each morning. The bathroom was a bit cramped but it was spotless, and we had plenty of hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and a cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: lachobruiser
Reviews.Content: The Paramount is a funky hotel just a half a block from Times Square. Our stay was thoroughly enjoyable and the few kinks in service (i.e. no sugar with room service) were remedied immediately. The security in the hotel and doorman Jed were particularly helpful. This was our first time in New York and the location couldn't have been better. We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “NY's Finest Doorman”
Reviews.Author: newport58
Reviews.Content: Brian couldn't have been more helpful and courteous in getting me a cab right away. Service with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Chopper56
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, right by Times Square. I could not find any fault with the hotel and the staff were so friendly and helpful. It has a family atmosphere rather than the usual staff/guest approach. I look forward to staying at the Paramount again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Crammed like a sardine- but in the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: Canuckgal25
Reviews.Content: The Paramount was located off of a side street from Times Square. The room was just sooooo horrible. We couldn't believe how horrible it was. The door touches the bed as you open it to your room. The bed was hard as rock, and just a double bed. The bathroom was small and dingy.....kinda like one you would see on a cruise ship. We had to take turns walking around the room, because there just wasn't enough space to move at the same time. I slept on the floor a few nights, because the bed just wasn't big enough for the two of us. I'd wake up in the middle of the night squished into the wall, with all my muscles killing me. Our window faced right into a brick wall. The lobby was beautiful, and ultra modern, and the location was amazing. You are literally a 30 second walk to the middle of Times Square. Mind you it was always a battle to get into the million people walking down the street. So much fun though. I guess it's a normal thing to have small rooms in New York. It's big city living. I would recommend this hotel for location, but make sure you pay a little extra and get a queen bed.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, great location, excellent prices”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlr1119
Reviews.Content: The Paramount is a great hotel for the price. I’m not sure if it can be beat. Yes the room was small, but again I don’t know what people expect for the price you pay for the room. The room was clean and the service was very good. The only thing that that I didn’t like about the room was that the heat system made a very loud noise when it would turn on. Overall for the price paid location and service I really think the Paramount is a great value. I’d also like to say how nice the doorman Brian was. He was by far the nicest person I came across during my entire time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The Paramount Hotel, New York, exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: KatzenMuseumStore
Reviews.Content: From the location, cleanliness and comfort, the Paramount Hotel exceeded my expectations. From the minute I walked through the doors, everything was perfect. Karen and Patrick were exceptional at making sure my stay was the best ever! The rooms are beautiful and comfy! The fitness center is clean and modern! I will make sure this is my destination hotel for New York in the future! Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: turist4ever
Reviews.Content: I stayed for just one night at the Paramount Hotel and I was looking for a relatively cheap and decent place close to Times Square. I paid $89 plus taxes for a single room and was expecting nothing more than a good place to sleep. Upon arrival, my first impression was that I was entering a fancy night club (which can be a positive or a negative aspect, depending on your mood). The lobby is very modern and the hotel bar seems to be very popular. They offered to upgrade me to a double room because it would be just faster. I couldn't be happier. Thanks, Nathalie. The room was not big, but it was extremely comfortable and clean. My only complaint: the heating system would make a loud noise when turned on. Overall, a great choice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best attention, great place to stay, drink, relax and party”
Reviews.Author: FranciscoCanese
Reviews.Content: The staff that work here is excelents, the atention was perfect. We had a great time there. Thank you Moosa and everybody for your help and assistance!

Reviews.Title: “Catherine made me feel like I was at home!”
Reviews.Author: MikePDFW
Reviews.Content: I had a bunch of challenges and the staff, specifically Catherine, took care of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyabl”
Reviews.Author: onefc
Reviews.Content: We had a great evening at the paramount which was located within 2 blocks of a play we were seeing. Arriving a little later than expected we decided to have dinner in the hotel. The menu was somewhat limited but everything was 5 star especially the steak I had. Service from check in, restraunt and bar was superior. The room was done in art deco, very different for the city but a nice touch. I found the price extemely fair, not only for the room but the other ammenities we enjoyed as well. A definate place we will be going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to hard to be trendy, but definitely clean, friendly and a great location”
Reviews.Author: dealz
Reviews.Content: For our short trip to NYC my mother and I stayed at the Paramount Hotel. The hotel was in a decent location, perfect location for those looking to see Time Square or Broadway buffs, seeing as most of the broadway shows are within 1 to 2 blocks. Upon entering the hotel it was a bit over the top in it's attempt to be modern and high class. The tech-no music was over the top. The whole trendy hotel was a bit much. But despite the decor the staff was really helpful and willing to go out of their way to be accommodating. We had a room with two full size beds, the room was small but no surprise there, and the bathroom was also small but it was designed to try and maximize space. The only major issues we had with the hotel was that the hallways were extremely dark since there was no windows, but the lack of lighting in the hallways also gave it a dingy feel. Also our room was extremely hot for March, and we had to put on the AC to sleep comfortably. Overall a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “A European "W" hotel with great service & value”
Reviews.Author: globaltraveler97
Reviews.Content: I stayed 28 February to 3 March on business. The rate was a great value, the service very good and it included a very nice breakfast buffet. Two people who really hustled to help make my stay excellent were a bellman named Edgar and a doorman named Brian. But the whole staff had a good attitude. Two bars and a casual restaurant; I enjoyed them all. It is like a European "W" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NYC's Friendliest Doorman”
Reviews.Author: AshimaM
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, very warm staff and great location. Has the buzz of NYC!! Special mention to BRION for being NYC's Friendliest Doorman!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Rob B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a refreshing change from normal city "chains". Room was small as you would expect in NYC but really quite funky and the Queen size bed was a delight. Staff were very friendly and Andrew the bartender in the main bar makes the very best Manhatten you will have during your stay. The location could not be better as you are tucked away but on Time Sq in 30 seconds. Our stay was perfect, great value, superb staff and I will be returning as soon as I can

Reviews.Title: “class location”
Reviews.Author: anneanddarren
Reviews.Content: Returned from this hotel today..2nd March 2010. Impressive lobby..warm and welcoming..check-in was swift and easy.... Thank you to Trey and Catherine at reception and to Diana at Concierge.. you were all very professional at all times...a special 'thanks' to Trey for our lovely room...610...lovely comfy bed, spacious room, fresh towels every day, flat screen tv, hairdryer, iron and board..safe in room, excellant housekeeping. well done. Fantastic access to eveywhere from here..less than 5 mins to the centre of Times Square. Across the road from BiIlly Elliott theatre..great Pizerria next door...minutes from Bebe Kings, the Irish Rogues, The Playwright and O'Lunneys...around the corner from the Grayline Sight seeing stand.. Intending to return here as soon as we can...as I work in Travel, I would have no hesitation in recomending the Paramount to my clients..infact, I had some staying there whilst I was there and they all enjoyed.. So THANK-YOU to all concernd..which includes back-of -house staff as well...as without you the hotel wouldnt function as well as it does.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Perfect Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: aaronusa
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel, and the staff went out of their way to help me when I needed to print out a document urgently (thanks Catherine and Barbara!). My only complaint is that the room I had (a double with two twin beds) didn't have a writing surface on which to place my laptop. There's this neat sliding table that fits over the bed, which is a lot of fun if you want to have coffee in bed, but not really practical for eating lunch or typing on a computer. Since I had business work to do during the day I spent two days typing with my laptop on my lap. On the bright side, the Internet was reasonably fast and the location is perfect if you want to be in the middle of the theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “Location Fantastic & Hotel Beds so comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Mermaids21
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to celebrate a special birthday. We spent 6 days 5 nights at the Paramount which was a gorgeous Hotel, it had all the major attractions on it's doorstep which made sight-seeing so easy. We were greeted by a smiling pleasant young lady called Nathalie, when my Husband explained it was his birthday we upgraded to a twin double room for a little extra. The beds were so comfortable!! and the good quality bedding and pillows made such a difference to a good night's sleep. My husband was impressed by the 32 inch flat screen tv which seemed to broadcast all chanels in HD. Luis was so attentive in the restaurant and made me a tasty waffle and couldn't do enough for us, great to have old fashioned service in these times. We can't wait to visit again. Only negative the internet fees were a little expensive, then again maybe that is the going rate in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Blues_Monster
Reviews.Content: Great service and the world's friendliest doorman! Right in the middle of the theater district with shows and restaurants on all sides.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Doorman”
Reviews.Author: ErinStrub
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the paramount. Brian the door guy was so nice. There was a terrible snow storm and he was so attentive on getting us cabs so we didnt have to wait in the bad weather. He gave great directions. Thanks Brian for being so helpful!

Reviews.Title: “central to all the excitement”
Reviews.Author: 042collins
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel close to everything. rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels each day. As for Brian the doorman he has to be nyc friendliest doorman and always willing to help with any queries you may have. Will defo stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: flairVirginia
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel. The people were very polite and helpful especially Catherene. The only bad thing was that the room was small but it was enough for us and there was no hot water. The TV didn't work half of the time. But we enjoyed staying there and would again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: IheartNY_10
Reviews.Content: Hi, my husband and I have recently returned from a trip to New York where we stayed at the Paramount Hotel, The Hotel is perfectly placed for Times Square and Theatreland (Billy Elliott is on right across the road!)We were met by Brian the doorman who gave us a quick run down of what was nearby, the reception is a fantastic space with a fab chandelier and unusual seating which you will need as the Hotel reception is always busy (even at midnight). The rooms are spotless and nicely decorated, but if your looking for tons of space you might want to reconsider. The first room we were given had a bed in smaller than a UK double and a room to match, however we did ask nicely and were given a different room which was slightly bigger with a bed you could actually turn over in. The best bit of this Hotel is that it has a (expensive) bar and a cracking deli attached where you could get a cup of tea (as there are no facilities for this in the rooms) and sometimes we English just need a cup of tea even in a city that thrives on coffee- the cakes in the deli were pretty amazing too. If you are planning, like we did to sightsee and shop and only spend time in your room to sleep and get changed it is perfect and we would be happy to return (providing decent bed is provided!)

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Laker04
Reviews.Content: Fantastic lobby, really sets the tone for the hotel. We mentioned it was our honeymoon when checking in and the guy at reception upgraded us to a superior room. Great location as well, just off Times Square. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant atmosphere, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ginevra111
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Paramount Hotel to anyone visiting NYC; the rooms, lobby, and bars are tastefully decorated, immaculately clean, and absolutely elegant! (As an aside, Lorenzo and Jed are friendly, helpful and truly professional!!!) The room rates are very reasonable (I hope they stay that way), but the parking rates are a little high. All in all, we preferred our stay at the Paramount to our stay at the W (two years ago).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous NY hotel just off Times Square”
Reviews.Author: TurboMD
Reviews.Content: Exclusive and chic! With no huge sign on the building, I felt that I was entering my own New York Club. Dazzling lobby with all the help and attention instantly available to check in and plan my NYC stay. Loved the Euro-cool furnishings, the bathrobes and the large flat screen TV in my room. Glamorous watering hole off the lobby for romance or people watching. Dean & Deluca for breakfast and light meals or snacks. What could be easier. And for a real New York experience, a pizza joint next door for a slice or a bagel and cawfee in the morning. TKTS a block away! Between 2 subway stops at 42nd St. and 50th St. B'way Theater and parking across the street. Military friendly! This NOT the creaky, dumpy Paramount of by-gone days and old TripAdvisor reviews. Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “where did the towels go?”
Reviews.Author: LondonJmcg
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 nights and found it to be a good hotel, housekeeping were very keen to take towels and face cloths without replacing them! not sure why...however all requests to reception for replacements were met with a swift response! all staff were very helpful and pleasant...bryan the doorman was also helpful....rooms at front can be noisy as you are on a busy street so stay as high up in this hotel as you possibly can! i was very happy to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: nicandkai
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my partner for 4 nights in Feb. Our room was perfect modern tv and two double beds. The rooms was small but no problem at all. As it was just me and partner we didnt mind however a family of 4 may find it to small as there wudnt be alot room to get ready. The beds were very comfy! breakfast was great we also had a voucher for money off! The girls at the desk (to book shows etc) were fab, they helped us out on directions all the time. The cafe next door to the hotel was good open everday, as this is where we got our tea from in the mornings,also reasonably priced. The pizza place next door was also another good place to stop for a slice, very friendly. The hotel was in the best location, times square. Literally less than a min walk in to the heart of times square, so plenty to do in the surrounding area. Would definatly go back to this hotel in the future and would recommend. Gym Facility brilliant

Reviews.Title: “Luis Torres, thank you”
Reviews.Author: tatta76
Reviews.Content: Luis Torres gave the best service I ever had in hotels on breakfast time He is really professional and very nice person, who can make you a good mood for whole day. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Paramount Hotel 2 steps to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: xwore
Reviews.Content: This week-end was our first to New York. We really enjoyed our stay and the Paramount Hotel was 2 steps from Times Square. This is one reason we selected that hotel. It has been renovated and the rooms look really modern. I recommand the place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: slusarzj
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for the price. Very central location to everything you want to do in NYC. The rooms are a little small, but if you are going to NYC you dont want to stay in your room! Lobby is very nice and the lobby bar was a great place for a drink. Anna Marie was great and very helpful at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Emperors New Clothes”
Reviews.Author: Koatsey
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good points..., Great locations, bar a lobby. When they say small within the reviews please do not underestimate that they really do mean small. I have a feeling it is hit and miss on the room size so don't take this to chance. This in of its self is not the big disappointment, it was that this was compounded by three other things. 1) No storage so the room became a health hazard, change the base of the beds so that visitors can at least put their cases under the bed. 2) The room was so small that as the one who got to sleep on the right hand side of the bed I got the heating/cooling right in my face and ear, great experience... 3) Lastly it was impossible to regulate the room temperature and wow what a noise when it was on. In a nut shell great location, nice bar and entrance but I can't recommend it I'm afraid as the niggles add up and value for money I just don't see it. We went for Valentines day and my partner emailed to get tables booked and got responses saying they would. Guess what no tables booked and no romantic Valentines supper for two. It's a hell of a long way to go to be so poorly services in this respect and not how you want to spend £2,000 ($3,000ish) including flights. We travel a lot and are used to booking different styles and quality of accommodation and hope this means we are fairly balanced and experienced in our review, in this case I would have to recommend you look a little harder than I did...., sorry Paramount but its a thumbs down for me. I would have attached a photo of the room but it was so small you would have only seen a wall as the angle on the camera lens was not wide angle.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Food Service Superior”
Reviews.Author: CatloverHolbrook
Reviews.Content: The breakfast buffet was excellent, a nice variety of pastries, waffles (excellent, by the way) and hot food. The wait staff was attentive and helpful and I must give extra praise to Chevarlo/Luis who made sure everything was served and cooked to perfection, especially those waffles, which we got to make ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “best breakfastservice ever”
Reviews.Author: kamioginel
Reviews.Content: thanks to luis torres - we had a wonderful time - we were a group of 6 - flight was cancelled due to snow-luis was very friendly -congratulations on such a good staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and services...small rooms...”
Reviews.Author: MariaViajante
Reviews.Content: Damus is the best driver we ever met, sympathy, helpful, an excellent NYC guide. Unfortunately we’ve met him only in the last day! Damus, keep up the great job!

Reviews.Title: “Brian the doorman”
Reviews.Author: bugsyCheshire
Reviews.Content: Great location and the best doorman in the world - Brian!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Institution”
Reviews.Author: JordanPaige
Reviews.Content: I visit NYC 4-5 times a year, and have for the past decade. Paramount was the first place I stayed upon first arriving in NYC all those years ago, and I would never go anywhere else. If you're used to the huge hotel rooms typical of the midwest, you'd best rethink your expectations. The rooms at the Paramount are small and maybe a little rusty, but they are very great quality for NYC. They rooms are clean- which has become THE number one priority for NYC hotels what with the bed bug infestation issue. Of course, the greatest thing about this Paramount is its location. I can't even count the number of times I leisurely enjoyed a drink at the bar and then strolled out the door to a theatre that was literally next door. Awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: HGreynolds
Reviews.Content: While there is a lot of traffic in the lobby that should come as no shock given its a stones throw from Times Square. Stayed with a small-ish group (20 people) and found the rooms to be updated and nice for the price we were paying. The staff were all great and patient and clearly are used to dealing in chaos. In short and having stayed at a few places in this part of town, I'd go back here over the others.

Reviews.Title: “great location w/bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: mtnlovinhikerchick
Reviews.Content: small rooms, tiny bathrooms, bar that won't let you take your drink to your room all located in the heart of mid town. i now have a love/hate thing for them.

Reviews.Title: “Good music. Terrible bar. You can't...”
Reviews.Author: Emjane81
Reviews.Content: Good music. Terrible bar. You can't take your drink to your room, and they close at midnight, so you have to finish your drink with all the lights on while they close up. Then on top of this, they add a 15% service charge in addition to the drink charge. I would never recommend anyone stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Experience”
Reviews.Author: JennRx2000
Reviews.Content: Our Hotel stay was fantastic from beginning to end. the hotel staff were all superior especially Catherine, who did everything to make sure all our needs were met. Would definitely recommend and plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: bgorgone
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfull valentine's weekend planned. Went to a play and for dinner, asked for recommendations from the Concierge. Diana was most helpful and recommended the Blue WWater Grill. She was right on. Diana went out of her way and got us seated on the bottom floor where a fabulous jazz combo was playing. The dinner was outstanding, the setting romantic and service unbeatable. Thank you Paramount and ank you Diana. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable beds and Brian--the friendliest Doorman in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFool1978
Reviews.Content: Had a great visit to NYC and enjoyed our stay at Paramount NYC. It is centrally located in Times Square and you're close to the subway, just a block from restaurant row with tons of great restaurants and theatres everywhere! The building is an old building that has been renovated and the aesthetics are visually appealing, very trendy. Some of the craftmanship of the remodel was a little sloppy, but overall it's a nice hotel. Very friendly staff and Brian the doorman was very helpful and friendly in anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: NYKER82
Reviews.Content: Newly rennovated. Located 100m from times square. Good gym - new equipment. Brian is NY's finest doorman!

Reviews.Title: “thanks so much!”
Reviews.Author: jingading
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the paramount after being snowed in while visiting NY. The hotel is very well located and the rooms were simply but stylishly furnished. Special thanks to Amanda on the front desk for going out of her way to lend us her own iPhone charger and also to Brian the doormanfor his excellent service. I highly recommend this hotel and give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: superal1942
Reviews.Content: We haven't stayed here in years, and were pleased with the experience. Last time we had a closet of a room, like some of the reviewers. but this time were able to take advantage of winter special in a double bed room at a very reasonble rate for New York. Not spacious, but in New York, you will pay big time for that perk. Only stayed one night so, accomodations were fine. Nice lounge, friendly bartender, New York prices for cocktails - a happy hour would have been nice! We also have to say a thank you to Brian, the friendliest doorman in New York! Helped us get a cab in really nasty weather. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: WritinFoodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in early February, just ahead of the big snowstorm. Have wanted to stay at the Paramount for years and received an unbelievable deal, especially for the fantastic location. It exceeded expectations; I knew the rooms to be fairly small, but the room we had was clean, nicely designed, and more spacious than anticipated. The staff was terrific - Jed and Clayton were great with bag storage around check-out - and having the Dean & Deluca on main floor is a nice convenience. I'd stay again in a heartbeat. One note, and this isn't unique to the Paramount - I miss NY1 television. Used to love watching it as I prepared to go out in the morning or right before sleep. With the advent of digital it seems to have disappeared from all hotels. Would love to see it back.

Reviews.Title: “great place, friendly and professional”
Reviews.Author: barbyAsolo_TV_
Reviews.Content: catherine was very friendly and all the staff. rooms very confortable, location of the hotel very close to Time Square in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: alether
Reviews.Content: Brian is the friendliest doorman in New York City. He is the best! The staff is very accommodating and the rooms are nice!

Reviews.Title: “The Location is everything!”
Reviews.Author: Freddie-Actor
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the Paramount Hotel has a wonderful location. The Hotel itself is very luxurious. Tidy, clean, helpful staff and with very handy rooms for a single person or even for two. Ok, usually they have small rooms...but did you really want to go to NYC, Manhattan, about 15 seconds (NO JOKE) from Times Square and Broadway to stay in your room ? No Way. Paramount is perfect and i will definitely come back if I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: David52555
Reviews.Content: I had been to the Paramount but had never stayed at the hotel due to the fact that I thought all the rooms were tiny. On this trip I wanted to be in the Times Square area so I checked their website and booked a deluxe king. The room turned out to be just fine, and I found it very comfortable. When I checked in Trey at the front desk was outstanding!! I quized him about the room size, location, etc...He then called me after I got to the room to make sure everything was to my liking. I stayed for four days and had a great experience...Brian the doorman was also outstanding..Always hailing a cab, assisting with directions, etc...Then when I was leaving I checked my bags with I believe Paul and he even took them out to my car when I left. I will certainly stay at the Paramount again, as I visit the city many times throughout the year. I would also mention that I work with a five star resort so I understand good service...you can't go wrong with these guys.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: lisafitt
Reviews.Content: When we first got to the hotel, the room was tiny!! I mean, really tiny, with only a full-sized bed. Granted, I'm not big and my husband isn't, either, but a full-sized bed?I went to the front desk and Nathalie didn't even blink, giving us a complimentary upgrade, Thank you, Nathalie. And thank you to Brian the doorman, who schlepped our bags out to the cab half a block away and waited with them while we got (takeout) lunch. I'd never been to New York at this time of the year - the weather was fabulous and we could actually run up Broadway to get to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “item taken from room”
Reviews.Author: EssexMusiclover
Reviews.Content: we stayed in thing hotel in jan 2010, everything was nice untill the morning of the first day when we left our room to be cleaned, when we came back an item had been taken, reception was not very helpfull and housekeeping even worse, it took 3 day of complaining before they even gave us a form to fill out, no one seemed to care. the hotel said they will be in contact and its now been over a week and i havent heard a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Nathalie at the front desk was super cool!”
Reviews.Author: Dawgbroker
Reviews.Content: I got in from a red eye flight and had a meeting to get ready for. She got me in my room immediately the day after they were sold out! That is great customer service! Sol

Reviews.Title: “A really good position”
Reviews.Author: PEBALL
Reviews.Content: We came for my daughters 21st Birthday from 27/1 to 2/2 and had a great time. The Paramount is in a really good central position, it was reasonably priced so a good standard for the money. My criticisms are that the rooms are absolutely tiny so you need to bear that in mind, they were clean and refurbished so that compensated. Also not impressed that they charge you 2 dollars per bag to store after you check out your room, I would expect this just to be a standard service for any hotel!! Also dont like the fact that they automatically charged 14 dollars gratuity for drinks at the bar which didnt warrant this. The coffee place attached expensive and poor service but the pizza place next to that cheap and good!!
