Found a great diner called the Westway Diner, amazing and cheap and avoid Ellens Stardust Diner in Times Square, expensive and dirty. Loved New York but very cold, a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: mashelly
Reviews.Content: Brian the Doorman was great . From start to finish he was very pleasant and went above and beyond to help make my stay wonderful. I'm in the hospitality industry and appreciate great service.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ExTJOE
Reviews.Content: Nathalie was very accomodating given my unsual arrival time. Overall I'd say this is the best hotel in that are for this price. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nathalie was the best!!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravelers814
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I checked into the Parmount and we were greeted with a friendly face, Nathalie at the front desk was so great to us . We had a smaller room than we expected and she automatically changed our room to accomadate our needs. The day we checked out we decided to stay a little while longer than the "normal" check out time and she arranged for us to delay our check out time with out any hesitation. This was great because we wanted to shop and enjoy the city a little more before we headed home. The Parmount was such a great location on top of the excellent service. You walk out the door and your practically standing in the middle of all the bright lights and broadway shows.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: wessthedj
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had an awful experience recently at the Paramount. We booked a room for 1 night and all was fine until we were jarred awake at 8am by extremely loud construction going on right outside our window. I mean hammers and electric saws so loud that we had to scream to hear each other in our own tiny room. We immediately called down to the front desk to complain and were shocked at the response, "Oh, were you planning on sleeping in?" First of all, 8am is not "sleeping in", especially if you're on vacation. Second, who says that? It was a completely unhelpful and rude response. He offered no help and no resolution. At that, we were livid and decided that sleeping any longer was not an option so we decided to get up and check out. Then, at only 8:30am, while we were getting ready, a hotel employee just walks right into our room without knocking. We're standing there in our underwear and he doesn't immediately shut the door! Instead, he says to us, "When are you checking out?" We reply "We don't know." and he says "Well you know check-out is at 10." This infuriated us further. This should NEVER happen to ANYONE staying at any hotel ever. First of all, check out is at NOON as clearly stated on the hotel's website. Second, who cares what time check out is? It 's 8:30am and we're in our underwear! Close the door! I travel a lot and I have never complained about any hotel but I must say that we had an awful, awful experience. Do not ever stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: imsinc
Reviews.Content: Brian is NYC best doorman! Chris is a lively bartender, that pours a good drink.

Reviews.Title: “FLAWLESS STAY”
Reviews.Author: justadude1986
Reviews.Content: Perfect. I must admit by reading other reviews I was very hesitant to stay here due to the "small rooms". I stayed in a Deluxe King Room. PERFECT size. Not small at all. However, I did notice some of the single/double bed rooms (when people walked out of their room) are SUPER TINY! Not our room though, it was flawless! The hotel is very interesting and very enjoyable. The best thing (aside from our stay at the Paramount) was it's LOCATION! Literally, 1 minute walk to Time Square. Oh! Also used the business center which was nice and worked perfect. Good food near by! I'd stay again with out hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Your doorman Brian was the greatest in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Doorman_10
Reviews.Content: Brian the doorman was the greatest help,even in the coldest of Jan. Sat the 30th of 2010,in 14 degree weather he was upbeat and helped us out with a smile.Here is to Brian the doorman of the Paramount Hotel at 245 W 46th st in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Clean Rooms, Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: manny3vee
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The place was clean and the service was excellent. Moreover, the location/value ratio was off the charts. I highly recommend this place. I just hope the prices don't skyrocket anytime soon. One more thing, Brian at the front door is NYC's best doorman!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay @ Paramount again every time we are in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Villeneuve76
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Rooms are nice and cosy, Some canbe small but very stylish , very modern and with all you need. A bath tub in all rooms we been to. This was our second stay at the PAramount and we would come to stay here again. Price / quality = top ratio Brian and Edgar are top and friendly door men.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, cozy, and in the heart of everything!"”
Reviews.Author: Brandi_xo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paramount Hotel. I booked through Expedia. Upon arrival, I asked for an upgrade, and was put on the list for a complimentary next day upgrade. I read the rooms were very small, but I found it to be quite cozy considering I was traveling alone. The next day I was upgraded to a bigger room with a view. I loved the location. Great price for a place in New York City. Lola at the front desk was very sweet! You can't beat the price, location, and friendliness this hotel offers. This will be my new place to stay when I visit New York. I would consider myself selective when it comes to hotels and this place met all of my expectations. The only thing that would have been nice was room service...especially when you're sick and your flight was cancelled due to a snow storm, but with New York City, you can order take in =)

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: boosie21
Reviews.Content: Property over was very clean, rooms were nice, clean lines, comfortable bed. Staff was great. Doorman Brian is also a standout.

Reviews.Title: “Best Doorman in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mikejeff
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, newly renovated. Staff very friendly and helpful. Brian the doorman ia the best in NY. Always ready to help and warmly greats all guests. Facility has one of the best fitness centers for a hotel in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ruggedAthens
Reviews.Content: Location - At the heart of Manhattan and Broadway. Best place to combine business with pleasure. Staff - Extremely friendly and helpful with no exception! Very rare to find in hotels nowdays. Room - Very clean; Every day cleaning lady; Very small though! Other - It should be more wise to have free WiFi connection; The breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a real personality”
Reviews.Author: Bucknellgrad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great and very unique. It is also in an ideal location. The employees are outstanding especially the friendly doorman Brian!

Reviews.Title: “The Paramount was well worth staying at, and I will gladly do so again.”
Reviews.Author: Schomburg
Reviews.Content: Since the Milford Plaza, where I usually stay when I visit New York, is undergoing renovation, I selected the Paramount. What drew me were the price and the location, and I wasn't disappointed with either. The Paramount--on 46th near Eighth--is centrally located near the Great White Way and Restaurant Row--although if you blink, you'll miss the building entriely (it's almost camaflauged...strange for a hotel of its size). But for a hotel in that area, you absolutely cannot beat the price. (A piece of advice: make your reservations online, NOT by phone--phoning in does not get you the best rate.) Also be aware that the rooms are small (some have said "tiny" in their reviews; others have called them "miniscule"). But the size of the rooms should not be a deterrant. My room was hyper-clean, comfortable, well heated (I visted in early January when the temperature was near frigid), and just downright cozy. Perhaps because I'm used to the Milford Plaza with its considerably small rooms, I wasn't put off by the size of my room at the Paramount. Just don't go there expecting spacious quarters. On the other hand, I was (and you will also be) impressed with the hotel staff. They proved to be the friendliest, most courteous and helpful people I've had the pleasure of meeting. (Exceptionally pleasant and helpful was the young woman--Nathalie was her name--at the front desk. Even though I checked in three hours before the normal check-in time, she graciously gave me one of the rooms that was ready.) All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Paramount, and unless you're a so-called "hotel snob," you will also. I plan to stay there on my next visit to New York--even after the Milford Plaza is up and running again.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: travelingpants09
Reviews.Content: Pros for this hotel: right in the heart of everything! This is the only saving grace for this hotel Cons for this hotel: Too small - could not even turn around, the room was too hot, no hot water, you had to pay for WiFi, staff was not accommodating at all, mostly rude. Plenty of other places to stay - find one and go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best location, friendly doorman Brian”
Reviews.Author: pedrogu
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great locaton just half block from times square, the doorman was very helpfull and friendly, the rooms and bathroom very clean, beautifull lobby ,and a great price

Reviews.Title: “location of hotel is fantastic coupled with clean and tidy.good value”
Reviews.Author: wilmaCwmbranWales
Reviews.Content: great location for times square, theatre district and restaurant row.City bus tour stop 2 mins away.Use the free river cruise2hrs hudson and east side river passing libertey.Empire State best time is half hour before sunset.See view from top in daylight, sunset and night time all in one go.

Reviews.Title: “Center of it all!”
Reviews.Author: Fastrack101
Reviews.Content: There's really only one reason to stay at the Paramount Hotel - it's located less than 1 block away from the center of Times Square! And isn't that the reason many people come to visit NYC? So, I selected the Paramount not only because of its proximity to the hustle/bustle of Broadway, but because I like the hotel's modern appeal. I've stayed here about 4 times already, and each visit has been in a different sized room (keep in mind they're all small). However, the comforters are plush, the rooms are clean, and the lobby is a gargantuan open space that feels like it belongs in one of NYC's nightclubs.

Reviews.Title: “Compact room at best central midtown location”
Reviews.Author: Ballyhac
Reviews.Content: Our stay for three nights started with Brian, the friendly doorman, explaining the location and features both outside and inside. The queen-bedded room was cozy and comfortable, if a bit hot. The location can not be beat for theaters, and museums - either uptown or downtown, or transportation hubs. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and plan to return inthe future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, staff very friendly especially doorman Brian and barman Todd.”
Reviews.Author: tiggyPortugal
Reviews.Content: Perfect place at New Year as left hotel bar at 11.50, strolled to Times Square a few metres away. No need to queue, had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “A real port in a snowstorm”
Reviews.Author: ElleTell
Reviews.Content: We ended up in the Paramount after the hotel we had been staying in had no rooms available during the blizzard that hit new york unexpectedly. The paramount was really centrally located (2mins hobble from times square), it's foyer while dark is very hip & almost art-deco. the rooms were of a good size with a nice sized bathroom. the heating was really great & the staff were very nice and extremely helpful. didn't see much of the amenities but there was a coffee shop & loads of restaurants nearby. the room rate was very good especially as it was the week before christmas in a blizzard. quiet and restful. only thing was when we left our luggage to be delivered to our room- when we arrived back two hours later it was still there so we took it up ourselves. but in general- a real find & i'd book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Pete at the check in desk”
Reviews.Author: royalt3240
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay in this hotel. The room was perfect and spacious considering its NYC-times square location. Pete at the check in desk was more than accommodating and was extremely helpful. This place is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “great location- nice staff- mediocre hotel services”
Reviews.Author: kmacmurphy33
Reviews.Content: Clean room when we arrived but had to call maids all days but one to ask them to come clean room; the maids never replaced shampoo/lotion/conditioner bottles unless we asked; we ran out of toilet paper; no vending machines or room service; no in-room fridge or coffee maker so if you wanted anything to eat or drink you had to go down the block to drug store or next door to pizza place; good rate so wasn't upset about the price I paid for what I got in NYC; staff was nice; the doormen were very helpful; thank goodness I brought a noise maker b/c if not, I would have been up all night- the walls are thin; location is great- one block from Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Paying just for the location”
Reviews.Author: umass913
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed by this hotel. It put too much emphasis on "artsy" decor and not enough on the expected necessities of a basic hotel room. The temperature of the room did not change regardless of what we set the thermostat at, our view was of a black plastic trash bag caught in barbed wire, the shower kept getting periodically hot and cold, and the sheets gave me rugburn ("sheetburn"?). Also, my boyfriend got thirsty in the night and there were absolutely no drinks available throughout the entire hotel - no in-room fridge, no vending machines, no alternative to tap water from the bathroom sink. Good points: the location was very convenient, the room was clean, and the TV is pretty good. All in all, we thought the (silly) decor was way too overbearing and more attention was given to the appearance of the place rather than the comfort of the guests' stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: harleygirl7474
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Paramount Hotel. The hotel was very clean and everyone was very helpful. Brian the doorman was great. He helped bring in mine and my fiances luggage and helped us load it. He also had a cab waiting for us whenever we needed one. My stay at the Paramount was very pleasant! The concierge did wonderful job helping us to pick what we wanted to do in the time we had and helped book all the tickets and reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!! We will remember this trip for the rest of our lives!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Corningstone
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel we were checked in by the friendly lobby staff quickly. Our room wasnt huge, but was cosy and had everything that we needed- perfect considering we were about 100m from Time Square! The rooms were cleaned everyday, the whole hotel was well presented and spotless. The only downside, not a problem with the hotel, was the attitude of a member of staff (the small black lady) in the cafe Dean and Deluca- I found her insulting comments and rude attitude offensive! However, the other staff in the cafe were lovely and funny. We must also mention Brian the doorman, who was super friendly and helpful. I struggled with the doors into the hotel as they are quite heavy, he was always there to save the day! Also must say thanks to Brian for helping with our bags and getting a cab for us on the day we left! Much love John and Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Good Location VERY VERY VERY SMALL ROOMS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kay1973
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is in a really good location especially for us who wanted to see the new year in at times square but i would not stay in this hotel agian with a family we have 2 children aged 12 and 10 and booked a standard double room this was a very very very small room double beds were not standard doubles, and we had to keep juggling around with our suitcases No hanging space unless you are one of the 7 dwafts, bathroom small but ok, aircon was rubbish although it was freezing outside, because room was so small and there was 4 of us in there room was too hot. If you are booking this hotel for more than 2 people dont bother.

HotelInfo.Name: Paramount Hotel Times Square New York
HotelInfo.Address: 235 W 46th Street, Between Broadway & 8th Avenue, New York City, NY 10036
